2622.text: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.
2622.name: klefki

2623.text: These Pokmon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.
2623.name: phantump

2624.text: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.
2624.name: trevenant

2625.text: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
2625.name: pumpkaboo

2626.text: It blocks opponents attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.
2626.name: bergmite

2627.text: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.
2627.name: noibat

2628.text: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
2628.name: xerneas

2629.text: When this legendary Pokmons wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.
2629.name: yveltal

2630.text: When the Kalos regions ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.
2630.name: zygarde

2631.text: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
2631.name: diancie

2632.text: This troublemaker sends anything and everything to faraway places using its loop, which can warp space.
2632.name: hoopa

2633.text: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. Its said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
2633.name: volcanion

2634.text: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.
2634.name: bulbasaur

2635.text: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flowers coming bloom.
2635.name: ivysaur

2636.text: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to unbearably high levels.
2636.name: charmeleon

2637.text: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.
2637.name: wartortle

2638.text: The pressurized water jets on this brutal Pokmons shell are used for high-speed tackles.
2638.name: blastoise

2639.text: Its feet have suction cups designed to stick to any surface. It tenaciously climbs trees to forage.
2639.name: caterpie

2640.text: This Pokmon is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body.
2640.name: metapod

2641.text: The wings are protected by rain-repellent dust. As a result, this Pokmon can fly about even in rain.
2641.name: butterfree

2642.text: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.
2642.name: weedle

2643.text: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.
2643.name: kakuna

2644.text: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.
2644.name: beedrill

2645.text: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.
2645.name: pidgeot

2646.text: Its fangs are long and very sharp. They grow continuously, so it gnaws on hard things to whittle them down.
2646.name: rattata

2647.text: The webs on its hind legs enable it to cross rivers. It searches wide areas for food.
2647.name: raticate

2648.text: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.
2648.name: spearow

2649.text: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.
2649.name: fearow

2650.text: Moving silently and stealthily, it eats the eggs of birds, such as Pidgey and Spearow, whole.
2650.name: ekans

2651.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. If threatened, it looses electric charges from the sacs.
2651.name: pikachu

2652.text: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
2652.name: raichu

2653.text: Disliking water, it lives in deep burrows in arid areas. It can roll itself instantly into a ball.
2653.name: sandshrew

2654.text: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape.
2654.name: sandslash

2655.text: Small and very docile, it protects itself with its small, poisonous horn when attacked.
2655.name: nidoranf

2656.text: When feeding its young, it first chews the food into a paste, then spits it out for the offspring.
2656.name: nidorina

2657.text: The body is covered by stiff, needlelike scales. If it becomes excited, the needles bristle outwards.
2657.name: nidoqueen

2658.text: Its large ears are flapped like wings when it is listening to distant sounds. It extends toxic barbs when angered.
2658.name: nidoranm

2659.text: An aggressive Pokmon that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom.
2659.name: nidorino

2660.text: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.
2660.name: nidoking

2661.text: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size.
2661.name: wigglytuff

2662.text: It has no eyes. Instead, it relies on its ultrasonic cries for echolocation to flit about in darkness.
2662.name: zubat

2663.text: Once it starts sucking blood, it does not stop until it is full. It flies at night in search of prey.
2663.name: golbat

2664.text: The honey it drools from its mouth smells so atrocious, it can curl noses more than a mile away.
2664.name: gloom

2665.text: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.
2665.name: parasect

2666.text: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats bugs. It is attracted by light at night.
2666.name: venonat

2667.text: Extremely powerful, they can dig through even the hardest ground to a depth of over 60 miles.
2667.name: dugtrio

2668.text: Adores round objects. It wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change.
2668.name: meowth

2669.text: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
2669.name: persian

2670.text: It has mystical powers but doesnt recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.
2670.name: psyduck

2671.text: The forelegs are webbed, helping to make it an adept swimmer. It can be seen swimming elegantly in lakes, etc.
2671.name: golduck

2672.text: It lives in treetop colonies. If one becomes enraged, the whole colony rampages for no reason.
2672.name: mankey

2673.text: It is always outrageously furious. If it gives chase, it will tenaciously track the target no matter how far.
2673.name: primeape

2674.text: A swimmer adept at both the front crawl and breaststroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers.
2674.name: poliwrath

2675.text: It senses impending attacks and teleports away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.
2675.name: abra

2676.text: Its brain can outperform a supercomputer. Its IQ (intelligence quotient) is said to be around 5,000.
2676.name: alakazam

2677.text: Its bud looks like a human face. Because of the bud, it is rumored to be a type of legendary mandrake plant.
2677.name: bellsprout

2678.text: Once ingested into this Pokmons body, even the hardest object will melt into nothing.
2678.name: victreebel

2679.text: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by their stingers.
2679.name: tentacool

2680.text: It has 80 tentacles that move about freely. They can sting, causing poisoning and sharp, stabbing pain.
2680.name: tentacruel

2681.text: It is impossible to distinguish from rocks. It slams against others in contests of hardness.
2681.name: geodude

2682.text: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction.
2682.name: graveler

2683.text: Even dynamite cant harm its hard, boulder-like body. It sheds its hide just once a year.
2683.name: golem

2684.text: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.
2684.name: ponyta

2685.text: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.
2685.name: rapidash

2686.text: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges Thunder Wave and so on from the units at its sides.
2686.name: magnemite

2687.text: It always walks about with a plant stalk clamped in its beak. The stalk is used for building its nest.
2687.name: farfetchd

2688.text: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with a telepathic power.
2688.name: doduo

2689.text: An odd species that is rarely found. The three heads respectively represent joy, sadness, and anger.
2689.name: dodrio

2690.text: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.
2690.name: seel

2691.text: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.
2691.name: dewgong

2692.text: Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.
2692.name: grimer

2693.text: A toxic fluid seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.
2693.name: muk

2694.text: If you think that you had a good dream but you cant remember it, a Drowzee has probably eaten it.
2694.name: drowzee

2695.text: Seeing its swinging pendulum can induce sleep in three seconds, even in someone who just woke up.
2695.name: hypno

2696.text: Its pincers grow peculiarly large. If it lifts the pincers too fast, it loses its balance and staggers.
2696.name: kingler

2697.text: It stores an overflowing amount of electric energy inside its body. Even a small shock makes it explode.
2697.name: electrode

2698.text: Even though it appears to be eggs of some sort, it was discovered to be a life-form more like plant seeds.
2698.name: exeggcute

2699.text: It is called The Walking Jungle. If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an Exeggcute.
2699.name: exeggutor

2700.text: It always wears the skull of its dead mother, so no one has any idea what its hidden face looks like.
2700.name: cubone

2701.text: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets.
2701.name: marowak

2702.text: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.
2702.name: hitmonlee

2703.text: The spirit of a pro boxer has infused this Pokmon. It throws punches that are faster than a bullet train.
2703.name: hitmonchan

2704.text: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.
2704.name: lickitung

2705.text: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
2705.name: koffing

2706.text: Very rarely, a sudden mutation can result in two small Koffing twins becoming conjoined as a Weezing.
2706.name: weezing

2707.text: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.
2707.name: rhyhorn

2708.text: It lays several eggs a day. The eggs are apparently rich in nutrients and extremely delicious.
2708.name: chansey

2709.text: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
2709.name: tangela

2710.text: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.
2710.name: kangaskhan

2711.text: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
2711.name: horsea

2712.text: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.
2712.name: seadra

2713.text: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.
2713.name: seaking

2714.text: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.
2714.name: staryu

2715.text: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.
2715.name: mrmime

2716.text: It speaks using a language that sounds human. Research is under way to determine what is being said.
2716.name: jynx

2717.text: It loves to feed on strong electricity. It occasionally appears around large power plants and so on.
2717.name: electabuzz

2718.text: Born in the spout of a volcano, its body is covered by flames that shimmer like the sun.
2718.name: magmar

2719.text: When it is about to tackle, it whips its body repeatedly with its three long tails.
2719.name: tauros

2720.text: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage.
2720.name: gyarados

2721.text: Its high intelligence enables it to understand human speech. It likes to ferry people on its back.
2721.name: lapras

2722.text: A Pokmon that consists entirely of programming code. It is capable of moving freely in cyberspace.
2722.name: porygon

2723.text: Revived from an ancient fossil, this Pokmon uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.
2723.name: omanyte

2724.text: Once wrapped around its prey, it never lets go. It eats the prey by tearing at it with sharp fangs.
2724.name: omastar

2725.text: This Pokmon was regenerated from the fossil of an ancient creature. It protects itself with a hard shell.
2725.name: kabuto

2726.text: This vicious Pokmon is said to have flown in ancient skies while shrieking high-pitched cries.
2726.name: aerodactyl

2727.text: Its stomach can digest any kind of food, even if it happens to be moldy or rotten.
2727.name: snorlax

2728.text: A legendary bird Pokmon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.
2728.name: articuno

2729.text: A legendary Pokmon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.
2729.name: zapdos

2730.text: One of the legendary bird Pokmon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.
2730.name: moltres

2731.text: A mystical Pokmon that exudes a gentle aura. It is said to have the ability to change the weather.
2731.name: dragonair

2732.text: A Pokmon created by recombining Mews genes. Its said to have the most savage heart among Pokmon.
2732.name: mewtwo

2733.text: Its DNA is said to contain the genetic codes of all Pokmon, so it can use all kinds of techniques.
2733.name: mew

2734.text: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.
2734.name: chikorita

2735.text: The buds that ring its neck give off a spicy aroma that perks people up.
2735.name: bayleef

2736.text: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.
2736.name: cyndaquil

2737.text: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.
2737.name: quilava

2738.text: Once it bites down, it wont let go until it loses its fangs. New fangs quickly grow into place.
2738.name: croconaw

2739.text: It stands on its tail so it can see a long way. If it spots an enemy, it cries loudly to warn its kind.
2739.name: sentret

2740.text: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other Pokmon to enter.
2740.name: furret

2741.text: It is timid and clusters together with others. The fluid secreted by its feet indicates its location.
2741.name: ledyba

2742.text: The spot patterns on its back grow larger or smaller depending on the number of stars in the night sky.
2742.name: ledian

2743.text: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.
2743.name: spinarak

2744.text: It attaches silk to its prey and sets it free. Later, it tracks the silk to the prey and its friends.
2744.name: ariados

2745.text: Having four wings allows it to fly more quickly and quietly so it can sneak up on prey without its noticing.
2745.name: crobat

2746.text: Many appear when the night skies are filled with shooting stars. They disappear with sunrise.
2746.name: cleffa

2747.text: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.
2747.name: igglybuff

2748.text: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.
2748.name: togepi

2749.text: It usually forages for food on the ground but may, on rare occasions, hop onto branches to peck at shoots.
2749.name: natu

2750.text: It stores lots of air in its soft fur, allowing it to stay cool in summer and warm in winter.
2750.name: mareep

2751.text: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. It fires hair that zaps on impact.
2751.name: flaaffy

2752.text: When the heavy rainfall season ends, it is drawn out by warm sunlight to dance in the open.
2752.name: bellossom

2753.text: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.
2753.name: marill

2754.text: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when its in the water.
2754.name: azumarill

2755.text: It drifts on winds. It is said that when Hoppip gather in fields and mountains, spring is on the way.
2755.name: hoppip

2756.text: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.
2756.name: skiploom

2757.text: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.
2757.name: jumpluff

2758.text: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.
2758.name: aipom

2759.text: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.
2759.name: sunkern

2760.text: It gets energy from warm sunlight and is known for its habit of moving in pursuit of it.
2760.name: sunflora

2761.text: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.
2761.name: yanma

2762.text: When the temperature cools in the evening, they emerge from water to seek food along the shore.
2762.name: wooper

2763.text: Its fur is so sensitive, it can feel minute shifts in the air and predict the weather...and its foes thoughts.
2763.name: espeon

2764.text: It likes playing mischievous tricks, such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.
2764.name: misdreavus

2765.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.
2765.name: unown

2766.text: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.
2766.name: girafarig

2767.text: It looks just like a pinecone. Its shell protects it from bird Pokmon that peck it by mistake.
2767.name: pineco

2768.text: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.
2768.name: forretress

2769.text: It digs into the ground with its tail and makes a mazelike nest. It can fly just a little.
2769.name: dunsparce

2770.text: It flies straight at its targets face, then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.
2770.name: gligar

2771.text: Small Pokmon flee from its scary face. It is, however, considered by women to be cute.
2771.name: snubbull

2772.text: Before food becomes scarce in wintertime, its habit is to hoard food in many hidden locations.
2772.name: teddiursa

2773.text: Although it has a large body, it is quite skilled at climbing trees. It eats and sleeps in the treetops.
2773.name: ursaring

2774.text: Its body is made of magma. If it doesnt keep moving, its body will cool and harden.
2774.name: slugma

2775.text: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.
2775.name: magcargo

2776.text: They prefer unpolluted southern seas. Their coral branches lose their color and deteriorate in dirty water.
2776.name: corsola

2777.text: It carries food all day long. When someone is lost in the mountains, it shares that food.
2777.name: delibird

2778.text: While elegantly swimming in the sea, it ignores Remoraid that cling to its fins seeking food scraps.
2778.name: mantine

2779.text: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph.
2779.name: skarmory

2780.text: To corner prey, they check each others location using barks that only they can understand.
2780.name: houndour

2781.text: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life-forms can survive.
2781.name: kingdra

2782.text: It is strong despite its compact size. It can easily pick up and carry an adult human on its back.
2782.name: phanpy

2783.text: The longer and bigger its tusks, the higher its rank in its herd. The tusks take long to grow.
2783.name: donphan

2784.text: With planetary development software installed, it became capable of working in space.
2784.name: porygon2

2785.text: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where reality is distorted.
2785.name: stantler

2786.text: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.
2786.name: smeargle

2787.text: To brush up on its fighting skills, it will challenge anyone. It has a very strong competitive spirit.
2787.name: tyrogue

2788.text: If you are enchanted by its smooth, dance-like kicks, you may get a closer experience with one than youd like.
2788.name: hitmontop

2789.text: It tests everything by touching with its lips, which remember what it likes and dislikes.
2789.name: smoochum

2790.text: Spinning its arms around to generate electricity makes the area between its horns shine light blue.
2790.name: elekid

2791.text: Its magma-like blood circulates throughout its body. Its bodys heat can top 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
2791.name: magby

2792.text: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.
2792.name: miltank

2793.text: This kindhearted Pokmon nurses sick Pokmon to health. It senses feelings of sadness.
2793.name: blissey

2794.text: This rough Pokmon stores energy inside its body, then sweeps across the land, shooting off electricity.
2794.name: raikou

2795.text: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.
2795.name: entei

2796.text: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.
2796.name: suicune

2797.text: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.
2797.name: lugia

2798.text: It will reveal itself before a pure-hearted Trainer by shining its bright, rainbow-colored wings.
2798.name: hooh

2799.text: It has the power to travel across time, but it is said to appear only in peaceful times.
2799.name: celebi

2800.text: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.
2800.name: treecko

2801.text: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.
2801.name: grovyle

2802.text: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
2802.name: torchic

2803.text: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
2803.name: mudkip

2804.text: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has made its legs sturdy.
2804.name: marshtomp

2805.text: It can swim while towing a large ship. It bashes down foes with a swing of its thick arms.
2805.name: swampert

2806.text: It has a very tenacious nature. Its acute sense of smell lets it chase a chosen prey without ever losing track.
2806.name: poochyena

2807.text: It chases down prey in a pack of around ten. They defeat foes with perfectly coordinated teamwork.
2807.name: mightyena

2808.text: A Pokmon with abundant curiosity. It shows an interest in everything, so it always zigzags.
2808.name: zigzagoon

2809.text: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.
2809.name: linoone

2810.text: It lives among the tall grass and in forests. It repels attacks by raising up the spikes on its rear.
2810.name: wurmple

2811.text: It drinks dew that collects on its silk and waits for evolution. Its hard cocoon repels attacks.
2811.name: silcoon

2812.text: It has an aggressive nature. It stabs prey with its long, narrow mouth to drain the preys fluids.
2812.name: beautifly

2813.text: It never forgets any attack it endured while in the cocoon. After evolution, it seeks payback.
2813.name: cascoon

2814.text: It violently flutters its wings to scatter toxic dust when attacked. It becomes active after sunset.
2814.name: dustox

2815.text: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.
2815.name: lombre

2816.text: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokmon.
2816.name: seedot

2817.text: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 feet per second that can level houses.
2817.name: shiftry

2818.text: It dislikes cold seasons. They migrate to other lands in search of warmth, flying over 180 miles a day.
2818.name: taillow

2819.text: It dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. It catches its prey with sharp claws.
2819.name: swellow

2820.text: It makes its nest on steep sea cliffs. Riding updrafts, it soars to great heights.
2820.name: wingull

2821.text: It appears as if it is skating on water. It draws prey with a sweet scent from the tip of its head.
2821.name: surskit

2822.text: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.
2822.name: shroomish

2823.text: If it eats just three leaves in a day, it is satisfied. Other than that, it sleeps for 20 hours a day.
2823.name: slakoth

2824.text: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.
2824.name: ninjask

2825.text: If it senses danger, it scares the foe by crying out with the volume of a jet-plane engine.
2825.name: whismur

2826.text: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.
2826.name: loudred

2827.text: Its roar in battle shakes the ground like a tremor--or like an earthquake has struck.
2827.name: exploud

2828.text: It loves to match power with big-bodied Pokmon. It can knock a truck flying with its arm thrusts.
2828.name: hariyama

2829.text: It swings its large, nutrient-filled tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
2829.name: azurill

2830.text: Its magnetic nose consistently faces north. Travelers check Nosepass to get their bearings.
2830.name: nosepass

2831.text: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.
2831.name: skitty

2832.text: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.
2832.name: delcatty

2833.text: It habitually shows off its strength with the size of sparks it creates by ramming its steel body into boulders.
2833.name: lairon

2834.text: While seeking iron for food, it digs tunnels by breaking through bedrock with its steel horns.
2834.name: aggron

2835.text: It eats just one berry a day. By enduring hunger, its spirit is tempered and made sharper.
2835.name: meditite

2836.text: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.
2836.name: manectric

2837.text: It absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out its body to create crackling noises.
2837.name: plusle

2838.text: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.
2838.name: minun

2839.text: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.
2839.name: illumise

2840.text: Roselia that drink nutritionally rich springwater are said to reveal rare coloration when they bloom.
2840.name: roselia

2841.text: It lives in massive rivers that course through jungles. It swarms prey that enter its territory.
2841.name: carvanha

2842.text: It eats one ton of food every day. It plays by shooting stored seawater out its blowholes with great force.
2842.name: wailmer

2843.text: The biggest of all Pokmon. It can dive to a depth of almost 10,000 feet on only one breath.
2843.name: wailord

2844.text: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.
2844.name: spoink

2845.text: The chances of two Spinda having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion.
2845.name: spinda

2846.text: It generates ultrasonic waves by violently flapping its wings. After making its prey faint, it melts the prey with acid.
2846.name: vibrava

2847.text: Its fur would all stand on end if it smelled a Seviper nearby. Its sharp claws tear up its foes.
2847.name: zangoose

2848.text: It absorbs solar energy during the day. Always expressionless, it can sense what its foe is thinking.
2848.name: solrock

2849.text: Its whiskers make a superb radar. They are used to locate prey, even in the murkiest of water.
2849.name: barboach

2850.text: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.
2850.name: corphish

2851.text: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokmon that was discovered in ancient ruins.
2851.name: baltoy

2852.text: It is said that it originates from clay dolls made by an ancient civilization.
2852.name: claydol

2853.text: It lived on the seafloor 100 million years ago and was reanimated scientifically.
2853.name: lileep

2854.text: It ensnares prey with its eight tentacles. It then melts the prey with a strong acid before feeding.
2854.name: cradily

2855.text: A Pokmon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.
2855.name: anorith

2856.text: Protected by a hard shell, its body is very sturdy. It skewers prey with its claws to feed.
2856.name: armaldo

2857.text: It is the worlds most beautiful Pokmon. There are many works of art featuring Milotic.
2857.name: milotic

2858.text: It has the ability to change its form into the sun, the rain, or a snow cloud, depending on the weather.
2858.name: castform

2859.text: It changes its shading to match its surroundings so it can sneak up on prey. Only its belly patterns stay fixed.
2859.name: kecleon

2860.text: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.
2860.name: shuppet

2861.text: Its body is hollow. It is said that those who look into its body are sucked into the void.
2861.name: dusclops

2862.text: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. Its a highly favored tropical snack.
2862.name: tropius

2863.text: Emitting ultrasonic cries, it floats on winds to travel great distances.
2863.name: chimecho

2864.text: It appears when it senses an impending natural disaster. As a result, it was mistaken as a doom bringer.
2864.name: absol

2865.text: It grows strong by pushing up against others en masse. It loves eating sweet fruit.
2865.name: wynaut

2866.text: Its body is covered in fluffy fur. The fur keeps it from feeling cold while it is rolling on ice.
2866.name: spheal

2867.text: Be it Spheal or Pok Ball, it will spin any round object on its nose with the greatest of ease.
2867.name: sealeo

2868.text: It shatters drift ice with its strong tusks. Its thick layer of blubber repels enemy attacks.
2868.name: walrein

2869.text: It is protected by a sturdy shell. Once in a lifetime, it makes a magnificent pearl.
2869.name: clamperl

2870.text: It lives deep in the sea. With a tail shaped like a small fish, it attracts unsuspecting prey.
2870.name: huntail

2871.text: Its swimming form is exquisitely elegant. With its thin mouth, it feeds on seaweed that grows between rocks.
2871.name: gorebyss

2872.text: A rare Pokmon discovered during a deep-sea exploration. It has not changed in over 100 million years.
2872.name: relicanth

2873.text: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.
2873.name: bagon

2874.text: It converses with others by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
2874.name: beldum

2875.text: The same rocks that form its body have been found in ground layers around the world.
2875.name: regirock

2876.text: Its body is made of ice from the ice age. It controls frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit.
2876.name: regice

2877.text: Its body is said to be harder than any kind of metal. A study has revealed that its body is hollow.
2877.name: registeel

2878.text: It can telepathically communicate with people. It changes its appearance using its down that refracts light.
2878.name: latias

2879.text: It understands human speech and is highly intelligent. It is a tender Pokmon that dislikes fighting.
2879.name: latios

2880.text: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.
2880.name: kyogre

2881.text: This legendary Pokmon is said to represent the land. It went to sleep after dueling Kyogre.
2881.name: groudon

2882.text: It flies in the ozone layer, way up high in the sky. Until recently, no one had ever seen it.
2882.name: rayquaza

2883.text: It is said to have the ability to grant any wish for just one week every thousand years.
2883.name: jirachi

2884.text: DNA from a space virus mutated and became a Pokmon. It appears where auroras are seen.
2884.name: deoxys

2885.text: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.
2885.name: turtwig

2886.text: Small Pokmon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.
2886.name: torterra

2887.text: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.
2887.name: monferno

2888.text: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
2888.name: infernape

2889.text: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.
2889.name: piplup

2890.text: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.
2890.name: empoleon

2891.text: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.
2891.name: staravia

2892.text: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.
2892.name: bidoof

2893.text: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.
2893.name: bibarel

2894.text: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.
2894.name: kricketune

2895.text: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.
2895.name: shinx

2896.text: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.
2896.name: budew

2897.text: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.
2897.name: roserade

2898.text: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.
2898.name: cranidos

2899.text: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.
2899.name: rampardos

2900.text: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.
2900.name: shieldon

2901.text: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokmon that feeds on grass and berries.
2901.name: bastiodon

2902.text: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.
2902.name: burmy

2903.text: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokmons body. The cloak is never shed.
2903.name: wormadam

2904.text: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.
2904.name: mothim

2905.text: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.
2905.name: combee

2906.text: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.
2906.name: vespiquen

2907.text: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.
2907.name: buizel

2908.text: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.
2908.name: floatzel

2909.text: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.
2909.name: cherubi

2910.text: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the suns rays with its whole body.
2910.name: cherrim

2911.text: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.
2911.name: shellos

2912.text: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.
2912.name: gastrodon

2913.text: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.
2913.name: ambipom

2914.text: These Pokmon are called the Signpost for Wandering Spirits. Children holding them sometimes vanish.
2914.name: drifloon

2915.text: Its drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.
2915.name: drifblim

2916.text: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
2916.name: buneary

2917.text: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.
2917.name: lopunny

2918.text: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous Murkrow in tow.
2918.name: honchkrow

2919.text: When its happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.
2919.name: glameow

2920.text: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.
2920.name: purugly

2921.text: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.
2921.name: stunky

2922.text: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.
2922.name: skuntank

2923.text: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.
2923.name: bronzor

2924.text: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.
2924.name: bronzong

2925.text: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.
2925.name: bonsly

2926.text: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokmon.
2926.name: mimejr

2927.text: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.
2927.name: chatot

2928.text: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.
2928.name: spiritomb

2929.text: It conceals food under the long fur on its body. It carts around this food stash and swallows it without chewing.
2929.name: munchlax

2930.text: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.
2930.name: skorupi

2931.text: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.
2931.name: drapion

2932.text: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.
2932.name: toxicroak

2933.text: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.
2933.name: carnivine

2934.text: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.
2934.name: finneon

2935.text: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.
2935.name: lumineon

2936.text: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.
2936.name: mantyke

2937.text: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.
2937.name: weavile

2938.text: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.
2938.name: magnezone

2939.text: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.
2939.name: lickilicky

2940.text: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.
2940.name: rhyperior

2941.text: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you cant even see its eyes.
2941.name: tangrowth

2942.text: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
2942.name: electivire

2943.text: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
2943.name: magmortar

2944.text: It shares many blessings with people who respect one anothers rights and avoid needless strife.
2944.name: togekiss

2945.text: This six-legged Pokmon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.
2945.name: yanmega

2946.text: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.
2946.name: gliscor

2947.text: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.
2947.name: mamoswine

2948.text: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...
2948.name: porygonz

2949.text: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.
2949.name: probopass

2950.text: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.
2950.name: dusknoir

2951.text: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as Froslass.
2951.name: froslass

2952.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.
2952.name: rotom

2953.text: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.
2953.name: uxie

2954.text: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lakes surface.
2954.name: mesprit

2955.text: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.
2955.name: azelf

2956.text: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.
2956.name: dialga

2957.text: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.
2957.name: palkia

2958.text: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.
2958.name: heatran

2959.text: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokmon towed continents with ropes.
2959.name: regigigas

2960.text: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.
2960.name: giratina

2961.text: Those who sleep holding Cresselias feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.
2961.name: cresselia

2962.text: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.
2962.name: phione

2963.text: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokmon.
2963.name: manaphy

2964.text: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.
2964.name: darkrai

2965.text: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.
2965.name: shaymin

2966.text: It is told in mythology that this Pokmon was born before the universe even existed.
2966.name: arceus

2967.text: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that beings entire body will be overflowing with power.
2967.name: victini

2968.text: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
2968.name: snivy

2969.text: When it gets dirty, its leaves cant be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
2969.name: servine

2970.text: It can stop its opponents movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
2970.name: serperior

2971.text: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
2971.name: tepig

2972.text: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
2972.name: pignite

2973.text: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.
2973.name: oshawott

2974.text: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
2974.name: dewott

2975.text: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.
2975.name: samurott

2976.text: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it wont notice a foe coming from behind.
2976.name: patrat

2977.text: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
2977.name: watchog

2978.text: Though it is a very brave Pokmon, its also smart enough to check its foes strength and avoid battle.
2978.name: lillipup

2979.text: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
2979.name: herdier

2980.text: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.
2980.name: stoutland

2981.text: They steal from people for fun, but their victims cant help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.
2981.name: purrloin

2982.text: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.
2982.name: liepard

2983.text: Its good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. Its kind enough to share them with friends.
2983.name: pansage

2984.text: This Pokmon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
2984.name: pansear

2985.text: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
2985.name: panpour

2986.text: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
2986.name: simipour

2987.text: It eats the dreams of people and Pokmon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.
2987.name: munna

2988.text: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.
2988.name: musharna

2989.text: These Pokmon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.
2989.name: pidove

2990.text: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.
2990.name: tranquill

2991.text: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.
2991.name: unfezant

2992.text: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
2992.name: blitzle

2993.text: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
2993.name: zebstrika

2994.text: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.
2994.name: roggenrola

2995.text: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
2995.name: boldore

2996.text: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
2996.name: gigalith

2997.text: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
2997.name: woobat

2998.text: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.
2998.name: swoobat

2999.text: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.
2999.name: tympole

3000.text: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.
3000.name: palpitoad

3001.text: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.
3001.name: seismitoad

3002.text: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.
3002.name: throh

3003.text: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.
3003.name: sawk

3004.text: Since this Pokmon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
3004.name: sewaddle

3005.text: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
3005.name: swadloon

3006.text: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
3006.name: leavanny

3007.text: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
3007.name: whirlipede

3008.text: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.
3008.name: scolipede

3009.text: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.
3009.name: cottonee

3010.text: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.
3010.name: petilil

3011.text: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokmon is popular with celebrities.
3011.name: lilligant

3012.text: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the others school.
3012.name: basculin

3013.text: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.
3013.name: sandile

3014.text: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
3014.name: darumaka

3015.text: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
3015.name: darmanitan

3016.text: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
3016.name: maractus

3017.text: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
3017.name: dwebble

3018.text: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
3018.name: crustle

3019.text: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.
3019.name: scraggy

3020.text: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.
3020.name: scrafty

3021.text: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.
3021.name: sigilyph

3022.text: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
3022.name: yamask

3023.text: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
3023.name: cofagrigus

3024.text: Restored from a fossil, this Pokmon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.
3024.name: tirtouga

3025.text: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
3025.name: carracosta

3026.text: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokmon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
3026.name: archen

3027.text: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
3027.name: archeops

3028.text: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.
3028.name: trubbish

3029.text: Bonds between these Pokmon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
3029.name: zoroark

3030.text: Cinccinos body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
3030.name: cinccino

3031.text: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokmon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
3031.name: gothita

3032.text: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
3032.name: gothorita

3033.text: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers life spans.
3033.name: gothitelle

3034.text: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
3034.name: duosion

3035.text: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
3035.name: ducklett

3036.text: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
3036.name: swanna

3037.text: This Pokmon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.
3037.name: vanillite

3038.text: Snowy mountains are this Pokmons habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.
3038.name: vanillish

3039.text: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.
3039.name: vanilluxe

3040.text: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokmons fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
3040.name: deerling

3041.text: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
3041.name: sawsbuck

3042.text: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
3042.name: karrablast

3043.text: These Pokmon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
3043.name: escavalier

3044.text: It lures Pokmon with its pattern that looks just like a Pok Ball, then releases poison spores.
3044.name: foongus

3045.text: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Pok Balls, in a swaying motion.
3045.name: amoonguss

3046.text: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
3046.name: frillish

3047.text: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicents habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
3047.name: jellicent

3048.text: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokmon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
3048.name: joltik

3049.text: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
3049.name: ferroseed

3050.text: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
3050.name: ferrothorn

3051.text: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
3051.name: klink

3052.text: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesnt return, it will die.
3052.name: klang

3053.text: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
3053.name: klinklang

3054.text: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
3054.name: elgyem

3055.text: It uses psychic power to control an opponents brain and tamper with its memories.
3055.name: beheeyem

3056.text: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.
3056.name: lampent

3057.text: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
3057.name: axew

3058.text: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
3058.name: fraxure

3059.text: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokmon are covered in hard armor.
3059.name: haxorus

3060.text: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
3060.name: cubchoo

3061.text: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
3061.name: beartic

3062.text: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.
3062.name: cryogonal

3063.text: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.
3063.name: shelmet

3064.text: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
3064.name: accelgor

3065.text: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
3065.name: druddigon

3066.text: Ancient science fashioned this Pokmon from clay. Its been active for thousands of years.
3066.name: golett

3067.text: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
3067.name: golurk

3068.text: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.
3068.name: pawniard

3069.text: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
3069.name: bisharp

3070.text: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
3070.name: bouffalant

3071.text: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.
3071.name: rufflet

3072.text: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.
3072.name: braviary

3073.text: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.
3073.name: vullaby

3074.text: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokmon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.
3074.name: mandibuzz

3075.text: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
3075.name: heatmor

3076.text: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
3076.name: durant

3077.text: Lacking sight, its unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
3077.name: deino

3078.text: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
3078.name: zweilous

3079.text: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokmon devours everything in its path!
3079.name: hydreigon

3080.text: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.
3080.name: larvesta

3081.text: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcaronas fire provided a replacement for the sun.
3081.name: volcarona

3082.text: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokmon.
3082.name: cobalion

3083.text: Spoken of in legend, this Pokmon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokmon.
3083.name: terrakion

3084.text: Legends say this Pokmon confounded opponents with its swift movements.
3084.name: virizion

3085.text: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.
3085.name: tornadus

3086.text: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.
3086.name: thundurus

3087.text: When Reshirams tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the worlds weather.
3087.name: reshiram

3088.text: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
3088.name: zekrom

3089.text: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.
3089.name: landorus

3090.text: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.
3090.name: kyurem

3091.text: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.
3091.name: keldeo

3092.text: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
3092.name: meloetta

3093.text: This Pokmon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
3093.name: genesect

3094.text: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldnt faze it.
3094.name: chespin

3095.text: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
3095.name: chesnaught

3096.text: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
3096.name: fennekin

3097.text: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
3097.name: braixen

3098.text: It appears and vanishes with a ninjas grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
3098.name: greninja

3099.text: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.
3099.name: bunnelby

3100.text: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When its finished digging, it lounges lazily.
3100.name: diggersby

3101.text: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.
3101.name: talonflame

3102.text: The beaks of bird Pokmon cant begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
3102.name: spewpa

3103.text: The patterns on this Pokmons wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
3103.name: vivillon

3104.text: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the prides cubs.
3104.name: pyroar

3105.text: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the winds embrace with an untroubled heart.
3105.name: flabebe

3106.text: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.
3106.name: floette

3107.text: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.
3107.name: florges

3108.text: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
3108.name: gogoat

3109.text: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.
3109.name: pangoro

3110.text: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.
3110.name: espurr

3111.text: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.
3111.name: meowstic

3112.text: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that persons arm and drains that persons life energy completely.
3112.name: honedge

3113.text: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.
3113.name: doublade

3114.text: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.
3114.name: swirlix

3115.text: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a humans, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. Its like it can see with its nose!
3115.name: slurpuff

3116.text: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponents will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.
3116.name: inkay

3117.text: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.
3117.name: malamar

3118.text: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.
3118.name: binacle

3119.text: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.
3119.name: skrelp

3120.text: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.
3120.name: dragalge

3121.text: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.
3121.name: clauncher

3122.text: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.
3122.name: heliolisk

3123.text: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.
3123.name: tyrunt

3124.text: This calm Pokmon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.
3124.name: amaura

3125.text: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponents attack.
3125.name: aurorus

3126.text: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.
3126.name: dedenne

3127.text: Its covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.
3127.name: goomy

3128.text: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch thats the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.
3128.name: goodra

3129.text: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.
3129.name: pumpkaboo

3130.text: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.
3130.name: gourgeist

3131.text: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.
3131.name: bergmite

3132.text: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.
3132.name: avalugg

3133.text: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.
3133.name: noivern

3134.text: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
3134.name: diancie

3135.text: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.
3135.name: hoopa

3136.text: When attacked by bird Pokmon, it resists by releasing a terrifically strong odor from its antennae, but it often becomes their prey.
3136.name: caterpie

3137.text: Its shell is filled with its soft innards. It doesnt move much because of the risk it might carelessly spill its innards out.
3137.name: metapod

3138.text: Close examination of its large eyes reveals that each eye is composed of a myriad of tiny eyes.
3138.name: butterfree

3139.text: Its incisors continue growing until its death. If its Trainer doesnt offer it a file to gnaw on, it will gnaw on door frames, table legs, and so on.
3139.name: rattata

3140.text: Its hind feet are webbed, so its a strong swimmer. It can cross rivers and sometimes even oceans.
3140.name: raticate

3141.text: Its short wings make it inept at flying. It moves about hurriedly and pecks at Bug-type Pokmon in the tall grass.
3141.name: spearow

3142.text: Its tough and has excellent stamina. It has no problem flying continuously for a whole day carrying a heavy load.
3142.name: fearow

3143.text: A plan was recently announced to gather many Pikachu and make an electric power plant.
3143.name: pikachu

3144.text: It unleashes electric shocks that can reach 100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out even an Indian elephant.
3144.name: raichu

3145.text: It can roll its body into a ball. It moves through the desert by rolling at high speeds.
3145.name: sandshrew

3146.text: Although they are sharp, its claws and spikes often break off. They grow back the next day, so it is not bothered by the temporary loss.
3146.name: sandslash

3147.text: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.
3147.name: clefairy

3148.text: They dont like to reveal themselves in front of people. They live quietly in packs deep in the mountains.
3148.name: clefable

3149.text: Its beautiful fur and tails have made it very popular. As it grows, its tails split to form more tails.
3149.name: vulpix

3150.text: Legend has it that this mystical Pokmon was formed when nine saints coalesced into one.
3150.name: ninetales

3151.text: It hugely inflates its stomach and sings a mysterious melody. If you hear this melody, youll become sleepy right away.
3151.name: jigglypuff

3152.text: It sheds its fine fur when the seasons change. The fur is gathered and spun into a luxurious yarn.
3152.name: wigglytuff

3153.text: It sleeps in caves during the day. It has no eyes, so to check its surroundings while flying, it emits ultrasonic waves.
3153.name: zubat

3154.text: Its thick fangs are hollow like straws, making them unexpectedly fragile. These fangs are specialized for sucking blood.
3154.name: golbat

3155.text: No matter how much it eats, the mushrooms growing on its back steal away most of the nutrients it consumes.
3155.name: paras

3156.text: The large mushroom on its back controls it. It often fights over territory with Shiinotic.
3156.name: parasect

3157.text: It chews on plant roots underground. Farmers whose vegetables are vulnerable find it can be quite a pest.
3157.name: diglett

3158.text: This set of triplets moves cooperatively. Its the power of teamwork that enables this Pokmon to dig to a depth of 60 miles.
3158.name: dugtrio

3159.text: It lies around all day, becoming active near dusk. At night, it wanders the city in search of loose change.
3159.name: meowth

3160.text: It has a violent temperament. It will attack anything that looks it in the eye. Its sharp claws inflict deep wounds.
3160.name: persian

3161.text: As a result of headaches so fierce they cause it to cry, it sometimes uses psychokinesis without meaning to.
3161.name: psyduck

3162.text: It is said that the red part of its forehead grants supernatural powers to those who possess one, so it was over-hunted in the past.
3162.name: golduck

3163.text: It can spontaneously become enraged. Everyone near it clears out as it rampages, and the resulting loneliness makes it angrier still.
3163.name: mankey

3164.text: It has been known to become so angry that it dies as a result. Its face looks peaceful in death, however.
3164.name: primeape

3165.text: Its both clever and loyal, but if a stranger tries to invade its territory, it barks threateningly.
3165.name: growlithe

3166.text: Overflowing with beauty and majesty, this strong Pokmon appears in ancient Eastern folklore.
3166.name: arcanine

3167.text: The swirl on its belly is its internal organs showing through. If the swirl is tinged white, that means its affected by some disease.
3167.name: poliwag

3168.text: Although it can live on land, it prefers to stay in the water, where it has fewer natural enemies.
3168.name: poliwhirl

3169.text: Poliwrath in the Alola region are strong swimmers that use the breaststroke. Many children learn to swim by imitating Poliwrath.
3169.name: poliwrath

3170.text: It sleeps 18 hours a day. Even while sleeping, it will teleport itself to treetops and pick and eat berries there.
3170.name: abra

3171.text: A theory exists that this Pokmon was a young boy who couldnt control his psychic powers and ended up transformed into this Pokmon.
3171.name: kadabra

3172.text: It is said to have an IQ of approximately 5,000. Its overflowing psychokinetic powers cause headaches to anyone nearby.
3172.name: alakazam

3173.text: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.
3173.name: machop

3174.text: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.
3174.name: machoke

3175.text: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
3175.name: machamp

3176.text: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
3176.name: tentacool

3177.text: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.
3177.name: tentacruel

3178.text: Its round body makes it easy to pick up, but it is hard and heavy. Its dangerous to play with them as if they were snowballs.
3178.name: geodude

3179.text: Mossy rocks are its favorite food. It can devour a ton a day while crunching loudly.
3179.name: graveler

3180.text: Its body can survive dynamite blasts without a single scratch, but it hates rain and humidity.
3180.name: golem

3181.text: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesnt really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isnt particularly bothered.
3181.name: slowpoke

3182.text: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With Shellders poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.
3182.name: slowbro

3183.text: They gather in places where electricity is available. They can be found clinging to the steel towers used to support power lines.
3183.name: magnemite

3184.text: When three Magnemite link together, their brains also become one. They do not become three times more intelligent.
3184.name: magneton

3185.text: Its main source of food is the slimy industrial waste of factories. This Pokmons numbers have been decreasing in recent years.
3185.name: grimer

3186.text: The stench it gives off will make your nose scrunch up. Still, there are Muk fans who think thats a good thing.
3186.name: muk

3187.text: The hardness of its shell surpasses the hardness of a diamond. In days gone by, people used the shells to make shields.
3187.name: shellder

3188.text: Its hard shell cannot be shatterednot even by a bomb. The contents of the shell remain unknown.
3188.name: cloyster

3189.text: Should a strange light be seen flickering in an abandoned building, Gastly is lurking there.
3189.name: gastly

3190.text: It strikes at humans from total darkness. Those licked by its cold tongue grow weaker with each passing day until they die.
3190.name: haunter

3191.text: Should you feel yourself attacked by a sudden chill, it is evidence of an approaching Gengar. There is no escaping it. Give up.
3191.name: gengar

3192.text: A Pokmon that nourishes itself by eating dreams, it is thought to share common ancestry with Munna and Musharna.
3192.name: drowzee

3193.text: While it is an extremely dangerous Pokmon, people who are in need of a good, sound sleep call it their savior.
3193.name: hypno

3194.text: Its six eggs use telepathy to communicate among themselves. It is believed to carry plant genes and the genes of other species.
3194.name: exeggcute

3195.text: Each of its heads has its own will. They use telepathy to discuss their plans before coming to a joint decision.
3195.name: exeggutor

3196.text: When it thinks of its deceased mother, it weeps loudly. Mandibuzz that hear its cries will attack it from the air.
3196.name: cubone

3197.text: Originally, it was weak and timid. After evolution, its temperament becomes violent, and it begins to wield bones as weapons.
3197.name: marowak

3198.text: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokmon.
3198.name: chansey

3199.text: Kangaskhans maternal love is so deep that it will brave death to protect its offspring.
3199.name: kangaskhan

3200.text: When the weather grows warm, they form groups and swim upriver. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that spring has arrived.
3200.name: goldeen

3201.text: When the weather grows cold, its whole body flushes a deep red. This sight serves as a poetic reminder that autumn has arrived.
3201.name: seaking

3202.text: Large numbers of these Pokmon make their home at the seaside. At night, a strange red glow radiates from the center of their bodies.
3202.name: staryu

3203.text: Its shining core is thought to receive and transmit enigmatic signals. It has been known to cause headaches in those who approach it.
3203.name: starmie

3204.text: It confuses its prey with its quick, ninja-like movements. Then, in an instant, it cleaves them with its scythes.
3204.name: scyther

3205.text: Half of all sudden blackouts are caused by Electabuzz gathering at electric power plants and gobbling up electricity.
3205.name: electabuzz

3206.text: When its tired, it leaps into the mouth of a volcano and soaks its body in magma to ease its weariness. Its body burns at 2,192 degrees F.
3206.name: magmar

3207.text: It grips its prey in its pincers and splits them apart. Although it is a powerful Pokmon, it cant deal with the cold.
3207.name: pinsir

3208.text: Historically, people in areas all over the world have ridden Tauros, but the practice is said to have started in Alola.
3208.name: tauros

3209.text: Although weak and helpless, this Pokmon is incredibly fertile. They exist in such multitudes, youll soon grow tired of seeing them.
3209.name: magikarp

3210.text: A tale is told of a town that angered Gyarados. Before the sun rose the next day, flames utterly consumed the town, leaving not a trace behind.
3210.name: gyarados

3211.text: Its high intelligence enables it to comprehend human speech. When its in a good mood, it sings in its beautiful voice.
3211.name: lapras

3212.text: It can reorganize its cells to make itself into a duplicate of anything it sees. The quality of the duplicate depends on the individual.
3212.name: ditto

3213.text: Possessing an unbalanced and unstable genetic makeup, it conceals many possible evolutions.
3213.name: eevee

3214.text: Its cells are composed of units much like water molecules. It lives close to water and is often mistaken for a mermaid.
3214.name: vaporeon

3215.text: They send out electrical charges of about 10,000 volts. Because they are high-strung, it can be difficult to grow close to them.
3215.name: jolteon

3216.text: When it catches prey or finds berries, it breathes fire on them until theyre well done, and then it gobbles them up.
3216.name: flareon

3217.text: Roughly 20 years ago, it was artificially created, utilizing the latest technology of the time.
3217.name: porygon

3218.text: A Pokmon from the age of the dinosaurs. It used its sawlike fangs to shred its prey before eating them.
3218.name: aerodactyl
