3219.text: Its stomach is said to be incomparably strong. Even Muks poison is nothing more than a hint of spice on Snorlaxs tongue.
3219.name: snorlax

3220.text: It grows by molting repeatedly. Boots made from the tanned cast-off skin are a super luxury item.
3220.name: dratini

3221.text: It has long been thought that its crystalline orbs are imbued with the power to control the weather.
3221.name: dragonair

3222.text: This Pokmon saved a shipwrecked man, taking him to a remote islanda paradise occupied solely by Dragonite.
3222.name: dragonite

3223.text: They are timid and grow uneasy when not in a swarm with others of their kind. The pattern on their backs differs slightly from one to another.
3223.name: ledyba

3224.text: While its believed that starlight provides it with energy, this Pokmon also loves to eat berries. In the daytime, it curls up in the grass to sleep.
3224.name: ledian

3225.text: It waits intently until its preferred prey, Cutiefly, gets caught in its web. In fact, its quite a patient Pokmon.
3225.name: spinarak

3226.text: There are some areas where people use the string Ariados spins for their own weaving. The resulting cloth is popular for its strength.
3226.name: ariados

3227.text: Both its legs became wings, and as a result, it cant move well on the ground. All it can do is crawl around.
3227.name: crobat

3228.text: Its two antennae were originally fins. It discharges electricity to stun its prey before attacking.
3228.name: chinchou

3229.text: Should you peer into the ocean at night and see a light shining like the stars, that is Lanturn.
3229.name: lanturn

3230.text: It is not yet skilled at controlling electricity. If you take your eyes off it, it may shock itself.
3230.name: pichu

3231.text: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.
3231.name: sudowoodo

3232.text: They gather on moonlit nights to form a large chorus. Their cries sound angry and not at all pleasant, but they are certainly distinctive.
3232.name: politoed

3233.text: It can instantaneously sense its opponents movements by feeling air currents with its fine fur.
3233.name: espeon

3234.text: They awaken at dusk and take wing in the twilight, leading to the expression, Get home before the Murkrow fly.
3234.name: murkrow

3235.text: A poisonous bite reacted with its system, blessing it with the enhanced intellect of a genius. It has full control of its psychic powers.
3235.name: slowking

3236.text: It will use any means necessary to frighten people and absorb their life energy. It practices constantly to hone its skill in causing fear.
3236.name: misdreavus

3237.text: Despite its intimidating face, its quite cowardly. Its desperate attempts to appear threatening make it popular with people.
3237.name: snubbull

3238.text: Its well-developed lower jaw and heavy fangs are its weapons. As long as its not provoked, it rarely bites.
3238.name: granbull

3239.text: It uses its wings to adjust its body temperature. Otherwise, its metal body would become too hot and melt in the heat of battle.
3239.name: scizor

3240.text: Coral branches grow from its head. They break off quite easily, but they grow back in about three days.
3240.name: corsola

3241.text: Although it naturally prefers colder locales, Delibird in Alola seem able to withstand the heat to a certain extent.
3241.name: delibird

3242.text: Its feathers, which fall off as it grows, are thin and sharp. In times long past, warriors used them as swords.
3242.name: skarmory

3243.text: For the purposes of planetary development, Porygon was updated with the most cutting-edge technology available.
3243.name: porygon2

3244.text: The unique creations produced by each Smeargle are painted using the fluid that oozes from its tail. This is how it marks its territory.
3244.name: smeargle

3245.text: When its in a house, electrical outlets serve as its baby bottles. It sucks down electricity.
3245.name: elekid

3246.text: Many of these Pokmon can be seen in areas with volcanic activity. Feeding can get them so excited, they exhale flames of 1,100 degrees F.
3246.name: magby

3247.text: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltanks.
3247.name: miltank

3248.text: Even the most ferocious Pokmon become calm when they eat Blisseys egg, which is said to be filled with happiness.
3248.name: blissey

3249.text: Its hollow bones enhance its lightness. It spreads its wings to the wind and soars away into the sky.
3249.name: wingull

3250.text: Its spacious beak is large enough for a small child to fit right inside.
3250.name: pelipper

3251.text: It moves as if skating on the surface of the water. It often fights with Dewpider over food.
3251.name: surskit

3252.text: It intimidates enemies with the eye-like patterns on its antennae. Its four wings allow it to fly in any direction.
3252.name: masquerain

3253.text: It was originally brought in from another region, but now Makuhita from Alola are more famous.
3253.name: makuhita

3254.text: It is known for its fantastic strength, but as it grows older, it focuses more on training Makuhita.
3254.name: hariyama

3255.text: Its a fiend for gemstones, so it stalks Carbink. Unfortunately, Gabite almost always grabs them first.
3255.name: sableye

3256.text: Each school has its own territory. Any intruders are mercilessly attacked with fangs bared.
3256.name: carvanha

3257.text: It pursues its prey at speeds of 75 mph and finishes them off with fangs that can crush iron. It is known as the bully of the sea.
3257.name: sharpedo

3258.text: It loves to startle people. It fills itself up with seawater and plays by bouncing around like a ball.
3258.name: wailmer

3259.text: Wailord pursue their prey in pods. With their large mouths, they can swallow entire schools of Wishiwashi whole.
3259.name: wailord

3260.text: Its steps are staggering and unsteady, but Spinda thinks its walking in a straight line.
3260.name: spinda

3261.text: It can live for a week without eating a thing. It waits patiently at the bottom of its nest for prey to appear.
3261.name: trapinch

3262.text: A glutton that devours anything that moves, it quietly lurks at the bottom of swamps, lying in wait for prey.
3262.name: whiscash

3263.text: It changes its form depending on the weather. Changes in the temperature or humidity appear to affect its cellular structure.
3263.name: castform

3264.text: Long ago, superstitions were spread about it, saying it brought disaster. This fed a hatred of it, and it was driven deep into the mountains.
3264.name: absol

3265.text: Their numbers seem to have rapidly increased in Alola. Custom has it that houses where Snorunt live will be prosperous for generations to come.
3265.name: snorunt

3266.text: Legend says a boulder on an icy mountain absorbed the distress and regrets of a stranded mountaineer, giving rise to Glalie.
3266.name: glalie

3267.text: Its form has remained the same for one hundred million years. Its body is filled with fat, so it can withstand the water pressure of the deep sea.
3267.name: relicanth

3268.text: If a Luvdisc is left on its own, it becomes despondent, leaving itself open to attack. That is when Pelipper snatch them up.
3268.name: luvdisc

3269.text: When angered, it loses all sense of itself and destroys everything around it. The destruction will continue until Salamence has tired itself out.
3269.name: salamence

3270.text: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.
3270.name: metang

3271.text: It firmly pins its prey using its four claws and large body. Then the teeth in the mouth on its stomach chew the prey to bits.
3271.name: metagross

3272.text: The result of repeated headbutts is a skull grown thick and hard. However, its brain has shrunk in size compared with Cranidoss.
3272.name: rampardos

3273.text: Many fossils of this Pokmon have been found, but almost none have shown signs of damage to the face.
3273.name: shieldon

3274.text: For the most part, it makes its home along the seashore. Its color and form differ according to its habitat and the quality of its food.
3274.name: shellos

3275.text: It has strong regenerative capabilities. Even if parts of it are bitten off by fish Pokmon, it will return to normal within a few hours.
3275.name: gastrodon

3276.text: Stories go that it grabs the hands of small children and drags them away to the afterlife. It dislikes heavy children.
3276.name: drifloon

3277.text: There was once an incident in which a man took a trip riding a Drifblim, only to go missing.
3277.name: drifblim

3278.text: It appears as if from nowheremuttering incantations, placing curses, and giving people terrifying visions.
3278.name: mismagius

3279.text: It does not deal well with water, so it lives in dry locales. Since its surroundings tend to lack greenery, it stands out noticeably.
3279.name: bonsly

3280.text: It lives in caves warmed by geothermal heat. Even so, when the weather gets cold, it will huddle close with others of its kind.
3280.name: gible

3281.text: It can fly at speeds rivaling jet planes. It dives into flocks of bird Pokmon and gulps the entire flock down whole.
3281.name: garchomp

3282.text: It can discern the physical and emotional states of people, Pokmon, and other natural things from the shape of their aura waves.
3282.name: riolu

3283.text: Not only does it perceive auras, but it has also gained the power to control them. It employs them in battle.
3283.name: lucario

3284.text: Three units generate magnetism. There have been many mistaken reports of UFO sightings when Magnezone flies through the night sky.
3284.name: magnezone

3285.text: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.
3285.name: electivire

3286.text: Its cellular composition is closer to that of a plant than an animal. It uses photosynthesis to produce its energy supply without eating food.
3286.name: leafeon

3287.text: In order to create a more advanced Pokmon, an additional program was installed, but apparently it contained a defect that makes it move oddly.
3287.name: porygonz

3288.text: It radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances become unusable.
3288.name: probopass

3289.text: Because it doesnt yelp, its extremely popular with Trainers who live in apartment buildings.
3289.name: lillipup

3290.text: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed makes this a troublesome Pokmon to train.
3290.name: herdier

3291.text: Intelligent, good-natured, and valiant, its a trustworthy partner on rescue teams.
3291.name: stoutland

3292.text: Born deep within the ground, it compares itself with similar species, such as Geodude and Carbink, to settle which has the hardest body.
3292.name: roggenrola

3293.text: Its orange crystal is a mass of energy. Just one crystal fragment would provide enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.
3293.name: boldore

3294.text: The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams have terrifying power. However, its not able to fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.
3294.name: gigalith

3295.text: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
3295.name: cottonee

3296.text: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from wearinesseven more so when boiled.
3296.name: petilil

3297.text: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.
3297.name: krokorok

3298.text: Based on studies of its skeletal structure, it can apparently dive to ocean depths of over half a mile.
3298.name: tirtouga

3299.text: It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.
3299.name: carracosta

3300.text: It is the ancestor of all bird Pokmon. Archen itself could not actually fly but moved by hopping from treetop to treetop.
3300.name: archen

3301.text: Although apparently able to fly, they tended to run along the ground, averaging speeds of roughly 25 mph.
3301.name: archeops

3302.text: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.
3302.name: trubbish

3303.text: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, youll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
3303.name: garbodor

3304.text: Born of an icicle, this Pokmon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.
3304.name: vanillite

3305.text: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.
3305.name: vanillish

3306.text: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.
3306.name: vanilluxe

3307.text: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.
3307.name: emolga

3308.text: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokmon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.
3308.name: alomomola

3309.text: With its brave disposition, it fears nothingnot even death. Ancient Alolan people respected it, referring to it as the hero of the sky.
3309.name: braviary

3310.text: It protects its plump posterior with the bones of prey it has consumed. As it grows, it  replaces the bones.
3310.name: vullaby

3311.text: They adorn themselves beautifully with bones. This is supposedly an effort to attract males, but no male Mandibuzz have ever been found.
3311.name: mandibuzz

3312.text: This amiable Pokmon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side.
3312.name: fletchling

3313.text: From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once it has caught them, it grills them at high heat before feasting upon them.
3313.name: fletchinder

3314.text: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.
3314.name: talonflame

3315.text: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.
3315.name: pancham

3316.text: It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoros Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.
3316.name: pangoro

3317.text: Its ribbonlike feelers give off an aura that weakens hostility in its prey, causing them to let down their guard. Then it attacks.
3317.name: sylveon

3318.text: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokmon, its unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
3318.name: goomy

3319.text: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.
3319.name: sliggoo

3320.text: An amazingly friendly Pokmon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
3320.name: goodra

3321.text: This even-tempered Pokmon has a habit of collecting keys. It will sneak into peoples homes to steal their keys.
3321.name: klefki

3322.text: These Pokmon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
3322.name: phantump

3323.text: This Pokmon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
3323.name: trevenant

3324.text: This is Zygardes form when it has gathered 50% of its cells. It wipes out all those who oppose it, showing not a shred of mercy.
3324.name: zygarde

3325.text: This wary Pokmon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.
3325.name: rowlet

3326.text: A bit of a dandy, it spends its free time preening its wings. Its preoccupation with any dirt on its plumage can leave it unable to battle.
3326.name: dartrix

3327.text: It fires arrow quills from its wings with such precision, they can pierce a pebble at distances over a hundred yards.
3327.name: decidueye

3328.text: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever this Pokmon spits fire.
3328.name: torracat

3329.text: This Pokmon has a violent, selfish disposition. If its not in the mood to listen, it will ignore its Trainers orders with complete nonchalance.
3329.name: incineroar

3330.text: This Pokmon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. Its famous for being a hard worker.
3330.name: popplio

3331.text: It controls its water balloons with song. The melody is learned from others of its kind and is passed down from one generation to the next.
3331.name: primarina

3332.text: It can peck at a rate of 16 times a second to drill holes in trees. It uses the holes for food storage and for nesting.
3332.name: pikipek

3333.text: It eats berries and stores their seeds in its beak. When it encounters enemies or prey, it fires off all the seeds in a burst.
3333.name: trumbeak

3334.text: When it battles, its beak heats up. The temperature can easily exceed 212 degrees Fahrenheit, causing severe burns when it hits.
3334.name: toucannon

3335.text: With its sharp fangs, it will bite anything. It did not originally live in Alola but was imported from another region.
3335.name: yungoos

3336.text: When it finds a trace of its prey, it patiently stakes out the location...but its always snoozing by nightfall.
3336.name: gumshoos

3337.text: Its strong jaw enables it to scrape trees and slurp out the sap. It normally lives underground.
3337.name: grubbin

3338.text: Its body is capable of storing electricity. On camping trips, people are grateful to have one around.
3338.name: charjabug

3339.text: It zips around, on sharp lookout for an opening. It concentrates electrical energy within its large jaws and uses it to zap its enemies.
3339.name: vikavolt

3340.text: While guarding its weak points with its pincers, it looks for an opening and unleashes punches. When it loses, it foams at the mouth and faints.
3340.name: crabrawler

3341.text: It aimed for the top but got lost and ended up on a snowy mountain. Being forced to endure the cold, this Pokmon evolved and grew fur.
3341.name: crabominable

3342.text: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
3342.name: oricorio

3343.text: It feeds on the nectar and pollen of flowers. Because its able to sense auras, it can identify which flowers are about to bloom.
3343.name: cutiefly

3344.text: It rolls up pollen into puffs. It makes many different varieties, some used as food and others used in battle.
3344.name: ribombee

3345.text: Its considered to be a good Pokmon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
3345.name: rockruff

3346.text: Its quick movements confuse its enemies. Well equipped with claws and fangs, it also uses the sharp rocks in its mane as weapons.
3346.name: lycanroc

3347.text: When its in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
3347.name: wishiwashi

3348.text: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
3348.name: mareanie

3349.text: Toxapex crawls along the ocean floor on its 12 legs. It leaves a trail of Corsola bits scattered in its wake.
3349.name: toxapex

3350.text: The mud stuck to Mudbrays hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
3350.name: mudbray

3351.text: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
3351.name: mudsdale

3352.text: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.
3352.name: dewpider

3353.text: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokmon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.
3353.name: araquanid

3354.text: During the day, it sleeps and soaks up light. When night falls, it walks around looking for a safer place to sleep.
3354.name: fomantis

3355.text: It requires a lot of effort to maintain Lurantiss vivid coloring, but some collectors enjoy this work and treat it as their hobby.
3355.name: lurantis

3356.text: It scatters spores that flicker and glow. Anyone seeing these lights falls into a deep slumber.
3356.name: morelull

3357.text: Forests where Shiinotic live are treacherous to enter at night. People confused by its strange lights can never find their way home again.
3357.name: shiinotic

3358.text: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
3358.name: salandit

3359.text: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
3359.name: salazzle

3360.text: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.
3360.name: stufful

3361.text: This immensely dangerous Pokmon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
3361.name: bewear

3362.text: A delectable aroma pours from its body. They are often swallowed whole by Toucannon lured by that wafting deliciousness.
3362.name: bounsweet

3363.text: The sepals on its head developed to protect its body. These are quite hard, so even if pecked by bird Pokmon, this Pokmon is totally fine.
3363.name: steenee

3364.text: Its long, striking legs arent just for show but to be used to kick with skill. In victory, it shows off by kicking the defeated, laughing boisterously.
3364.name: tsareena

3365.text: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
3365.name: comfey

3366.text: Known for its extreme intelligence, this Pokmon will look down on inexperienced Trainers, so its best suited to veteran Trainers.
3366.name: oranguru

3367.text: They form groups of roughly 20 individuals. Their mutual bond is remarkablethey will never let down a comrade.
3367.name: passimian

3368.text: This Pokmon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
3368.name: wimpod

3369.text: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawateror even airright in two.
3369.name: golisopod

3370.text: Born from a sand mound playfully built by a child, this Pokmon embodies the grudges of the departed.
3370.name: sandygast

3371.text: Possessed people controlled by this Pokmon transformed its sand mound into a castle. As it evolved, its power to curse grew ever stronger.
3371.name: palossand

3372.text: It lives in shallow seas, such as areas near a beach. It can eject its internal organs, which it uses to engulf its prey or battle enemies.
3372.name: pyukumuku

3373.text: The heavy control mask it wears suppresses its intrinsic capabilities. This Pokmon has some hidden special power.
3373.name: typenull

3374.text: Its trust in its partner is what awakens it. This Pokmon is capable of changing its type, a flexibility that is well displayed in battle.
3374.name: silvally

3375.text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
3375.name: minior

3376.text: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
3376.name: komala

3377.text: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
3377.name: turtonator

3378.text: The spiny fur on its back is normally at rest. When this Pokmon becomes agitated, its fur stands on end and stabs into its attackers.
3378.name: togedemaru

3379.text: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by terror and died from the shock.
3379.name: mimikyu

3380.text: When it unleashes its psychic power from the protuberance on its head, the grating sound of grinding teeth echoes through the area.
3380.name: bruxish

3381.text: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
3381.name: dhelmise

3382.text: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
3382.name: jangmoo

3383.text: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.
3383.name: hakamoo

3384.text: When it spots enemies, it threatens them by jingling the scales on its tail. Weak opponents will crack and flee in panic.
3384.name: kommoo

3385.text: This guardian deity of Melemele is brimming with curiosity. It summons thunderclouds and stores their lightning inside its body.
3385.name: tapukoko

3386.text: This guardian deity of Akala is guilelessly cruel. The fragrant aroma of flowers is the source of its energy.
3386.name: tapulele

3387.text: It pulls large trees up by the roots and swings them around. It causes vegetation to grow, and then it absorbs energy from the growth.
3387.name: tapubulu

3388.text: The dense fog it creates brings the downfall and destruction of its confused enemies. Ocean currents are the source of its energy.
3388.name: tapufini

3389.text: Its body is gaseous and frail. It slowly grows as it collects dust from the atmosphere.
3389.name: cosmog

3390.text: Motionless as if dead, its body is faintly warm to the touch. In the distant past, it was called the cocoon of the stars.
3390.name: cosmoem

3391.text: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
3391.name: solgaleo

3392.text: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
3392.name: lunala

3393.text: One of several mysterious Ultra Beasts. People on the street report observing those infested by it suddenly becoming violent.
3393.name: nihilego

3394.text: This Ultra Beast appeared from another world. It shows off its body, but whether that display is a boast or a threat remains unclear.
3394.name: buzzwole

3395.text: One of the dangerous Ultra Beasts, it has been spotted running across the land at terrific speeds.
3395.name: pheromosa

3396.text: One of the mysterious life-forms known as Ultra Beasts. Astonishing electric shocks emanate from its entire body, according to witnesses.
3396.name: xurkitree

3397.text: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. Witnesses observed it flying across the sky at high speed.
3397.name: celesteela

3398.text: This Ultra Beast came from the Ultra Wormhole. It seems not to attack enemies on its own, but its sharp body is a dangerous weapon in itself.
3398.name: kartana

3399.text: It has gobbled mountains and swallowed whole buildings, according to reports. Its one of the Ultra Beasts.
3399.name: guzzlord

3400.text: Reminiscent of the Ultra Beasts, this life-form, apparently asleep underground, is thought to have come from another world in ancient times.
3400.name: necrozma

3401.text: This artificial Pokmon, constructed more than 500 years ago, can understand human speech but cannot itself speak.
3401.name: magearna

3402.text: Able to conceal itself in shadows, it never appears before humans, so its very existence was the stuff of myth.
3402.name: marshadow

3403.text: With its incisors, it gnaws through doors and infiltrates people's homes. Then, with a twitch of its whiskers, it steals whatever food it finds.
3403.name: rattataalola

3404.text: It forms a group of Rattata, which it assumes command of. Each group has its own territory, and disputes over food happen often.
3404.name: raticatealola

3405.text: It only evolves to this form in the Alola region. According to researchers, its diet is one of the causes of this change.
3405.name: raichualola

3406.text: Fleeing a volcanic eruption, it settled on a snowy mountain. As it races through the snowfields, it sends up a spray of snow.
3406.name: sandslashalola

3407.text: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokmon by an older nameKeokeo.
3407.name: vulpixalola

3408.text: Its head sports an altered form of whiskers made of metal. When in communication with its comrades, its whiskers wobble to and fro.
3408.name: diglettalola

3409.text: Its shining gold hair provides it with protection. It's reputed that keeping any of its fallen hairs will bring bad luck.
3409.name: dugtrioalola

3410.text: This Pokmon was not originally found in Alola. Human actions caused a surge in their numbers, and they went feral. They're prideful and crafty.
3410.name: meowthalola

3411.text: Its round face and smooth coatsofter than the most high-class velvethave made this a very popular Pokmon in Alola.
3411.name: persianalola

3412.text: As a result of Mega Evolution, its power has been entirely converted into psychic energy, and it has lost all strength in its muscles.
3412.name: alakazammega

3413.text: Its preferred food is dravite. After it has eaten this mineral, crystals form inside the Pokmon, rising to the surface of part of its body.
3413.name: graveleralola

3414.text: All the energy from Mega Evolution poured into the Shellder on its tail, leaving Slowpoke to be swallowed whole.
3414.name: slowbromega

3415.text: A Grimer, which had been brought in to solve a problem with garbage, developed over time into this form.
3415.name: grimeralola

3416.text: The garbage it eats causes continuous chemical changes in its body, which produce its exceedingly vivid coloration.
3416.name: mukalola

3417.text: Gengar's relationships are warped. It has no interest in opponents unless it perceives them as prey.
3417.name: gengarmega

3418.text: Alola is the best environment for this Pokmon. Local people take pride in its appearance, saying this is how Exeggutor ought to look.
3418.name: exeggutoralola

3419.text: The bones it possesses were once its mother's. Its mother's regrets have become like a vengeful spirit protecting this Pokmon.
3419.name: marowakalola

3420.text: Mega Kangaskhan's strength derives from the mother's happiness about her child's growth. Watching it grow up keeps her spirits high.
3420.name: kangaskhanmega

3421.text: The influence of Mega Evolution leaves it in a state of constant excitement. It pierces enemies with its two large horns before shredding them.
3421.name: pinsirmega

3422.text: Mega Evolution also affects its brain, leaving no other function except its destructive instinct to burn everything to cinders.
3422.name: gyaradosmega

3423.text: The excess energy that bathes this Pokmon keeps it in constant danger of overflow. It can't sustain a battle over long periods of time.
3423.name: scizormega

3424.text: This is the form Castform takes on the brightest of days. Its skin is unexpectedly hot to the touch, so approach with care.
3424.name: castformsunny

3425.text: This is the form Castform takes when soaked with rain. When its body is compressed, water will seep out as if from a sponge.
3425.name: castformrainy

3426.text: This is the form Castform takes when covered in snow. Its body becomes an ice-like material, with a temperature near 23 degrees Fahrenheit.
3426.name: castformsnowy

3427.text: The excess energy from Mega Evolution spilled over from its mouth, breaking its jaw. It spews endless blizzards.
3427.name: glaliemega

3428.text: Anyone standing in its path gets sliced right in two, while this Pokmon continues its flight without interruption.
3428.name: salamencemega

3429.text: Shellos lives in the sea and feasts on plankton. The lovelier the ocean where Shellos resides, the more vibrant its color becomes.
3429.name: shelloseast

3430.text: A team of researchers is scouring the oceans of the world in search of a Gastrodon in a color never seen before.
3430.name: gastrodoneast

3431.text: Excess energy melted its arms and wings, transforming them into giant scythes.
3431.name: garchompmega

3432.text: Its sharp fangs make short work of finishing off its enemies, but it's unable to maintain this body indefinitely. After a period of time, it falls apart.
3432.name: zygarde10

3433.text: This is Zygarde's form at times when it uses its overwhelming power to suppress those who endanger the ecosystem.
3433.name: zygardecomplete

3434.text: This Oricorio has sipped bright yellow nectar. Its bright, cheerful dance melts the hearts of its enemies.
3434.name: oricoriopompom

3435.text: This Oricorio relaxes by swaying gently. This increases its psychic energy, which it then fires at its enemies.
3435.name: oricoriopau

3436.text: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Its elegant, attractive dance will send the minds and hearts of its enemies to another world.
3436.name: oricoriosensu

3437.text: The more intimidating the opponent it faces, the more this Pokmon's blood boils. It will attack with no regard for its own safety.
3437.name: lycanrocmidnight

3438.text: Weak Wishiwashi school together to concentrate their power. Their united force makes them the demon of the sea, feared near and far.
3438.name: wishiwashischool

3439.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3439.name: silvallyfighting

3440.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3440.name: silvallyflying

3441.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3441.name: silvallypoison

3442.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3442.name: silvallyground

3443.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3443.name: silvallyrock

3444.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3444.name: silvallybug

3445.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3445.name: silvallyghost

3446.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3446.name: silvallysteel

3447.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3447.name: silvallyfire

3448.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3448.name: silvallywater

3449.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3449.name: silvallygrass

3450.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3450.name: silvallyelectric

3451.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3451.name: silvallypsychic

3452.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3452.name: silvallyice

3453.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3453.name: silvallydragon

3454.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3454.name: silvallydark

3455.text: It destroyed its own control mask. It has become capable of changing its type by equipping special memories.
3455.name: silvallyfairy

3456.text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
3456.name: miniormeteororange

3457.text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
3457.name: miniormeteoryellow

3458.text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
3458.name: miniormeteorgreen

3459.text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
3459.name: miniormeteorblue

3460.text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
3460.name: miniormeteorindigo

3461.text: Originally making its home in the ozone layer, it hurtles to the ground when the shell enclosing its body grows too heavy.
3461.name: miniormeteorviolet

3462.text: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
3462.name: miniorred

3463.text: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
3463.name: miniororange

3464.text: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
3464.name: minioryellow

3465.text: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
3465.name: miniorgreen

3466.text: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
3466.name: miniorblue

3467.text: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
3467.name: miniorindigo

3468.text: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
3468.name: miniorviolet

3469.text: After going to all the effort of disguising itself, its neck was broken. Whatever is inside is probably unharmed, but it's still feeling sad.
3469.name: mimikyubusted

3470.text: This beautiful form reflects Magearna's appearance when first presented to a king's daughter 500 years ago.
3470.name: magearnaoriginal

3471.text: Its easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making it one of the top recommendations for novice Pokmon Trainers.
3471.name: caterpie

3472.text: Its shell is hard, but its still just a bug shell. Its been known to break, so intense battles with it should be avoided.
3472.name: metapod

3473.text: When attacked by other Pokmon, it defends itself by scattering its poisonous scales and fluttering its wings.
3473.name: butterfree

3474.text: With their strong capacity for survival, they can live in dirty places without concern. Left unchecked, their numbers multiply rapidly.
3474.name: rattata

3475.text: Its disposition is far more violent than its looks would suggest. Dont let your hand get too close to its face, as it could bite your hand clean off.
3475.name: raticate

3476.text: Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug Pokmon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous appetite and look after it.
3476.name: spearow

3477.text: Drawings of a Pokmon resembling Fearow can be seen in murals from deep in ancient history.
3477.name: fearow

3478.text: Its in its nature to store electricity. It feels stressed now and then if its unable to fully discharge the electricity.
3478.name: pikachu

3479.text: It becomes aggressive when it has electricity stored up. At such times, even its Trainer has to take care to avoid being attacked.
3479.name: raichu

3480.text: It usually makes its home in deserts and arid zones, where rain does not fall. It digs holes to catch Bug-type Pokmon.
3480.name: sandshrew

3481.text: It uses its claws to climb trees and then curls its body into a spiny ball, ready to drop onto any prey that appears.
3481.name: sandslash

3482.text: According to tradition, people who see a pair of Clefable skipping by can look forward to a happy marriage.
3482.name: clefable

3483.text: From its mouth spew flames that seem to resemble the spirits of the deceased. Some people mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.
3483.name: vulpix

3484.text: Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokmon uses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire. It can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.
3484.name: ninetales

3485.text: Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individuals singing skill depends on its own effort.
3485.name: jigglypuff

3486.text: As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.
3486.name: wigglytuff

3487.text: When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns. The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can differ slightly from colony to colony.
3487.name: zubat

3488.text: Sometimes they drink so much blood, they cant fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and become food for other Pokmon.
3488.name: golbat

3489.text: Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its back. They can be dried and powdered to make a medicine used to extend life.
3489.name: paras

3490.text: It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap. Once harvested, these spores can be steeped and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.
3490.name: parasect

3491.text: Many farmers cherish and nurture Diglett because its droppings enrich the soil it lives in.
3491.name: diglett

3492.text: Despite the closeness between this Pokmon and farmers and other people, no one has ever seen the parts of it concealed underground.
3492.name: dugtrio

3493.text: It loves shiny things. It often fights with Murkrow over prey theyre both trying to catch.
3493.name: meowth

3494.text: It has a high opinion of itself, although not to the same extent as the Alolan Persian. Its quite difficult to make friends with this Pokmon.
3494.name: persian

3495.text: This Pokmon is troubled by constant headaches. The more pain its in, the more powerful its psychokinesis becomes.
3495.name: psyduck

3496.text: It swims along the banks of lakes and catches fish Pokmon. It takes them to the shore and quietly eats them up.
3496.name: golduck

3497.text: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake upwhich infuriates it all over again.
3497.name: mankey

3498.text: It looks cute, but when you approach another Trainers Growlithe, it will bark at you and bite.
3498.name: growlithe

3499.text: The fire burning inside its body serves as the energy to fuel it as it runs great distances. It appears in many legends.
3499.name: arcanine

3500.text: Its still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokmon to walk every day.
3500.name: poliwag

3501.text: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokmon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where its safe.
3501.name: poliwhirl

3502.text: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.
3502.name: poliwrath

3503.text: It can teleport itself to safety while its asleep, but when it wakes, it doesnt know where it is, so it panics.
3503.name: abra

3504.text: Kadabras presence infests televisions and monitors with creepy shadows that bring bad luck.
3504.name: kadabra

3505.text: Its brain cells continue to increase in number until its death. The older the Alakazam, the larger its head.
3505.name: alakazam

3506.text: With its superhuman strength, its able to throw a hundred people all at the same time. Its strength comes from lifting Graveler every day.
3506.name: machop

3507.text: It willingly assists with hard labor because it knows the work is good training for its muscles.
3507.name: machoke

3508.text: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
3508.name: machamp

3509.text: It drifts in shallow seas, such as the areas near beaches. If you get bitten or stabbed by its toxic tentacles, rush to the hospital.
3509.name: tentacool

3510.text: Although these Pokmon are rare, when a large outbreak of them occurs, all fish Pokmon disappear from the surrounding sea.
3510.name: tentacruel

3511.text: There are plenty of them to be found along any road. A scholar with too much free time once counted a hundred of them along a single route.
3511.name: geodude

3512.text: This slow-footed Pokmon moves by curling up and rolling instead of walking. With enough momentum, its speed can exceed 60 mph.
3512.name: graveler

3513.text: Once a year, this Pokmon molts, and its shed shell returns to the soil. This process creates enriched soil, so farmers collect the shells.
3513.name: golem

3514.text: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.
3514.name: slowpoke

3515.text: Whenever Shellder bites down hard on its tail, it gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it forgets a moment later.
3515.name: slowbro

3516.text: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while its eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.
3516.name: magnemite

3517.text: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokmon happen when lots of sunspots appear.
3517.name: magneton

3518.text: It was born from sludge transformed by exposure to X-rays from the moon. When its internal load of germs decreases, it dies.
3518.name: grimer

3519.text: After recent environmental improvements, this Pokmon is now hardly seen at all. People speculate that it may go extinct at some point.
3519.name: muk

3520.text: This Pokmons tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.
3520.name: shellder

3521.text: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokmons shell.
3521.name: cloyster

3522.text: Although Gastly is barely visible, when its near, a faint sweet smell lingers.
3522.name: gastly

3523.text: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.
3523.name: haunter

3524.text: It apparently wishes for a traveling companion. Since it was once human itself, it tries to create one by taking the lives of other humans.
3524.name: gengar

3525.text: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams its ever eaten.
3525.name: drowzee

3526.text: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.
3526.name: hypno

3527.text: Six of them together form a full-fledged Pokmon. Its often hunted by Crabrawler, but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.
3527.name: exeggcute

3528.text: When the time comes, one of its three heads falls off. Before long, the fallen head grows into an Exeggcute.
3528.name: exeggutor

3529.text: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.
3529.name: cubone

3530.text: This Pokmon is out for vengeance on its natural enemy, Mandibuzz. It throws bones like boomerangs to try to take it down.
3530.name: marowak

3531.text: Not only are these Pokmon fast runners, theyre also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.
3531.name: chansey

3532.text: The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly three years. That is the only time the mother is heard to cry wildly.
3532.name: kangaskhan

3533.text: Spellbound by the length of its horn and the beauty of its fins, many strange Trainers raise Goldeen and nothing but Goldeen.
3533.name: goldeen

3534.text: Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided into horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts. The two groups do not get along well.
3534.name: seaking

3535.text: This Pokmon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so its unconcerned by their snack attacks.
3535.name: staryu

3536.text: Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract art, led local people to spread rumors that this Pokmon may be an invader from outer space.
3536.name: starmie

3537.text: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.
3537.name: scyther

3538.text: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.
3538.name: electabuzz

3539.text: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesnt calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.
3539.name: magmar

3540.text: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.
3540.name: pinsir

3541.text: Although its known to be a fierce Pokmon, Tauros in the Alola region are said to possess a measure of calmness.
3541.name: tauros

3542.text: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokmon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.
3542.name: magikarp

3543.text: There are people who swear that any place Gyarados appears is fated for destruction.
3543.name: gyarados

3544.text: These Pokmon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.
3544.name: lapras

3545.text: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.
3545.name: ditto

3546.text: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokmon.
3546.name: eevee

3547.text: Blending in with the water and erasing all signs of its presence, it patiently waits for its prey, fish Pokmon.
3547.name: vaporeon

3548.text: When its fur stands on end, thats a sign its about to give off a jolt of electricity. Take care, as sometimes lightning strikes next to it, too.
3548.name: jolteon

3549.text: Its average body temperature is between 1,300 and 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. In its internal flame sac, temperatures reach 3,000 degrees.
3549.name: flareon

3550.text: It can convert its body into digital data, which enables it to enter cyberspace.
3550.name: porygon

3551.text: In ancient times, it ruled the skies. A widely accepted theory is that it went extinct due to a large meteor impact.
3551.name: aerodactyl

3552.text: It eats nearly 900 pounds of food every day. It starts nodding off while eatingand continues to eat even while its asleep.
3552.name: snorlax

3553.text: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.
3553.name: dratini

3554.text: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.
3554.name: dragonair

3555.text: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokmon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before its satisfied.
3555.name: dragonite

3556.text: They communicate with one another using bodily fluids that give off odors. When theyre angry, their odor smells sour.
3556.name: ledyba

3557.text: In battle, it throws punches with all four arms. The power of each individual blow is piddly, so it aims to win by quantity rather than quality.
3557.name: ledian

3558.text: It spins thread from both its rear and its mouth. Then it wraps its prey up in thread and sips their bodily fluids at its leisure.
3558.name: ariados

3559.text: Silent and swift in its four-winged flight, it bites down on its prey before they realize whats happening. In a heartbeat, it drains their blood.
3559.name: crobat

3560.text: Because of its silhouette, its believed to be a star reborn. For some reason, it loves Minior.
3560.name: cleffa

3561.text: It moves by bouncing along. As it moves a lot, it sweats, and its body gives off a sweet aroma.
3561.name: igglybuff

3562.text: Apparently, the larger the green parts of this Pokmon, the more collectors value it. Its a particular favorite among elderly people.
3562.name: sudowoodo

3563.text: With its black fur, it blends into the darkness. It bides its time, and when prey appears, this Pokmon goes for its throat, and then eats it.
3563.name: umbreon

3564.text: Seen as a symbol of bad luck, its generally disliked. Yet it gives presentsobjects that sparkle or shineto Trainers its close to.
3564.name: murkrow

3565.text: This Pokmon is so famed for its intellect that a proverb still persists in some regions: When in doubt, ask Slowking.
3565.name: slowking

3566.text: If you hear a sobbing sound emanating from a vacant room, its undoubtedly a bit of mischief from Misdreavus.
3566.name: misdreavus

3567.text: More timid than Snubbull, this Pokmon is doted on by young people amused at the contrast between its looks and its attitude.
3567.name: granbull

3568.text: Once it has identified an enemy, this Pokmon smashes it mercilessly with pincers hard as steel.
3568.name: scizor

3569.text: It uses its claws to poke holes in eggs so it can slurp out the insides. Breeders consider it a scourge and will drive it away or eradicate it.
3569.name: sneasel

3570.text: Pursued by Mareanie for the branches on its head, this Pokmon will sometimes snap its own branches off as a diversion while it escapes.
3570.name: corsola

3571.text: Its metal body is sturdy, but it does rust rather easily. So on rainy days, this Pokmon prefers to stay put in its nest.
3571.name: skarmory

3572.text: Porygon was updated to a new version in readiness for planetary development. But that dream remains unrealized as yet.
3572.name: porygon2

3573.text: It draws symbols all over the place to mark its territory. In towns with many Smeargle, the walls are covered in graffiti.
3573.name: smeargle

3574.text: This Pokmon is constantly fighting with Togedemaru that try to steal its electricity. Its a pretty even match.
3574.name: elekid

3575.text: A famous potter lives with a Magby. Apparently its soft flames produce fine works.
3575.name: magby

3576.text: Most people raise it for its milk, but its quite tough and strong, so its also well suited for battle.
3576.name: miltank

3577.text: Its fluffy fur coat acts as a sensor, enabling it to read the feelings of people and Pokmon.
3577.name: blissey

3578.text: Fishermen keep an eye out for Wingull in the sky, because wherever theyre circling, the ocean is sure to be teeming with fish Pokmon.
3578.name: wingull

3579.text: Gathering food is the work of young males. They store food in their capacious beaks and carry it back to others waiting in the nest.
3579.name: pelipper

3580.text: When this Pokmon senses danger, a sweet fluid oozes from the tip of its head. The taste of it disgusts bird Pokmon.
3580.name: surskit

3581.text: Its wings and antennae dont cope well with moisture. After a rain, it faces sunward to dry off.
3581.name: masquerain

3582.text: Their daily routine consists of training together first thing in the morning, eating and napping in the afternoon, and then more training afterward.
3582.name: makuhita

3583.text: They love to compare their freakish strength strength enough to send a truck flying with a single slap.
3583.name: hariyama

3584.text: It uses powerful magnetism to drag its prey toward it. Its also been known to pull in metal, which it collects and uses to protect itself.
3584.name: nosepass

3585.text: If they scent the faintest trace of blood, they rush to attack en masse. When alone, theyre rather cowardly.
3585.name: carvanha

3586.text: It has a sad history. In the past, its dorsal fin was a treasured foodstuff, so this Pokmon became a victim of overfishing.
3586.name: sharpedo

3587.text: If the fire burning within its shell goes out, it will die. Those who wish to raise one in their home must always keep something flammable at hand.
3587.name: torkoal

3588.text: Each and every Spinda has a slightly different configuration of spots. There are collectors who enjoy the tiny differences in their spot patterns.
3588.name: spinda

3589.text: Its slippery body is hard to grasp, so much so that there are festivals where people compete to see how many they can catch barehanded.
3589.name: barboach

3590.text: Its form changes on its own, due to its cells sensitive reactions to temperature and humidity.
3590.name: castform

3591.text: Although its said to bring disaster, in actuality, this Pokmon possesses a calm disposition and warns people of any crises that loom.
3591.name: absol

3592.text: It was fortuitously discovered during a deep sea expedition. Its teeth have atrophied, so it now survives on microscopic organisms it sucks up.
3592.name: relicanth

3593.text: Loving couples have a soft spot for this Pokmon, so honeymoon hotels often release this Pokmon into their pools.
3593.name: luvdisc

3594.text: With its steel-hard stone head, it headbutts indiscriminately. This is because of the stress it feels at being unable to fly.
3594.name: bagon

3595.text: They lurk deep within cavesmotionless, neither eating nor drinking. Why they dont die is not known.
3595.name: shelgon

3596.text: With magnetic traction, it pulls its opponents in close. When theyre in range, it slashes them with its rear claws.
3596.name: beldum

3597.text: A linkage of two Metang, this Pokmon can perform any calculation in a flash by utilizing parallel processing in its four brains.
3597.name: metagross

3598.text: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.
3598.name: cranidos

3599.text: Records exist of a revived fossil that evolved into Rampardos. It proceeded to escape and then destroy a skyscraper with a headbutt.
3599.name: rampardos

3600.text: This Pokmon lived in primeval jungles. Few enemies would have been willing to square off against its heavily armored face, so its thought.
3600.name: shieldon

3601.text: It lived in the same environments as Rampardos. Their fossils have been found together seemingly from after theyd fought to the finish.
3601.name: bastiodon

3602.text: Purple mucus sticks to the hands of anyone who touches it. Take care, as the substance is troublesome to wash off.
3602.name: shellos

3603.text: Plankton, invisible to the naked eye, is its main food source. It comes onto the land periodically, but the reason for this is not known.
3603.name: gastrodon

3604.text: If for some reason its body bursts, its soul spills out with a screaming sound.
3604.name: drifloon

3605.text: Even while under careful observation, large flocks of Drifblim flying at dusk will inexplicably disappear from view.
3605.name: drifblim

3606.text: Mismagius have been known to cast spells to make people fall in love, so some people search for this Pokmon as if their life depended on it.
3606.name: mismagius

3607.text: If its Murkrow cronies fail to catch food for it, or if it feels they have betrayed it, it will hunt them down wherever they are and punish them.
3607.name: honchkrow

3608.text: Its too small to lay eggs yet. As a surrogate, it searches out round white stones.
3608.name: happiny

3609.text: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels its amassed or Carbink it has caught.
3609.name: gabite

3610.text: When it finds something that looks like it might be edible, it goes right ahead and swallows it whole. Thats why it gets fatter day by day.
3610.name: munchlax

3611.text: Its tough enough to run right through the night, and its also a hard worker, but its still just a youngster.
3611.name: riolu

3612.text: They can detect the species of a living being and its emotionsfrom over half a mile away. They control auras and hunt their prey in packs.
3612.name: lucario

3613.text: Its double tail fins propel its energetic jumps. When it breaks the surface of the sea, Wingull swoop down to grab it on the fly.
3613.name: finneon

3614.text: This deep-sea Pokmon lives at the bottom of the sea. Its fins haul it over the seabed in search of its favorite foodStarmie.
3614.name: lumineon

3615.text: They dwell in cold places. This Pokmons main food source in Alola is Vulpix and Sandshrew, which they carefully divide among their group.
3615.name: weavile

3616.text: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit. Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.
3616.name: magmortar

3617.text: It freezes its fur into icicles, spiky and sharp, and tackles its prey.
3617.name: glaceon

3618.text: Its program was modified to facilitate extra-dimensional activities, but that led to noticeably strange behavior.
3618.name: porygonz

3619.text: The main body controls three mobile units called Mini-Noses, which it maneuvers to catch prey.
3619.name: probopass

3620.text: The soul of a woman lost on a snowy mountain possessed an icicle, becoming this Pokmon. The food it most relishes is the souls of men.
3620.name: froslass

3621.text: The long fur surrounding its face functions as radar, enabling it to probe the condition of its battle opponents.
3621.name: lillipup

3622.text: This Pokmon obeys its masters orders faithfully. However, it refuses to listen to anything said by a person it doesnt respect.
3622.name: herdier

3623.text: With this wise Pokmon, there could be no concern that it would ever attack people. Some parents even trust it to babysit.
3623.name: stoutland

3624.text: The hexagonal cavity is its ear. It walks in the direction of sounds it hears, but if the sounds cease, it panics and topples over.
3624.name: roggenrola

3625.text: It explores caves in search of underground water. Its not comfortable around water, so this Pokmon takes great care in lapping it up.
3625.name: boldore

3626.text: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokmon is a popular partner for construction workers.
3626.name: gigalith

3627.text: This Pokmon appears, riding upon the wind. But if the wind gusts up, itll blow the cotton on this Pokmons head clean off.
3627.name: whimsicott

3628.text: As soon as it finds a male to be its partner, the beautiful flower on its head darkens, droops, and withers away.
3628.name: lilligant

3629.text: It conceals itself in the sand and chomps down on the legs of any prey that unwarily walk over it. Its favorite food is Trapinch.
3629.name: sandile

3630.text: Reputed to be the ancestor of most turtle Pokmon, it lived in warm seas approximately a hundred million years ago.
3630.name: tirtouga

3631.text: Active both on land and in the sea, this Pokmon drags its land-based prey into the water to finish it off.
3631.name: carracosta

3632.text: To all appearances flightless, it was able to glide down from tall treetops to snag its prey.
3632.name: archen

3633.text: They hunted in flocks. When one Archeops had the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.
3633.name: archeops

3634.text: It gorges on trash until its stomach is full. Then it belches toxic gas. An unlucky whiff of gas will put a person in the hospital.
3634.name: trubbish

3635.text: For a time, their numbers increased explosively in Alola. Since the arrival of Grimer, their population has decreased dramatically.
3635.name: garbodor

3636.text: It feels pleasantly cool when embraced. This Pokmon is treasured by households in warm regions.
3636.name: vanillite

3637.text: This Pokmon has existed since the Ice Age. It controls particles of ice, freezes its opponents, and then shatters them with a headbutt.
3637.name: vanillish

3638.text: Even if it loses one of its heads, it can live relatively problem-free. It makes snow clouds inside its body.
3638.name: vanilluxe

3639.text: It grills berries and bug Pokmon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.
3639.name: emolga

3640.text: Its thought that people disturbed their habitats in the past, so Braviary banded together to fight back.
3640.name: braviary

3641.text: It cant fly yet and must wait until its wings have developed more. Since its still at a playful age, it hops around friskily.
3641.name: vullaby

3642.text: It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for Pokmon in a weakened state. Its choicest food is Cubone.
3642.name: mandibuzz

3643.text: When its excited, its temperature can double, spiking hormone production in its body.
3643.name: fletchling

3644.text: It will not tolerate other Fletchinder entering its territory, which has a radius of several miles.
3644.name: fletchinder

3645.text: It zooms directly at its prey at flight speeds of close to 310 mph, while fiery embers scatter from gaps in its feathers.
3645.name: talonflame

3646.text: Theres no point to the leaf in its mouth, aside from an effort to look cool. Its mischievous, so its not well suited to inexperienced Trainers.
3646.name: pancham

3647.text: From the slight twitches of its bamboo leaf, it deduces its opponents movements. Its eager to tussle but kindhearted toward its companions.
3647.name: pangoro

3648.text: When this Pokmon sights its prey, it swirls its ribbonlike feelers as a distraction. A moment later, it pounces.
3648.name: sylveon

3649.text: Although this Pokmon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
3649.name: carbink

3650.text: Its source of protection is its slimy, germ-laden mucous membrane. Anyone who touches it needs some thorough hand-washing.
3650.name: goomy

3651.text: This Pokmons mucous can dissolve anything. Toothless, it sprays mucous on its prey. Once theyre nicely dissolved, it slurps them up.
3651.name: sliggoo

3652.text: It gets picked on because its meek. But then, whoever teased it gets to feel the full force of its horns and a good swatting from its thick tail.
3652.name: goodra

3653.text: It inserts its horn into chinks in metal, absorbing metal ions. For some reason, it collects keys.
3653.name: klefki

3654.text: According to legend, medicine to cure any illness can be made by plucking the green leaves on its head, brewing them, and boiling down the liquid.
3654.name: phantump

3655.text: Through its roots, it exerts control over other trees. A deadly curse falls upon anyone cutting down trees in forests where Trevenant dwell.
3655.name: trevenant

3656.text: Its thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.
3656.name: zygarde

3657.text: Although basically cool and cautious, when its caught by surprise, its seized by panic.
3657.name: decidueye

3658.text: It doesnt allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.
3658.name: litten

3659.text: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.
3659.name: torracat

3660.text: This Pokmon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.
3660.name: popplio

3661.text: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokmons Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.
3661.name: primarina

3662.text: This Pokmon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.
3662.name: pikipek

3663.text: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.
3663.name: trumbeak

3664.text: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.
3664.name: toucannon

3665.text: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.
3665.name: yungoos

3666.text: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as its diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokmon boasts incredible patience.
3666.name: gumshoos

3667.text: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokmon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokmon.
3667.name: grubbin

3668.text: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.
3668.name: charjabug

3669.text: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokmon with shocking beams of electrical energy.
3669.name: vikavolt

3670.text: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.
3670.name: crabrawler

3671.text: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.
3671.name: crabominable

3672.text: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.
3672.name: oricorio

3673.text: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.
3673.name: cutiefly

3674.text: Some of Ribombees pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.
3674.name: ribombee

3675.text: This Pokmon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainers side.
3675.name: rockruff

3676.text: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.
3676.name: lycanroc

3677.text: Its awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.
3677.name: wishiwashi

3678.text: Its found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsolas head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokmon.
3678.name: mareanie

3679.text: Those attacked by Toxapexs poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.
3679.name: toxapex

3680.text: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.
3680.name: mudbray

3681.text: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.
3681.name: mudsdale

3682.text: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokmon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.
3682.name: dewpider

3683.text: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokmon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.
3683.name: araquanid

3684.text: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.
3684.name: fomantis

3685.text: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.
3685.name: lurantis

3686.text: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.
3686.name: morelull

3687.text: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokmon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.
3687.name: shiinotic

3688.text: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokmon, then attacks them.
3688.name: salandit

3689.text: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.
3689.name: salazzle

3690.text: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. Its an incredibly dangerous Pokmon.
3690.name: stufful

3691.text: This Pokmon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.
3691.name: bewear

3692.text: Although its too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweets sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.
3692.name: bounsweet

3693.text: This Pokmon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokmon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.
3693.name: steenee

3694.text: A Pokmon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.
3694.name: tsareena

3695.text: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokmon is a hit with many people.
3695.name: comfey

3696.text: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokmon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.
3696.name: oranguru

3697.text: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.
3697.name: passimian

3698.text: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.
3698.name: wimpod

3699.text: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.
3699.name: golisopod

3700.text: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.
3700.name: sandygast

3701.text: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.
3701.name: palossand

3702.text: These Pokmon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!
3702.name: pyukumuku

3703.text: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokmon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.
3703.name: typenull

3704.text: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.
3704.name: silvally

3705.text: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokmon was born from mutated nanoparticles.
3705.name: minior

3706.text: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.
3706.name: komala

3707.text: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.
3707.name: turtonator

3708.text: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.
3708.name: togedemaru

3709.text: A lonely Pokmon, it conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokmon.
3709.name: mimikyu

3710.text: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellders shell is no match for it.
3710.name: bruxish

3711.text: This Pokmon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.
3711.name: drampa

3712.text: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokmon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.
3712.name: dhelmise

3713.text: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.
3713.name: jangmoo

3714.text: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time theyre regrown.
3714.name: hakamoo

3715.text: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.
3715.name: kommoo

3716.text: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.
3716.name: tapukoko

3717.text: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.
3717.name: tapulele

3718.text: The guardian deity of Ulaula is a lazy Pokmon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.
3718.name: tapubulu

3719.text: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.
3719.name: tapufini

3720.text: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. Its said to be a Pokmon from another world, but no specific details are known.
3720.name: cosmog

3721.text: Theres something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokmon may come from another world.
3721.name: cosmoem

3722.text: This Pokmon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.
3722.name: solgaleo

3723.text: Said to live in another world, this Pokmon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.
3723.name: lunala

3724.text: One of the Ultra Beasts. Its unclear whether or not this Pokmon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.
3724.name: nihilego

3725.text: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.
3725.name: buzzwole

3726.text: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.
3726.name: pheromosa

3727.text: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.
3727.name: xurkitree

3728.text: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.
3728.name: celesteela

3729.text: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.
3729.name: kartana

3730.text: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.
3730.name: guzzlord

3731.text: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.
3731.name: necrozma

3732.text: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.
3732.name: magearna

3733.text: It lurks in the shadows of others, copying their movements and powers. This Pokmon is craven and cowering.
3733.name: marshadow

3734.text: When the sun goes down, it becomes active. It runs around town on a chase for good food for the boss of its nestRaticate.
3734.name: rattataalola

3735.text: This gourmet Pokmon is particular about the taste and freshness of its food. Restaurants where Raticate live have a good reputation.
3735.name: raticatealola

3736.text: Its golden hairs function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.
3736.name: diglettalola

3737.text: These Pokmon are cherished in the Alola region, where they are thought to be feminine deities of the land incarnate.
3737.name: dugtrioalola

3738.text: When its delicate pride is wounded, or when the gold coin on its forehead is dirtied, it flies into a hysterical rage.
3738.name: meowthalola

3739.text: It looks down on everyone other than itself. Its preferred tactics are sucker punches and blindside attacks.
3739.name: persianalola

3740.text: Its hidden psychic power has been unleashed. A glance at someone gives it knowledge of the course of that person's life, from birth to death.
3740.name: alakazammega

3741.text: Because it can't fire boulders at a rapid pace, it's been known to seize nearby Geodude and fire them from its back.
3741.name: golemalola

3742.text: The crystals on Grimer's body are lumps of toxins. If one falls off, lethal poisons leak out.
3742.name: grimeralola
