4802.text: Smells incredibly foul! However, around one out of a thousand people enjoy sniffing its nose-bending stink.
4802.name: gloom

4803.text: Flaps its broad flower petals to scatter its poisonous pollen. The flapping sound is very loud.
4803.name: vileplume

4804.text: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
4804.name: paras

4805.text: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.
4805.name: parasect

4806.text: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
4806.name: venonat

4807.text: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
4807.name: venomoth

4808.text: It prefers dark places. It spends most of its time underground, though it may pop up in caves.
4808.name: diglett

4809.text: A team of triplets that can burrow to a depth of 60 miles. Its reported that this triggers an earthquake.
4809.name: dugtrio

4810.text: Appears to be more active at night. It loves round and shiny things. It cant stop itself from picking them up.
4810.name: meowth

4811.text: The gem in its forehead glows on its own! It walks with all the grace and elegance of a proud queen.
4811.name: persian

4812.text: Always tormented by headaches. It uses psychic powers, but whether it intends to do so is not known.
4812.name: psyduck

4813.text: Its long, slim limbs end in broad flippers. They are used for swimming gracefully in lakes.
4813.name: golduck

4814.text: An agile Pokmon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
4814.name: mankey

4815.text: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
4815.name: primeape

4816.text: A Pokmon with a friendly nature. However, it will bark fiercely at anything invading its territory.
4816.name: growlithe

4817.text: A legendary Pokmon in the East. Many people are charmed by the grace and beauty of its running.
4817.name: arcanine

4818.text: The direction of the spiral on the belly differs by area. It is more adept at swimming than walking.
4818.name: poliwag

4819.text: Under attack, it uses its belly spiral to put the foe to sleep. It then makes its escape.
4819.name: poliwhirl

4820.text: Swims powerfully using all the muscles in its body. It can even overtake world-class swimmers.
4820.name: poliwrath

4821.text: Sleeps 18 hours a day. If it senses danger, it will teleport itself to safety even as it sleeps.
4821.name: abra

4822.text: Many odd things happen if this Pokmon is close by. For example, it makes clocks run backward.
4822.name: kadabra

4823.text: A Pokmon that can memorize anything. It never forgets what it learnsthats why this Pokmon is smart.
4823.name: alakazam

4824.text: Very powerful in spite of its small size. Its mastery of many types of martial arts makes it very tough.
4824.name: machop

4825.text: The belt around its waist holds back its energy. Without it, this Pokmon would be unstoppable.
4825.name: machoke

4826.text: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokmon fires off awesome punches.
4826.name: machamp

4827.text: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
4827.name: bellsprout

4828.text: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
4828.name: weepinbell

4829.text: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
4829.name: victreebel

4830.text: It can sometimes be found all dry and shriveled up on a beach. Toss it back into the sea to revive it.
4830.name: tentacool

4831.text: Its 80 tentacles can stretch and contract freely. They wrap around prey and weaken it with poison.
4831.name: tentacruel

4832.text: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
4832.name: geodude

4833.text: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.
4833.name: graveler

4834.text: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when its exposed to air.
4834.name: golem

4835.text: Capable of jumping incredibly high. Its hooves and sturdy legs absorb the impact of a hard landing.
4835.name: ponyta

4836.text: Just loves to run. If it sees something faster than itself, it will give chase at top speed.
4836.name: rapidash

4837.text: Incredibly slow and sluggish. It is quite content to loll about without worrying about the time.
4837.name: slowpoke

4838.text: Lives lazily by the sea. If the Shellder on its tail comes off, it becomes a Slowpoke again.
4838.name: slowbro

4839.text: It is hatched with the ability to defy gravity. It floats while emitting powerful electromagnetic waves.
4839.name: magnemite

4840.text: Generates strange radio signals. It raises the temperature by 3.6 degrees Fahrenheit within 3,300 feet.
4840.name: magneton

4841.text: They live where reedy plants grow. Farfetchd are rarely seen, so its thought their numbers are decreasing.
4841.name: farfetchd

4842.text: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokmon runs at high speed on developed legs.
4842.name: doduo

4843.text: One of Doduos two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
4843.name: dodrio

4844.text: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
4844.name: seel

4845.text: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
4845.name: dewgong

4846.text: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds wont grow in its path.
4846.name: grimer

4847.text: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.
4847.name: muk

4848.text: The shell can withstand any attack. However, when it is open, the tender body is exposed.
4848.name: shellder

4849.text: For protection, it uses its harder-than-diamond shell. It also shoots spikes from the shell.
4849.name: cloyster

4850.text: Said to appear in decrepit, deserted buildings. It has no real shape, as it appears to be made of a gas.
4850.name: gastly

4851.text: By licking, it saps the victims life. It causes shaking that wont stop until the victims demise.
4851.name: haunter

4852.text: A Gengar is close by if you feel a sudden chill. It may be trying to lay a curse on you.
4852.name: gengar

4853.text: Burrows at high speed in search of food. The tunnels it leaves are used as homes by Diglett.
4853.name: onix

4854.text: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
4854.name: drowzee

4855.text: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
4855.name: hypno

4856.text: Its pincers are superb weapons. They sometimes break off during battle, but they grow back fast.
4856.name: krabby

4857.text: One claw grew massively and is as hard as steel. It has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, it is too heavy.
4857.name: kingler

4858.text: It is said to camouflage itself as a Pok Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
4858.name: voltorb

4859.text: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.
4859.name: electrode

4860.text: The heads attract each other and spin around. There must be six heads for it to maintain balance.
4860.name: exeggcute

4861.text: Its cries are very noisy. This is because each of the three heads thinks about whatever it likes.
4861.name: exeggutor

4862.text: Wears the skull of its deceased mother. Its cries echo inside the skull and come out as a sad melody.
4862.name: cubone

4863.text: Small and weak, this Pokmon is adept with its bone club. It has grown more vicious over the ages.
4863.name: marowak

4864.text: When kicking, the sole of its foot turns as hard as a diamond on impact and destroys its enemy.
4864.name: hitmonlee

4865.text: Punches in corkscrew fashion. It can punch its way through a concrete wall like a drill.
4865.name: hitmonchan

4866.text: Its tongue spans almost seven feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.
4866.name: lickitung

4867.text: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!
4867.name: koffing

4868.text: This Pokmon lives and grows by absorbing poison gas, dust, and germs that exist inside garbage.
4868.name: weezing

4869.text: A Pokmon with a one-track mind. Once it charges, it wont stop running until it falls asleep.
4869.name: rhyhorn

4870.text: Its brain developed when it began walking on its hind legs. Its armor-like hide even repels molten lava.
4870.name: rhydon

4871.text: A gentle and kindhearted Pokmon that shares its nutritious eggs if it sees an injured Pokmon.
4871.name: chansey

4872.text: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
4872.name: tangela

4873.text: Raises its young in its belly pouch. Wont run from any fight to keep its young protected.
4873.name: kangaskhan

4874.text: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
4874.name: horsea

4875.text: Touching the back fin causes numbness. It hooks its tail to coral to stay in place while sleeping.
4875.name: seadra

4876.text: When it is time for them to lay eggs, they can be seen swimming up rivers and falls in large groups.
4876.name: goldeen

4877.text: It is the males job to make a nest by carving out boulders in a stream using the horn on its head.
4877.name: seaking

4878.text: As long as the center section is unharmed, this Pokmon can grow back fully even if it is chopped to bits.
4878.name: staryu

4879.text: The center section is named the core. People think it is communicating when it glows in seven colors.
4879.name: starmie

4880.text: Always practicing its pantomime act. It makes enemies believe something exists that really doesnt.
4880.name: mrmime

4881.text: Leaps out of tall grass and slices prey with its scythes. The movement looks like that of a ninja.
4881.name: scyther

4882.text: Appears to move to a rhythm of its own, as if it were dancing. It wiggles its hips as it walks.
4882.name: jynx

4883.text: If a major power outage occurs, it is certain that this Pokmon has eaten electricity at a power plant.
4883.name: electabuzz

4884.text: Born in an active volcano. Its body is always cloaked in flames, so it looks like a big ball of fire.
4884.name: magmar

4885.text: Grips its prey in its pincers and squeezes hard! It cant move if its cold out, so it lives in warm places.
4885.name: pinsir

4886.text: A rowdy Pokmon with a lot of stamina. Once running, it wont stop until it hits something.
4886.name: tauros

4887.text: Famous for being very unreliable. It can be found swimming in seas, lakes, rivers, and shallow puddles.
4887.name: magikarp

4888.text: Brutally vicious and enormously destructive. Known for totally destroying cities in ancient times.
4888.name: gyarados

4889.text: A gentle soul that can understand human speech. It can ferry people across the sea on its back.
4889.name: lapras

4890.text: When it spots an enemy, its body transfigures into an almost-perfect copy of its opponent.
4890.name: ditto

4891.text: It can evolve into a variety of forms. Eevees genes are the key to solving the mysteries of Pokmon evolution.
4891.name: eevee

4892.text: Its cell structure is similar to water molecules. It melts into the water and becomes invisible.
4892.name: vaporeon

4893.text: A sensitive Pokmon that easily becomes sad or angry. Every time its mood changes, it charges power.
4893.name: jolteon

4894.text: It has a flame chamber inside its body. It inhales, then breathes out fire that is over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
4894.name: flareon

4895.text: The only Pokmon that people anticipate can fly into space. None has managed the feat yet, however.
4895.name: porygon

4896.text: An ancient Pokmon that was recovered from a fossil. It swam by cleverly twisting its 10 tentacles about.
4896.name: omanyte

4897.text: Its sharp beak rings its mouth. Its shell was too big for it to move freely, so it became extinct.
4897.name: omastar

4898.text: A Pokmon that was recovered from a fossil. It used the eyes on its back while hiding on the seafloor.
4898.name: kabuto

4899.text: A slim and fast swimmer. It sliced its prey with its sharp sickles and drank the body fluids.
4899.name: kabutops

4900.text: A savage Pokmon that died out in ancient times. It was resurrected using DNA taken from amber.
4900.name: aerodactyl

4901.text: Will eat anything, even if the food happens to be a little moldy. It never gets an upset stomach.
4901.name: snorlax

4902.text: A legendary bird Pokmon. It freezes water that is contained in winter air and makes it snow.
4902.name: articuno

4903.text: This legendary bird Pokmon is said to appear when the sky turns dark and lightning showers down.
4903.name: zapdos

4904.text: A legendary bird Pokmon. As it flaps its flaming wings, even the night sky will turn red.
4904.name: moltres

4905.text: Long thought to be a myth, this Pokmons existence was only recently confirmed by a fisherman who caught one.
4905.name: dratini

4906.text: According to a witness, its body was surrounded by a strange aura that gave it a mystical look.
4906.name: dragonair

4907.text: It is said that this Pokmon lives somewhere in the sea and that it flies. However, these are only rumors.
4907.name: dragonite

4908.text: Its DNA is almost the same as Mews. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
4908.name: mewtwo

4909.text: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokmons short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
4909.name: mew

4910.text: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.
4910.name: meltan

4911.text: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
4911.name: melmetal

4912.text: Its whiskers provide it with a keen sense of smell, enabling it to pick up the scent of hidden food and locate it instantly.
4912.name: rattataalola

4913.text: It makes its Rattata underlings gather food for it, dining solely on the most nutritious and delicious fare.
4913.name: raticatealola

4914.text: Its ice-covered body lets it slide across the ground with bullet-like speed, sending its enemies flying when it hits them.
4914.name: sandshrewalola

4915.text: This is Sandslash's form after adaptation to a frigid environment. The cold air emitted by its body sharpens its icy spikes.
4915.name: sandslashalola

4916.text: It looks like snow come to life, and the breath it exhales is ?58 degrees Fahrenheit. Another name for it is Keokeo.
4916.name: vulpixalola

4917.text: It lives on mountains perpetually covered in snow and is revered as a deity incarnate. It appears draped in a blizzard.
4917.name: ninetalesalola

4918.text: After living in soil with high iron content for some time, three steel whiskers sprouted from the top of its head.
4918.name: diglettalola

4919.text: They're referred to as triplets, but they're not identicalthe metallic elements in their bodies differ slightly. The proof shows in their whiskers!
4919.name: dugtrioalola

4920.text: Highly intelligent and prideful, it's famously difficult to handlebut that's also a reason for its popularity.
4920.name: meowthalola

4921.text: It has the classiest coat. The rippling of its fur in the heat of battle has a beauty all its own.
4921.name: persianalola

4922.text: Its stone head is imbued with electricity and magnetism. If you carelessly step on one, you'll be in for a painful shock.
4922.name: geodudealola

4923.text: When it comes rolling down a mountain path, anything in its way gets zapped by electricity and sent flying.
4923.name: graveleralola

4924.text: It uses magnetism to accelerate and fire off rocks tinged with electricity. Even if it doesn't score a direct hit, the jolt of electricity will do the job.
4924.name: golemalola

4925.text: Under the influence of Shellder's digestive fluids, Slowpoke has awakened, gaining a great deal of powerand a little motivation to boot.
4925.name: slowbromega

4926.text: It has a passion for trash above all else, speedily digesting it and creating brilliant crystals of sparkling poison.
4926.name: grimeralola

4927.text: Muk's coloration becomes increasingly vivid the more it feasts on its favorite dishtrash.
4927.name: mukalola

4928.text: The strong sunlight of the Alola region has awakened the power hidden within Exeggcute. This is the result.
4928.name: exeggutormega

4929.text: It has transformed the spirit of its dear departed mother into flames, and tonight it will once again dance in mourning of others of its kind.
4929.name: marowakalola

4930.text: Its child has grown rapidly, thanks to the energy of Mega Evolution. Mother and child show their harmonious teamwork in battle.
4930.name: kangaskhan

4931.text: With its vaunted horns, it can lift an opponent 10 times heavier than itself and fly about with ease.
4931.name: pinsirmega

4932.text: Although it obeys its instinctive drive to destroy everything within its reach, it will respond to orders from a Trainer it truly trusts.
4932.name: gyaradosmega

4933.text: The power of Mega Evolution has completely restored its genes. The rocks on its body are harder than diamond.
4933.name: aerodactylmega

4934.text: There is a plant seed on its back right from the day this Pokmon is born. The seed slowly grows larger.
4934.name: bulbasaur

4935.text: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
4935.name: ivysaur

4936.text: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
4936.name: venusaur

4937.text: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
4937.name: charmander

4938.text: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
4938.name: charmeleon

4939.text: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
4939.name: charizard

4940.text: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
4940.name: squirtle

4941.text: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
4941.name: wartortle

4942.text: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
4942.name: caterpie

4943.text: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
4943.name: metapod

4944.text: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
4944.name: butterfree

4945.text: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.
4945.name: pikachu

4946.text: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
4946.name: raichu

4947.text: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokmon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.
4947.name: sandshrew

4948.text: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokmons spikes will feel when touched.
4948.name: sandslash

4949.text: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, theyll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.
4949.name: nidoranf

4950.text: The horn on its head has atrophied. Its thought that this happens so Nidorinas children wont get poked while their mother is feeding them.
4950.name: nidorina

4951.text: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokmon will shield its children from any kind of attack.
4951.name: nidoqueen

4952.text: The horn on a male Nidorans forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokmon, always straining its large ears.
4952.name: nidoranm

4953.text: With a horn thats harder than diamond, this Pokmon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.
4953.name: nidorino

4954.text: When it goes on a rampage, its impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen its lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.
4954.name: nidoking

4955.text: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
4955.name: clefairy

4956.text: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
4956.name: vulpix

4957.text: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
4957.name: ninetales

4958.text: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokmon. It wont stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
4958.name: jigglypuff

4959.text: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
4959.name: wigglytuff

4960.text: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.
4960.name: zubat

4961.text: It loves to drink other creatures blood. Its said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood its gathered.
4961.name: golbat

4962.text: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
4962.name: oddish

4963.text: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
4963.name: gloom

4964.text: It has the worlds largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
4964.name: vileplume

4965.text: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
4965.name: diglett

4966.text: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
4966.name: dugtrio

4967.text: It loves to collect shiny things. If its in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.
4967.name: meowth

4968.text: Getting this prideful Pokmon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.
4968.name: persian

4969.text: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokmon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
4969.name: psyduck

4970.text: This Pokmon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.
4970.name: golduck

4971.text: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.
4971.name: arcanine

4972.text: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokmons innards showing through the skin.
4972.name: poliwag

4973.text: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirls has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.
4973.name: poliwhirl

4974.text: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
4974.name: poliwrath

4975.text: This Pokmon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abras dreams affect the powers that the Pokmon wields.
4975.name: abra

4976.text: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
4976.name: kadabra

4977.text: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
4977.name: alakazam

4978.text: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
4978.name: machoke

4979.text: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
4979.name: machamp

4980.text: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
4980.name: tentacool

4981.text: When the red orbs on Tentacruels head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokmon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
4981.name: tentacruel

4982.text: It cant run properly when its newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.
4982.name: ponyta

4983.text: This Pokmon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.
4983.name: rapidash

4984.text: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokmon wont feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It wont notice when its tail grows back, either.
4984.name: slowpoke

4985.text: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.
4985.name: slowbro

4986.text: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, itll start moving again.
4986.name: magnemite

4987.text: This Pokmon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
4987.name: magneton

4988.text: The stalk this Pokmon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
4988.name: farfetchd

4989.text: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
4989.name: shellder

4990.text: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
4990.name: cloyster

4991.text: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
4991.name: haunter

4992.text: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengars doing.
4992.name: gengar

4993.text: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
4993.name: onix

4994.text: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
4994.name: krabby

4995.text: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
4995.name: kingler

4996.text: Though it may look like its just a bunch of eggs, its a proper Pokmon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
4996.name: exeggcute

4997.text: Each of Exeggutors three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three dont seem to be very interested in one another.
4997.name: exeggutor

4998.text: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
4998.name: cubone

4999.text: This Pokmon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.
4999.name: marowak

5000.text: This amazing Pokmon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
5000.name: hitmonlee

5001.text: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
5001.name: hitmonchan

5002.text: If this Pokmons sticky saliva gets on you and you dont clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch wont go away, either.
5002.name: lickitung

5003.text: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
5003.name: koffing

5004.text: It mixes gases between its two bodies. Its said that these Pokmon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.
5004.name: weezing

5005.text: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokmon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
5005.name: rhyhorn

5006.text: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
5006.name: rhydon

5007.text: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. Its used as a high-class cooking ingredient.
5007.name: chansey

5008.text: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokmons true appearance remains a mystery.
5008.name: tangela

5009.text: Although its carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
5009.name: kangaskhan

5010.text: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokmon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
5010.name: horsea

5011.text: Its the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.
5011.name: seadra

5012.text: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
5012.name: goldeen

5013.text: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
5013.name: seaking

5014.text: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, youll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
5014.name: staryu

5015.text: This Pokmon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
5015.name: starmie

5016.text: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidencemany scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.
5016.name: mrmime

5017.text: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
5017.name: scyther

5018.text: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
5018.name: jynx

5019.text: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokmon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
5019.name: electabuzz

5020.text: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
5020.name: magmar

5021.text: These Pokmon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
5021.name: pinsir

5022.text: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, its a warning that the Pokmon is about to charge with astounding speed.
5022.name: tauros

5023.text: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
5023.name: gyarados

5024.text: A smart and kindhearted Pokmon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
5024.name: lapras

5025.text: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
5025.name: ditto

5026.text: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.
5026.name: eevee

5027.text: When Vaporeons fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
5027.name: vaporeon

5028.text: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
5028.name: jolteon

5029.text: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokmons body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
5029.name: flareon

5030.text: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokmon to be created via computer programming.
5030.name: porygon

5031.text: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
5031.name: omanyte

5032.text: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldnt move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.
5032.name: omastar

5033.text: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.
5033.name: kabuto

5034.text: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokmon.
5034.name: kabutops

5035.text: This is a ferocious Pokmon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.
5035.name: aerodactyl

5036.text: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
5036.name: snorlax

5037.text: Its said that this Pokmons beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.
5037.name: articuno

5038.text: This Pokmon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
5038.name: zapdos

5039.text: Its one of the legendary bird Pokmon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.
5039.name: moltres

5040.text: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
5040.name: dratini

5041.text: This Pokmon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.
5041.name: dragonair

5042.text: Its a kindhearted Pokmon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokmon, Dragonite simply must help them.
5042.name: dragonite

5043.text: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.
5043.name: hoothoot

5044.text: Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to see clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.
5044.name: noctowl

5045.text: Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a sound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and sinks its fangs into the nape of its targets neck.
5045.name: crobat

5046.text: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.
5046.name: chinchou

5047.text: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the seas surface from a depth of over three miles.
5047.name: lanturn

5048.text: Despite its small size, it can zap even adult humans. However, if it does so, it also surprises itself.
5048.name: pichu

5049.text: Igglybuff loves to sing. Its marshmallow-like body gives off a faint sweet smell.
5049.name: igglybuff

5050.text: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.
5050.name: togepi

5051.text: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, caring people and shower them with happiness.
5051.name: togetic

5052.text: It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and likes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.
5052.name: natu

5053.text: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.
5053.name: xatu

5054.text: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
5054.name: bellossom

5055.text: This Pokmon uses its round tail as a float. The ball of Marills tail is filled with nutrients that have been turned into an oil.
5055.name: marill

5056.text: It spends most of its time in the water. On sunny days, Azumarill floats on the surface of the water and sunbathes.
5056.name: azumarill

5057.text: If a tree branch shakes when there is no wind, its a Sudowoodo, not a tree. It hides from the rain.
5057.name: sudowoodo

5058.text: At nightfall, these Pokmon appear on the shores of lakes. They announce their territorial claims by letting out cries that sound like shouting.
5058.name: politoed

5059.text: This Pokmon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.
5059.name: wooper

5060.text: It has an easygoing nature. It doesnt care if it bumps its head on boats and boulders while swimming.
5060.name: quagsire

5061.text: By reading air currents, it can predict things such as the weather or its foes next move.
5061.name: espeon

5062.text: When this Pokmon becomes angry, its pores secrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at its opponents eyes.
5062.name: umbreon

5063.text: Miraculously, this former Slowpokes latent intelligence was drawn out when Shellder poison raced through its brain.
5063.name: slowking

5064.text: It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its body to pump up its counterstrike.
5064.name: wobbuffet

5065.text: This Pokmons tiny wings have some scientists saying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky in ancient times.
5065.name: dunsparce

5066.text: It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years, its composition changes to become diamond-like.
5066.name: steelix

5067.text: When faced with a larger opponent, it swallows as much water as it can to match the opponents size.
5067.name: qwilfish

5068.text: Bulky pincers account for one third of Scizors body weight. A single swing of one of these pincers will crush a boulder completely.
5068.name: scizor

5069.text: It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks, it hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
5069.name: shuckle

5070.text: Heracross loves sweet sap and will go looking through forests for it. The Pokmon uses its two antennae to pick up scents as it searches.
5070.name: heracross

5071.text: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.
5071.name: sneasel

5072.text: If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back stand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.
5072.name: piloswine

5073.text: It will regrow any branches that break off its head. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola branches as charms to promote safe childbirth.
5073.name: corsola

5074.text: The water they shoot from their mouths can hit moving prey from more than 300 feet away.
5074.name: remoraid

5075.text: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.
5075.name: octillery

5076.text: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.
5076.name: mantine

5077.text: The pointed feathers of these Pokmon are sharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight fight viciously over territory.
5077.name: skarmory

5078.text: With the arrival of a storm at sea, this Pokmon will show itself on the surface. When a Kingdra and a Dragonite meet, a fierce battle ensues.
5078.name: kingdra

5079.text: This is a Porygon that was updated with special data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about many different subjects all on its own.
5079.name: porygon2

5080.text: It is always bursting with energy. To make itself stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.
5080.name: tyrogue

5081.text: It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high speed, it may bore its way into the ground.
5081.name: hitmontop

5082.text: If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will bathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty, Smoochum doesnt really seem to care.
5082.name: smoochum

5083.text: When a storm approaches, this Pokmon gets restless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder, it gets full-on rowdy.
5083.name: elekid

5084.text: This Pokmon is still small and timid. Whenever Magby gets excited or surprised, flames leak from its mouth and its nose.
5084.name: magby

5085.text: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so its been supporting the lives of people and other Pokmon since ancient times.
5085.name: miltank

5086.text: Whenever a Blissey finds a weakened Pokmon, it will share its egg and offer its care until the other Pokmon is all better.
5086.name: blissey

5087.text: Born deep underground, it comes aboveground and becomes a pupa once it has finished eating the surrounding soil.
5087.name: larvitar

5088.text: Even sealed in its shell, it can move freely. Hard and fast, it has outstanding destructive power.
5088.name: pupitar

5089.text: Its body cant be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.
5089.name: tyranitar

5090.text: This Pokmon has the ability to move through time. Records describing it as a forest deity can be found from many different eras.
5090.name: celebi

5091.text: It marks its territory by rubbing its bristly fur on trees. This variety of Zigzagoon is friendlier and calmer than the kind native to Galar.
5091.name: zigzagoon

5092.text: Its fur is strong and supple. Shaving brushes made with shed Linoone hairs are highly prized.
5092.name: linoone

5093.text: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.
5093.name: lotad

5094.text: It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.
5094.name: lombre

5095.text: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolos cells, making it more powerful.
5095.name: ludicolo

5096.text: If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokmon.
5096.name: seedot

5097.text: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.
5097.name: nuzleaf

5098.text: A Pokmon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foes mind and take preemptive action.
5098.name: shiftry

5099.text: It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea breeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.
5099.name: wingull

5100.text: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokmon and eggs to safety in its bill.
5100.name: pelipper

5101.text: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.
5101.name: kirlia

5102.text: Because it lived almost entirely underground, it is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
5102.name: nincada

5103.text: Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too long. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.
5103.name: ninjask

5104.text: A most peculiar Pokmon that somehow appears in a Pok Ball when a Nincada evolves.
5104.name: shedinja

5105.text: The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels. If youre close to a Whismur when it lets out a cry, youll be stuck with an all-day headache.
5105.name: whismur

5106.text: Loudreds ears serve as speakers, and they can put out sound waves powerful enough to blow away a house.
5106.name: loudred

5107.text: In the past, people would use the loud voices of these Pokmon as a means of communication between distant cities.
5107.name: exploud

5108.text: The ball on Azurills tail bounces like a rubber ball, and its full of the nutrients the Pokmon needs to grow.
5108.name: azurill

5109.text: This Pokmon is feared. When its gemstone eyes begin to glow with a sinister shine, its believed that Sableye will steal peoples spirits away.
5109.name: sableye

5110.text: It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into complacency, then bites with its huge, relentless jaws.
5110.name: mawile

5111.text: It eats iron oreand sometimes railroad tracks to build up the steel armor that protects its body.
5111.name: aron

5112.text: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokmon often came into conflict with humans in the past.
5112.name: lairon

5113.text: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.
5113.name: aggron

5114.text: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. It gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
5114.name: electrike

5115.text: It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so it can move quickly. It eases its soreness with electricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.
5115.name: manectric

5116.text: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.
5116.name: roselia

5117.text: It wont attack while its alonenot even if it spots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to join it, and then the Pokmon attack as a group.
5117.name: carvanha

5118.text: As soon as it catches the scent of prey, Sharpedo will jet seawater from its backside, hurtling toward the target to attack at 75 mph.
5118.name: sharpedo

5119.text: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.
5119.name: wailmer

5120.text: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.
5120.name: wailord

5121.text: Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert. Once something has fallen in, there is no escape.
5121.name: trapinch

5122.text: The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its two wings together cause severe headaches.
5122.name: vibrava

5123.text: This Pokmon hides in the heart of sandstorms it creates and seldom appears where people can see it.
5123.name: flygon

5124.text: Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light and fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care of its wings.
5124.name: swablu

5125.text: As it flies in a calm and relaxed manner, Altaria performs a humming song that would enrapture any audience.
5125.name: altaria

5126.text: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. Its active on the night of a full moon.
5126.name: lunatone

5127.text: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.
5127.name: solrock

5128.text: Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is said to have been born from hardened mud.
5128.name: barboach

5129.text: It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will eat anythingif it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.
5129.name: whiscash

5130.text: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.
5130.name: corphish

5131.text: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.
5131.name: baltoy

5132.text: This mysterious Pokmon started life as an ancient clay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.
5132.name: claydol

5133.text: This Pokmon was restored from a fossil. Lileep once lived in warm seas that existed approximately 100,000,000 years ago.
5133.name: lileep

5134.text: It has short legs and cant walk very fast, but its neck and tentacles can extend to over three times their usual length to nab distant prey.
5134.name: cradily

5135.text: This Pokmon was restored from a fossil. Anorith lived in the ocean about 100,000,000 years ago, hunting with its pair of claws.
5135.name: anorith

5136.text: After evolution, this Pokmon emerged onto land. Its lower body has become stronger, and blows from its tail are devastating.
5136.name: armaldo

5137.text: Although unattractive and unpopular, this Pokmons marvelous vitality has made it a subject of research.
5137.name: feebas

5138.text: Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists. It has even been referred to as the most beautiful Pokmon of all.
5138.name: milotic

5139.text: If it finds bad children who wont listen to their parents, it will spirit them awayor so its said.
5139.name: duskull

5140.text: Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its mouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a black hole.
5140.name: dusclops

5141.text: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.
5141.name: absol

5142.text: It tends to move in a pack. Individuals squash against one another to toughen their spirits.
5142.name: wynaut

5143.text: Its said that if they are seen at midnight, theyll cause heavy snow. They eat snow and ice to survive.
5143.name: snorunt

5144.text: It has a body of ice that wont melt, even with fire. It can instantly freeze moisture in the atmosphere.
5144.name: glalie

5145.text: This Pokmons body is covered in blubber and impressively round. Its faster for Spheal to roll around than walk.
5145.name: spheal

5146.text: Sealeo live on top of drift ice. They go swimming when theyre on the hunt, seeking out their prey by scent.
5146.name: sealeo

5147.text: Walrein form herds of 20 to 30 individuals. When a threat appears, the herds leader will protect the group with its life.
5147.name: walrein

5148.text: Rock-hard scales and oil-filled swim bladders allow this Pokmon to survive the intense water pressure of the deep sea.
5148.name: relicanth

5149.text: Bagon jumps off cliffs every day, trying to grow stronger so that someday it will be able to fly.
5149.name: bagon

5150.text: This Pokmon has covered its body in a hard shell that has the same composition as bone. Shelgon stores energy for evolution.
5150.name: shelgon

5151.text: Salamence is an unusual Pokmon in that it was able to evolve a body with wings just by constantly wishing to be able to fly.
5151.name: salamence

5152.text: From its rear, Beldum emits a magnetic force that rapidly pulls opponents in. They get skewered on Beldums sharp claws.
5152.name: beldum

5153.text: Two Beldum have become stuck together via their own magnetic forces. With two brains, the resulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.
5153.name: metang

5154.text: Because the magnetic powers of these Pokmon get stronger in freezing temperatures, Metagross living on snowy mountains are full of energy.
5154.name: metagross

5155.text: Every bit of Regirocks body is made of stone. As parts of its body erode, this Pokmon sticks rocks to itself to repair whats been lost.
5155.name: regirock

5156.text: With cold air that can reach temperatures as low as -328 degrees Fahrenheit, Regice instantly freezes any creature that approaches it.
5156.name: regice

5157.text: Registeels body is made of a strange material that is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but also more durable than any metal.
5157.name: registeel

5158.text: Once every 1,000 years, the singing of a pure voice will rouse this Pokmon from its near- perpetual slumber. It wakes for only seven days.
5158.name: jirachi

5159.text: This Pokmon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.
5159.name: shinx

5160.text: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokmon can receive some of the other Luxios electricity and power up its own electric blasts.
5160.name: luxio

5161.text: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.
5161.name: luxray

5162.text: The pollen it releases contains poison. If this Pokmon is raised on clean water, the poisons toxicity is increased.
5162.name: budew

5163.text: After captivating opponents with its sweet scent, it lashes them with its thorny whips.
5163.name: roserade

5164.text: The members of the trio spend all their time together. Each one has a slightly different taste in nectar.
5164.name: combee

5165.text: It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its enemies. The grubs are willing to risk their lives to defend Vespiquen.
5165.name: vespiquen

5166.text: It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked by bird Pokmon that would love to make off with its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.
5166.name: cherubi

5167.text: As a bud, it barely moves. It sits still, placidly waiting for sunlight to appear.
5167.name: cherrim

5168.text: This Pokmons habitat shapes its physique. According to some theories, life in warm ocean waters causes this variation to develop.
5168.name: shellos

5169.text: Its search for food sometimes leads it onto land, where it leaves behind a sticky trail of slime as it passes through.
5169.name: gastrodon

5170.text: Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children. However, it often quickly runs away again when the children play too roughly with it.
5170.name: drifloon

5171.text: Some say this Pokmon is a collection of souls burdened with regrets, silently drifting through the dusk.
5171.name: drifblim

5172.text: If both of Bunearys ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. Its a sure sign the Pokmon is in need of care.
5172.name: buneary

5173.text: Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings. If danger approaches, this Pokmon responds with superdestructive kicks.
5173.name: lopunny

5174.text: From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at opponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit them from over 16 feet away.
5174.name: stunky

5175.text: In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots from its tail during battle. As this Pokmons diet varies, so does the stench of its fluid.
5175.name: skuntank

5176.text: It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its body doesnt come from any culture in the Galar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.
5176.name: bronzor

5177.text: Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain clouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry that rings out like the tolling of a bell.
5177.name: bronzong

5178.text: It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes. The sweat is a little salty, while the tears have a slight bitterness.
5178.name: bonsly

5179.text: It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra effort into copying the graceful dance steps of Mr. Rime as practice.
5179.name: mimejr

5180.text: Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg- shaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will treasure this stone.
5180.name: happiny

5181.text: Exactly 108 spirits gathered to become this Pokmon. Apparently there are some ill-natured spirits in the mix.
5181.name: spiritomb

5182.text: Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides of caves heated by geothermal energy. This way, Gible can stay warm even during a blizzard.
5182.name: gible

5183.text: This Pokmon emits ultrasonic waves from a protrusion on either side of its head to probe pitch-dark caves.
5183.name: gabite

5184.text: Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains. It flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane, hunting down as much prey as it can.
5184.name: garchomp

5185.text: Stuffing itself with vast amounts of food is its only concern. Whether the food is rotten or fresh, yummy or tastelessit does not care.
5185.name: munchlax

5186.text: Its exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.
5186.name: riolu

5187.text: It controls waves known as auras, which are powerful enough to pulverize huge rocks. It uses these waves to take down its prey.
5187.name: lucario

5188.text: It moves through the sands with its mouth open, swallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of the sand by spouting it from its nose.
5188.name: hippopotas

5189.text: Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies. Dwebble help dislodge such stones, so Hippowdon look after these Pokmon.
5189.name: hippowdon

5190.text: After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently for prey to come near. This Pokmon and Sizzlipede share common descent.
5190.name: skorupi

5191.text: Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This Pokmon prefers to use physical force instead, going on rampages with its car-crushing strength.
5191.name: drapion

5192.text: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.
5192.name: croagunk

5193.text: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.
5193.name: toxicroak

5194.text: Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat sluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this region may be the cause.
5194.name: mantyke

5195.text: It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into the snow to absorb water and keep its own temperature down.
5195.name: snover

5196.text: If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after Snover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable arms like hammers.
5196.name: abomasnow

5197.text: They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large as Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of a group of Weavile.
5197.name: weavile

5198.text: Some say that Magnezone receives signals from space via the antenna on its head and that its being controlled by some mysterious being.
5198.name: magnezone

5199.text: Lickilickys strange tongue can stretch to many times the length of its body. No one has figured out how Lickilickys tongue can stretch so far.
5199.name: lickilicky

5200.text: It can load up to three projectiles per arm into the holes in its hands. What launches out of those holes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
5200.name: rhyperior

5201.text: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
5201.name: tangrowth

5202.text: The amount of electrical energy this Pokmon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
5202.name: electivire

5203.text: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
5203.name: magmortar

5204.text: These Pokmon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, theyve hardly been seen at all.
5204.name: togekiss

5205.text: Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts from this Pokmons leaves. Theres a popular perfume made using that scent.
5205.name: leafeon

5206.text: Any who become captivated by the beauty of the snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen before they know it.
5206.name: glaceon

5207.text: This Pokmon can be spotted in wall paintings from as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a while, it was thought to have gone extinct.
5207.name: mamoswine

5208.text: Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to move between dimensions, but the program also caused instability in Porygon-Zs behavior.
5208.name: porygonz

5209.text: True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses the blades on its elbows only in defense of something or someone.
5209.name: gallade

5210.text: At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit world, it steals people and Pokmon away. No one knows whether it has a will of its own.
5210.name: dusknoir

5211.text: After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain, her regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokmon was born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.
5211.name: froslass

5212.text: One boys invention led to the development of many different machines that take advantage of Rotoms unique capabilities.
5212.name: rotom

5213.text: All over the world, there are legends that tell of Regigigas creating other Pokmon in its own image.
5213.name: regigigas

5214.text: This Pokmon is courageous but also cautious. It uses the soft fur covering its face to collect information about its surroundings.
5214.name: lillipup

5215.text: Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokmon. So much so that theres a theory that Herdier was the first Pokmon to partner with people.
5215.name: herdier

5216.text: These Pokmon seem to enjoy living with humans. Even a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up to people in about three days.
5216.name: stoutland

5217.text: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokmon and Nickit.
5217.name: purrloin

5218.text: Dont be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokmon.
5218.name: liepard

5219.text: Late at night, it appears beside peoples pillows. As it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body give off a faint glow.
5219.name: munna

5220.text: When dark mists emanate from its body, dont get too near. If you do, your nightmares will become reality.
5220.name: musharna

5221.text: Where people go, these Pokmon follow. If youre scattering food for them, be careful several hundred of them can gather at once.
5221.name: pidove

5222.text: It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far it travels, it can always find its way back to its master and its nest.
5222.name: tranquill

5223.text: Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females are known for their stamina, while the males outclass them in terms of speed.
5223.name: unfezant

5224.text: Its as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in water will cause it to soften a bit.
5224.name: roggenrola

5225.text: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. Its about to fire off bursts of energy.
5225.name: boldore

5226.text: This hardy Pokmon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.
5226.name: gigalith

5227.text: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, its evidence that Woobat live there.
5227.name: woobat

5228.text: Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out. Afterward, it wont be able to fly for a little while.
5228.name: swoobat

5229.text: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.
5229.name: drilbur

5230.text: Its not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrills rampant digging.
5230.name: excadrill

5231.text: Audinos sense of hearing is superb. Not even a pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape Audinos ears.
5231.name: audino

5232.text: It loves helping out with construction projects. It loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt, it swings its log around and throws a tantrum.
5232.name: timburr

5233.text: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokmon, it lies low for a little while.
5233.name: gurdurr

5234.text: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.
5234.name: conkeldurr

5235.text: Graceful ripples running across the waters surface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing in high-pitched voices below.
5235.name: tympole

5236.text: It weakens its prey with sound waves intense enough to cause headaches, then entangles them with its sticky tongue.
5236.name: palpitoad

5237.text: The vibrating of the bumps all over its body causes earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and Croagunk are similar species.
5237.name: seismitoad

5238.text: It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill. Over the course of many battles, Throhs belt grows darker as it absorbs its wearers sweat.
5238.name: throh

5239.text: If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its single-minded pursuit of strength, its best to quietly pass by.
5239.name: sawk

5240.text: Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species, but when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
5240.name: venipede

5241.text: This Pokmon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
5241.name: whirlipede

5242.text: Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on its neck before slamming them into the ground and jabbing them with its claws toxic spikes.
5242.name: scolipede

5243.text: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
5243.name: cottonee

5244.text: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, itll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
5244.name: whimsicott

5245.text: Petilil appears around sources of clean water. Boiling leaves from this Pokmons head results in a liquid thats sometimes used as a bug repellent.
5245.name: petilil

5246.text: Its believed that even first-rate gardeners have a hard time getting the flower on a Lilligants head to bloom.
5246.name: lilligant

5247.text: Anglers love the fight this Pokmon puts up on the hook. And there are always more to catch many people release them into lakes illicitly.
5247.name: basculin

5248.text: The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun sets, this Pokmon burrows deep into the sand and sleeps until sunrise.
5248.name: sandile

5249.text: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.
5249.name: krokorok

5250.text: This Pokmon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodiles mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.
5250.name: krookodile

5251.text: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokmon will immediately fall asleep.
5251.name: darumaka

5252.text: The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokmon can deliver punches capable of obliterating a dump truck.
5252.name: darmanitan

5253.text: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokmon and making them fly off in a hurry.
5253.name: maractus

5254.text: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokmon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
5254.name: dwebble

5255.text: This highly territorial Pokmon prefers dry climates. It wont come out of its boulder on rainy days.
5255.name: crustle

5256.text: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokmon.
5256.name: scraggy

5257.text: As halfhearted as this Pokmons kicks may seem, they pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurrs concrete pillars.
5257.name: scrafty

5258.text: Psychic power allows these Pokmon to fly. Some say they were the guardians of an ancient city. Others say they were the guardians emissaries.
5258.name: sigilyph

5259.text: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask thats said to have been the face it had when it was still human.
5259.name: yamask

5260.text: This Pokmon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.
5260.name: cofagrigus

5261.text: This Pokmon inhabited ancient seas. Although it can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in search of prey.
5261.name: tirtouga

5262.text: Carracosta completely devours its preybones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracostas own shell grows thick and sturdy.
5262.name: carracosta

5263.text: This Pokmon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But its very good at jumping.
5263.name: archen

5264.text: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
5264.name: archeops

5265.text: Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you leave trash lying around, you could even find one of these Pokmon living in your room.
5265.name: trubbish

5266.text: This Pokmon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
5266.name: garbodor

5267.text: Zorua is a timid Pokmon. This disposition seems to be what led to the development of Zoruas ability to take on the forms of other creatures.
5267.name: zorua

5268.text: This Pokmon cares deeply about others of its kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to keep its den and pack safe.
5268.name: zoroark

5269.text: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
5269.name: minccino

5270.text: Its body secretes oil that this Pokmon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino wont tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
5270.name: cinccino

5271.text: Though theyre still only babies, theres psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.
5271.name: gothita

5272.text: Its said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokmon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.
5272.name: gothorita

5273.text: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. Its also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.
5273.name: gothitelle

5274.text: It communicates with others telepathically. Its body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes a heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.
5274.name: solosis

5275.text: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a milebut only if its two brains can agree with each other.
5275.name: duosion

5276.text: While it could use its psychic abilities in battle, this Pokmon prefers to swing its powerful arms around to beat opponents into submission.
5276.name: reuniclus

5277.text: Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself comfortable by breathing out air cold enough to cause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.
5277.name: vanillite

5278.text: By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body. This Pokmon can be hard to find on days with warm, sunny weather.
5278.name: vanillish

5279.text: When its anger reaches a breaking point, this Pokmon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes every creature around it, be they friend or foe.
5279.name: vanilluxe

5280.text: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokmon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.
5280.name: emolga

5281.text: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokmon to evolve.
5281.name: karrablast

5282.text: They use shells theyve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. Theyre very popular Pokmon in the Galar region.
5282.name: escavalier

5283.text: No one knows what the Pok Balllike pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.
5283.name: foongus

5284.text: This Pokmon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores arent washed off quickly, theyll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.
5284.name: amoonguss

5285.text: It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws it down to the deeps, five miles below the oceans surface.
5285.name: frillish

5286.text: Most of this Pokmons body composition is identical to sea water. It makes sunken ships its lair.
5286.name: jellicent

5287.text: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokmon. Its soaking up static electricity because it cant produce a charge on its own.
5287.name: joltik

5288.text: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.
5288.name: galvantula

5289.text: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isnt very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.
5289.name: ferroseed

5290.text: This Pokmon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.
5290.name: ferrothorn

5291.text: The two minigears that compose this Pokmon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.
5291.name: klink

5292.text: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokmons rotation speed increases sharply.
5292.name: klang

5293.text: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.
5293.name: klinklang

5294.text: If this Pokmon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.
5294.name: elgyem

5295.text: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.
5295.name: beheeyem

5296.text: The flame on its head keeps its body slightly warm. This Pokmon takes lost children by the hand to guide them to the spirit world.
5296.name: litwick

5297.text: This Pokmon appears just before someone passes away, so its feared as an emissary of death.
5297.name: lampent

5298.text: This Pokmon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.
5298.name: chandelure

5299.text: These Pokmon nest in the ground and use their tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is also how they test each others strength.
5299.name: axew

5300.text: After battle, this Pokmon carefully sharpens its tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its tusksif one breaks, it will never grow back.
5300.name: fraxure

5301.text: Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its tusks in top condition.
5301.name: haxorus

5302.text: When this Pokmon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesnt like.
5302.name: cubchoo

5303.text: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.
5303.name: beartic

5304.text: With its icy chains, Cryogonal freezes those it encounters. It then takes its victims away to somewhere unknown.
5304.name: cryogonal

5305.text: When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.
5305.name: shelmet

5306.text: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.
5306.name: accelgor

5307.text: Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with it, this Pokmon developed the organs it uses to generate electricity.
5307.name: stunfisk

5308.text: In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop with its arms more than 100 times.
5308.name: mienfoo

5309.text: When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging opponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the fur on its arms.
5309.name: mienshao

5310.text: Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathingit wont be able to move if its body gets too cold.
5310.name: druddigon

5311.text: They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.
5311.name: golett

5312.text: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.
5312.name: golurk

5313.text: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.
5313.name: pawniard

5314.text: Its accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.
5314.name: bisharp

5315.text: These Pokmon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.
5315.name: bouffalant

5316.text: If it spies a strong Pokmon, Rufflet cant resist challenging it to a battle. But if Rufflet loses, it starts bawling.
5316.name: rufflet

5317.text: Known for its bravery and pride, this majestic Pokmon is often seen as a motif for various kinds of emblems.
5317.name: braviary

5318.text: It wears a bone to protect its rear. It often squabbles with others of its kind over particularly comfy bones.
5318.name: vullaby

5319.text: Although its a bit of a ruffian, this Pokmon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till theyre ready to leave the nest.
5319.name: mandibuzz

5320.text: Theres a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokmon will fall ill.
5320.name: heatmor

5321.text: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.
5321.name: durant

5322.text: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.
5322.name: deino

5323.text: While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.
5323.name: zweilous

5324.text: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.
5324.name: hydreigon

5325.text: The people of ancient times believed that Larvesta fell from the sun.
5325.name: larvesta

5326.text: Volcarona scatters burning scales. Some say it does this to start fires. Others say its trying to rescue those that suffer in the cold.
5326.name: volcarona

5327.text: This Pokmon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova regions Pokmon.
5327.name: cobalion

5328.text: It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush anyone or anything that bullies small Pokmon.
5328.name: terrakion

5329.text: A legend tells of this Pokmon working together with Cobalion and Terrakion to protect the Pokmon of the Unova region.
5329.name: virizion

5330.text: Flames spew from its tail as it flies through the sky like a jet airplane. Its said that this Pokmon will scorch the world.
5330.name: reshiram

5331.text: When the interior part of its tail spins like a motor, Zekrom can generate many bolts of lightning to blast its surroundings.
5331.name: zekrom

5332.text: Dwelling within it is a power even greater than that of Reshiram or Zekrom, but the extreme cold keeps that power bound.
5332.name: kyurem

5333.text: Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion taught this Pokmon how to fight. It dashes across the world, seeking more opportunities to further its training.
5333.name: keldeo

5334.text: It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.
5334.name: bunnelby

5335.text: With power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. Its a huge help during tunnel construction.
5335.name: diggersby

5336.text: Its melodious cries are actually warnings. Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.
5336.name: fletchling

5337.text: Fletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinders sharp talons finish it off.
5337.name: fletchinder

5338.text: Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird Pokmon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.
5338.name: talonflame

5339.text: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its masters actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.
5339.name: pancham

5340.text: This Pokmon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.
5340.name: pangoro

5341.text: Though Espurrs expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.
5341.name: espurr

5342.text: Revealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of its ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally keeps the patterns hidden, however.
5342.name: meowstic

5343.text: Honedges soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedges body.
5343.name: honedge

5344.text: Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.
5344.name: doublade

5345.text: In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.
5345.name: aegislash

5346.text: A scent pouch within this Pokmons body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.
5346.name: spritzee

5347.text: The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokmons companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.
5347.name: aromatisse
