5875.text: Gible attacks anything that moves, and it drags whatever it catches into the crevice that is its lair. Despite the big mouth, Gibles stomach is small.
5875.name: gible

5876.text: Jewels are buried in the caves these Pokmon nest in, but youll be torn apart by claws and fangs the moment you enter one of these caves.
5876.name: gabite

5877.text: Garchomp is fast both underground and above. It can bring down prey and return to its den before its body has chilled from being outside.
5877.name: garchomp

5878.text: It stores food beneath its fur. It might share just one bite, but only if it really trusts you.
5878.name: munchlax

5879.text: It can use waves called auras to gauge how others are feeling. These same waves can also tell this Pokmon about the state of the environment.
5879.name: riolu

5880.text: It can tell what people are thinking. Only Trainers who have justice in their hearts can earn this Pokmons trust.
5880.name: lucario

5881.text: This Pokmon is active during the day and passes the cold desert nights burrowed snugly into the sand.
5881.name: hippopotas

5882.text: When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out the quantities of sand it has swallowed and whips up a sandstorm.
5882.name: hippowdon

5883.text: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokmons poison seeps in.
5883.name: skorupi

5884.text: Its so vicious that its called the Sand Demon. Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.
5884.name: drapion

5885.text: Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal. This Pokmon came into popularity after a pharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.
5885.name: croagunk

5886.text: It booms out a victory croak when its prey goes down in defeat. This Pokmon and Seismitoad are related species.
5886.name: toxicroak

5887.text: It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and theyll all fight together to repel attackers.
5887.name: mantyke

5888.text: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.
5888.name: snover

5889.text: This Pokmon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.
5889.name: abomasnow

5890.text: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.
5890.name: weavile

5891.text: Its thought that a special magnetic field changed the molecular structure of this Pokmons body, and thats what caused the Pokmons evolution.
5891.name: magnezone

5892.text: Lickilicky can do just about anything with its tongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand. In contrast, Lickilickys use of its fingers is clumsy.
5892.name: lickilicky

5893.text: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.
5893.name: rhyperior

5894.text: Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in warm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth shortens them by tearing parts of them off.
5894.name: tangrowth

5895.text: In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire is one of the best among all Electric Pokmon. It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.
5895.name: electivire

5896.text: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokmons body to resemble its environment it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.
5896.name: magmortar

5897.text: Known as a bringer of blessings, its been depicted on good-luck charms since ancient times.
5897.name: togekiss

5898.text: This Pokmons tail is blade sharp, with a fantastic cutting edge that can slice right though large trees.
5898.name: leafeon

5899.text: The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes powdery snow to form, making it quite a popular Pokmon at ski resorts.
5899.name: glaceon

5900.text: It looks strong, and thats exactly what it is. As the weather grows colder, its ice tusks grow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
5900.name: mamoswine

5901.text: Some say an additional program made this Pokmon evolve, but even academics cant agree on whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.
5901.name: porygonz

5902.text: Sharply attuned to others wishes for help, this Pokmon seeks out those in need and aids them in battle.
5902.name: gallade

5903.text: With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its target whole. The soul is the only thing eaten Dusknoir disgorges the body before departing.
5903.name: dusknoir

5904.text: It spits out cold air of nearly -60 degrees Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.
5904.name: froslass

5905.text: With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all sorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.
5905.name: rotom

5906.text: Its said that Regigigas created other Pokmon from many different materials before it moved the continents to where they are today.
5906.name: regigigas

5907.text: This Pokmon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup wont forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.
5907.name: lillipup

5908.text: The black fur that covers this Pokmons body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.
5908.name: herdier

5909.text: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. Its said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.
5909.name: stoutland

5910.text: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
5910.name: purrloin

5911.text: This stealthy Pokmon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.
5911.name: liepard

5912.text: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when its eating a good dream, and black when its eating a nightmare.
5912.name: munna

5913.text: It drowses and dreams all the time. Its best to leave it be if its just woken up, as its a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.
5913.name: musharna

5914.text: Its forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.
5914.name: pidove

5915.text: These bright Pokmon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.
5915.name: tranquill

5916.text: This Pokmon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.
5916.name: unfezant

5917.text: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokmon slightly warm to the touch.
5917.name: roggenrola

5918.text: It relies on sound in order to monitor whats in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction its facing.
5918.name: boldore

5919.text: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation they can only be fired when the sun is out.
5919.name: gigalith

5920.text: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its preybug Pokmon.
5920.name: woobat

5921.text: The auspicious shape of this Pokmons nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.
5921.name: swoobat

5922.text: Its a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.
5922.name: drilbur

5923.text: Known as the Drill King, this Pokmon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.
5923.name: excadrill

5924.text: This Pokmon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures feelings and physical conditions.
5924.name: audino

5925.text: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.
5925.name: timburr

5926.text: Gurdurr excels at demolitionconstruction is not its forte. In any case, theres skill in the way this Pokmon wields its metal beam.
5926.name: gurdurr

5927.text: When going all out, this Pokmon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.
5927.name: conkeldurr

5928.text: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokmon species cant hear its cries of warning.
5928.name: tympole

5929.text: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
5929.name: palpitoad

5930.text: This Pokmon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.
5930.name: seismitoad

5931.text: They train in groups of five. Any member that cant keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.
5931.name: throh

5932.text: The karate chops of a Sawk thats trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
5932.name: sawk

5933.text: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokmon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.
5933.name: venipede

5934.text: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy itll need for evolution.
5934.name: whirlipede

5935.text: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.
5935.name: scolipede

5936.text: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth thats highly prized by many luxury brands.
5936.name: cottonee

5937.text: As long as this Pokmon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
5937.name: whimsicott

5938.text: The deeper the color of a Petilils leaves, the healthier the Pokmon is. Petilil sometimes makes its home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.
5938.name: petilil

5939.text: Essential oils made from Lilligant flowers have a sublime scent, but theyre also staggeringly expensive.
5939.name: lilligant

5940.text: In the past, it often appeared on the dinner table. The meat of red-striped Basculin is on the fatty side, and its more popular with the youth.
5940.name: basculin

5941.text: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if its swimming.
5941.name: sandile

5942.text: Although this Pokmon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok wont move much at nightthe desert gets cold after sunset.
5942.name: krokorok

5943.text: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.
5943.name: krookodile

5944.text: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how its pushed or pulled.
5944.name: darumaka

5945.text: This Pokmons power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
5945.name: darmanitan

5946.text: Once each year, this Pokmon scatters its seeds. Theyre jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.
5946.name: maractus

5947.text: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
5947.name: dwebble

5948.text: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. Theyre mighty enough to crack Rhyperiors carapace.
5948.name: crustle

5949.text: It protects itself with its durable skin. Its thought that this Pokmon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.
5949.name: scraggy

5950.text: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokmon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.
5950.name: scrafty

5951.text: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
5951.name: sigilyph

5952.text: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokmon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.
5952.name: yamask

5953.text: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. Theyre symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
5953.name: cofagrigus

5954.text: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokmon. It was restored to life from a fossil.
5954.name: tirtouga

5955.text: This Pokmon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.
5955.name: carracosta

5956.text: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokmon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokmon.
5956.name: archen

5957.text: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.
5957.name: archeops

5958.text: This Pokmon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.
5958.name: trubbish

5959.text: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.
5959.name: garbodor

5960.text: Zorua sometimes transforms into a person and goes into cities to search for food. When Zorua does this, it usually takes on the form of a child.
5960.name: zorua

5961.text: Seeking to ease the burden of their solitude, lonely Trainers tell Zoroark to show illusions to them.
5961.name: zoroark

5962.text: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.
5962.name: minccino

5963.text: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.
5963.name: cinccino

5964.text: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe its speaking to something only it can see.
5964.name: gothita

5965.text: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokmons psychic power is at its strongest. Its unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.
5965.name: gothorita

5966.text: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.
5966.name: gothitelle

5967.text: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokmons body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.
5967.name: solosis

5968.text: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.
5968.name: duosion

5969.text: Its said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
5969.name: reuniclus

5970.text: Supposedly, this Pokmon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at -58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
5970.name: vanillite

5971.text: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching -148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterwardits a kind Pokmon.
5971.name: vanillish

5972.text: People believe this Pokmon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
5972.name: vanilluxe

5973.text: This Pokmon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it cant fly properly.
5973.name: emolga

5974.text: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmets shell. Karrablast doesnt eat the shell it eats only the contents.
5974.name: karrablast

5975.text: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetchd.
5975.name: escavalier

5976.text: The spores released from this Pokmons hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.
5976.name: foongus

5977.text: Amoonguss generally doesnt move much. It tends to stand still near Pok Balls that have been dropped on the ground.
5977.name: amoonguss

5978.text: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokmon.
5978.name: frillish

5979.text: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.
5979.name: jellicent

5980.text: Joltik latch on to other Pokmon and suck out static electricity. Theyre often found sticking to Yampers hindquarters.
5980.name: joltik

5981.text: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokmon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.
5981.name: galvantula

5982.text: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseeds spikes grow big and strong.
5982.name: ferroseed

5983.text: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokmon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.
5983.name: ferrothorn

5984.text: Its suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient peoples invention of the first gears.
5984.name: klink

5985.text: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokmon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.
5985.name: klang

5986.text: The three gears that compose this Pokmon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isnt a living creature.
5986.name: klinklang

5987.text: This Pokmon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.
5987.name: elgyem

5988.text: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokmon can control the memories of its opponents.
5988.name: beheeyem

5989.text: The younger the life this Pokmon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.
5989.name: litwick

5990.text: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.
5990.name: lampent

5991.text: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence or so its said.
5991.name: chandelure

5992.text: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isnt a concern.
5992.name: axew

5993.text: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxures favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.
5993.name: fraxure

5994.text: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.
5994.name: haxorus

5995.text: It sniffles before performing a move, using its frosty snot to provide an icy element to any move that needs it.
5995.name: cubchoo

5996.text: It swims energetically through frigid seas. When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater with its breath so it can rest on the ice.
5996.name: beartic

5997.text: When the weather gets hot, these Pokmon turn into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never seen during summer.
5997.name: cryogonal

5998.text: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.
5998.name: shelmet

5999.text: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.
5999.name: accelgor

6000.text: For some reason, this Pokmon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.
6000.name: stunfisk

6001.text: Though small, Mienfoos temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
6001.name: mienfoo

6002.text: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokmon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.
6002.name: mienshao

6003.text: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokmon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.
6003.name: druddigon

6004.text: This Pokmon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.
6004.name: golett

6005.text: Theres a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasnt been proven.
6005.name: golurk

6006.text: A pack of these Pokmon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.
6006.name: pawniard

6007.text: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.
6007.name: bisharp

6008.text: These Pokmon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.
6008.name: bouffalant

6009.text: A combative Pokmon, its ready to pick a fight with anyone. It has talons that can crush hard berries.
6009.name: rufflet

6010.text: Because this Pokmon is hotheaded and belligerent, its Corviknight thats taken the role of transportation in Galar.
6010.name: braviary

6011.text: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.
6011.name: vullaby

6012.text: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.
6012.name: mandibuzz

6013.text: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.
6013.name: heatmor

6014.text: With their large mandibles, these Pokmon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
6014.name: durant

6015.text: Because it cant see, this Pokmon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.
6015.name: deino

6016.text: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.
6016.name: zweilous

6017.text: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks wont slow until their target goes down.
6017.name: hydreigon

6018.text: Larvestas body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.
6018.name: larvesta

6019.text: This Pokmon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as a deity of fire.
6019.name: volcarona

6020.text: From the moment its born, this Pokmon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.
6020.name: cobalion

6021.text: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokmon.
6021.name: terrakion

6022.text: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.
6022.name: virizion

6023.text: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.
6023.name: reshiram

6024.text: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekroms lightning.
6024.name: zekrom

6025.text: It appears that this Pokmon uses its powers over ice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its cellular structure.
6025.name: kyurem

6026.text: They say that Keldeo must survive harsh battles and fully develop the horn on its forehead before this Pokmons true power will awaken.
6026.name: keldeo

6027.text: Its very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknights flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.
6027.name: bunnelby

6028.text: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokmon.
6028.name: diggersby

6029.text: When this Pokmon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.
6029.name: fletchling

6030.text: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokmon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.
6030.name: fletchinder

6031.text: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.
6031.name: talonflame

6032.text: Wanting to make sure its taken seriously, Panchams always giving others a glare. But if its not focusing, it ends up smiling.
6032.name: pancham

6033.text: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.
6033.name: pangoro

6034.text: Theres enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power cant be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.
6034.name: espurr

6035.text: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. Its when theyre protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.
6035.name: meowstic

6036.text: The blue eye on the swords handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains peoples lives away.
6036.name: honedge

6037.text: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.
6037.name: doublade

6038.text: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokmon to build a kingdom to its liking.
6038.name: aegislash

6039.text: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.
6039.name: spritzee

6040.text: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponents will to fight.
6040.name: aromatisse

6041.text: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlixs fluffy fur. This Pokmon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
6041.name: swirlix

6042.text: Slurpuffs fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.
6042.name: slurpuff

6043.text: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.
6043.name: inkay

6044.text: Its said that Malamars hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.
6044.name: malamar

6045.text: If the two dont work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they wont survive.
6045.name: binacle

6046.text: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemys defeat.
6046.name: barbaracle

6047.text: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.
6047.name: skrelp

6048.text: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the oceans surface and bathing it in sunlight.
6048.name: dragalge

6049.text: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokmon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.
6049.name: clauncher

6050.text: Clawitzers right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzers cannon arm can sink a tanker.
6050.name: clawitzer

6051.text: The sun powers this Pokmons electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.
6051.name: helioptile

6052.text: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.
6052.name: heliolisk

6053.text: This Pokmon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.
6053.name: tyrunt

6054.text: A single bite of Tyrantrums massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokmon was the king of the ancient world.
6054.name: tyrantrum

6055.text: Amaura is an ancient Pokmon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.
6055.name: amaura

6056.text: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.
6056.name: aurorus

6057.text: Theres a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokmon.
6057.name: sylveon

6058.text: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.
6058.name: hawlucha

6059.text: Since Dedenne cant generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokmon.
6059.name: dedenne

6060.text: Its said that somewhere in the world, theres a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. Its also said that this pack has a queen.
6060.name: carbink

6061.text: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how theyve survived.
6061.name: goomy

6062.text: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.
6062.name: sliggoo

6063.text: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.
6063.name: goodra

6064.text: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokmon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
6064.name: klefki

6065.text: With a voice like a human childs, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
6065.name: phantump

6066.text: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokmons feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.
6066.name: trevenant

6067.text: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokmon that see it.
6067.name: pumpkaboo

6068.text: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.
6068.name: gourgeist

6069.text: This Pokmon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.
6069.name: bergmite

6070.text: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokmons body returns to a pristine state overnight.
6070.name: avalugg

6071.text: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibats ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokmon.
6071.name: noibat

6072.text: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
6072.name: noivern

6073.text: During the day, it builds up energy via photosynthesis. At night, it flies silently through the sky, on the prowl for prey.
6073.name: rowlet

6074.text: It never slacks when it comes to the task of cleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it looking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.
6074.name: dartrix

6075.text: In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an arrow quill, piercing an opponents weak point before they notice whats happening.
6075.name: decidueye

6076.text: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.
6076.name: litten

6077.text: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracats fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.
6077.name: torracat

6078.text: Incineroars rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokmon shows that it has a kind side as well.
6078.name: incineroar

6079.text: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokmon to develop their skills.
6079.name: popplio

6080.text: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina thats leading them.
6080.name: brionne

6081.text: For Primarina, every battles a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.
6081.name: primarina

6082.text: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.
6082.name: grubbin

6083.text: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.
6083.name: charjabug

6084.text: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.
6084.name: vikavolt

6085.text: An opponents aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponents next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.
6085.name: cutiefly

6086.text: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.
6086.name: ribombee

6087.text: This Pokmon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
6087.name: rockruff

6088.text: With swift movements, this Pokmon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanrocs fangs are always aimed toward opponents weak spots.
6088.name: lycanroc

6089.text: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.
6089.name: wishiwashi

6090.text: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.
6090.name: mareanie

6091.text: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokmon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.
6091.name: toxapex

6092.text: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.
6092.name: mudbray

6093.text: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.
6093.name: mudsdale

6094.text: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.
6094.name: dewpider

6095.text: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.
6095.name: araquanid

6096.text: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.
6096.name: fomantis

6097.text: The petals on this Pokmons arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.
6097.name: lurantis

6098.text: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.
6098.name: morelull

6099.text: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, dont go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.
6099.name: shiinotic

6100.text: This sneaky Pokmon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.
6100.name: salandit

6101.text: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.
6101.name: salazzle

6102.text: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.
6102.name: stufful

6103.text: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.
6103.name: bewear

6104.text: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.
6104.name: bounsweet

6105.text: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokmon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.
6105.name: steenee

6106.text: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokmons legs leaves a wound in the opponents body and soul that will never heal.
6106.name: tsareena

6107.text: These Pokmon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokmon has its own individual scent.
6107.name: comfey

6108.text: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokmon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.
6108.name: oranguru

6109.text: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.
6109.name: passimian

6110.text: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemys presence.
6110.name: wimpod

6111.text: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winners meal.
6111.name: golisopod

6112.text: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.
6112.name: sandygast

6113.text: This Pokmon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand cant maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.
6113.name: palossand

6114.text: Its covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist, allowing it to stay on land for days without drying up.
6114.name: pyukumuku

6115.text: It was modeled after a mighty Pokmon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.
6115.name: typenull

6116.text: The final factor needed to release this Pokmons true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
6116.name: silvally

6117.text: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.
6117.name: turtonator

6118.text: When its in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.
6118.name: togedemaru

6119.text: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyus old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.
6119.name: mimikyu

6120.text: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokmonup until its angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.
6120.name: drampa

6121.text: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.
6121.name: dhelmise

6122.text: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur thats become as hard as metal.
6122.name: jangmoo

6123.text: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.
6123.name: hakamoo

6124.text: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.
6124.name: kommoo

6125.text: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.
6125.name: cosmog

6126.text: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.
6126.name: cosmoem

6127.text: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.
6127.name: solgaleo

6128.text: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.
6128.name: lunala

6129.text: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.
6129.name: necrozma

6130.text: This Pokmon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.
6130.name: marshadow

6131.text: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.
6131.name: zeraora

6132.text: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.
6132.name: meltan

6133.text: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetals heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokmon.
6133.name: melmetal

6134.text: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.
6134.name: grookey

6135.text: When its drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it wont even notice that its already knocked out its opponent.
6135.name: thwackey

6136.text: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.
6136.name: rillaboom

6137.text: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once its raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.
6137.name: scorbunny

6138.text: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.
6138.name: raboot

6139.text: Its skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
6139.name: cinderace

6140.text: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokmon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
6140.name: sobble

6141.text: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.
6141.name: drizzile

6142.text: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.
6142.name: inteleon

6143.text: It eats berries nonstopa habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. Itll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.
6143.name: skwovet

6144.text: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokmon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.
6144.name: greedent

6145.text: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokmon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.
6145.name: rookidee

6146.text: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponents strength.
6146.name: corvisquire

6147.text: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokmon very successfully act as the Galar regions airborne taxi service.
6147.name: corviknight

6148.text: Often found in gardens, this Pokmon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.
6148.name: blipbug

6149.text: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.
6149.name: dottler

6150.text: It emits psychic energy to observe and study whats around itand whats around it can include things over six miles away.
6150.name: orbeetle

6151.text: Cunning and cautious, this Pokmon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
6151.name: nickit

6152.text: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.
6152.name: thievul

6153.text: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokmon.
6153.name: gossifleur

6154.text: The cotton on the head of this Pokmon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarna Galar regional specialty.
6154.name: eldegoss

6155.text: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo wont be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokmon is surprisingly strong.
6155.name: wooloo

6156.text: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
6156.name: dubwool

6157.text: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokmon bites down and never lets go.
6157.name: chewtle

6158.text: This Pokmon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.
6158.name: drednaw

6159.text: This gluttonous Pokmon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
6159.name: yamper

6160.text: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
6160.name: boltund

6161.text: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
6161.name: rolycoly

6162.text: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
6162.name: carkol

6163.text: While its engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.
6163.name: coalossal

6164.text: As soon as its born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.
6164.name: applin

6165.text: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.
6165.name: flapple

6166.text: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.
6166.name: appletun

6167.text: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
6167.name: silicobra

6168.text: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.
6168.name: sandaconda

6169.text: This hungry Pokmon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokmon other than its preferred prey.
6169.name: cramorant

6170.text: After its eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. Thats when Cramorant swallows it up.
6170.name: arrokuda

6171.text: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.
6171.name: barraskewda

6172.text: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.
6172.name: toxel

6173.text: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokmon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.
6173.name: toxtricity

6174.text: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once theyre well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
6174.name: sizzlipede

6175.text: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokmon also has large and very sharp fangs.
6175.name: centiskorch

6176.text: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isnt alarmed when that happensit knows theyll grow back. Its about as smart as a three-year-old.
6176.name: clobbopus

6177.text: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
6177.name: grapploct

6178.text: The teacup in which this Pokmon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.
6178.name: sinistea

6179.text: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokmon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.
6179.name: polteageist

6180.text: If this Pokmon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.
6180.name: hatenna

6181.text: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.
6181.name: hattrem

6182.text: If youre too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokmon is also known as the Forest Witch.
6182.name: hatterene

6183.text: It sneaks into peoples homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.
6183.name: impidimp

6184.text: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.
6184.name: morgrem

6185.text: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.
6185.name: grimmsnarl

6186.text: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
6186.name: obstagoon

6187.text: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.
6187.name: perrserker

6188.text: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. Youll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
6188.name: cursola

6189.text: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.
6189.name: sirfetchd

6190.text: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
6190.name: mrrime

6191.text: Never touch its shadowlike body, or youll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
6191.name: runerigus

6192.text: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
6192.name: milcery

6193.text: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.
6193.name: alcremie

6194.text: The six of them work together as one Pokmon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.
6194.name: falinks

6195.text: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.
6195.name: pincurchin

6196.text: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.
6196.name: snom

6197.text: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.
6197.name: frosmoth

6198.text: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
6198.name: stonjourner

6199.text: This Pokmon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.
6199.name: eiscue

6200.text: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.
6200.name: indeedee

6201.text: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if theyre precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
6201.name: morpeko

6202.text: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokmon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.
6202.name: cufant

6203.text: These Pokmon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.
6203.name: copperajah

6204.text: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.
6204.name: dracozolt

6205.text: This Pokmon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
6205.name: arctozolt

6206.text: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokmon cant breathe unless its underwater.
6206.name: dracovish

6207.text: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokmon go extinct anyway.
6207.name: arctovish

6208.text: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokmon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
6208.name: duraludon

6209.text: If this weak Pokmon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.
6209.name: dreepy

6210.text: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy itll try to substitute any Pokmon it finds for the missing Dreepy.
6210.name: drakloak

6211.text: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapults horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.
6211.name: dragapult

6212.text: This Pokmon has slumbered for many years. Some say its Zamazentas elder sisterothers say the two Pokmon are rivals.
6212.name: zacian

6213.text: This Pokmon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
6213.name: zamazenta

6214.text: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokmon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
6214.name: eternatus

6215.text: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
6215.name: kubfu

6216.text: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokmon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.
6216.name: urshifu

6217.text: Once the vines on Zarudes body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.
6217.name: zarude

6218.text: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galars electricity.
6218.name: regieleki

6219.text: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokmon.
6219.name: regidrago

6220.text: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.
6220.name: glastrier

6221.text: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.
6221.name: spectrier

6222.text: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.
6222.name: calyrex

6223.text: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainers cap. The cap is proof that the two traveled across many regions together.
6223.name: pikachuoriginal

6224.text: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainers cap. The cap is proof that the two traveled throughout the Hoenn region together.
6224.name: pikachuhoenn

6225.text: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainers cap. The cap is proof that the two traveled throughout the Sinnoh region together.
6225.name: pikachusinnoh

6226.text: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainers cap. The cap is proof that the two traveled throughout the Unova region together.
6226.name: pikachuunova

6227.text: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainers cap. The cap is proof that the two traveled throughout the Kalos region together
6227.name: pikachukalos

6228.text: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainers cap. The cap is proof that the two traveled throughout the Alola region together.
6228.name: pikachualola

6229.text: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainers cap. The cap is a precious symbol of a fateful encounter.
6229.name: pikachupartner

6230.text: This Pikachu is wearing its Trainers cap. The cap is a precious symbol that travels across different regions with Pikachu.
6230.name: pikachuworld

6231.text: This Pokmon rides on its tail while it uses its psychic powers to levitate. It attacks with star-shaped thunderbolts.
6231.name: raichualola

6232.text: It lives in snowy mountains on southern islands. When a blizzard rolls in, this Pokmon hunkers down in the snow to avoid getting blown away.
6232.name: sandshrewalola

6233.text: Many people climb snowy mountains, hoping to see the icy spikes of these Pokmon glistening in the light of dawn.
6233.name: sandslashalola

6234.text: If you observe its curly hairs through a microscope, youll see small ice particles springing up.
6234.name: vulpixalola

6235.text: While it will guide travelers who get lost on a snowy mountain down to the mountains base, it wont forgive anyone who harms nature.
6235.name: ninetalesalola

6236.text: Its three hairs change shape depending on Digletts mood. Theyre a useful communication tool among these Pokmon.
6236.name: diglettalola

6237.text: The three of them get along very well. Through their formidable teamwork, they defeat powerful opponents.
6237.name: dugtrioalola

6238.text: Deeply proud and keenly smart, this Pokmon moves with cunning during battle and relentlessly attacks enemies weak points.
6238.name: meowthalola

6239.text: These daring Pokmon have coins on their foreheads. Darker coins are harder, and harder coins garner more respect among Meowth.
6239.name: meowthgalar

6240.text: This Pokmon is one tough opponent. Not only does it have formidable physical abilities, but its also not above fighting dirty.
6240.name: persianalola

6241.text: This Pokmon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.
6241.name: ponytagalar

6242.text: Brave and prideful, this Pokmon dashes airily through the forest, its steps aided by the psychic power stored in the fur on its fetlocks.
6242.name: rapidashgalar

6243.text: Because Galarian Slowpoke eat the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor.
6243.name: slowpokegalar

6244.text: If this Pokmon squeezes the tongue of the Shellder biting it, the Shellder will launch a toxic liquid from the tip of its shell.
6244.name: slowbrogalar

6245.text: The stalks of leeks are thicker and longer in the Galar region. Farfetchd that adapted to these stalks took on a unique form.
6245.name: farfetchdgalar

6246.text: This Pokmons psychic powers arent as strong as they once were. The head on this Exeggutors tail scans surrounding areas with weak telepathy.
6246.name: exeggutoralola

6247.text: The cursed flames that light up the bone carried by this Pokmon are said to cause both mental and physical pain that will never fade.
6247.name: marowakalola

6248.text: Long ago, during a time when droves of factories fouled the air with pollution, Weezing changed into this form for some reason.
6248.name: weezinggalar

6249.text: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. Itll spend the whole day tap-dancing on a frozen floor.
6249.name: mrmimegalar

6250.text: Known as Articuno, this Pokmon fires beams that can immobilize opponents as if they had been frozen solid.
6250.name: articunogalar

6251.text: One kick from its powerful legs will pulverize a dump truck. Supposedly, this Pokmon runs through the mountains at over 180 mph.
6251.name: zapdosgalar

6252.text: The sinister aura that blazes like molten fire around this Pokmon is what inspired the name Moltres.
6252.name: moltresgalar

6253.text: While chanting strange spells, this Pokmon combines its internal toxins with what its eaten, creating strange potions.
6253.name: slowkinggalar

6254.text: Sudden climate change wiped out this ancient kind of Corsola. This Pokmon absorbs others life-force through its branches.
6254.name: corsolagalar

6255.text: Thought to be the oldest form of Zigzagoon, it moves in zigzags and wreaks havoc upon its surroundings.
6255.name: zigzagoongalar

6256.text: This very aggressive Pokmon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.
6256.name: linoonegalar

6257.text: The faint scent that emanates from its full blossom entices bug Pokmon to it.
6257.name: cherrimsunshine

6258.text: Its appearance changes depending on the environment. One theory suggests that living in cold seas causes Shellos to take on this form.
6258.name: shelloseast

6259.text: Its body is covered in a sticky slime. Its very susceptible to dehydration, so it cant spend too much time on land.
6259.name: gastrodoneast

6260.text: This form of Rotom enjoys making mischief by turning up the heat. It will gleefully burn your favorite outfit.
6260.name: rotomheat

6261.text: This Rotom has possessed a washing machine that uses a special motor. It blasts out water to get enemies to back down.
6261.name: rotomwash

6262.text: When its like this, Rotom likes to play pranks that are freezing cold. You may find its turned the bath you just filled to solid ice!
6262.name: rotomfrost

6263.text: This Rotom has taken over a fan that has a special motor. Its gusts of wind blow its opponents away!
6263.name: rotomfan

6264.text: In this form, Rotom focuses its antics on plants. Any flowers you were growing are going to get mowed down.
6264.name: rotommow

6265.text: Females of this species are very capable fliers, particularly notable for their stamina. They also take longer to adjust to people.
6265.name: unfezantf

6266.text: Known for their violence, these Pokmon have the most fights with schools of red- striped Basculin.
6266.name: basculinbluestriped

6267.text: The colder they get, the more energetic they are. They freeze their breath to make snowballs, using them as ammo for playful snowball fights.
6267.name: darumakagalar

6268.text: When wounded, it stops moving. It goes as still as stone to meditate, sharpening its mind and spirit.
6268.name: darmanitanzen

6269.text: Though it has a gentle disposition, its also very strong. It will quickly freeze the snowball on its head before going for a headbutt.
6269.name: darmanitangalar

6270.text: Darmanitan takes this form when enraged. It wont stop spewing flames until its rage has settled, even if its body starts to melt.
6270.name: darmanitangalarzen

6271.text: Its said that this Pokmon was formed when an ancient clay tablet was drawn to a vengeful spirit.
6271.name: yamaskgalar

6272.text: Its thin, veillike arms have tens of thousands of poisonous stingers. Females have slightly longer stingers.
6272.name: frillishf

6273.text: The crown on its head gets bigger and bigger as it absorbs more and more of the life-force of other creatures.
6273.name: jellicentf

6274.text: Its conspicuous lips lure prey in as it lies in wait in the mud. When prey gets close, Stunfisk clamps its jagged steel fins down on them.
6274.name: stunfiskgalar

6275.text: It has foreseen that a world of truth will arrive for people and Pokmon. It strives to protect that future.
6275.name: kyuremwhite

6276.text: The sameness of Zekroms and Kyurems genes allowed Kyurem to absorb Zekrom. Kyurem can now use the power of both electricity and ice.
6276.name: kyuremblack

6277.text: The power that lay hidden in its body now covers its horn, turning it into a sword that can slice through anything.
6277.name: keldeoresolute

6278.text: If it doesnt hold back when it unleashes its psychic power, it can tear apart a tanker. Its unfriendliness is part of its charm.
6278.name: meowsticf

6279.text: Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash reigned over the land. His Pokmon eventually drained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.
6279.name: aegislashblade

6280.text: Small Pumpkaboo are said to be the product of areas where few lost souls lingered.
6280.name: pumpkaboosmall

6281.text: Large Pumpkaboo are said to be the product of areas where many lost souls lingered.
6281.name: pumpkaboolarge

6282.text: Massive Pumpkaboo are said to be the product of areas where a great number of lost souls lingered.
6282.name: pumpkaboosuper

6283.text: A small-sized Pumpkaboo evolves into a small-sized Gourgeist. Its bodily proportions also get passed on to its descendants.
6283.name: gourgeistsmall

6284.text: A large-sized Pumpkaboo evolves into a large-sized Gourgeist. Its bodily proportions also get passed on to its descendants.
6284.name: gourgeistlarge

6285.text: A supersized Pumpkaboo evolves into a supersized Gourgeist. Its bodily proportions also get passed on to its descendants.
6285.name: gourgeistsuper

6286.text: Its invigorated by powerful opponentsthe stronger the better. A full-force headbutt from one of these Lycanroc can shatter giant boulders.
6286.name: lycanrocmidnight

6287.text: These Pokmon have both calm and ferocious qualities. Their temperamental nature makes them a difficult species to raise.
6287.name: lycanrocdusk

6288.text: When facing tough opponents, they get into formation. But if they get wounded in battle, theyll scatter and become solitary again.
6288.name: wishiwashischool

6289.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Fighting-type form.
6289.name: silvallyfighting

6290.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Flying-type form.
6290.name: silvallyflying

6291.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Poison-type form.
6291.name: silvallypoison

6292.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Ground-type form.
6292.name: silvallyground

6293.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Rock-type form.
6293.name: silvallyrock

6294.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Bug-type form.
6294.name: silvallybug

6295.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Ghost-type form.
6295.name: silvallyghost

6296.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Steel-type form.
6296.name: silvallysteel

6297.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Fire-type form.
6297.name: silvallyfire

6298.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Water-type form.
6298.name: silvallywater

6299.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Grass-type form.
6299.name: silvallygrass

6300.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Electric-type form.
6300.name: silvallyelectric

6301.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Psychic-type form.
6301.name: silvallypsychic

6302.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Ice-type form.
6302.name: silvallyice

6303.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Dragon-type form.
6303.name: silvallydragon

6304.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Dark-type form.
6304.name: silvallydark

6305.text: It has the ability to change its type based on the memory its holding. This is its Fairy-type form.
6305.name: silvallyfairy

6306.text: Its disguise made from an old rag allowed it to avoid an attack, but the impact broke the neck of the disguise. Now everyone knows its a Mimikyu.
6306.name: mimikyubusted

6307.text: Necrozma has attached itself to Solgaleo. It siphons away its hosts limitless energy, exploiting that energy to fuel a rampage.
6307.name: necrozmaduskmane

6308.text: When Necrozma latches on to Lunala, it becomes vicious, seeing enemies everywhere it looks. It will burn the world with lasers.
6308.name: necrozmadawnwings

6309.text: The slightest shock is sometimes enough to get this Pokmon to spit out the Arrokuda lodged in its throat.
6309.name: cramorantgulping

6310.text: The half-swallowed Pikachu is so startled that it isnt struggling yet, but its still looking for a chance to strike back.
6310.name: cramorantgorging

6311.text: It has an electrical organ on its chest. While generating electricity, it fills its surroundings with what sounds like the strumming of a bass guitar.
6311.name: toxtricitylowkey

6312.text: It absorbs the life-force of those who drink it. It waits patiently, but opportunities are fleeting it tastes so bad that it gets spat out immediately.
6312.name: sinisteantique

6313.text: When angered, it launches tea from its body at the offenders mouth. The tea causes strong chills if swallowed.
6313.name: polteageistantique

6314.text: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a sweet and tart flavor.
6314.name: alcremierubycream

6315.text: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream an aromatic flavor.
6315.name: alcremiematchacream

6316.text: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a refreshing flavor.
6316.name: alcremiemintcream

6317.text: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a sour flavor.
6317.name: alcremielemoncream

6318.text: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a salty flavor.
6318.name: alcremiesaltedcream

6319.text: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a mixed flavor.
6319.name: alcremierubyswirl

6320.text: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a bitter flavor.
6320.name: alcremiecaramelswirl

6321.text: The cells that compose its cream fluctuated suddenly during evolution, giving the cream a complex flavor.
6321.name: alcremierainbowswirl

6322.text: The hair on its head connects to the surface of its brain. When this Pokmon has something on its mind, its hair chills the air around it.
6322.name: eiscuenoice

6323.text: They diligently serve people and Pokmon so they can gather feelings of gratitude. The females are particularly good at babysitting.
6323.name: indeedeef

6324.text: Hunger hormones affect its temperament. Until its hunger is appeased, it gets up to all manner of evil deeds.
6324.name: morpekohangry

6325.text: Able to cut down anything with a single strike, it became known as the Fairy Kings Sword, and it inspired awe in friend and foe alike.
6325.name: zaciancrowned

6326.text: Now that its equipped with its shield, it can shrug off impressive blows, including the attacks of Dynamax Pokmon.
6326.name: zamazentacrowned

6327.text: Infinite amounts of energy pour from this Pokmons enlarged core, warping the surrounding space-time.
6327.name: eternatuseternamax

6328.text: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in defeating foes by raining many blows down on them. Its strikes are nonstop, flowing like a river.
6328.name: urshifurapidstrike

6329.text: This Zarudes special strength stems from its love and care for an orphaned human child that the Pokmon has raised since the childs infancy.
6329.name: zarudedada

6330.text: Its said that this Pokmon once moved a large forestand all the Pokmon living thereto a new location overnight.
6330.name: calyrexice

6331.text: Legend says that by using its power to see all events from past to future, this Pokmon saved the creatures of a forest from a meteorite strike.
6331.name: calyrexshadow

6332.text: In battle, this Pokmon swings around two thick vines. If these vines slammed into a 10-story building, they could easily topple it.
6332.name: venusaurgmax

6333.text: This colossal, flame-winged figure of a Charizard was brought about by Gigantamax energy.
6333.name: charizardgmax

6334.text: Its not very good at precision shooting. When attacking, it just fires its 31 cannons over and over and over.
6334.name: blastoisegmax

6335.text: Crystallized Gigantamax energy makes up this Pokmons blindingly bright and highly toxic scales.
6335.name: butterfreegmax

6336.text: Its Gigantamax power expanded, forming its supersized body and towering tail.
6336.name: pikachugmax

6337.text: The pattern that has appeared on its giant coin is thought to be the key to unlocking the secrets of the Dynamax phenomenon.
6337.name: meowthgmax

6338.text: The Gigantamax energy coursing through its arms makes its punches hit as hard as bomb blasts.
6338.name: machampgmax

6339.text: Rumor has it that its gigantic mouth leads not into its body, filled with cursed energy, but instead directly to the afterlife.
6339.name: gengargmax

6340.text: The flow of Gigantamax energy has spurred this Pokmons left pincer to grow to an enormous size. That claw can pulverize anything.
6340.name: kinglergmax

6341.text: Over 5,000 people can ride on its shell at once. And its a very comfortable ride, without the slightest shaking or swaying.
6341.name: laprasgmax

6342.text: Gigantamax energy upped the fluffiness of the fur around Eevees neck. The fur will envelop a foe, capturing its body and captivating its mind.
6342.name: eeveegmax

6343.text: Gigantamax energy has affected stray seeds and even pebbles that got stuck to Snorlax, making them grow to a huge size.
6343.name: snorlaxgmax

6344.text: Due to Gigantamax energy, this Pokmons toxic gas has become much thicker, congealing into masses shaped like discarded toys.
6344.name: garbodorgmax

6345.text: In a distant land, there are legends about a cyclopean giant. In fact, the giant was a Melmetal that was flooded with Gigantamax energy.
6345.name: melmetalgmax

6346.text: Gigantamax energy has caused Rillabooms stump to grow into a drum set that resembles a forest.
6346.name: rillaboomgmax

6347.text: Infused with Cinderaces fighting spirit, the gigantic Pyro Ball never misses its targets and completely roasts opponents.
6347.name: cinderacegmax

6348.text: Gigantamax Inteleons Water Gun move fires at Mach 7. As the Pokmon takes aim, it uses the crest on its head to gauge wind and temperature.
6348.name: inteleongmax

6349.text: Imbued with Gigantamax energy, its wings can whip up winds more forceful than any a hurricane could muster. The gusts blow everything away.
6349.name: corviknightgmax

6350.text: Its brain has grown to a gargantuan size, as has the rest of its body. This Pokmons intellect and psychic abilities are overpowering.
6350.name: orbeetlegmax

6351.text: It responded to Gigantamax energy by becoming bipedal. First it comes crashing down on foes, and then it finishes them off with its massive jaws.
6351.name: drednawgmax

6352.text: Its body is a colossal stove. With Gigantamax energy stoking the fire, this Pokmons flame burns hotter than 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
6352.name: coalossalgmax

6353.text: Under the influence of Gigantamax energy, it produces much more sweet nectar, and its shape has changed to resemble a giant apple.
6353.name: flapplegmax

6354.text: It blasts its opponents with massive amounts of sweet, sticky nectar, drowning them under the deluge.
6354.name: appletungmax

6355.text: Its sand pouch has grown to tremendous proportions. More than 1,000,000 tons of sand now swirl around its body.
6355.name: sandacondagmax

6356.text: Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokmon can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.
6356.name: toxtricitygmax

6357.text: Its excessive electric energy is its weapon. This Pokmon can build up more electricity than any thundercloud.
6357.name: toxtricitylowkeygmax

6358.text: Gigantamax energy has evoked a rise in its body temperature, now reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Its heat waves incinerate its enemies.
6358.name: centiskorchgmax

6359.text: This Pokmon can read the emotions of creatures over 30 miles away. The minute it senses hostility, it goes on the attack.
6359.name: hatterenegmax

6360.text: By transforming its leg hair, this Pokmon delivers power-packed drill kicks that can bore huge holes in Galars terrain.
6360.name: grimmsnarlgmax

6361.text: Cream pours endlessly from this Pokmons body. The cream stiffens when compressed by an impact. A harder impact results in harder cream.
6361.name: alcremiegmax

6362.text: So much power is packed within its trunk that if it were to unleash that power, the resulting blast could level mountains and change the landscape.
6362.name: copperajahgmax

6363.text: Its grown to resemble a skyscraper. Parts of its towering body glow due to a profusion of energy.
6363.name: duraludongmax

6364.text: People call it the embodiment of rage. Its said that this Pokmons terrifying expression and shout will rid the world of malevolence.
6364.name: urshifugmax

6365.text: As it waits for the right moment to unleash its Gigantamax power, this Pokmon maintains a perfect one-legged stance. It wont even twitch
6365.name: urshifurapidstrikegmax

6366.text: Possesses cheek sacs in which it stores electricity. This clever forest-dweller roasts tough berries with an electric shock before consuming them.
6366.name: pikachu

6367.text: It can discharge bursts of electricity exceeding 100,000 volts a single strike with that amount of power would incapacitate one of the Copperajah of my homeland.
6367.name: raichu

6368.text: It can be found in quiet mountain areas on a full moon's night. Its dancing and its tiny, faintly glowing wings confer upon it a lovely fairylike quality.
6368.name: clefairy

6369.text: Legend says that on clear, quiet nights, it listens for the voices of its kin living on the moon. I, too, often think of my homeland, so far away.
6369.name: clefable

6370.text: In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of fireballs. When young, this Pokmon has but one white tail. As the Pokmon matures, this single tail splits into six.
6370.name: vulpix

6371.text: The coat of gleaming golden fur is quite magnificent. This species is said to store sacred power in its nine long tails and to live for a millennium.
6371.name: ninetales

6372.text: Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this Pokmon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that it emits from its mouth as it flies.
6372.name: zubat

6373.text: It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow and akin to straws.
6373.name: golbat

6374.text: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its backcalled tochukasoare not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.
6374.name: paras

6375.text: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokmon lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect's actions.
6375.name: parasect

6376.text: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.
6376.name: psyduck

6377.text: Its body is strong, and it has webbing on its hands and feet. Golduck can swim easily through rough seas, clawing its way through the high waves.
6377.name: golduck

6378.text: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powersshould danger approach, the Pokmon will simply teleport away.
6378.name: abra

6379.text: There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.
6379.name: kadabra

6380.text: The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.
6380.name: alakazam

6381.text: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.
6381.name: machop

6382.text: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.
6382.name: machoke

6383.text: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokmon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.
6383.name: machamp

6384.text: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.
6384.name: tentacool

6385.text: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.
6385.name: tentacruel

6386.text: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesomecarelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.
6386.name: geodude

6387.text: Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall, so keep an eye upward while traversing mountain roads.
