6387.name: graveler

6388.text: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.
6388.name: golem

6389.text: These Pokmon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.
6389.name: ponyta

6390.text: Fiery mane aglow, Rapidash darts like an arrow across the land. This prodigiously swift creature can traverse the vast region of Hisui in a day and a half.
6390.name: rapidash

6391.text: A bizarre Pokmon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.
6391.name: magnemite

6392.text: Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokmon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.
6392.name: magneton

6393.text: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.
6393.name: gastly

6394.text: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.
6394.name: haunter

6395.text: Possesses potential victims' shadows in an effort to steal away the victims' lives. If your shadow begins to laugh, you must take hold of a protective charm posthaste!
6395.name: gengar

6396.text: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.
6396.name: onix

6397.text: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokmon's viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.
6397.name: lickitung

6398.text: Ludicrously strongwhen it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.
6398.name: rhyhorn

6399.text: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava's heat by its tough, armorlike hide.
6399.name: rhydon

6400.text: This purehearted Pokmon shares its eggs with the injured.
6400.name: chansey

6401.text: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewedthey're useful as a spice.
6401.name: tangela

6402.text: The behavior of this clown-like Pokmon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.
6402.name: mrmime

6403.text: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokmon's nimble motions.
6403.name: scyther

6404.text: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokmon will then wait for lightning to strike.
6404.name: electabuzz

6405.text: Legend has it that this Pokmon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.
6405.name: magmar

6406.text: A feeble, pitiful imbecile of a Pokmon that is nonetheless very hardy. Unperturbed by turbid water, it can be found living in all sorts of places.
6406.name: magikarp

6407.text: I suspect this Pokmon to be the true identity of a dragon written of in ancient texts, which claimed that it razed an entire village with white-hot beams from its maw.
6407.name: gyarados

6408.text: Harbors the potential to evolve into manifold forms. Within Eevee lies the key to the mysteries of Pokmon evolutionI'm certain of it.
6408.name: eevee

6409.text: Tests show that its cells closely resemble water molecules, which perhaps explains its ability to conceal its form while submerged. I believe the origins of mermaid folklore lie with this Pokmon.
6409.name: vaporeon

6410.text: Bristles its fur into sharp, needlelike points when enraged. One can hear electricity crackle in its breath when it exhales.
6410.name: jolteon

6411.text: Flames burn within a saclike organ inside this Pokmon. When Flareon inhales, these flames grow in intensity, reaching a mighty 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
6411.name: flareon

6412.text: It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.
6412.name: porygon

6413.text: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granariessuch occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.
6413.name: snorlax

6414.text: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.
6414.name: cyndaquil

6415.text: This creature's fur is most mysteriousit is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.
6415.name: quilava

6416.text: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.
6416.name: crobat

6417.text: Pichu stores electricity in the sacs on its cheeks but discharges it inadvertently when agitated or excited. Being yet immature, the Pokmon's handling of electricity is rather inept.
6417.name: pichu

6418.text: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.
6418.name: cleffa

6419.text: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.
6419.name: togepi

6420.text: No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human companion, upon whom the Pokmon then bestows great joy.
6420.name: togetic

6421.text: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.
6421.name: sudowoodo

6422.text: This treetop dweller possesses a tail as dexterous as a hand. Ancient writings describe this Pokmon as a one-armed oddity.
6422.name: aipom

6423.text: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.
6423.name: yanma

6424.text: Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather and even people's thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.
6424.name: espeon

6425.text: It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and perceive prey with absolute clarity.
6425.name: umbreon

6426.text: Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths with this creature, I've been told one must chant Workrum, Workrumbad luck, don't come as a protective incantation.
6426.name: murkrow

6427.text: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers' spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.
6427.name: misdreavus

6428.text: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokmon are truly living creatures. I've pointed out that the species' many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.
6428.name: unown

6429.text: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.
6429.name: gligar

6430.text: This Pokmon evolved through use of a strange item. Its body is coated with steel powder and notably hardnot even diamond can leave so much as a scratch.
6430.name: steelix

6431.text: Evolved by way of a curious item. The shell covering its body has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.
6431.name: scizor

6432.text: This Pokmon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself demonstrates tremendous powerit's capable of throwing several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.
6432.name: heracross

6433.text: It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.
6433.name: teddiursa

6434.text: When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokmon will wander fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries. Ursaring's hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.
6434.name: ursaring

6435.text: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.
6435.name: swinub

6436.text: The long fur of this Pokmon covers its eyes, ears, and even limbs, allowing Piloswine to resist harshly frigid conditions. The Pokmon's white tusks can be used to defeat its enemies.
6436.name: piloswine

6437.text: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.
6437.name: remoraid

6438.text: While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.
6438.name: octillery

6439.text: This calm and gentle Pokmon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokmon due to this behavior.
6439.name: mantine

6440.text: A bizarre item caused this Pokmon to evolve. While it now exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology remains inscrutable.
6440.name: porygon2

6441.text: Its strangely shaped antlers have the power to bewitch those who see them. Medicine made by grinding up the black orbs from fallen antlers is an effective treatment for insomnia.
6441.name: stantler

6442.text: They generate electricity by spinning their arms. During a thunderstorm, if one hears the lively voices of children out in the wilderness, what one is actually hearing are the voices of Elekid.
6442.name: elekid

6443.text: This Pokmon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.
6443.name: magby

6444.text: A kindhearted Pokmon that will care for any sick person or Pokmon until their health improves. The eggs it lays are delicious and bring good fortune to those who eat them.
6444.name: blissey

6445.text: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.
6445.name: wurmple

6446.text: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can't extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookoutSilcoon is always on guard.
6446.name: silcoon

6447.text: A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokmon. In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase away Combee as they try to gather nectar.
6447.name: beautifly

6448.text: The silk coating its body is thin but sufficiently strong. Cascoon's silk has a luster and texture superior to that of Silcoon's, and clothes made using Cascoon silk are regarded as top-notch.
6448.name: cascoon

6449.text: Tends to be drawn to bonfires on dark nights. Difficult to chase away from settlements because of the way it scatters highly toxic scales.
6449.name: dustox

6450.text: Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to age or gender. Needs more research.
6450.name: ralts

6451.text: It resembles a maiden in appearance, but it wields strange powers to project visions of paradise. I suspect the crimson ornaments on its head are the key to its abilities.
6451.name: kirlia

6452.text: It will dedicate itself to defending a master it has come to adore. Its pure white dress, reminiscent of those worn by ladies of nobility, is the dress of one who is willing to risk their life.
6452.name: gardevoir

6453.text: Once the people of Hisui discovered that its red nose always points north, they grew to rely on it greatly when traveling afar. The nose seems to work in a similar way to ancient compasses.
6453.name: nosepass

6454.text: Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.
6454.name: roselia

6455.text: Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility hides this Pokmon from predators, and the slime on its body makes grasping it difficult.
6455.name: barboach

6456.text: Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole. People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.
6456.name: whiscash

6457.text: I've heard that the children of Hisui all begin to behave once they've been told the story of how this Pokmon roams about before the witching hour to spirit away misbehaving children.
6457.name: duskull

6458.text: There are rumors that peeking inside its bandage-wrapped body will cause one to get pulled in through the gaps between the bandages, never to return. I've been too scared to verify.
6458.name: dusclops

6459.text: Can emit waves of air powerful enough to knock out prey taller than itself. I hypothesize that it amplifies the faint sound of wind within its body.
6459.name: chimecho

6460.text: Arrives alongside the first snow. It's thought that homes Snorunt visit will prosper for many generations. By tradition, one might offer a lump of ice made from pure water at one's front door.
6460.name: snorunt

6461.text: It covers its body with an armor of ice harder than steel. Uses its breath to freeze prey, which it then devours as if they were frozen desserts.
6461.name: glalie

6462.text: During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal prefers living on the icewhere fewer predators lurkrather than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.
6462.name: spheal

6463.text: Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure the Spheal is healthy.
6463.name: sealeo

6464.text: Its thick tusks are strong enough to shatter drift ice. They have been known to break, but they will grow back by the next year. The Hisui region is well known for these broken tusks.
6464.name: walrein

6465.text: This Pokmon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.
6465.name: turtwig

6466.text: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.
6466.name: grotle

6467.text: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokmon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.
6467.name: torterra

6468.text: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name Lantern-Tail and feared as some kind of apparition.
6468.name: chimchar

6469.text: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.
6469.name: monferno

6470.text: A tall, hardy Pokmon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dancetruly a sight to behold.
6470.name: infernape

6471.text: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable little thingas cute as any childbut it's also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.
6471.name: piplup

6472.text: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.
6472.name: prinplup

6473.text: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.
6473.name: empoleon

6474.text: They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks. Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are stronga strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.
6474.name: starly

6475.text: They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent plumes on their heads are the strong ones.
6475.name: staravia

6476.text: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.
6476.name: staraptor

6477.text: Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.
6477.name: bidoof

6478.text: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokmon create dams on rivers to live in.
6478.name: bibarel

6479.text: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokmon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.
6479.name: kricketot

6480.text: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.
6480.name: kricketune

6481.text: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggressionone must be patient to tame this Pokmon.
6481.name: shinx

6482.text: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokmon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.
6482.name: luxio

6483.text: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokmon can see through anything.
6483.name: luxray

6484.text: When the sun's light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokmon's head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.
6484.name: budew

6485.text: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.
6485.name: roserade

6486.text: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.
6486.name: cranidos

6487.text: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.
6487.name: rampardos

6488.text: Much remains unknown about this Pokmon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.
6488.name: shieldon

6489.text: Its face is sturdyas strong as diamondand this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.
6489.name: bastiodon

6490.text: If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokmon within the cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.
6490.name: burmy

6491.text: The cloakfashioned from plant matterhas merged with the Pokmon and is now part of the body, like fur or skin. I suspect this fusion is an effect of the energy involved in evolution.
6491.name: wormadam

6492.text: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.
6492.name: mothim

6493.text: They swear fealty to a queen Pokmon and work diligently to gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.
6493.name: combee

6494.text: Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.
6494.name: vespiquen

6495.text: A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokmon, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.
6495.name: pachirisu

6496.text: It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat is coincidental.
6496.name: buizel

6497.text: Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.
6497.name: floatzel

6498.text: Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.
6498.name: cherubi

6499.text: Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokmon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.
6499.name: cherrim

6500.text: Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters. Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!
6500.name: shellos

6501.text: Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.
6501.name: gastrodon

6502.text: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.
6502.name: ambipom

6503.text: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.
6503.name: drifloon

6504.text: It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy aspect touches some people deeplyevery so often, one will come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.
6504.name: drifblim

6505.text: My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokmon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.
6505.name: buneary

6506.text: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokmon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.
6506.name: lopunny

6507.text: The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune, so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the Pokmon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.
6507.name: mismagius

6508.text: One cry from this Pokmon, and a murder of Murkrow come flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.
6508.name: honchkrow

6509.text: Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze. Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokmon an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.
6509.name: glameow

6510.text: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.
6510.name: purugly

6511.text: This Pokmon gave me an excruciating headache when it seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.
6511.name: chingling

6512.text: The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.
6512.name: stunky

6513.text: Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.
6513.name: skuntank

6514.text: Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.
6514.name: bronzor

6515.text: Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world. It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.
6515.name: bronzong

6516.text: Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.
6516.name: bonsly

6517.text: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.
6517.name: mimejr

6518.text: In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.
6518.name: happiny

6519.text: A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech. It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even understand the meaning of the words they mimic.
6519.name: chatot

6520.text: It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this Pokmon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight malevolent spirits.
6520.name: spiritomb

6521.text: It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.
6521.name: gible

6522.text: Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly became quite docile.
6522.name: gabite

6523.text: Soars across the heavens at blinding speeda magnificent sight! It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.
6523.name: garchomp

6524.text: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.
6524.name: munchlax

6525.text: Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
6525.name: riolu

6526.text: A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway beings. I have given the name aura to this power.
6526.name: lucario

6527.text: Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.
6527.name: hippopotas

6528.text: Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for the attack.
6528.name: hippowdon

6529.text: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokmon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.
6529.name: skorupi

6530.text: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.
6530.name: drapion

6531.text: A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due to its peculiar cry and comical features.
6531.name: croagunk

6532.text: Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.
6532.name: toxicroak

6533.text: Though this is a plant Pokmon, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.
6533.name: carnivine

6534.text: What a gorgeous sight this Pokmon is as it swims with its long, pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful appearance has led to its nickname: finery fish.
6534.name: finneon

6535.text: Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking it's as though there were shining stars right there.
6535.name: lumineon

6536.text: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokmon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.
6536.name: mantyke

6537.text: One is likely to encounter this Pokmon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harmrather, they bond with the children.
6537.name: snover

6538.text: A powerful Pokmon that can split huge boulders with ease. Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep within the mountains, playing with the snow.
6538.name: abomasnow

6539.text: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.
6539.name: weavile

6540.text: I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokmon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.
6540.name: magnezone

6541.text: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.
6541.name: lickilicky

6542.text: This Pokmon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.
6542.name: rhyperior

6543.text: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.
6543.name: tangrowth

6544.text: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.
6544.name: electivire

6545.text: Use of a strange item caused this Pokmon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.
6545.name: magmortar

6546.text: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokmon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.
6546.name: togekiss

6547.text: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokmon must be of incredible bravery.
6547.name: yanmega

6548.text: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.
6548.name: leafeon

6549.text: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.
6549.name: glaceon

6550.text: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.
6550.name: gliscor

6551.text: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.
6551.name: mamoswine

6552.text: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokmon's offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.
6552.name: porygonz

6553.text: The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is astonishingly impressive.
6553.name: gallade

6554.text: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.
6554.name: probopass

6555.text: Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.
6555.name: dusknoir

6556.text: A Pokmon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.
6556.name: froslass

6557.text: This bizarre Pokmon appears to be a will-o'-the-wisp powered by electricity. Be wary, as Rotom is both smart and mischievous.
6557.name: rotom

6558.text: A Pokmon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.
6558.name: uxie

6559.text: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokmon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.
6559.name: mesprit

6560.text: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokmon manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.
6560.name: azelf

6561.text: This Pokmon is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin flowing in our world.
6561.name: dialga

6562.text: This Pokmon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.
6562.name: palkia

6563.text: Stories tell of this Pokmon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.
6563.name: heatran

6564.text: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.
6564.name: regigigas

6565.text: There is one Hisuian verse that tells of a powerful light creating a deep shadow. I imagine that this deep shadow is Giratina.
6565.name: giratina

6566.text: Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.
6566.name: cresselia

6567.text: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waterslogic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.
6567.name: phione

6568.text: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui's coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.
6568.name: manaphy

6569.text: On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every one of a village's inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.
6569.name: darkrai

6570.text: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.
6570.name: shaymin

6571.text: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokmon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.
6571.name: arceus

6572.text: This Pokmon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this shell the name scalchop.
6572.name: oshawott

6573.text: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.
6573.name: dewott

6574.text: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.
6574.name: petilil

6575.text: Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.
6575.name: rufflet

6576.text: This storm-stirring Pokmon is said to cause the seasons to turn by whipping up the air. I suspect its humanlike form to be a false one.
6576.name: tornadus

6577.text: They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its nemesis, Tornadus, since time immemorial. The lightning bolts it hurls pierce the very earth and enrich the soil.
6577.name: thundurus

6578.text: When the incarnations of wind and of lightning clash, Landorus arrives to quell the conflict. After the tempests and thunderbolts abate, the land is sure to be blessed with bountiful harvests.
6578.name: landorus

6579.text: It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to the situation.
6579.name: sylveon

6580.text: Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it's nice and humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokmon instantly becomes lethargic.
6580.name: goomy

6581.text: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.
6581.name: bergmite

6582.text: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.
6582.name: rowlet

6583.text: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather powerpresumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.
6583.name: dartrix

6584.text: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokmon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
6584.name: wyrdeer

6585.text: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokmon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.
6585.name: kleavor

6586.text: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
6586.name: ursaluna

6587.text: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.
6587.name: basculegion

6588.text: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
6588.name: sneasler

6589.text: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname sea fiend. It slurps up poison to nourish itself.
6589.name: overqwil

6590.text: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokmon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
6590.name: enamorus

6591.text: These Pokmon live in packs in the snowy mountains and defend themselves with icy breath. I suspect this species changed its form to adapt to the frigid climate.
6591.name: vulpixalola

6592.text: Dwells on sacred peaks perpetually covered in snow. Said to appear to virtuous people who have lost their way on mountain pathsit then guides them back down to the mountain's base.
6592.name: ninetalesalola

6593.text: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.
6593.name: growlithehisui

6594.text: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.
6594.name: arcaninehisui

6595.text: An enigmatic Pokmon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Pok Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
6595.name: voltorbhisui

6596.text: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokmon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.
6596.name: electrodehisui

6597.text: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.
6597.name: typhlosionhisui

6598.text: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokmon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.
6598.name: qwilfishhisui

6599.text: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel's grasp.
6599.name: sneaselhisui

6600.text: It creates a cloak by weaving together sand, mud, and silk it has spat out. This earthen cloak is ruined by wind and rain, so the Pokmon hides away in caves and other such places.
6600.name: burmysandy

6601.text: When confronted by a lack of other materials, Burmy will create its cloak using dust and refuse. The cloak seems to be more comfortable than one would think. .
6601.name: burmytrash

6602.text: Its earthen skin is reasonably hardit has no problem repelling a Starly's pecking, at least.
6602.name: wormadamsandy

6603.text: Its body, composed of refuse, blends in to the scenery so much as to be inconspicuous. This seems to be the perfect way for the Pokmon to evade the detection of predators.
6603.name: wormadamtrash

6604.text: Cheerfully active on sunny days. Immediately closes its petals and becomes immobile once the sun becomes hidden, however.
6604.name: cherrimsunshine

6605.text: Found in abundance on seashores bordering cold waters. When pressed upon, the Pokmon will secrete from its body's surface a purple fluid that will stain one's clothes.
6605.name: shelloseast

6606.text: Found more often on the land than in the sea. More active when it's cloudy or rainy out than when the weather is fair.
6606.name: gastrodoneast

6607.text: A form in which Rotom lurks within a strange cauldron. The cauldron's origin is unknown. A bothersome Pokmon, causing trouble with the flames it spits.
6607.name: rotomheat

6608.text: A form in which Rotom lurks within an odd bureau. The bureau's purpose is unknown. A bothersome Pokmon, causing trouble by splashing cold water everywhere.
6608.name: rotomwash

6609.text: A form in which Rotom lurks within a bizarre cupboard. The cupboard's composition is unknown. A bothersome Pokmon, causing trouble by frosting everything over.
6609.name: rotomfrost

6610.text: A form in which Rotom lurks within a mysterious contraption. The contraption's purpose is unknown. A bothersome Pokmon, causing trouble by stirring up powerful winds.
6610.name: rotomfan

6611.text: form in which Rotom lurks within a misshapen wheelbarrow. The wheelbarrow's mechanisms are bizarre. It's a bothersome Pokmon, causing trouble by mowing down grass and trees.
6611.name: rotommow

6612.text: Radiant light caused Dialga to take on a form bearing a striking resemblance to the creator Pokmon. Dialga now wields such colossal strength that one must conclude this is its true form.
6612.name: dialgaorigin

6613.text: It soars across the sky in a form that greatly resembles the creator of all things. Perhaps this imitation of appearance is Palkia's strategy for gaining Arceus's powers.
6613.name: palkiaorigin

6614.text: Giratina loses its legs upon changing into this form. I believe this Pokmon must hail from a world where the heavens and the earth are as one, though I have no way of proving it.
6614.name: giratinaorigin

6615.text: Upon taking in the scent of a particular rare flower, Shaymin is enveloped in light, and its tiny body transforms. I took a whiff of the flower myself, but alas, my body remained unchanged.
6615.name: shayminsky

6616.text: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokmon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
6616.name: samurotthisui

6617.text: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
6617.name: lilliganthisui

6618.text: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanorthis one is gentleI have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.
6618.name: basculinwhitestriped

6619.text: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
6619.name: zoruahisui

6620.text: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.
6620.name: zoroarkhisui

6621.text: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokmon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.
6621.name: braviaryhisui

6622.text: An example of what is known as a form change, though I suspect this strange avian guise to be Tornadus's true form. Tornadus has been sighted crossing the ocean while in this form.
6622.name: tornadustherian

6623.text: Quick as a flash, it materializes out of nowhere. It pulverizes foes into nothingness with showers of devastatingly powerful lightning bolts launched from the string of orbs on its tail.
6623.name: thundurustherian

6624.text: Landorus soars through the sky in this form, bestowing plentiful harvests upon the land and earning the people's reverence. It can traverse the whole of Hisui in a mere couple of hours.
6624.name: landorustherian

6625.text: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui's water.
6625.name: sliggoohisui

6626.text: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingyit will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
6626.name: goodrahisui

6627.text: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokmon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
6627.name: avalugghisui

6628.text: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokmon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
6628.name: decidueyehisui

6629.text: A different guise from its feminine humanoid form. From the clouds, it descends upon those who treat any form of life with disrespect and metes out wrathful, ruthless punishment.
6629.name: enamorustherian

6630.text: For some time after its birth, it uses the nutrients that are packed into the seed on its back in order to grow.
6630.name: bulbasaur

6631.text: The more sunlight Ivysaur bathes in, the more strength wells up within it, allowing the bud on its back to grow larger.
6631.name: ivysaur

6632.text: While it basks in the sun, it can convert the light into energy. As a result, it is more powerful in the summertime.
6632.name: venusaur

6633.text: When it swings its burning tail, the temperature around it rises higher and higher, tormenting its opponents.
6633.name: charmeleon

6634.text: If Charizard becomes truly angered, the flame at the tip of its tail burns in a light blue shade.
6634.name: charizard

6635.text: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. It sprays a potent foam from its mouth.
6635.name: squirtle

6636.text: Wartortles long, furry tail is a symbol of longevity, so this Pokmon is quite popular among older people.
6636.name: wartortle

6637.text: It deliberately increases its body weight so it can withstand the recoil of the water jets it fires.
6637.name: blastoise

6638.text: It can freely detach its jaw to swallow large prey whole. It can become too heavy to move, however.
6638.name: ekans

6639.text: The pattern on its belly appears to be a frightening face. Weak foes will flee just at the sight of the pattern.
6639.name: arbok

6640.text: When it is angered, it immediately discharges the energy stored in the pouches in its cheeks.
6640.name: pikachu

6641.text: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
6641.name: raichu

6642.text: It digs deep burrows to live in. When in danger, it rolls up its body to withstand attacks.
6642.name: sandshrew

6643.text: It is adept at attacking with the spines on its back and its sharp claws while quickly scurrying about.
6643.name: sandslash

6644.text: On nights with a full moon, Clefairy gather from all over and dance. Bathing in moonlight makes them float.
6644.name: clefairy

6645.text: Said to live in quiet, remote mountains, this type of fairy has a strong aversion to being seen.
6645.name: clefable

6646.text: If it is attacked by an enemy that is stronger than itself, it feigns injury to fool the enemy and escapes.
6646.name: vulpix

6647.text: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystical power.
6647.name: ninetales

6648.text: When its huge eyes waver, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep.
6648.name: jigglypuff

6649.text: It has a very fine fur. Take care not to make it angry, or it may inflate steadily and hit with a body slam.
6649.name: wigglytuff

6650.text: Its scientific name is Oddium wanderus. It is said to cover distances as far as 1,000 feet when night falls, walking on its two roots.
6650.name: oddish

6651.text: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isnt drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey.
6651.name: gloom

6652.text: The bud bursts into bloom with a bang. It then starts scattering allergenic, poisonous pollen.
6652.name: vileplume

6653.text: Poison oozes from all over its body. It catches small bug Pokmon at night that are attracted by light.
6653.name: venonat

6654.text: The wings are covered with dustlike scales. Every time it flaps its wings, it looses highly toxic dust.
6654.name: venomoth

6655.text: It lives about one yard underground, where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears aboveground.
6655.name: diglett

6656.text: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.
6656.name: dugtrio

6657.text: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.
6657.name: meowth

6658.text: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
6658.name: persian

6659.text: It is constantly wracked by a headache. When the headache turns intense, it begins using mysterious powers.
6659.name: psyduck

6660.text: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its forehead somehow begins to glow.
6660.name: golduck

6661.text: It lives in groups in the treetops. If it loses sight of its group, it becomes infuriated by its loneliness.
6661.name: mankey

6662.text: It becomes wildly furious if it even senses someone looking at it. It chases anyone that meets its glare.
6662.name: primeape

6663.text: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
6663.name: growlithe

6664.text: An ancient picture scroll shows that people were captivated by its movement as it ran through prairies.
6664.name: arcanine

6665.text: The swirl on its belly is its insides showing through the skin. It appears more clearly after Poliwag eats.
6665.name: poliwag

6666.text: Its two legs are well developed. Even though it can live on the ground, it prefers living in water.
6666.name: poliwhirl

6667.text: Although its skilled in a style of dynamic swimming that uses all its muscles, for some reason it lives on dry land.
6667.name: poliwrath

6668.text: No matter what Bellsprout is doing, if it detects movement nearby, it will immediately react by reaching out with its thin vines.
6668.name: bellsprout

6669.text: Even though it is filled with acid, it does not melt because it also oozes a protective fluid.
6669.name: weepinbell

6670.text: It lures prey into its mouth with a nectar-like aroma. The helpless prey is melted with a dissolving fluid.
6670.name: victreebel

6671.text: When the tide goes out, dehydrated Tentacool can be found left behind on the shore.
6671.name: tentacool

6672.text: On the rare occasions that large outbreaks of Tentacruel occur, all fish Pokmon disappear from the surrounding sea.
6672.name: tentacruel

6673.text: At rest, it looks just like a rock. Carelessly stepping on it will make it swing its fists angrily.
6673.name: geodude

6674.text: A slow walker, it rolls to move. It pays no attention to any object that happens to be in its path.
6674.name: graveler

6675.text: It is enclosed in a hard shell that is as rugged as slabs of rock. It sheds skin once a year to grow larger.
6675.name: golem

6676.text: It is incredibly slow and dopey. It takes five seconds for it to feel pain when under attack.
6676.name: slowpoke

6677.text: When a Slowpoke went hunting in the sea, its tail was bitten by a Shellder. That made it evolve into Slowbro.
6677.name: slowbro

6678.text: The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which allows it to float.
6678.name: magnemite

6679.text: Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.
6679.name: magneton

6680.text: Its twin heads have exactly the same genes and battle in perfect sync with each other.
6680.name: doduo

6681.text: It now has three hearts and three sets of lungs. Though it cant run as fast as Doduo, Dodrio can keep running for longer stretches of time.
6681.name: dodrio

6682.text: The protrusion on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice.
6682.name: seel

6683.text: It sleeps under shallow ocean waters during the day, then looks for food at night when its colder.
6683.name: dewgong

6684.text: Born from sludge, these Pokmon now gather in polluted places and increase the bacteria in their bodies.
6684.name: grimer

6685.text: Its thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.
6685.name: muk

6686.text: It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond. Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.
6686.name: shellder

6687.text: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.
6687.name: cloyster

6688.text: It wraps its opponent in its gas-like body, slowly weakening its prey by poisoning it through the skin.
6688.name: gastly

6689.text: It likes to lurk in the dark and tap shoulders with a gaseous hand. Its touch causes endless shuddering.
6689.name: haunter

6690.text: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the preys shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.
6690.name: gengar

6691.text: It remembers every dream it eats. It rarely eats the dreams of adults because childrens are much tastier.
6691.name: drowzee

6692.text: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of psi moves, such as Hypnosis and Confusion.
6692.name: hypno

6693.text: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.
6693.name: voltorb

6694.text: The more energy it charges up, the faster it gets. But this also makes it more likely to explode.
6694.name: electrode

6695.text: If you touch one of Exeggcutes heads, mistaking it for an egg, the other heads will quickly gather and attack you in a swarm.
6695.name: exeggcute

6696.text: It is called the Walking Jungle. Each of the nuts has a face and a will of its own.
6696.name: exeggutor

6697.text: At the exact moment it lands a kick on its target, Hitmonlee hardens the muscles on the sole of its foot, maximizing the power of the kick.
6697.name: hitmonlee

6698.text: It corners its foes with combo punches from both sides, then finishes them off with a single straight punch launched at over 300 mph.
6698.name: hitmonchan

6699.text: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.
6699.name: koffing

6700.text: Top-grade perfume is made using its internal poison gases by diluting them to the highest level.
6700.name: weezing

6701.text: Rhyhorn claims an area with over a six mile radius as its territory. It apparently forgets where this territory is when running, however.
6701.name: rhyhorn

6702.text: The horn of a Rhydon is powerful enough to crush raw diamonds. These Pokmon polish their horns by bashing them together.
6702.name: rhydon

6703.text: This kindly Pokmon lays highly nutritious eggs and shares them with injured Pokmon or people.
6703.name: chansey

6704.text: If attackedeven by a large enemyHorsea effortlessly swims to safety by utilizing its well-developed dorsal fin.
6704.name: horsea

6705.text: The male raises the young. If it is approached while caring for young, it will use its toxic spines to fend off the intruder.
6705.name: seadra

6706.text: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.
6706.name: scyther

6707.text: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.
6707.name: electabuzz

6708.text: Found near the mouth of a volcano. This fire-breathers body temperature is nearly 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit.
6708.name: magmar

6709.text: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails.
6709.name: tauros

6710.text: An underpowered, pathetic Pokmon. It may jump high on rare occasions but never more than seven feet.
6710.name: magikarp

6711.text: Once it appears, it goes on a rampage. It remains enraged until it demolishes everything around it.
6711.name: gyarados

6712.text: It ferries people across the sea on its back. It may sing an enchanting cry if it is in a good mood.
6712.name: lapras

6713.text: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it cant maintain its disguise.
6713.name: ditto

6714.text: Its ability to evolve into many forms allows it to adapt smoothly and perfectly to any environment.
6714.name: eevee

6715.text: It lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin, which is often mistaken for a mermaids.
6715.name: vaporeon

6716.text: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.
6716.name: jolteon

6717.text: Inhaled air is carried to its flame sac, heated, and exhaled as fire that reaches over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
6717.name: flareon

6718.text: It is an artificial Pokmon. Since it doesnt breathe, people are excited by its potential to be useful in any environment.
6718.name: porygon

6719.text: This gluttonous Pokmon eats constantly, apart from when its asleep. It devours nearly 900 pounds of food per day.
6719.name: snorlax

6720.text: It sheds many layers of skin as it grows larger. During this process, it is protected by a rapid waterfall.
6720.name: dratini

6721.text: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.
6721.name: dragonair

6722.text: It is said that somewhere in the ocean lies an island where these gather. Only they live there.
6722.name: dragonite

6723.text: It loves to bask in the sunlight. It uses the leaf on its head to seek out warm places.
6723.name: chikorita

6724.text: The spicy scent that wafts from around Bayleefs neck somehow makes those who smell it want to fight.
6724.name: bayleef

6725.text: Anyone who stands beside it becomes refreshed, just as if they were soaking in the soothing atmosphere of a forest.
6725.name: meganium

6726.text: It usually stays hunched over. If it is angry or surprised, it shoots flames out of its back.
6726.name: cyndaquil

6727.text: Before battle, it turns its back on its opponent to demonstrate how ferociously its fire blazes.
6727.name: quilava

6728.text: It has a secret, devastating move. It rubs its blazing fur to cause huge explosions.
6728.name: typhlosion

6729.text: Its powerful, well-developed jaws are capable of crushing anything. Even its Trainer must be careful.
6729.name: totodile

6730.text: The tips of its fangs are slanted backward. Once those fangs clamp down, the prey has no hope of escape.
6730.name: croconaw

6731.text: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.
6731.name: feraligatr

6732.text: This Pokmon is extremely cautious. Its supple tail is well muscled and firm to the touch.
6732.name: sentret

6733.text: It raises its offspring inside a long, narrow nest. Once theyre old enough, it takes them outside the nest to prepare them for independence.
6733.name: furret

6734.text: Hoothoots internal clock is precise at all times. It tilts its head in a fixed rhythm.
6734.name: hoothoot

6735.text: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.
6735.name: noctowl

6736.text: Even while there are prey ensnared in its nest of spun thread, Spinarak will wait motionlessly until darkness falls.
6736.name: spinarak

6737.text: A single strand of a special thread is endlessly spun out of its rear. The thread leads back to its nest.
6737.name: ariados

6738.text: It lives in ocean depths beyond the reach of sunlight. It flashes lights on its antennae to communicate with others of its kind.
6738.name: chinchou

6739.text: Portions of its dorsal fin mutated, becoming the parts that glow brightly to lure prey.
6739.name: lanturn

6740.text: It is unskilled at storing electric power. Any kind of shock causes it to discharge energy spontaneously.
6740.name: pichu

6741.text: On late nights illuminated by shooting stars, it gazes intently skyward, as if thinking of its home.
6741.name: cleffa

6742.text: Its body has a faintly sweet scent and is bouncy and soft. If it bounces even once, it cannot stop.
6742.name: igglybuff

6743.text: If static electricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.
6743.name: mareep

6744.text: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool wont grow.
6744.name: flaaffy

6745.text: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.
6745.name: ampharos

6746.text: Due to the effects of the Sun Stone, it is now active during the daytime. It likes to dance in pools of sunlight.
6746.name: bellossom

6747.text: The fur on its body naturally repels water. It can stay dry even when it plays in the water.
6747.name: marill

6748.text: Its long ears are superb sensors. It can distinguish the movements of things in water and tell what they are.
6748.name: azumarill

6749.text: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composition appears more similar to rock than to vegetation.
6749.name: sudowoodo

6750.text: If Poliwag and Poliwhirl hear its echoing cry, they respond by gathering from far and wide.
6750.name: politoed

6751.text: This Pokmon is blown across vast distances by the wind. It is unclear where the Hoppip of Paldea originally came from.
6751.name: hoppip

6752.text: Skiploom enthusiasts can apparently tell where a Skiploom was born by the scent drifting from the flower on the Pokmons head.
6752.name: skiploom

6753.text: Jumpluff travels on seasonal winds. Once its cotton spores run out, its journey ends, as does its life.
6753.name: jumpluff

6754.text: It lives atop tall trees. When leaping from branch to branch, it deftly uses its tail for balance.
6754.name: aipom

6755.text: It suddenly falls out of the sky in the morning. Knowing its weak, it simply feeds until it evolves.
6755.name: sunkern

6756.text: In the daytime, it rushes about in a hectic manner, but it comes to a complete stop when the sun sets.
6756.name: sunflora

6757.text: As Yanma surveys its territory, it periodically stops to hover in place by flapping its wings at high speeds.
6757.name: yanma

6758.text: A transparent mucous membrane covers its body. Touching it bare-handed will cause a tingling numbness.
6758.name: wooper

6759.text: This carefree Pokmon has an easygoing nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.
6759.name: quagsire

6760.text: The tip of its forked tail quivers when it is predicting its opponents next move.
6760.name: espeon

6761.text: When exposed to the moons aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.
6761.name: umbreon

6762.text: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.
6762.name: murkrow

6763.text: When its head was bitten, toxins entered Slowpokes head and unlocked an extraordinary power.
6763.name: slowking

6764.text: This Pokmon startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.
6764.name: misdreavus

6765.text: Though very small, the brain in its tail is still considered an important organ because it emits powerful psychic energy.
6765.name: girafarig

6766.text: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesnt bother it.
6766.name: pineco

6767.text: Its usually found hanging on to a fat tree trunk. It shoots out bits of its shell when it sees action.
6767.name: forretress

6768.text: It creates mazes in dark locations. When spotted, it flees into the ground by digging with its tail.
6768.name: dunsparce

6769.text: It builds its nest on a steep cliff. When it is done gliding, it hops along the ground back to its nest.
6769.name: gligar

6770.text: In truth, it is a cowardly Pokmon. It growls eagerly in order to hide its fear from its opponent.
6770.name: snubbull

6771.text: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If attacked, it desperately flails its limbs about in an attempt to repel its opponent.
6771.name: granbull

6772.text: Be cautious if this Pokmon starts sucking in waterit will soon attack by scattering the toxic spikes that grow all over its body.
6772.name: qwilfish

6773.text: This Pokmons pincers, which contain steel, can crush any hard object they get ahold of into bits.
6773.name: scizor

6774.text: It loves sweet nectar. To keep all the nectar to itself, it hurls rivals away with its prized horn.
6774.name: heracross

6775.text: This cunning Pokmon hides under the cover of darkness, waiting to attack its prey.
6775.name: sneasel

6776.text: This Pokmon discreetly follows Combee to find their hive. It scoops up big dollops of honey in its palms to eat.
6776.name: teddiursa

6777.text: It usually wears a hardened expression, but when its licking up honeywhich it lovesthe joy it feels will cause it to break into a wide grin.
6777.name: ursaring

6778.text: Its lava body can cool and chip away at times, but a magma bath will heal it right up.
6778.name: slugma

6779.text: This Pokmon lives near the craters of volcanoes. It stores fire energy in its shell of cooled and hardened magma.
6779.name: magcargo

6780.text: It searches for food by digging into the ground with its snout. Even frozen ground doesnt give it any trouble.
6780.name: swinub

6781.text: Covered by a shaggy coat, it is resistant to the cold. Its tusks of ice thicken when it snows.
6781.name: piloswine

6782.text: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.
6782.name: delibird

6783.text: Its sturdy, heavy-looking iron body is actually thin and light, so it can fly at speeds over 180 mph.
6783.name: skarmory

6784.text: It is smart enough to hunt in packs. It uses a variety of cries for communicating with others.
6784.name: houndour

6785.text: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.
6785.name: houndoom

6786.text: It sleeps deep on the ocean floor to build its energy. It is said to cause tornadoes as it wakes.
6786.name: kingdra

6787.text: This Pokmon lives and nests on a riverbank. After playing in the mud, it wont be able to settle down unless it washes its body.
6787.name: phanpy

6788.text: Donphan is covered in tough hide, so even being hit by a car wont faze this Pokmon. However, it is extremely susceptible to rain.
6788.name: donphan

6789.text: This artificial Pokmon evolved thanks to cutting- edge science. It sometimes displays behavior that is not in its programming.
6789.name: porygon2

6790.text: This Pokmon apparently used to live in much harsher environments, and thus it once had stronger psychic powers than it does now.
6790.name: stantler

6791.text: Once a Smeargle reaches adulthood, it will have other members of its species leave paw prints on its back.
6791.name: smeargle

6792.text: This earnest Pokmon battles all sorts of opponents, searching for the fighting style that suits it best.
6792.name: tyrogue

6793.text: This Pokmon is adept at dance-like kicks. The horn atop its head is made from the same substance that generally forms fur and claws.
6793.name: hitmontop

6794.text: It loves violent thunder. The space between its horns flickers bluish white when it is charging energy.
6794.name: elekid

6795.text: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, sparks leak from its mouth and nostrils.
6795.name: magby

6796.text: Anyone who takes even one taste of Blisseys egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.
6796.name: blissey

6797.text: Born deep underground, this Pokmon becomes a pupa after eating enough dirt to make a mountain.
6797.name: larvitar

6798.text: This pupa flies around wildly by venting with great force the gas pressurized inside its body.
6798.name: pupitar

6799.text: Extremely strong, it can change the landscape. It is so insolent that it doesnt care about others.
6799.name: tyranitar

6800.text: The small hooks on the soles of its feet latch on to walls and ceilings, so it will never fall even while hanging upside down.
6800.name: treecko

6801.text: Its strongly developed thigh muscles give it astounding agility and jumping performance.
6801.name: grovyle

6802.text: It agilely flits through the jungle and uses the sharp-edged leaves on its arms to cut down its prey.
6802.name: sceptile

6803.text: Torchic feels toasty warm if you hug it. It has a flame sac inside its belly, and the flames burn continuously as long as Torchic has life in it.
6803.name: torchic

6804.text: It boosts its concentration by emitting harsh cries. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.
6804.name: combusken

6805.text: When facing a tough foe, it looses flames from its wrists. Its powerful legs let it jump clear over buildings.
6805.name: blaziken

6806.text: It has the power to crush large boulders into pieces. To rest, it buries itself in mud at the bottom of a river.
6806.name: mudkip

6807.text: Living on muddy ground that provides poor footing has served to train its lower body and caused it to develop sturdy legs.
6807.name: marshtomp

6808.text: Its arms are hard as rock. With one swing, it can break an enormous boulder into pieces.
6808.name: swampert

6809.text: It bares its large fangs and barks vigorously to try to intimidate opponents, but this is actually a manifestation of its cowardly nature.
6809.name: poochyena

6810.text: They faithfully follow the orders of their leader. Prey targeted by Mightyena is never allowed to escape the outstanding teamwork of its pursuers.
6810.name: mightyena

6811.text: The leaf on its head is naturally dirt repellent and will stay clean even after transporting Pokmon that are covered in mud.
6811.name: lotad

6812.text: Old folklore in Kitakami tells of a mischievous child who was reborn as a Pokmon.
6812.name: lombre

6813.text: There are structures throughout its whole body that produce energy when hit by sound waves with a cheerful rhythm.
6813.name: ludicolo

6814.text: To expand its habitat, it pretends to be a nut so that bird Pokmon will pick it up and carry it far away.
6814.name: seedot

6815.text: It leads a quiet life deep in the forest. If anything wanders into its territory, Nuzleaf will warn the intruder by sounding its grass flute.
6815.name: nuzleaf

6816.text: It is said that when Shiftry flaps its leafy fans atop ancient trees, chilly winds blow and the season rolls into winter.
6816.name: shiftry

6817.text: It soars high in the sky, riding on updrafts like a glider. It carries food tucked in its bill.
6817.name: wingull

6818.text: It is a flying transporter that carries small Pokmon in its beak. It bobs on the waves to rest its wings.
6818.name: pelipper

6819.text: The horns on its head provide a strong power that enables it to sense peoples emotions.
6819.name: ralts

6820.text: It has a psychic power that enables it to distort the space around it and see into the future.
6820.name: kirlia

6821.text: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.
6821.name: gardevoir

6822.text: They usually live on ponds, but after an evening shower, they may appear on puddles in towns.
6822.name: surskit

6823.text: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any directionto and fro and sideways.
6823.name: masquerain

6824.text: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.
6824.name: shroomish

6825.text: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.
6825.name: breloom

6826.text: It sleeps for 20 hours every day. Making drowsy those that see it is one of its abilities.
6826.name: slakoth

6827.text: Its stress level rises if it cannot keep moving constantly. Too much stress makes it feel sick.
6827.name: vigoroth

6828.text: It is the worlds most slothful Pokmon. However, it can exert horrifying power by releasing pent-up energy all at once.
6828.name: slaking

6829.text: It grows stronger by enduring harsh training. It is a gutsy Pokmon that can withstand any attack.
6829.name: makuhita

6830.text: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.
6830.name: hariyama

6831.text: Its tail bounces like a rubber ball. It flings that tail around to fight opponents bigger than itself.
6831.name: azurill

6832.text: The magnet in Nosepasss nose provides an unerring compass, making this Pokmon an excellent partner for Trainers going on a journey.
6832.name: nosepass

6833.text: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.
6833.name: sableye

6834.text: It never skips its daily yoga training. It heightens its inner strength through meditation.
6834.name: meditite

6835.text: It cheers on partners while scattering sparks from its body. It climbs telephone poles to absorb electricity.
6835.name: plusle

6836.text: Exposure to electricity from Minun and Plusle promotes blood circulation and relaxes muscles.
6836.name: minun

6837.text: It lives around clean ponds. At night, its rear lights up. It converses with others by flashing its light.
6837.name: volbeat

6838.text: Illumise uses its sweet scent to guide Volbeat, having them form over 200 patterns in the night sky.
6838.name: illumise

6839.text: There is nothing its stomach cant digest. While it is digesting, vile, overpowering gases are expelled.
6839.name: gulpin

6840.text: It gulps anything that fits in its mouth. Its special enzymes can dissolve anything.
6840.name: swalot

6841.text: Magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit courses through its body. When it grows cold, the magma hardens and slows it.
6841.name: numel

6842.text: It lives in the crater of a volcano. It is well known that the humps on its back erupt every 10 years.
6842.name: camerupt

6843.text: It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows out black soot if it is endangered.
6843.name: torkoal

6844.text: Spoink will die if it stops bouncing. The pearl on its head amplifies its psychic powers.
6844.name: spoink

6845.text: It can perform odd dance steps to influence foes. Its style of dancing became hugely popular overseas.
6845.name: grumpig

6846.text: This Pokmon lives in arid deserts. It patiently awaits prey inside its funnel- shaped nest.
6846.name: trapinch

6847.text: Rather than using its underdeveloped wings for flight, it rubs them together, emitting ultrasonic waves to attack its enemies.
6847.name: vibrava

6848.text: Known as the Desert Spirit, this Pokmon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.
6848.name: flygon

6849.text: It prefers harsh environments, such as deserts. It can survive for 30 days on water stored in its body.
6849.name: cacnea

6850.text: Packs of them follow travelers through the desert until the travelers can no longer move.
6850.name: cacturne

6851.text: It constantly grooms its cotton-like wings. It takes a shower to clean itself if it becomes dirty.
6851.name: swablu

6852.text: If it bonds with a person, it will gently envelop the friend with its soft wings, then hum.
6852.name: altaria

6853.text: Its Sevipers archrival. To threaten those it encounters, it fans out the claws on its front paws.
6853.name: zangoose

6854.text: It sharpens its swordlike tail on hard rocks. It hides in tall grass and strikes unwary prey with venomous fangs.
6854.name: seviper

6855.text: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its preys location.
6855.name: barboach

6856.text: It is extremely protective of its territory. If any foe approaches, it attacks using vicious tremors.
6856.name: whiscash

6857.text: It came from overseas. It is a very hardy creature that will quickly proliferate, even in polluted streams.
6857.name: corphish

6858.text: Loving to battle, this Pokmon pinches all Pokmon that enter its territory with its pincers and throws them out.
6858.name: crawdaunt

6859.text: This tough Pokmon is perfectly fine even in dirty water. However, due to its ragged, shabby appearance, it isnt popular.
6859.name: feebas

6860.text: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow- colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.
6860.name: milotic

6861.text: It loves to feed on feelings like envy and malice. Its upright horn catches the emotions of people.
6861.name: shuppet

6862.text: This Pokmon developed from an abandoned doll that amassed a grudge. It is seen in dark alleys.
6862.name: banette

6863.text: In the dead of night, these Pokmon wander through towns in search of children, whose vital energy is a Duskulls favorite food.
6863.name: duskull

6864.text: Dusclops is feared because its said to pull the soul out of anyone who gazes upon the strange movements of its hands.
6864.name: dusclops

6865.text: It lives in tropical jungles. The bunch of fruit around its neck is delicious. The fruit grows twice a year.
6865.name: tropius

6866.text: It uses the sucker on its head to hang from a tree or from eaves. It can produce seven different tones.
6866.name: chimecho
