6867.text: It is said that several Snorunt gather under giant leaves and live together in harmony.
6867.name: snorunt

6868.text: Its prey is instantaneously frozen stiff by the cold air it exhales from its huge mouth. While theyre in that frozen state, it gobbles them up.
6868.name: glalie

6869.text: Its heart-shaped body makes it popular. In some places, you would give a Luvdisc to someone you love.
6869.name: luvdisc

6870.text: Its steel-hard head can shatter boulders. It longingly hopes for wings to grow so it can fly.
6870.name: bagon

6871.text: The cells within its shell transform with explosive speed, preparing it for evolution.
6871.name: shelgon

6872.text: It flies around on its wings, which have grown in at last. In its happiness, it gushes hot flames, burning up everything it passes over.
6872.name: salamence

6873.text: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the grounds natural magnetism, letting it float.
6873.name: beldum

6874.text: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its two brains are linked, amplifying its psychic power.
6874.name: metang

6875.text: It folds its four legs when flying. Its four brains are said to be superior to a supercomputer.
6875.name: metagross

6876.text: The shell on its back is made of soil. If the shell is moist to the touch, Turtwig is very healthy.
6876.name: turtwig

6877.text: Grotle live in the forest. Each is said to have its own secret place for getting clean springwater.
6877.name: grotle

6878.text: Ancient people imagined that beneath the ground dwelt a gigantic Torterra.
6878.name: torterra

6879.text: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.
6879.name: chimchar

6880.text: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.
6880.name: monferno

6881.text: This Pokmon confounds opponents with its speed. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.
6881.name: infernape

6882.text: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.
6882.name: piplup

6883.text: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees in half with a single hit.
6883.name: prinplup

6884.text: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them in two with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.
6884.name: empoleon

6885.text: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokmon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.
6885.name: starly

6886.text: Recognizing their own weakness, they always live in a group. When alone, a Staravia cries noisily.
6886.name: staravia

6887.text: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.
6887.name: staraptor

6888.text: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.
6888.name: kricketot

6889.text: By allowing its cry to resonate in the hollow of its belly, it produces a captivating sound.
6889.name: kricketune

6890.text: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.
6890.name: shinx

6891.text: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.
6891.name: luxio

6892.text: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.
6892.name: luxray

6893.text: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.
6893.name: cranidos

6894.text: Stifled by a thick skull that can withstand any impact, this Pokmons brain never got very big.
6894.name: rampardos

6895.text: It is outstandingly armored. As a result, it has no particular need to battle with others and can spend its time feeding on grass and berries.
6895.name: shieldon

6896.text: While it can guard against any sort of attack from the front, it is left without recourse when attacked from behind.
6896.name: bastiodon

6897.text: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a hundred, packed closely together in a lump.
6897.name: combee

6898.text: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.
6898.name: vespiquen

6899.text: Its one of the kinds of Pokmon with electric cheek pouches. It shoots charges from its tail.
6899.name: pachirisu

6900.text: It spins its two tails like a screw to propel itself through water. The tails also slice clinging seaweed.
6900.name: buizel

6901.text: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.
6901.name: floatzel

6902.text: It used to have a shell on its back long ago. This species is closely related to Pokmon like Shellder.
6902.name: shellos

6903.text: Its whole body is sticky with mucus. In the past, this form of Gastrodon was by far the more numerous one.
6903.name: gastrodon

6904.text: They live on large trees. They are said to communicate by connecting their tails to those of others.
6904.name: ambipom

6905.text: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.
6905.name: drifloon

6906.text: It can generate and release gas within its body. Thats how it can control the altitude of its drift.
6906.name: drifblim

6907.text: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.
6907.name: mismagius

6908.text: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.
6908.name: honchkrow

6909.text: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.
6909.name: chingling

6910.text: It sprays a foul fluid from its rear. Its stench spreads over a mile radius, driving Pokmon away.
6910.name: stunky

6911.text: It attacks by spraying a horribly smelly fluid from the tip of its tail. Attacks from above confound it.
6911.name: skuntank

6912.text: Ancient people believed that the pattern on Bronzors back contained a mysterious power.
6912.name: bronzor

6913.text: In ages past, this Pokmon was revered as a bringer of rain. It was found buried in the ground.
6913.name: bronzong

6914.text: In order to adjust the level of fluids in its body, it exudes water from its eyes. This makes it appear to be crying.
6914.name: bonsly

6915.text: It carries a round, white rock in its belly pouch. If it gets along well with someone, it will sometimes give that person the rock.
6915.name: happiny

6916.text: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.
6916.name: spiritomb

6917.text: It skulks in caves, and when prey or an enemy passes by, it leaps out and chomps them. The force of its attack sometimes chips its teeth.
6917.name: gible

6918.text: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
6918.name: gabite

6919.text: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.
6919.name: garchomp

6920.text: It needs to consume its own weight in food every day. As far as flavor is concerned, its indifferent.
6920.name: munchlax

6921.text: They communicate with one another using their auras. They are able to run all through the night.
6921.name: riolu

6922.text: Its said that no foe can remain invisible to Lucario, since it can detect auraseven those of foes it could not otherwise see.
6922.name: lucario

6923.text: It shuts its nostrils tight, then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around 10.
6923.name: hippopotas

6924.text: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.
6924.name: hippowdon

6925.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.
6925.name: croagunk

6926.text: Swaying and dodging the attacks of its foes, it weaves its flexible body in close, then lunges out with its poisonous claws.
6926.name: toxicroak

6927.text: The line running down its side can store sunlight. It shines vividly at night.
6927.name: finneon

6928.text: With its shining light, it lures its prey close. However, the light also happens to attract ferocious fish Pokmonits natural predators.
6928.name: lumineon

6929.text: During cold seasons, it migrates to the mountains lower reaches. It returns to the snow-covered summit in the spring.
6929.name: snover

6930.text: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.
6930.name: abomasnow

6931.text: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.
6931.name: weavile

6932.text: As it zooms through the sky, this Pokmon seems to be receiving signals of unknown origin while transmitting signals of unknown purpose.
6932.name: magnezone

6933.text: This Pokmons sturdy carapace protects it from volcanic eruptions. It shoots round rocks from the holes in its hands.
6933.name: rhyperior

6934.text: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
6934.name: electivire

6935.text: When shooting 3,600 degree Fahrenheit fireballs from its arms, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
6935.name: magmortar

6936.text: Yanmegas wingbeats are so powerful that the Pokmon blows down huge trees nearby when it vigorously launches itself into flight.
6936.name: yanmega

6937.text: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, youll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.
6937.name: leafeon

6938.text: If it succeeds in catching even a faint breeze properly, it can circle the globe without flapping once.
6938.name: gliscor

6939.text: A frozen Mamoswine was dug from ice dating back 10,000 years. This Pokmon has been around a long, long, long time.
6939.name: mamoswine

6940.text: An additional program was installed to create a more advanced Pokmon, but it was apparently flawed. Porygon-Z moves oddly as a result.
6940.name: porygonz

6941.text: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.
6941.name: gallade

6942.text: It controls three units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force. With them, it can attack a foe from three directions.
6942.name: probopass

6943.text: It is said to take lost spirits into its pliant body and take them to the afterlife.
6943.name: dusknoir

6944.text: When it finds humans or Pokmon it likes, it freezes them and takes them to its chilly den, where they become decorations.
6944.name: froslass

6945.text: Its electricity-like body can enter some kinds of machines and take control in order to make mischief.
6945.name: rotom

6946.text: The leaf on Snivys tail generates energy when exposed to sunlight, making Snivy swifter and adding an edge to its moves.
6946.name: snivy

6947.text: It runs low to the ground, weaving through the grass, then mercilessly pummels its target by whipping them with its vines.
6947.name: servine

6948.text: It generates energy from sunlight, then amplifies that energy dozens of times within its long body.
6948.name: serperior

6949.text: Its more nimble than it looks, and it uses its speed to confound its enemies. It rapidly launches fireballs from both nostrils.
6949.name: tepig

6950.text: When Pignite enters battle, its body temperature rapidly soars until Pignite itself is engulfed by a scorching fireball.
6950.name: pignite

6951.text: The flames blazing deep inside Emboars chest erupt vigorously from its chin, forming a beard of fire.
6951.name: emboar

6952.text: It wields the scalchop on its stomach like a knife, blocking the moves of its enemies before slashing back at them in swift retaliation.
6952.name: oshawott

6953.text: Its said that people modeled swordplay after the way Dewotts movements flow like water while its wielding its two scalchops.
6953.name: dewott

6954.text: A master of a sword-drawing art called iaijutsu, Samurott settles its battles with a single swing of either large sword sheathed in its foreleg armor.
6954.name: samurott

6955.text: Its heartbeat generates electricity. When Blitzle is surprised and its heart rate goes up, the voltage of its electricity also rises.
6955.name: blitzle

6956.text: This Pokmon is aggressive and has a volatile disposition. When agitated, it will illuminate its mane in yellow and fire off bolts of electricity.
6956.name: zebstrika

6957.text: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
6957.name: drilbur

6958.text: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.
6958.name: excadrill

6959.text: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.
6959.name: timburr

6960.text: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.
6960.name: gurdurr

6961.text: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
6961.name: conkeldurr

6962.text: Sewaddle chews on leaves to make its clothing. Its trying to mimic the leafy garment Leavanny first dressed it in.
6962.name: sewaddle

6963.text: Swadloon lives quietly at the feet of trees. It prefers eating fallen leaves that have grown soft rather than fresh ones.
6963.name: swadloon

6964.text: This gentle Pokmon has strong protective instincts. The leaves on its arms are sharp enough to slice a thick tree in half with one stroke.
6964.name: leavanny

6965.text: Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled by Cottonee are soft and puffy, light and airy altogether top quality.
6965.name: cottonee

6966.text: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.
6966.name: whimsicott

6967.text: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
6967.name: petilil

6968.text: The fragrance of the garland on its head has a relaxing effect, but taking care of it is very difficult.
6968.name: lilligant

6969.text: Its temperament is vicious and aggressive. This Pokmon is also full of vitality and can multiply rapidly before anyone notices.
6969.name: basculin

6970.text: It submerges itself in sand and moves as if swimming. This wise behavior keeps its enemies from finding it and maintains its temperature.
6970.name: sandile

6971.text: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
6971.name: krokorok

6972.text: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
6972.name: krookodile

6973.text: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. Among Scraggy, individuals with saggier skin apparently garner more respect.
6973.name: scraggy

6974.text: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.
6974.name: scrafty

6975.text: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
6975.name: zorua

6976.text: Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.
6976.name: zoroark

6977.text: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean springwater.
6977.name: minccino

6978.text: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.
6978.name: cinccino

6979.text: This Pokmon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.
6979.name: gothita

6980.text: This Pokmon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.
6980.name: gothorita

6981.text: Gothitelle unleashes psychic energy and shows opponents dreams of the universes end. These dreams are apparently ethereal and beautiful.
6981.name: gothitelle

6982.text: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they can survive in any environment.
6982.name: solosis

6983.text: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
6983.name: duosion

6984.text: Their arms are made of a special liquid. They use psychic power to control these arms and crush boulders.
6984.name: reuniclus

6985.text: Its not very good at flying yet. It watches the dances of its Swanna parents to learn how to move its wings.
6985.name: ducklett

6986.text: Centered around its leader, the flock dances in perfect sync to strengthen its unity.
6986.name: swanna

6987.text: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In early spring, these Pokmon give off a delicate, sweet, and calming scent.
6987.name: deerling

6988.text: It seems that a Sawsbuck with many flowers on its antlers will grow at a slightly slower pace because the flowers absorb the Pokmons nutrients.
6988.name: sawsbuck

6989.text: There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Pok Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.
6989.name: foongus

6990.text: Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoongusss caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.
6990.name: amoonguss

6991.text: It gently holds injured and weak Pokmon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
6991.name: alomomola

6992.text: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
6992.name: joltik

6993.text: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
6993.name: galvantula

6994.text: While one alone doesnt have much power, a chain of many Tynamo can be as powerful as lightning.
6994.name: tynamo

6995.text: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
6995.name: eelektrik

6996.text: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
6996.name: eelektross

6997.text: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when Litwick absorbs life-force from people or Pokmon.
6997.name: litwick

6998.text: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
6998.name: chandelure

6999.text: This Pokmon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.
6999.name: axew

7000.text: Because its tusks dont grow back once they break, this Pokmon apparently wont use them unless truly necessary.
7000.name: fraxure

7001.text: This Pokmon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.
7001.name: haxorus

7002.text: Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, theres a chance it is sick.
7002.name: cubchoo

7003.text: It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokmon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.
7003.name: beartic

7004.text: Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokmon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokmon.
7004.name: cryogonal

7005.text: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.
7005.name: mienfoo

7006.text: When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, youre in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!
7006.name: mienshao

7007.text: These Pokmon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization.
7007.name: golett

7008.text: When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately. During such rampages, it can turn a whole town into a mountain of rubble.
7008.name: golurk

7009.text: Pawniard will fearlessly challenge even powerful foes. In a pinch, it will cling to opponents and pierce them with the blades all over its body.
7009.name: pawniard

7010.text: This Pokmon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.
7010.name: bisharp

7011.text: They pick fights indiscriminately. They grow stronger and more powerful each time they faint or are injured.
7011.name: rufflet

7012.text: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
7012.name: braviary

7013.text: They tend to guard their posteriors with suitable bones they have found. They pursue weak Pokmon.
7013.name: vullaby

7014.text: Its always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokmon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.
7014.name: mandibuzz

7015.text: It cant see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.
7015.name: deino

7016.text: The two heads do not get along at all. If you dont give each head the same amount of attention, theyll begin fighting out of jealousy.
7016.name: zweilous

7017.text: Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.
7017.name: hydreigon

7018.text: This Pokmon was called the Larva That Stole the Sun. The fire Larvesta spouts from its horns can cut right through a sheet of iron.
7018.name: larvesta

7019.text: Its burning body causes it to be unpopular in hot parts of the world, but in cold ones, Volcarona is revered as an embodiment of the sun.
7019.name: volcarona

7020.text: When Chespin tenses up just before landing a headbutt, the spikes on its head sharpen to points, piercing the enemys body on contact.
7020.name: chespin

7021.text: Its protected by a sturdy shell. The shell is also very heavy, which naturally strengthens Quilladins lower body.
7021.name: quilladin

7022.text: When its allies are in trouble, Chesnaught creates a shield with its arms and uses its own body to block attacks.
7022.name: chesnaught

7023.text: This Pokmon gets worked up easily. Its body can also overheat, so it uses its ears to dissipate the heat and calm down.
7023.name: fennekin

7024.text: It ignites the twig from its tail and waves the twig around to signal its allies. To indicate danger, it draws circles in the air with the twigs flame.
7024.name: braixen

7025.text: It leaves burn marks in the ground with the flame at the tip of its wand. Long ago, people used the shapes of these burn marks for divination.
7025.name: delphox

7026.text: Its happy-go-lucky look is an act intended to fool its enemies. It will suddenly drop the facade and overwhelm its foes with its blinding speed.
7026.name: froakie

7027.text: It excels at devising battle strategies that make use of the terrain, and it never misses its mark when throwing bubble-covered pebbles.
7027.name: frogadier

7028.text: The movement of air against the long tongue Greninja keeps wrapped around its neck allows it to sense enemies it cant see.
7028.name: greninja

7029.text: This Pokmon is normally calm, but once it enters battle, its hormonal balance changes and it becomes aggressive.
7029.name: fletchling

7030.text: Fletchinder scatters embers in tall grass where bug Pokmon might be hiding and then catches them as they come leaping out.
7030.name: fletchinder

7031.text: It has top-notch flying capabilities. It flies around easily, even while carrying prey that weighs more than 220 lbs.
7031.name: talonflame

7032.text: Any poison this Pokmon takes in is converted into a black powder and secreted. Thats why Scatterbug can eat poisonous leaves and roots.
7032.name: scatterbug

7033.text: If Rufflet attacks this Pokmon by pecking at it, it will retaliate with its sharp fur and poisonous black powder.
7033.name: spewpa

7034.text: When Litleo are young, female Pyroar will teach them how to hunt. Once the Litleo mature, they will leave the pride and set out on their own.
7034.name: litleo

7035.text: The females of a pride work together to bring down prey. Its thanks to them that their pride doesnt starve.
7035.name: pyroar

7036.text: This Pokmon draws forth what power is left in withered flowers to make them healthy again. It holds a red flower.
7036.name: floette

7037.text: This Pokmon creates an impressive flower garden in its territory. It draws forth the power of the red flowers around its neck.
7037.name: florges

7038.text: Until recently, people living in the mountains would ride on the backs of these Pokmon to traverse the mountain paths.
7038.name: skiddo

7039.text: It can sense the feelings of others by touching them with its horns. This species has assisted people with their work since 5,000 years ago.
7039.name: gogoat

7040.text: It keeps its ears covered to prevent the intense psychic power in its body from escaping, but it falls unconscious if this power builds too much.
7040.name: espurr

7041.text: Though it has enough psychic power to blast away any opponent, Meowstic prefers to support its allies rather than attack.
7041.name: meowstic

7042.text: It protects itself from tough foes by flashing its luminescent spots to discourage them.
7042.name: inkay

7043.text: Its hypnotic powers are dangerously strong. Anyone who falls under Malamars control loses their memories surrounding the event.
7043.name: malamar

7044.text: Skrelp evades its enemies by hiding amid drifting seaweed. It eats rotten seaweed to create its poison.
7044.name: skrelp

7045.text: Using a liquid poison, Dragalge indiscriminately attacks anything that wanders into its territory. This poison can corrode the undersides of boats.
7045.name: dragalge

7046.text: This Pokmon launches water by detonating gas inside its right claw. It snipes flying Pokmon.
7046.name: clauncher

7047.text: Clawitzer can move through the water at a speed of 60 knots by using gas inside its body to expel water from the back of its claw.
7047.name: clawitzer

7048.text: This Pokmon uses its ribbonlike feelers to send a soothing aura into its opponents, erasing their hostility.
7048.name: sylveon

7049.text: Its elegant finishing movesperformed by nimbly leaping around using its wingsare polished in the forest where it was born and raised.
7049.name: hawlucha

7050.text: Its small and its electricity-generating organ is not fully developed, so it uses its tail to absorb electricity from peoples homes and charge itself.
7050.name: dedenne

7051.text: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. Its occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
7051.name: carbink

7052.text: Most of a Goomys body is water. A membrane covers the whole Pokmon to prevent it from shriveling up in dry weather.
7052.name: goomy

7053.text: The swirly protrusion on its back is filled with all its vital organs, such as its brain and heart.
7053.name: sliggoo

7054.text: It loves the rain. This mellow Pokmon can be seen walking around on the plains and in the mountains on rainy days.
7054.name: goodra

7055.text: Once it absorbs a keys metal ions, it discards the key without a second thought. However, it will hang on to keys it favors for decades.
7055.name: klefki

7056.text: Legend tells that its green leaves can cure any illness. When plucked, however, the leaves will instantly wither away.
7056.name: phantump

7057.text: Using its roots, Trevenant connects itself to trees and monitors every corner of its forest. It uses curses to drive intruders away.
7057.name: trevenant

7058.text: They live in mountainous regions of frigid cold. On rare occasions, they ride on the back of an Avalugg to cross seas and move to new habitats.
7058.name: bergmite

7059.text: As Avalugg walks along with Bergmite on its back, it comes across pods of Cetitan. It lets them pass to avoid conflict.
7059.name: avalugg

7060.text: This Pokmon emits ultrasonic waves from its large ears to search for fruit to eat. It mistakes Applin for its food.
7060.name: noibat

7061.text: Ultrasonic waves emitted by a Noivern can pulverize a large boulder. This Pokmon has a cruel disposition.
7061.name: noivern

7062.text: Silently it glides, streaking toward its targets to get close to them. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.
7062.name: rowlet

7063.text: This narcissistic Pokmon is a clean freak. If you dont groom it diligently, it may stop listening to you.
7063.name: dartrix

7064.text: It cunningly conceals arrow quills in its wings. It launches these quills with such precision that they can pierce a pebble at over a hundred yards.
7064.name: decidueye

7065.text: If you try too hard to get close to it, it wont open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.
7065.name: litten

7066.text: At its throat, it bears a bell of fire. The bell rings brightly whenever fire spews out.
7066.name: torracat

7067.text: When its fighting spirit is set alight, the flames around its waist become especially intense.
7067.name: incineroar

7068.text: This Pokmon can control balloons made of water. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big balloons.
7068.name: popplio

7069.text: A skillful dancer, it creates a sequence of water balloons as it dances, then briskly bombards its enemies.
7069.name: brionne

7070.text: To Primarina, every battle is a stage. It takes down its prey with beautiful singing and dancing.
7070.name: primarina

7071.text: Using its beak to strike 16 times per second, it opens holes in even the hardest of trees.
7071.name: pikipek

7072.text: It flies around using a hundred different cries in various ways to declare its territory to others.
7072.name: trumbeak

7073.text: The compressed gas in Toucannons beak launches seeds with such force that they can shatter large boulders.
7073.name: toucannon

7074.text: Its stomach fills most of its torso. It wanders the same path every day, searching for fresh food.
7074.name: yungoos

7075.text: Once it finds signs of prey, it will patiently stake out the location, waiting until the sun goes down.
7075.name: gumshoos

7076.text: Grubbin normally live underground, but if they get unearthed by Hoothoot, they may be found gathered around electric Pokmon.
7076.name: grubbin

7077.text: Protected by a sturdy shell, Charjabug eats large quantities of fresh and decomposing leaf litter in order to evolve.
7077.name: charjabug

7078.text: Displaying exceptional mobility, it weaves between trees and shoots down bird Pokmon with its electromagnetic beams.
7078.name: vikavolt

7079.text: This Pokmon punches trees and eats the berries that drop down, training itself and getting food at the same time.
7079.name: crabrawler

7080.text: The detached pincers of these Pokmon are delicious. Some Trainers bring Lechonk into the mountains just to search for them.
7080.name: crabominable

7081.text: This Pokmon is incredibly popular, possibly because its passionate dancing is a great match with the temperament of Paldean people.
7081.name: oricorio

7082.text: When it senses the auras of people or Pokmon who are having fun, it will draw close and give them a painful poke with its long proboscis.
7082.name: cutiefly

7083.text: Ribombee can sense when people or Pokmon are feeling down, and it will cheer them up with handmade pollen puffs.
7083.name: ribombee

7084.text: This Pokmon is very friendly when its young. Its disposition becomes vicious once it matures, but it never forgets the kindness of its master.
7084.name: rockruff

7085.text: Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.
7085.name: lycanroc

7086.text: This Pokmon wanders the seaside looking for food. It often gets electric shocks from broken Pincurchin spines that it tries to eat.
7086.name: mareanie

7087.text: This Pokmon lives within a dome made by its own legs. Toxapex monitors its surroundings by sensing the flow of the tide through its spikes.
7087.name: toxapex

7088.text: This Pokmon covers itself in mud that it has regurgitated. The mud wont dry out even if its exposed to the sun for a long time.
7088.name: mudbray

7089.text: This Pokmon has been treasured not just for its physical labor but also because it produces high-quality mud used for making pottery.
7089.name: mudsdale

7090.text: Dewpider uses sticky threads to create the water bubble that covers its head, so the bubble very rarely bursts.
7090.name: dewpider

7091.text: A caring Pokmon, Araquanid carries Dewpider around inside its water bubble to protect them as it walks. It protects its food in its bubble too.
7091.name: araquanid

7092.text: Fomantis hates having its naps interrupted. It fires off beams using energy it gathers by bathing in the sun.
7092.name: fomantis

7093.text: By masquerading as a bug Pokmon, it lowers the guard of actual bug Pokmon lured in by a scent of sweet flowers. Its sickles bring them down.
7093.name: lurantis

7094.text: It taunts its prey and lures them into narrow, rocky areas where it then sprays them with toxic gas to make them dizzy and take them down.
7094.name: salandit

7095.text: Salazzle makes its opponents light-headed with poisonous gas, then captivates them with alluring movements to turn them into loyal servants.
7095.name: salazzle

7096.text: Its sweat is sweet, like syrup made from boiled- down fruit. Because of this, Bounsweet was highly valued in the past, when sweeteners were scarce.
7096.name: bounsweet

7097.text: Steenee spreads a sweet scent that makes others feel invigorated. This same scent is popular for antiperspirants.
7097.name: steenee

7098.text: This Pokmon is proud and aggressive. However, it is said that a Tsareena will instantly become calm if someone touches the crown on its calyx.
7098.name: tsareena

7099.text: It uses its vine to pick flowers. The flowers that Comfey attaches to itself develop healing properties.
7099.name: comfey

7100.text: People used to mistake Oranguru for a human when they saw it issue command after command to the other Pokmon of the forest.
7100.name: oranguru

7101.text: This Pokmon battles by throwing hard berries. It wont obey a Trainer who throws Pok Balls without skill.
7101.name: passimian

7102.text: If it loses its shovel, it will stick something else like a branchin its head to make do until it finds another shovel.
7102.name: sandygast

7103.text: The terrifying Palossand drags smaller Pokmon into its sandy body. Once its victims are trapped, it drains them of their vitality whenever it pleases.
7103.name: palossand

7104.text: This Pokmon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
7104.name: minior

7105.text: Komala spends its entire life sleeping. It feeds on leaves that contain a potent poison only Komala can break down.
7105.name: komala

7106.text: This Pokmon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.
7106.name: mimikyu

7107.text: It grinds its teeth with great force to stimulate its brain. It fires the psychic energy created by this process from the protuberance on its head.
7107.name: bruxish

7108.text: The scale atop its head is useful for both offense and defense. It bravely stands and faces its foes rather than turning tail, even if its foes are strong.
7108.name: jangmoo

7109.text: It gets into fistfights so intense that the scales on its arms peel off. Bare arms are a sign of valiance.
7109.name: hakamoo

7110.text: It lets its arm hang, and thenquick as a flash swings upward to land its specialty punch and send the opponent flying high into the sky.
7110.name: kommoo

7111.text: The stick Grookey holds has grown harder and more flexible after soaking in the energy that emanates from inside Grookeys body.
7111.name: grookey

7112.text: It skillfully uses its two sticks not only for drumming out rapid beats but also for pummeling opponents during battle.
7112.name: thwackey

7113.text: Though it has a calm disposition, it wont tolerate those who drum up discord. It strictly disciplines offenders until they learn their lesson.
7113.name: rillaboom

7114.text: Once its body has heated up, Scorbunny can use the full extent of its power. Thats why it does warm-up exercises.
7114.name: scorbunny

7115.text: Thanks to its soft and fluffy fur, Raboot can easily heat up its fire energy and produce flames with more power.
7115.name: raboot

7116.text: Although Cinderace loses its cool easily, it will battle flawlessly for a Trainer it trusts.
7116.name: cinderace

7117.text: It gets berries to eat by shooting them down with bullets of water it spurts from its mouth. Its aim is perfect.
7117.name: sobble

7118.text: It extends its long, slimy tongue at blinding speeds and finishes off its prey with great skill.
7118.name: drizzile

7119.text: It uses special lenses in its eyes to sense things about its opponentslike their body heatthen attacks once it identifies a weak spot.
7119.name: inteleon

7120.text: It stores berries in its cheeks. When there are no berries to be found, Skwovet will stuff pebbles into its cheeks to stave off its cravings.
7120.name: skwovet

7121.text: If it spots a berry tree, it will immediately go to gather berries without a sideways glanceeven if its in the middle of a battle.
7121.name: greedent

7122.text: This Pokmon is brave and reckless. The white markings around a Rookidees eyes intimidate fainthearted Pokmon.
7122.name: rookidee

7123.text: Its said that the reason behind Corvisquires high level of intelligence is the large size of its brain relative to those of other bird Pokmon.
7123.name: corvisquire

7124.text: Corviknight cant serve as a taxi service in Paldea because the Pokmons natural predators will attack it while it flies, endangering the customer.
7124.name: corviknight

7125.text: Its large front tooth is still growing in. When the tooth itches, this Pokmon will bite another Chewtles horn, and the two Pokmon will tussle.
7125.name: chewtle

7126.text: Its massive, jagged teeth can crush a boulder in a single bite. This Pokmon has an extremely vicious disposition.
7126.name: drednaw

7127.text: On sunny days, Rolycoly will come out onto grassy plains and roll around. Then it will eat the grass that gets tangled in its wheel-like leg.
7127.name: rolycoly

7128.text: The temperature inside its body increases when it experiences strong emotions. It rolls around frantically while spewing flames.
7128.name: carkol

7129.text: To intimidate its opponents, Coalossal will vigorously shake its body, scattering coal from its smoldering back.
7129.name: coalossal

7130.text: It grows by eating the flesh of an apple. Applin uses its own body fluid to strengthen the apples skin and prevent it from rotting.
7130.name: applin

7131.text: It flutters around while seeking an opening in the opponents guard, then attacks by spitting acidic liquid strong enough to melt metal.
7131.name: flapple

7132.text: It feeds mainly on sweet apples. It will also eat small bug Pokmon that are attracted by its sweet nectar.
7132.name: appletun

7133.text: Silicobras neck pouch, which can inflate and deflate like a balloon, gets more elastic each time Silicobra sheds its skin.
7133.name: silicobra

7134.text: It will expand its body as much as it can and then contract itself, blasting out sand with enough force to wash away a dump truck.
7134.name: sandaconda

7135.text: Cramorant instinctively swallow everything whole. Theyre at their most formidable when theyre struggling to swallow overly large prey.
7135.name: cramorant

7136.text: Arrokuda can swim quickly only in a straight line. The ones that become sluggish from overeating are the first to be targeted by flocks of Wattrel.
7136.name: arrokuda

7137.text: It spins its tail fins to leap from the water, then viciously bites down on Wingull flying close to the waters surface.
7137.name: barraskewda

7138.text: It has no problem drinking dirty water. An organ inside Toxels body filters such water into a poisonous liquid that is harmless to Toxel.
7138.name: toxel

7139.text: As it scatters toxic sweat and emits electricity, a melody that sounds like it came from a guitar reverberates through the surrounding area.
7139.name: toxtricity

7140.text: The soul of someone who died alone possessed some leftover tea. This Pokmon appears in hotels and houses.
7140.name: sinistea

7141.text: The tea that composes Polteageists body has a distinct and enjoyable flavor. Drinking too much, however, can be fatal.
7141.name: polteageist

7142.text: Because the emotions of others constantly flow into its head, this Pokmon prefers environments where no other creatures live.
7142.name: hatenna

7143.text: To this Pokmon, strong emotions apparently feel like incredibly loud noiseseven if the emotions are happy ones.
7143.name: hattrem

7144.text: Hatterene knocks out those that intrude in its home forest by blasting them with a beam, then slashing with claws enhanced by psychic power.
7144.name: hatterene

7145.text: The reason this Pokmon causes trouble for those it feels close to is because Impidimp itself gets irritable if it cant absorb negative emotions.
7145.name: impidimp

7146.text: Morgrem prefers dirty tactics, like ambushing, because it doesnt have confidence in its brawn.
7146.name: morgrem

7147.text: This Pokmon has complete control over its hair. Grimmsnarl normally keeps its hair wrapped around its body to support its muscles.
7147.name: grimmsnarl

7148.text: The more sweet aromas it absorbs, the more its body swells. Milcery will deflate when its energy level drops.
7148.name: milcery

7149.text: Desserts that Alcremie have decorated with their cream have a rich, sweet flavor and bring happiness to all who eat them.
7149.name: alcremie

7150.text: The brass, which is the one that stands at the front and issues orders, is the strongest and smartest of the six.
7150.name: falinks

7151.text: This Pokmon generates electricity when it digests food. It uses its five hard teeth to scrape seaweed off surfaces and eat it.
7151.name: pincurchin

7152.text: It eats snow that has accumulated on the ground. It prefers soft, freshly fallen snow, so it will eat its way up a mountain, aiming for the peak.
7152.name: snom

7153.text: Frosmoth senses air currents with its antennae. It sends its scales drifting on frigid air, making them fall like snow.
7153.name: frosmoth

7154.text: The elemental composition of the rocks that form its body were found to match the bedrock of a land far away from this Pokmons habitat.
7154.name: stonjourner

7155.text: On hot days, these Pokmon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.
7155.name: eiscue

7156.text: This Pokmon picks up on the positive emotions of other creatures via its horns and uses those emotions to fuel itself.
7156.name: indeedee

7157.text: Morpeko eats seeds constantly to keep its hunger at bay. If its hungry for too long, it grows wild and brutish.
7157.name: morpeko

7158.text: Using the pointy tip of its trunk, it carves off chunks of hard rocks to eat. It is very docile and helps people with physical labor.
7158.name: cufant

7159.text: This Pokmon was brought to Paldea long ago by people from a faraway land. Its so strong that it can easily pull an airplane.
7159.name: copperajah

7160.text: Duraludons body is comprised of a special metal thats lightweight and scratch resistant. Its also smooth, as though it was given a mirror finish.
7160.name: duraludon

7161.text: In the evening, groups of Dreepy will fly at high speeds over the ocean and poke at Pokmon in the water for fun.
7161.name: dreepy

7162.text: This Pokmon flies around at over 120 miles per hour. If a Drakloak is defeated in a battle, its Dreepy will wander off without a second thought.
7162.name: drakloak

7163.text: Dragapult can make its whole body transparent by clearing its mind and focusing. Even the Dreepy in Dragapults horns become invisible.
7163.name: dragapult

7164.text: Parts of its body turned to stone when it evolved thanks to an extremely rare ore found in volcanic areas.
7164.name: kleavor

7165.text: This Pokmon is cloaked in the souls of its comrades who perished during a punishing journey to the river of their birth.
7165.name: basculegion

7166.text: Overqwils poisonous spikes will reflexively react even while Overqwil sleeps, stabbing any moving thing that approaches.
7166.name: overqwil

7167.text: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokmon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
7167.name: sprigatito

7168.text: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
7168.name: floragato

7169.text: This Pokmon uses the reflective fur lining its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
7169.name: meowscarada

7170.text: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
7170.name: fuecoco

7171.text: The combination of Crocalors fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokmons head.
7171.name: crocalor

7172.text: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirges head gained a soul.
7172.name: skeledirge

7173.text: This Pokmon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime."
7173.name: quaxly

7174.text: These Pokmon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
7174.name: quaxwell

7175.text: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokmon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
7175.name: quaquaval

7176.text: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesnt use it for anything other than foraging.
7176.name: lechonk

7177.text: Oinkologne is proud of its fine, glossy skin. It emits a concentrated scent from the tip of its tail.
7177.name: oinkologne

7178.text: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokmons natural enemy.
7178.name: tarountula

7179.text: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
7179.name: spidops

7180.text: It has its third set of legs folded up. When its in a tough spot, this Pokmon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
7180.name: nymble

7181.text: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
7181.name: lokix

7182.text: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
7182.name: pawmi

7183.text: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
7183.name: pawmo

7184.text: This Pokmon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
7184.name: pawmot

7185.text: Exhibiting great teamwork, they use their incisors to cut pieces out of any material that might be useful for a nest, then make off with them.
7185.name: tandemaus

7186.text: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokmon, but nobody knows for sure.
7186.name: maushold

7187.text: This Pokmon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidoughs breath induces fermentation in the Pokmons vicinity.
7187.name: fidough

7188.text: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokmons body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
7188.name: dachsbun

7189.text: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
7189.name: smoliv

7190.text: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
7190.name: dolliv

7191.text: This calm Pokmon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokmon.
7191.name: arboliva

7192.text: These Pokmon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
7192.name: squawkabilly

7193.text: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
7193.name: nacli

7194.text: This Pokmon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the preys body.
7194.name: naclstack

7195.text: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokmon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
7195.name: garganacl

7196.text: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokmon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
7196.name: charcadet

7197.text: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokmon is incredibly loyal.
7197.name: armarouge

7198.text: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
7198.name: ceruledge

7199.text: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
7199.name: tadbulb

7200.text: When this Pokmon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
7200.name: bellibolt

7201.text: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokmon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
7201.name: wattrel

7202.text: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokmon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
7202.name: kilowattrel

7203.text: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiffs face.
7203.name: maschiff

7204.text: This Pokmon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
7204.name: mabosstiff

7205.text: Though usually a mellow Pokmon, it will sink its sharp, poison-soaked front teeth into any that anger it, causing paralysis in the object of its ire.
7205.name: shroodle

7206.text: The color of the poisonous saliva depends on what the Pokmon eats. Grafaiai covers its fingers in its saliva and draws patterns on trees in forests.
7206.name: grafaiai

7207.text: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokmon.
7207.name: bramblin

7208.text: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
7208.name: brambleghast

7209.text: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
7209.name: toedscool

7210.text: These Pokmon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
7210.name: toedscruel

7211.text: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf cant remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
7211.name: klawf

7212.text: The more sunlight this Pokmon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
7212.name: capsakid

7213.text: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
7213.name: scovillain

7214.text: This Pokmon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
7214.name: rellor

7215.text: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokmon is actually inside the ball.
7215.name: rabsca

7216.text: Flittles toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokmons belly.
7216.name: flittle

7217.text: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
7217.name: espathra

7218.text: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokmon that eat metal.
7218.name: tinkatink

7219.text: This Pokmon will attack groups of Pawniard and Bisharp, gathering metal from them in order to create a large and sturdy hammer.
7219.name: tinkatuff

7220.text: This intelligent Pokmon has a very daring disposition. It knocks rocks into the sky with its hammer, aiming for flying Corviknight.
7220.name: tinkaton

7221.text: This Pokmon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
7221.name: wiglett

7222.text: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
7222.name: wugtrio

7223.text: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokmons chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
7223.name: bombirdier

7224.text: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
7224.name: finizen

7225.text: This Pokmon changes its appearance if it hears its allies calling for help. Palafin will never show anybody its moment of transformation.
7225.name: palafin

7226.text: It is said that this Pokmon was born when an unknown poison Pokmon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
7226.name: varoom

7227.text: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylindersnow numbering eightto generate energy.
7227.name: revavroom

7228.text: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
7228.name: cyclizar

7229.text: When attacked, this Pokmon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
7229.name: orthworm

7230.text: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
7230.name: glimmet

7231.text: When this Pokmon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
7231.name: glimmora

7232.text: It is said that a dog Pokmon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokmon.
7232.name: greavard

7233.text: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokmon, this one is most loyal to its master.
7233.name: houndstone

7234.text: This Pokmon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
7234.name: flamigo

7235.text: This species left the ocean and began living on land a very long time ago. It seems to be closely related to Wailmer.
7235.name: cetoddle

7236.text: This Pokmon wanders around snowy, icy areas. It protects its body with powerful muscles and a thick layer of fat under its skin.
7236.name: cetitan

7237.text: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
7237.name: veluza

7238.text: This Pokmon is a glutton, but its bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
7238.name: dondozo

7239.text: This is a small dragon Pokmon. It lives inside the mouth of Dondozo to protect itself from enemies on the outside.
7239.name: tatsugiri

7240.text: When its anger rose beyond a critical point, this Pokmon gained power that is unfettered by the limits of its physical body.
7240.name: annihilape

7241.text: When attacked, this Pokmon will retaliate by sticking thick spines out from its body. Its a risky move that puts everything on the line.
7241.name: clodsire

7242.text: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokmon is 10 times stronger than Girafarigs.
7242.name: farigiraf

7243.text: This Pokmon uses its hard tail to make its nest by boring holes into bedrock deep underground. The nest can reach lengths of over six miles.
7243.name: dudunsparce

7244.text: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
7244.name: kingambit

7245.text: Sightings of this Pokmon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
7245.name: greattusk

7246.text: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokmon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
7246.name: screamtail

7247.text: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokmon.
7247.name: brutebonnet

7248.text: This Pokmon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
7248.name: fluttermane

7249.text: This mysterious Pokmon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
7249.name: slitherwing

7250.text: No records exist of this Pokmon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokmons traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
7250.name: sandyshocks

7251.text: This Pokmon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
7251.name: irontreads

7252.text: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
7252.name: ironbundle

7253.text: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
7253.name: ironhands

7254.text: It resembles a certain Pokmon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
7254.name: ironjugulis

7255.text: This Pokmon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
7255.name: ironmoth

7256.text: It has some similarities to a Pokmon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
7256.name: ironthorns

7257.text: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
7257.name: frigibax

7258.text: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
7258.name: arctibax

7259.text: This Pokmon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
7259.name: baxcalibur

7260.text: This Pokmon was born inside a treasure chest about 1,500 years ago. It sucks the life-force out of scoundrels who try to steal the treasure.
7260.name: gimmighoul

7261.text: Its body seems to be made up of 1,000 coins. This Pokmon gets along well with others and is quick to make friends with anybody.
7261.name: gholdengo

7262.text: The grudge of a person punished for writing the kings evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokmon.
7262.name: wochien

7263.text: This Pokmon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
7263.name: chienpao

7264.text: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokmon.
7264.name: tinglu

7265.text: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
7265.name: chiyu

7266.text: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
7266.name: roaringmoon

7267.text: It has some similarities to a mad scientists invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
7267.name: ironvaliant

7268.text: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.
7268.name: koraidon

7269.text: Much remains unknown about this creature. It resembles Cyclizar, but it is far more ruthless and powerful.
7269.name: miraidon

7270.text: This ferocious creature is shrouded in mystery. It's named after an aquatic monster mentioned in an old expedition journal.
7270.name: walkingwake

7271.text: Many of its physical characteristics match those of a Virizion from the future that was covered in a paranormal magazine.
7271.name: ironleaves

7272.text: Dipplin is two creatures in one Pokmon. Its evolution was triggered by a special apple grown only in one place.
7272.name: dipplin

7273.text: Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokmon.
7273.name: poltchageist

7274.text: It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.
7274.name: sinistcha

7275.text: After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.
7275.name: okidogi

7276.text: The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokmon's psychic powers to bloom.
7276.name: munkidori

7277.text: Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.
7277.name: fezandipiti

7278.text: This Pokmon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.
7278.name: ogerpon

7279.text: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.
7279.name: archaludon

7280.text: Seven syrpents live inside an apple made of syrup. The syrpent in the center is the commander.
7280.name: hydrapple

7281.text: There are scant few reports of this creature being sighted. One short video shows it rampaging and spouting pillars of flame.
7281.name: gougingfire

7282.text: It's said to incinerate everything around it with lightning launched from its fur. Very little is known about this creature.
7282.name: ragingbolt

7283.text: It resembles a Pokmon described in a dubious magazine as a Terrakion that had been modified by an evil organization.
7283.name: ironboulder

7284.text: It resembles a mysterious object introduced in a paranormal magazine as a cutting-edge weapon shaped like a Cobalion.
7284.name: ironcrown

7285.text: Terapagos protects itself using its power to transform energy into hard crystals. This Pokmon is the source of the Terastal phenomenon.
7285.name: terapagos

7286.text: It feeds others toxic mochi that draw out desires and capabilities. Those who eat the mochi fall under Pecharunts control, chained to its will.
7286.name: pecharunt

7287.text: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokmon and its partner traveling across lots of different regions together.
7287.name: pikachuoriginal

7288.text: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokmon and its partner traveling across the Hoenn region together.
7288.name: pikachuhoenn

7289.text: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokmon and its partner traveling across the Sinnoh region together.
7289.name: pikachusinnoh

7290.text: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokmon and its partner traveling across the Unova region together.
7290.name: pikachuunova

7291.text: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokmon and its partner traveling across the Kalos region together.
7291.name: pikachukalos

7292.text: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokmon and its partner traveling across the Alola region together.
7292.name: pikachualola

7293.text: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokmon traveling together with its partner, whom it met in a fateful encounter.
7293.name: pikachupartner

7294.text: The cap this Pikachu wears is filled with memories of this Pokmon and its partner traveling across the world together.
7294.name: pikachuworld

7295.text: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hardso much so, it cant roll its body up into a ball.
7295.name: sandshrewalola

7296.text: This Pokmons steel spikes are sheathed in ice. Stabs from these spikes cause deep wounds and severe frostbite as well.
7296.name: sandslashalola

7297.text: They live together in a skulk, helping one another. Before eating their prey, they freeze it solid with their ?58 degree Fahrenheit breath.
7297.name: vulpixalola

7298.text: Possessing a calm demeanor, this Pokmon was revered as a deity incarnate before it was identified as a regional variant of Ninetales.
7298.name: ninetalesalola

7299.text: The things growing from its head are whiskers that have become metallic. Diglett communicates with its comrades by waving them.
7299.name: diglettalola

7300.text: Its shining gold whiskers are advanced sensors that can detect vibrations from sounds several miles away.
7300.name: dugtrioalola

7301.text: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.
7301.name: geodudealola

7302.text: They eat rocks and often get into a scrap over them. The impact of Graveler smashing together causes a flash of light and a booming noise.
7302.name: graveleralola

7303.text: Its grumpy and stubborn. If you upset it, it discharges electricity from the surface of its body and growls with a voice like thunder.
7303.name: golemalola

7304.text: It gives off a stimulating scent because of chemicals that have seeped into its body from the spice that it eats as its staple food.
7304.name: slowpokegalar

7305.text: Shellder seems blissful over the taste of Slowbro even though the toxins seeping from the bite have caused Shellder to faint.
7305.name: slowbrogalar

7306.text: They store their toxins inside their bodies, so unlike Grimer from other regions, they dont smell bad even up close.
7306.name: grimeralola

7307.text: There are over a hundred kinds of poison inside its body. Chemical reactions between different poisons are the source of its vitality.
7307.name: mukalola

7308.text: It swings its long neck like a whip and smacks its head into opponents. This makes Exeggutor itself a little dizzy too.
7308.name: exeggutoralola

7309.text: This Pokmon has a muscular body and excels at close-quarters combat. It uses its short horns to strike the opponents weak spots.
7309.name: taurospaldeacombat

7310.text: When heated by fire energy, its horns can get hotter than 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. Those gored by them will suffer both wounds and burns.
7310.name: taurospaldeablaze

7311.text: This Pokmon blasts water from holes on the tips of its hornsthe high-pressure jets pierce right through Tauross enemies.
7311.name: taurospaldeaaqua

7312.text: After losing a territorial struggle, Wooper began living on land. The Pokmon changed over time, developing a poisonous film to protect its body.
7312.name: wooperpaldea

7313.text: It administers its potions to weakened Pokmon it sees. These potions are derived from poison and secreted from holes in Slowkings horns.
7313.name: slowkinggalar

7314.text: It lives just offshore in cold parts of the world. Its poisonous spikes are thicker and shorter than those of other regions Qwilfish.
7314.name: qwilfishhisui

7315.text: A recently published research paper states that this form of Shellos is gradually decreasing in number.
7315.name: shelloseast

7316.text: They normally inhabit rocky seashores, but in times of continuous rain, they can sometimes be found in the mountains, far from the sea.
7316.name: gastrodoneast

7317.text: If the convection microwave oven is not working properly, then the Rotom inhabiting it will become lethargic.
7317.name: rotomheat

7318.text: This Rotom has entered a washing machine. It nods with satisfaction after it floods the surrounding area.
7318.name: rotomwash

7319.text: This Rotom has entered a refrigerator. It leaps around gleefully after it uses cold air to freeze the area around it.
7319.name: rotomfrost

7320.text: This Rotom has entered an electric fan. It smirks with satisfaction over a prank well pulled after it blows away everything around it.
7320.name: rotomfan

7321.text: The lawn mower is one of the household appliances that led to the development of the Rotom Dex.
7321.name: rotommow

7322.text: These Pokmon form schools with others of the same color. The greatest foe of a school of blue Basculin is a school of red Basculin.
7322.name: basculinbluestriped

7323.text: They live in frigid seas, forming schools and sharing food among themselves. When the time comes, they return to the river they were born in.
7323.name: basculinwhitestriped

7324.text: To prevent Deerling from entering their fields, many farmers will have several Lycanroc stand guard, as they are the natural enemy of Deerling.
7324.name: deerlingsummer

7325.text: These Pokmon are not shythey will behave as they please, even in front of people. If you feed one of them, it will quickly take a liking to you.
7325.name: deerlingautumn

7326.text: Deerlings scent changes with the seasons, but when the Pokmon is in its Winter Form, it has hardly any scent at all.
7326.name: deerlingwinter

7327.text: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The thicker and larger the branches and leaves on its antlers, the more majestic the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
7327.name: sawsbucksummer

7328.text: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The darker the red of the foliage that hangs from its antlers, the more stylish the Sawsbuck is thought to be.
7328.name: sawsbuckautumn

7329.text: Its said that Sawsbuck are calm and easy to tame during the season when they take on this form, so its the perfect time to make one your partner.
7329.name: sawsbuckwinter

7330.text: This Flabb rides an orange flower. On its head, it wears a crown of pollen that has healing properties.
7330.name: flabebeorange

7331.text: Once it finds a flower it likes, this Pokmon will spend the rest of its life taking care of its flower. This Flabb rides a blue flower.
7331.name: flabebeblue

7332.text: This Flabb rides a white flower. The wind blows this Pokmon around as it drifts in search of flower gardens.
7332.name: flabebewhite

7333.text: Floette that are fond of white flowers can also easily sync with flowers of other colors.
7333.name: floettewhite

7334.text: Its orange flowers fire off powerful beams, attacking as if they were a battery of artillery.
7334.name: florgesorange

7335.text: Though usually compassionate, Florges will hunt down anyone who vandalizes its flower garden, showing no mercy even if they beg for their lives.
7335.name: florgesblue

7336.text: Female Meowstic are more aggressive than males. Their expression remains blank even while theyre wielding immense psychic power.
7336.name: meowsticf

7337.text: This form of Oricorio has sipped yellow nectar. It uses nimble steps to approach opponents, then knocks them out with electric punches.
7337.name: oricoriopompom

7338.text: The airy dance of these Oricorio is popular as a means of maintaining good health, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.
7338.name: oricoriopau

7339.text: This form of Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. It uses ethereal dance steps to call forth the spirits of the dead.
7339.name: oricoriosensu

7340.text: This Pokmon uses its rocky mane to slash any who approach. It will even disobey its Trainer if it dislikes the orders it was given.
7340.name: lycanrocmidnight

7341.text: Normally this Pokmon doesnt even bark, but once it enters battle, it will relentlessly drive the opponent into a corner.
7341.name: lycanrocdusk

7342.text: This Pokmon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
7342.name: miniormeteororange

7343.text: This Pokmon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
7343.name: miniormeteoryellow

7344.text: This Pokmon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
7344.name: miniormeteorgreen

7345.text: This Pokmon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
7345.name: miniormeteorblue

7346.text: This Pokmon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
7346.name: miniormeteorindigo

7347.text: This Pokmon is born in the ozone layer. It falls to the ground once the outer shell enclosing its core grows heavy.
7347.name: miniormeteorviolet

7348.text: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come trueall they can do is fade away.
7348.name: miniorred

7349.text: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come trueall they can do is fade away.
7349.name: miniororange

7350.text: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come trueall they can do is fade away.
7350.name: minioryellow

7351.text: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come trueall they can do is fade away.
7351.name: miniorgreen

7352.text: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come trueall they can do is fade away.
7352.name: miniorblue

7353.text: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come trueall they can do is fade away.
7353.name: miniorindigo

7354.text: Minior that fall to the ground try to return to space, but their wish will not come trueall they can do is fade away.
7354.name: miniorviolet

7355.text: Even as it struggles beneath the cloth to repair the broken neck of its disguise, Mimikyu keeps up its impersonation of Pikachu.
7355.name: mimikyubusted

7356.text: Cramorant is constantly on the hunt for food along riverbanks. It loves Arrokudawhen it finds them, it swallows them whole without a thought.
7356.name: cramorantgulping

7357.text: Its throat is clearly not wide enough to swallow a Pikachu, and yet Cramorant makes no move to release its catch.
7357.name: cramorantgorging

7358.text: Many youths admire the way this Pokmon listlessly picks fights and keeps its cool no matter what opponent it faces.
7358.name: toxtricitylowkey

7359.text: Some fanatics will go to great pains to prepare the perfect tea and teacup, eagerly waiting for a Sinistea to come and possess their selections.
7359.name: sinisteaantique

7360.text: Apparently a Polteageists disposition is affected by the type of tea the Pokmon came from. What teapot it inhabits makes no difference.
7360.name: polteageistantique

7361.text: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a sweet and tart flavor.
7361.name: alcremierubycream

7362.text: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it an aromatic flavor.
7362.name: alcremiematchacream

7363.text: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a refreshing flavor.
7363.name: alcremiemintcream

7364.text: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a sour flavor.
7364.name: alcremielemoncream

7365.text: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a salty flavor.
7365.name: alcremiesaltedcream

7366.text: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a mixed flavor.
7366.name: alcremierubyswirl

7367.text: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a bitter flavor.
7367.name: alcremiecaramelswirl

7368.text: Slight vibrations shook its cells when it evolved, giving it a complex flavor.
7368.name: alcremierainbowswirl

7369.text: The ice that was covering this Eiscues face has shattered. Eiscue emits cold air from the tip of its hair to protect its head, which is sensitive to heat.
7369.name: eiscuenoice

7370.text: It dislikes conflict. If a fight occurs in its territory, it uses psychic power to throw things at the combatants in an effort to drive them away.
7370.name: indeedeef

7371.text: Even after using up all its dark energy, this violent ruffian will keep running riot until its hunger is appeased.
7371.name: morpekohangry

7372.text: It crossed the sea and drifted ashore in a new land. Surviving in this place led it to take on a unique appearance and gain special powers.
7372.name: ursalunabloodmoon

7373.text: The souls of its comrades cloak its body and propel it effortlessly through even raging rapids.
7373.name: basculegionf

7374.text: This Pokmon sends a flowerlike scent wafting about. Well-developed muscles in its legs allow it to leap more than 16 feet with no trouble at all.
7374.name: oinkolognef

7375.text: The two little ones just appeared one day. The group might be a family of related Pokmon, but nobody knows for sure.
7375.name: mausholdfour

7376.text: The largest of their flocks can contain more than 50 individuals. They fly around towns and forests, searching for food and making a racket.
7376.name: squawkabillyblue

7377.text: These Squawkabilly are hotheaded, and their fighting style is vicious. Theyll leap within reach of their foes to engage in close combat.
7377.name: squawkabillyyellow

7378.text: This Pokmon dislikes being alone. It has a strong sense of community and survives by cooperating with allies.
7378.name: squawkabillywhite

7379.text: This Pokmons ancient genes have awakened. It is now so extraordinarily strong that it can easily lift a cruise ship with one fin.
7379.name: palafinhero

7380.text: This species differing colors and patterns are apparently the result of Tatsugiri changing itself to suit the preferences of the prey it lures in.
7380.name: tatsugiridroopy

7381.text: Bird Pokmon are its main prey. This Pokmon knows its weak, so it hunts with a partner.
7381.name: tatsugiristretchy

7382.text: The gentle Dudunsparce will put Pokmon that wander into its nest onto its back and carry them to the entrance.
7382.name: dudunsparcethreesegment

7383.text: This Pokmon was born from passion that seeped into a coin. It wanders, apparently seeking to return to the treasure chest it once inhabited.
7383.name: gimmighoulroaming

7384.text: The ecology and other data about this Pokmon are unknown. It was named Koraidon by the professor who discovered it.
7384.name: koraidonlimited

7385.text: Its characteristics match those of a mysterious object recorded in an old expedition journal as the Iron Serpent.
7385.name: miraidonlowpower

7386.text: It sprinkles some of its powdery body onto food and drains the life-force from those who so much as lick it.
7386.name: poltchageistartisan
