7387.text: It lives inside a superb teacup that was crafted by a potter of great renown. Collectors positively adore this Pokmon.
7387.name: sinistchamasterpiece

7388.text: This form excels in both attack and defense. It ceaselessly unleashes moves like a spring gushes water.
7388.name: ogerponwellspring

7389.text: This form is the most aggressive, bombarding enemies with the intensity of flames blazing within a hearth.
7389.name: ogerponhearthflame

7390.text: This form has excellent defenses, absorbing impacts solidly like the cornerstones that support houses.
7390.name: ogerponcornerstone

7391.text: Upon sensing danger, it prepares itself for battle by creating a sturdy shell of crystallized Terastal energy.
7391.name: terapagosterastal

7392.text: In this form, Terapagos resembles the world as the ancients saw it, and its Terastal energy is abnormally amplified.
7392.name: terapagosstellar

7393.text: It carries a seed on its back right from birth. As its body grows larger, the seed does too.
7393.name: bulbasaur

7394.text: The bulb on its back grows as it absorbs nutrients. The bulb gives off a pleasant aroma when it blooms.
7394.name: ivysaur

7395.text: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the suns rays, it fills its body with power.
7395.name: venusaur

7396.text: If Charmander is healthy, the flame on the tip of its tail will burn vigorously and wont go out even if it gets a bit wet.
7396.name: charmander

7397.text: It is very hotheaded by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents to battle against. Its aggression will not be quelled if it doesnt win.
7397.name: charmeleon

7398.text: It uses its wings to fly sky-high. The more experience it gains in battle, the greater the temperature at which its flames burn.
7398.name: charizard

7399.text: Its shell is soft immediately after it is born. In no time at all, the shell becomes so resilient that a prodding finger will bounce right off it.
7399.name: squirtle

7400.text: It often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. While swimming quickly, it moves its ears to maintain balance.
7400.name: wartortle

7401.text: It has jet nozzles on its shell. This impressive Pokmon uses these jets to charge toward foes with all the force of a rocket.
7401.name: blastoise

7402.text: A very common sight in grasslands and such. It flicks its tongue in and out to sense danger in its surroundings.
7402.name: ekans

7403.text: This Pokmon is very tenacious. Once it targets its prey, it wont give up the chase, no matter how far the prey goes.
7403.name: arbok

7404.text: When several of these Pokmon gather, their electricity can build and cause lightning storms.
7404.name: pikachu

7405.text: If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
7405.name: raichu

7406.text: No matter how high a place it falls from, this Pokmon can save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.
7406.name: sandshrew

7407.text: The spikes on its body are made up of its hardened hide. It rolls up and attacks foes with its spikes.
7407.name: sandslash

7408.text: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.
7408.name: clefairy

7409.text: It has an acute sense of hearing. It can easily hear a pin being dropped nearly 1,100 yards away.
7409.name: clefable

7410.text: As its body grows larger, its six warm tails become more beautiful, with a more luxurious coat of fur.
7410.name: vulpix

7411.text: It has nine long tails and fur that gleams gold. It is said to live for 1,000 years.
7411.name: ninetales

7412.text: If it inflates to sing a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.
7412.name: jigglypuff

7413.text: The rich, fluffy fur that covers its body feels so good that anyone who feels it cant stop touching it.
7413.name: wigglytuff

7414.text: When it is woken by moonlight, it wanders about. But during the day, it stays still underground.
7414.name: oddish

7415.text: It secretes a sticky, drool-like nectar. Though sweet, it smells too repulsive to get very close.
7415.name: gloom

7416.text: It fiendishly scatters allergenic pollen from its petals, which are the largest in the world.
7416.name: vileplume

7417.text: Its eyes act as radar, enabling it to be active in darkness. The eyes can also shoot powerful beams.
7417.name: venonat

7418.text: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poisonous powder all around.
7418.name: venomoth

7419.text: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.
7419.name: diglett

7420.text: In battle, it digs through the ground and strikes the unsuspecting foe from an unexpected direction.
7420.name: dugtrio

7421.text: It loves things that sparkle. When it sees a shiny object, the gold coin on its head shines, too.
7421.name: meowth

7422.text: It has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. This is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.
7422.name: persian

7423.text: If its chronic headache peaks, it may exhibit odd powers. It seems unable to recall such an episode.
7423.name: psyduck

7424.text: It swims gracefully along on the quiet, slow- moving rivers and lakes of which it is so fond.
7424.name: golduck

7425.text: It is extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment, then thrashing away the next instant.
7425.name: mankey

7426.text: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Pok Ball.
7426.name: primeape

7427.text: Its very friendly and faithful to people. It will try to repel enemies by barking and biting.
7427.name: growlithe

7428.text: Its magnificent bark conveys a sense of majesty. Anyone hearing it cant help but grovel before it.
7428.name: arcanine

7429.text: Its legs are newly grown, and it cant walk very well. It seems to prefer swimming through the water instead.
7429.name: poliwag

7430.text: Its skin is moist all over its body. The skin on its belly spiral also feels smooth.
7430.name: poliwhirl

7431.text: It can use its well-developed arms and legs to run on the surface of the water for a split second.
7431.name: poliwrath

7432.text: It plants its feet deep underground to rehydrate itself. While doing so, its unable to run away if its attacked.
7432.name: bellsprout

7433.text: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
7433.name: weepinbell

7434.text: After dissolving many prey, this Pokmons acid becomes sweeter. This makes it even easier to attract more prey.
7434.name: victreebel

7435.text: Its eyes are as transparent as crystals. From them, it shoots mysterious beams of light.
7435.name: tentacool

7436.text: In battle, it extends all 80 of its tentacles to entrap its opponent inside a poisonous net.
7436.name: tentacruel

7437.text: Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many Geodude around.
7437.name: geodude

7438.text: Moss-covered rocks are Gravelers favorite food. It consumes over a ton of them a day, crunching loudly while it eats.
7438.name: graveler

7439.text: It deliberately blows itself up, then uses this explosive force to jump from mountain to mountain.
7439.name: golem

7440.text: It is always vacantly lost in thought, but no one knows what it is thinking about. It is good at fishing with its tail.
7440.name: slowpoke

7441.text: If the tail-biting Shellder is thrown off in a harsh battle, this Pokmon reverts to being an ordinary Slowpoke.
7441.name: slowbro

7442.text: It moves while constantly hovering. It discharges electromagnetic waves and so on from the units at its sides.
7442.name: magnemite

7443.text: Theyre formed by several Magnemite linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.
7443.name: magneton

7444.text: Its heads never sleep at the same timeeach one takes a turn keeping watch while the other sleeps, switching every hour or so.
7444.name: doduo

7445.text: The strongest head with the thickest neck becomes the leader and gains primary control of the body.
7445.name: dodrio

7446.text: The colder it gets, the better it feels. It joyfully swims around oceans so cold that they are filled with floating ice.
7446.name: seel

7447.text: It stores thermal energy in its body to fend off the cold. It swims at eight knots even in frigid waters.
7447.name: dewgong

7448.text: When two of these Pokmons bodies are combined together, new poisons are created.
7448.name: grimer

7449.text: Its so stinky! Muks body contains toxic elements, and any plant will wilt when it passes by.
7449.name: muk

7450.text: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.
7450.name: shellder

7451.text: When attacked, it launches its spikes in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.
7451.name: cloyster

7452.text: Its body is made of gas. Despite lacking substance, it can envelop an opponent of any size and cause suffocation.
7452.name: gastly

7453.text: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, Haunter lurks, silently stalking its next victim.
7453.name: haunter

7454.text: Hiding in peoples shadows at night, it absorbs their heat. The chill it causes makes the victims shake.
7454.name: gengar

7455.text: When it twitches its nose, it can tell where someone is sleeping and what that person is dreaming about.
7455.name: drowzee

7456.text: Always holding a pendulum that it swings at a steady rhythm, it causes drowsiness in anyone nearby.
7456.name: hypno

7457.text: Its usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a Pok Ball, it has zapped many people.
7457.name: voltorb

7458.text: It explodes in response to even minor stimuli. It is feared, with the nickname of the Bomb Ball.
7458.name: electrode

7459.text: Using telepathy only fellow Exeggcute can pick up on, they always form a cluster of six.
7459.name: exeggcute

7460.text: It is said that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an Exeggcute.
7460.name: exeggutor

7461.text: It has complete control over the ligaments in its legs, expanding and contracting them to double the reach of its kicks.
7461.name: hitmonlee

7462.text: Its fists are masses of muscle. It takes a break every three minutes to steady its breath and mood.
7462.name: hitmonchan

7463.text: The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air. Thats why its always slightly airborne.
7463.name: koffing

7464.text: When it inhales poisonous gases from garbage, its body expands, and its insides smell much worse.
7464.name: weezing

7465.text: Once it starts running, it wont stopeven if it crashes through boulders. This disposition is whats caused its habitat to expand.
7465.name: rhyhorn

7466.text: It evolved to walk using only its hind legs, which has allowed it to expand its habitat even onto steep mountains.
7466.name: rhydon

7467.text: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.
7467.name: chansey

7468.text: It maintains balance using its tail, which is wound up like a coil. It may spray ink from its mouth.
7468.name: horsea

7469.text: Its fin tips leak poison. Its fins and bones are highly valued as ingredients in herbal medicine.
7469.name: seadra

7470.text: The sharp scythes on its forearms become increasingly sharp by cutting through hard objects.
7470.name: scyther

7471.text: Research is progressing on storing lightning in Electabuzz so this energy can be used at any time.
7471.name: electabuzz

7472.text: Wavering flames similar to those of the sun appear on the surface of this Pokmons body.
7472.name: magmar

7473.text: They fight each other by locking horns. The herds protectors take pride in their battle-scarred horns.
7473.name: tauros

7474.text: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today.
7474.name: magikarp

7475.text: It appears whenever there is world conflict, burning down any place it travels through.
7475.name: gyarados

7476.text: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.
7476.name: lapras

7477.text: It can freely recombine its own cellular structure to transform into other life-forms.
7477.name: ditto

7478.text: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element stones.
7478.name: eevee

7479.text: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it cant be seen when it melts away into water.
7479.name: vaporeon

7480.text: If agitated, it uses electricity to straighten out its fur and launch it in small bunches.
7480.name: jolteon

7481.text: It fluffs out its fur collar to cool down its body temperature, which can reach 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
7481.name: flareon

7482.text: Porygon is an artificial Pokmon created using advanced scientific means. It can move freely through cyberspace.
7482.name: porygon

7483.text: Its stomachs digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. Eating things off the ground doesnt bother it at all.
7483.name: snorlax

7484.text: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.
7484.name: dratini

7485.text: It is called the divine Pokmon. When its entire body brightens slightly, the weather changes.
7485.name: dragonair

7486.text: It can fly in spite of its big and bulky physique. It circles the globe in just 16 hours.
7486.name: dragonite

7487.text: Its pleasantly aromatic leaf has the ability to check the humidity and temperature of the area around it.
7487.name: chikorita

7488.text: The scent that wafts from the leaves on its neck causes anyone who smells it to become energetic.
7488.name: bayleef

7489.text: Meganiums breath holds within it the power to revive grasses and plants that have withered.
7489.name: meganium

7490.text: The fire that spouts from its back burns hottest when it is angry. The flaring flames intimidate foes.
7490.name: cyndaquil

7491.text: The fur covering this Pokmons body never burns, no matter what. It can shrug off any kind of fire attack.
7491.name: quilava

7492.text: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.
7492.name: typhlosion

7493.text: This rough critter chomps at any moving object it sees. Turning your back on it is not recommended.
7493.name: totodile

7494.text: It opens its huge jaws wide to attack. If it loses fangs while biting, theyll just keep on growing back, one after another.
7494.name: croconaw

7495.text: Although it has a massive body, its powerful hind legs enable it to move quickly, even on land.
7495.name: feraligatr

7496.text: If it encounters a foe, it will stand up on its tail, making itself look bigger than usual to intimidate them.
7496.name: sentret

7497.text: It is nimble and has a very flexible body. Even if you get ahold of it, itll slip right out of your arms.
7497.name: furret

7498.text: Since it tells time precisely, some countries consider it to be a deity of wisdom, versed in the ways of the world.
7498.name: hoothoot

7499.text: Its extremely soft wings make no sound in flight. It silently sneaks up on prey without being detected.
7499.name: noctowl

7500.text: Some fishers weave its sturdy thread into nets to catch fish Pokmon.
7500.name: spinarak

7501.text: It wanders in search of food after darkness falls, never nesting in a specific place.
7501.name: ariados

7502.text: It shoots positively and negatively charged electricity from the tips of its two antennae and stuns its opponents.
7502.name: chinchou

7503.text: It blinds prey with an intense burst of light. With the prey incapacitated, the Pokmon swallows it in a single gulp.
7503.name: lanturn

7504.text: Despite this Pokmons cute appearance, those who want to live with one should prepare to be on the receiving end of its electric jolts.
7504.name: pichu

7505.text: Since it is often seen when shooting stars fill the night skies, its said to come here by riding on a star.
7505.name: cleffa

7506.text: It likes to sing but is not yet good at it. With praise and encouragement, it will get better little by little.
7506.name: igglybuff

7507.text: Its fleece grows continually. In the summer, the fleece is fully shed, but it grows back in a week.
7507.name: mareep

7508.text: Because of its rubbery, electricity-resistant skin, it can store lots of electricity in its fur.
7508.name: flaaffy

7509.text: When it gets dark, the light from its bright, shiny tail can be seen from far away on the oceans surface.
7509.name: ampharos

7510.text: After it grows up, it leaves the forest it was born in to form groups with other Bellossom. It breaks into dance when it gets excited.
7510.name: bellossom

7511.text: The oil-filled tail functions as a buoy, so its fine even in rivers with strong currents.
7511.name: marill

7512.text: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.
7512.name: azumarill

7513.text: To avoid being attacked, it does nothing but mimic a tree. It hates water and flees from rain.
7513.name: sudowoodo

7514.text: Its the leader of Poliwag and Poliwhirl. When Politoed roars, they all cower in fear.
7514.name: politoed

7515.text: Outside of cold regions, Hoppip can be found practically everywhere. This is because the wind carries this species all over the world.
7515.name: hoppip

7516.text: When the weather grows cold, Skiplooms flower closes and the Pokmon cannot photosynthesize, so it flies away to warmer regions.
7516.name: skiploom

7517.text: Beware its cotton spores. If you accidentally breathe them in, youll be racked with coughs and itchiness.
7517.name: jumpluff

7518.text: Its tail moves with greater dexterity than its hands. Making deft use of this tail, Aipom lives high among the treetops.
7518.name: aipom

7519.text: It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.
7519.name: sunkern

7520.text: Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always looking in the direction of the sun.
7520.name: sunflora

7521.text: It can see in all directions without moving its big eyes, helping it spot both attackers and prey right away.
7521.name: yanma

7522.text: When it walks around on land, it coats its body with a slimy, poisonous film.
7522.name: wooper

7523.text: Due to its relaxed and carefree attitude, it often bumps its head on riverbed boulders and boat hulls as it swims.
7523.name: quagsire

7524.text: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemys actions.
7524.name: espeon

7525.text: When darkness falls, the rings on the body begin to glow, striking fear in the hearts of anyone nearby.
7525.name: umbreon

7526.text: If spotted, it will lure an unwary person into chasing it, then lose the pursuer on mountain trails.
7526.name: murkrow

7527.text: It loves to bite and yank peoples hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.
7527.name: misdreavus

7528.text: Girafarigs tail has a small head. It instinctively bites at any foe that approaches the Pokmon from behind.
7528.name: girafarig

7529.text: It spits out a fluid that it uses to glue tree bark to its body. The fluid hardens when it touches air.
7529.name: pineco

7530.text: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.
7530.name: forretress

7531.text: If spotted, it escapes by burrowing with its tail. It can float just slightly using its wings.
7531.name: dunsparce

7532.text: It glides as if sliding. It startles foes by clamping on to their faces, then jabs with its poison stinger.
7532.name: gligar

7533.text: Its growls make its opponents uneasy. This laid-back Pokmon tends to sleep half the day.
7533.name: snubbull

7534.text: It can make most any Pokmon run away by opening its big mouth to reveal its thick fangs.
7534.name: granbull

7535.text: Experienced fishers say they try to catch Qwilfish in the brief moment that these Pokmon become defenseless just after launching poisonous spikes.
7535.name: qwilfish

7536.text: It swings its eye-patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.
7536.name: scizor

7537.text: With its herculean powers, it can easily throw around an object that is 100 times its own weight.
7537.name: heracross

7538.text: This is a smart and sneaky Pokmon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.
7538.name: sneasel

7539.text: Its paws are soaked in oodles of honey. When nervous, Teddiursa will lick its paws and soon have a smile back on its face.
7539.name: teddiursa

7540.text: It is quite skilled at climbing trees. If it comes across a Primeape while searching for berries in the treetops, trouble will surely ensue.
7540.name: ursaring

7541.text: Its said that in ancient times, when volcanoes were more active, there were many more Slugma than there are now.
7541.name: slugma

7542.text: According to folklore, a sudden increase in the wild Magcargo population heralds a volcanic eruption.
7542.name: magcargo

7543.text: It rubs its snout against the ground, digging through the soil as it searches for food. Sometimes it digs up hot springs.
7543.name: swinub

7544.text: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.
7544.name: piloswine

7545.text: It always carries its food with it, wherever it goes. If attacked, it throws its food at the opponent.
7545.name: delibird

7546.text: Since the feathers that it sheds are thin and sharp, people apparently once used them as swords.
7546.name: skarmory

7547.text: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.
7547.name: houndour

7548.text: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokmon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.
7548.name: houndoom

7549.text: This Pokmon is said to sleep at the bottom of the seadeeper than any other life-form can descendbuilding its energy.
7549.name: kingdra

7550.text: It is far stronger than it appears. If a Phanpy is swinging its trunk around and your arm gets hit by it, your arm bone will shatter.
7550.name: phanpy

7551.text: Donphan is normally a calm Pokmon, but once it is enraged, it will curl its body into a ball and charge at you while rolling.
7551.name: donphan

7552.text: Porygon was upgraded to become capable of planetary development. However, this upgraded version cannot even fly yet.
7552.name: porygon2

7553.text: Its said that this Pokmon used to be stronger long ago when it had many enemies, and that it was even able to evolve under its own power.
7553.name: stantler

7554.text: The color of the mysterious fluid secreted from the tip of the tail is predetermined for each Smeargle.
7554.name: smeargle

7555.text: Its intense desire to become stronger and stronger drives it to recklessly train its body and challenge any opponent it can find to battle.
7555.name: tyrogue

7556.text: It spins on its horn while dealing out elegant kicks. Its horn grows continuously through its lifetime.
7556.name: hitmontop

7557.text: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it only charges up a little bit.
7557.name: elekid

7558.text: Magma-like blood circulates throughout this Pokmons body, raising its body temperature as high as 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
7558.name: magby

7559.text: The eggs it lays are filled with happiness. Eating even one bite will bring a smile to anyone.
7559.name: blissey

7560.text: It is born deep underground. It cant emerge until it has entirely consumed the soil around it.
7560.name: larvitar

7561.text: Its shell is as hard as bedrock, and it is also very strong. Its thrashing can topple a mountain.
7561.name: pupitar

7562.text: In just one of its mighty hands, it has the power to make the ground shake and mountains crumble.
7562.name: tyranitar

7563.text: Treecko can quickly scale even vertical surfaces. It senses humidity with its tail to predict the next days weather.
7563.name: treecko

7564.text: Grovyle leaps from branch to branch in large trees, moving with ease. It propels itself with astounding speed and force.
7564.name: grovyle

7565.text: The leaves on its arms are as sharp as swords. It agilely leaps about the branches of trees to strike its enemies.
7565.name: sceptile

7566.text: In its belly, it has a sac filled with burning fire, meaning that Torchic feels as warm as a hot-water bottle if you hug it.
7566.name: torchic

7567.text: When it enters battle, the flame inside its body burns stronger. Its kicks have outstanding destructive power.
7567.name: combusken

7568.text: It can jump powerfully, clearing a 30-story building in a single leap. Its flaming punches scorch its opponents.
7568.name: blaziken

7569.text: When it uses its large tail fin, it picks up speed rapidly in the water. It is strong in spite of its small size.
7569.name: mudkip

7570.text: It is at its best when on muddy ground that offers poor footing. It quickly overwhelms opponents that are bogged down and unable to move.
7570.name: marshtomp

7571.text: Swamperts arms are rock-hard. With one swing, they can batter down Swamperts foes. This Pokmon makes its nest on beautiful beaches.
7571.name: swampert

7572.text: Poochyena pursue their prey in packs. Once the prey is exhausted, the pack finishes it off. But sometimes the prey retaliates, and the pack flees.
7572.name: poochyena

7573.text: Once its caught the scent of faraway prey, the leader gives a signal, and the whole pack moves out.
7573.name: mightyena

7574.text: Lotad will gather in lakes that have good water quality. The surfaces of these lakes sometimes become covered in Lotad leaves.
7574.name: lotad

7575.text: It prefers waterfronts with plentiful food. It became nocturnal so it wouldnt have to compete for food with bird Pokmon.
7575.name: lombre

7576.text: Dancing with an upbeat rhythm energizes and emboldens it, letting it face any foe without fear.
7576.name: ludicolo

7577.text: Seedot live in trees, hanging from the branches and leeching moisture. Rows of them can be found dangling from large, young trees.
7577.name: seedot

7578.text: Its sensory functions are concentrated in its pointed nose, which it uses to sense its surroundings. The nose is also its weak point.
7578.name: nuzleaf

7579.text: Legends tell of a bird Pokmon that received divine punishment for its evil deeds and had its beak and wings replaced.
7579.name: shiftry

7580.text: It rides upon ocean winds as if it were a glider. In the winter, it hides food around its nest.
7580.name: wingull

7581.text: It protects its young in its beak. It bobs on waves, resting on them on days when the waters are calm.
7581.name: pelipper

7582.text: It is highly attuned to the emotions of people and Pokmon. It hides if it senses hostility.
7582.name: ralts

7583.text: It unleashes psychokinetic energy at full power when protecting a Trainer it has bonded closely with.
7583.name: gardevoir

7584.text: It secretes a thick, sweet-scented syrup from the tip of its head. It lives on weed-choked ponds.
7584.name: surskit

7585.text: The antennae have distinctive patterns that look like eyes. When it rains, they grow heavy, making flight impossible.
7585.name: masquerain

7586.text: If it senses danger, it scatters spores from the top of its head to protect itself.
7586.name: shroomish

7587.text: The seeds on its tail are made of toxic spores. It knocks out foes with quick, virtually invisible punches.
7587.name: breloom

7588.text: The way Slakoth lolls around makes anyone who watches it feel like doing the same.
7588.name: slakoth

7589.text: It is always hungry because it wont stop rampaging. Even while it is eating, it cant keep still.
7589.name: vigoroth

7590.text: This Pokmon lives lying on its side. It only rolls over and moves when there is no more grass to eat.
7590.name: slaking

7591.text: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.
7591.name: makuhita

7592.text: It stomps on the ground to build power. It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a straight-arm punch.
7592.name: hariyama

7593.text: Its tail is packed full of the nutrients it needs to grow.
7593.name: azurill

7594.text: When endangered, it may protect itself by increasing its magnetism and drawing nearby iron objects to its body.
7594.name: nosepass

7595.text: Materials from gems it has eaten float to the surface of its body and can form an infinite number of patterns among individuals.
7595.name: sableye

7596.text: It meditates to heighten its inner energy and to float in the air. It eats one berry a day.
7596.name: meditite

7597.text: It elegantly avoids attacks with dance-like steps, then launches a devastating blow in the same motion.
7597.name: medicham

7598.text: This Pokmon absorbs electricity from telephone poles. It shorts out the electricity stored inside its body to create noises.
7598.name: plusle

7599.text: Its dislike of water makes it take shelter under the eaves of houses in rain. It uses pom-poms made of sparks for cheering.
7599.name: minun

7600.text: It flashes the light on its rear to communicate with other Volbeat. It loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
7600.name: volbeat

7601.text: It guides Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. There are scholars who research the meaning of these signs.
7601.name: illumise

7602.text: It has a small heart and brain. Its stomach comprises most of its body, with enzymes to dissolve anything.
7602.name: gulpin

7603.text: It can swallow a tire whole in one gulp. It secretes a horribly toxic fluid from the pores on its body.
7603.name: swalot

7604.text: The flaming magma it stores in the hump on its back is the source of its tremendous power.
7604.name: numel

7605.text: If angered, the humps on its back erupt in a shower of molten lava. It lives in the craters of volcanoes.
7605.name: camerupt

7606.text: Coal is the source of Torkoals energy. Large amounts of coal can be found in the mountains where they live.
7606.name: torkoal

7607.text: Using its tail like a spring, it keeps its heart beating by bouncing constantly. If it stops, it dies.
7607.name: spoink

7608.text: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does a strange dance to control foes minds.
7608.name: grumpig

7609.text: As it digs through the sand, its giant jaws crush any rocks that obstruct its path. It builds a funnel-shaped nest.
7609.name: trapinch

7610.text: It generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously vibrating its wings. After making its prey faint, it dissolves the prey with its digestive juices.
7610.name: vibrava

7611.text: The sound of its wings flapping resembles singing. Those entranced by this sound get lured into a sandstorm and become Flygons prey.
7611.name: flygon

7612.text: It lives in arid locations. Its yellow flowers bloom once a year.
7612.name: cacnea

7613.text: It lives in deserts. It becomes active at night when it hunts for prey exhausted from the deserts heat.
7613.name: cacturne

7614.text: It cant relax if it or its surroundings are not clean. It wipes off dirt with its wings.
7614.name: swablu

7615.text: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.
7615.name: altaria

7616.text: If it comes across a Seviper, its fur bristles and it assumes its battle pose. Its sharp claws are its best weapon.
7616.name: zangoose

7617.text: Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. Its Zangooses archrival.
7617.name: seviper

7618.text: It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long whiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
7618.name: barboach

7619.text: Sighting Whiscash leaping from the water is believed to herald an earthquake.
7619.name: whiscash

7620.text: It can live in impure water, where it doesnt need to compete with other water Pokmon for food, so its numbers have steadily increased.
7620.name: corphish

7621.text: A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws. It is said to be extremely hard to raise.
7621.name: crawdaunt

7622.text: It is the shabbiest Pokmon of all. It forms schools and lives at the bottom of rivers that teem with plant life.
7622.name: feebas

7623.text: It lives at the bottom of clear lakes. In times of war, it shows itself, which soothes peoples minds and hearts.
7623.name: milotic

7624.text: It feeds on the dark emotions of sadness and hatred, which make it grow steadily stronger.
7624.name: shuppet

7625.text: Strong feelings of hatred turned a puppet into a Pokmon. If it opens its mouth, its cursed energy escapes.
7625.name: banette

7626.text: Duskulls victims suffer an intense chill as the Pokmon siphons their life-force away, glaring at them with its bright red eye all the while.
7626.name: duskull

7627.text: Dusclopss true form is said to be a bright red eye burning within its body, but no one has ever seen such a thing.
7627.name: dusclops

7628.text: Delicious fruits grew out from around its neck because it always ate the same kind of fruit.
7628.name: tropius

7629.text: Its cries echo inside its hollow body to emerge as beautiful notes for startling and repelling foes.
7629.name: chimecho

7630.text: It is said that a home visited by a Snorunt will prosper. It can withstand cold of ?150 degrees Fahrenheit.
7630.name: snorunt

7631.text: It prevents prey from escaping by instantaneously freezing moisture in the air.
7631.name: glalie

7632.text: During the spawning season, countless Luvdisc congregate at coral reefs, turning the waters pink.
7632.name: luvdisc

7633.text: Its belief that it will be able to fly one day is apparently the influence of information carried in its genes.
7633.name: bagon

7634.text: Its armored body makes all attacks bounce off. The armor is too tough, however, making it heavy and somewhat sluggish.
7634.name: shelgon

7635.text: It becomes uncontrollable if it is enraged. It destroys everything with shredding claws and fire.
7635.name: salamence

7636.text: All its cells are magnets. It communicates with others of its kind by transmitting magnetic forces from its body.
7636.name: beldum

7637.text: It adores magnetic minerals, so it pursues Nosepass at speeds exceeding 60 mph.
7637.name: metang

7638.text: It firmly pins its prey using its four claws and large body. Then Metagross uses the mouth on its stomach to chew its prey to bits.
7638.name: metagross

7639.text: It uses its whole body to photosynthesize when exposed to sunlight. Its shell is made from hardened soil.
7639.name: turtwig

7640.text: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokmon there on its back.
7640.name: grotle

7641.text: Some Pokmon are born on a Torterras back and spend their entire life there.
7641.name: torterra

7642.text: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.
7642.name: chimchar

7643.text: A bigger fire on its tail and a brighter blue pattern on its face means it holds a higher rank in its troop.
7643.name: monferno

7644.text: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.
7644.name: infernape

7645.text: It doesnt like to be taken care of. Its difficult to bond with since it wont listen to its Trainer.
7645.name: piplup

7646.text: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.
7646.name: prinplup

7647.text: It avoids unnecessary disputes, but it will mercilessly decimate anything that threatens the safety of its colony.
7647.name: empoleon

7648.text: Because they are weak individually, they form groups. However, they bicker if the group grows too big.
7648.name: starly

7649.text: They maintain huge flocks, although fierce scuffles break out between various flocks.
7649.name: staravia

7650.text: It never stops attacking even if it is injured. It fusses over the shape of its comb.
7650.name: staraptor

7651.text: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.
7651.name: kricketot

7652.text: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokmon.
7652.name: kricketune

7653.text: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. Its fur glows when its in trouble.
7653.name: shinx

7654.text: By gathering their tails together, they collectively generate powerful electricity from their claws.
7654.name: luxio

7655.text: Luxrays ability to see through objects comes in handy when its scouting for danger.
7655.name: luxray

7656.text: Cranidos toughen up their already sturdy heads by headbutting one another.
7656.name: cranidos

7657.text: If two were to smash their heads together, their foot-thick skulls would keep them from fainting.
7657.name: rampardos

7658.text: This Pokmon lived in primeval jungles. Its thought that Shieldon had few enemies thanks to its sturdy face.
7658.name: shieldon

7659.text: Bastiodon live in herds. When assaulted by enemies, they line up side by side and use their hard faces to block attacks.
7659.name: bastiodon

7660.text: The trio is together from birth. It constantly gathers nectar from flowers to please Vespiquen.
7660.name: combee

7661.text: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control Combee.
7661.name: vespiquen

7662.text: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.
7662.name: pachirisu

7663.text: It inflates its flotation sac, keeping its face above water in order to watch for prey movement.
7663.name: buizel

7664.text: It is a common sight around fishing ports. It is known to rescue people and help fishers carry what they caught.
7664.name: floatzel

7665.text: It oozes a purple fluid to deter enemies. Apparently, there are more West Sea Shellos now than there were in the past.
7665.name: shellos

7666.text: It appears on beaches where the waters are shallow. Once it catches prey, it will slowly melt them with its mucus before slurping them up.
7666.name: gastrodon

7667.text: Split into two, the tails are so adept at handling and doing things that Ambipom rarely uses its hands.
7667.name: ambipom

7668.text: Because of the way it floats aimlessly, an old folktale calls it a signpost for wandering spirits.
7668.name: drifloon

7669.text: They carry people and Pokmon, but the wind can catch them, so there cant be a fixed destination.
7669.name: drifblim

7670.text: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.
7670.name: mismagius

7671.text: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokmon, and more than 100 of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.
7671.name: honchkrow

7672.text: It emits high-frequency cries that people cant hear. Once it starts, it can cry for an awfully long time.
7672.name: chingling

7673.text: The foul fluid from its rear is so revolting that it can make people feel queasy up to a mile and a quarter away.
7673.name: stunky

7674.text: It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.
7674.name: skuntank

7675.text: They are found in ancient tombs. The patterns on their backs are said to be imbued with mysterious power.
7675.name: bronzor

7676.text: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.
7676.name: bronzong

7677.text: From its eyes, it can expel excess moisture from its body. This liquid is similar in composition to human sweat.
7677.name: bonsly

7678.text: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. Its bothered by how curly its hair looks.
7678.name: happiny

7679.text: It was formed by uniting 108 spirits. It has been bound to the Odd Keystone to keep it from doing any mischief.
7679.name: spiritomb

7680.text: It nests in horizontal holes warmed by geothermal heat. Foes who get too close can expect to be pounced on and bitten.
7680.name: gible

7681.text: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
7681.name: gabite

7682.text: The protuberances on its head serve as sensors. It can even detect distant prey.
7682.name: garchomp

7683.text: When it is voraciously gulping down food, it forgets about the food it has hidden under its fur.
7683.name: munchlax

7684.text: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions, such as joy and rage, in the form of waves.
7684.name: riolu

7685.text: A well-trained one can use its aura to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.
7685.name: lucario

7686.text: It shrouds itself in sand to ward off germs. It travels easily through the sands of the desert.
7686.name: hippopotas

7687.text: It brandishes its gaping mouth in a display of fearsome strength. It raises vast quantities of sand while attacking.
7687.name: hippowdon

7688.text: It rarely fights fairly, but that is strictly to ensure survival. It is popular as a mascot.
7688.name: croagunk

7689.text: It has a poison sac at its throat. When it croaks, the stored poison is churned for greater potency.
7689.name: toxicroak

7690.text: It absorbs sunlight with the pink areas of its skin, which then shine. This appears to be a form of camouflage.
7690.name: finneon

7691.text: Lumineon swimming in the darkness of the deep sea look like stars shining in the night sky.
7691.name: lumineon

7692.text: Seemingly curious about people, they gather around footsteps they find on snowy mountains.
7692.name: snover

7693.text: They appear when the snow flowers bloom. When the petals fall, they retreat to places unknown again.
7693.name: abomasnow

7694.text: They travel in groups of four or five, leaving signs for one another on trees and rocks. They bring down their prey with coordinated attacks.
7694.name: weavile

7695.text: Exposure to a special magnetic field changed Magnetons molecular structure, turning it into Magnezone.
7695.name: magnezone

7696.text: A Rhyperiors brain is smaller than a Rhydons, but the Rhyperior is stronger because it spends more energy on battling and less on brainpower.
7696.name: rhyperior

7697.text: This Pokmon presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent and instantly sends over 20,000 volts of high-voltage electricity through them.
7697.name: electivire

7698.text: They dwell in volcanic craters. Its said that only a single pair of Magmortar will inhabit any given volcano.
7698.name: magmortar

7699.text: Its jaw power is incredible. It is adept at biting apart foes while flying by at high speed.
7699.name: yanmega

7700.text: The younger they are, the more they smell like fresh grass. With age, their fragrance takes on the odor of fallen leaves.
7700.name: leafeon

7701.text: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.
7701.name: glaceon

7702.text: It flies soundlessly through the sky. It catches prey with its long tail, then lunges at the preys vulnerable spots with its fangs.
7702.name: gliscor

7703.text: A frozen one was dug up from soil dating back 10,000 years. It woke up, to much amazement.
7703.name: mamoswine

7704.text: Its programming was modified to enable it to operate in other dimensions. This did not work as planned.
7704.name: porygonz

7705.text: Because it can sense what its foe is thinking, its attacks burst out first, fast, and fierce.
7705.name: gallade

7706.text: Probopass radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances are rendered useless while its around.
7706.name: probopass

7707.text: It comes and goes between this world and the afterlife. People fear this Pokmon because it is said to suck in lost spirits and take them along.
7707.name: dusknoir

7708.text: It freezes prey by blowing its ?58 degree Fahrenheit breath. It is said to then secretly display its prey.
7708.name: froslass

7709.text: Research continues on this Pokmon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.
7709.name: rotom

7710.text: It prefers to avoid groups. In its day-to-day life, it dexterously controls its vines to compensate for its short arms.
7710.name: snivy

7711.text: Servines one weakness is its inflated sense of pride. It takes a while for Servine to be able to cooperate with other Pokmon.
7711.name: servine

7712.text: An intimidating gaze and majestic appearance have caused this Pokmon to be known as the Lord of the Forest.
7712.name: serperior

7713.text: This Pokmon is a ravenous glutton. It uses its excellent sense of smell to find food, then cooks it to a crisp before eating.
7713.name: tepig

7714.text: When defending its friends, Pignite will stand up to any opponent, no matter how strong. But its powerless when faced with an empty stomach.
7714.name: pignite

7715.text: The direr the situation, the more it seems to enjoy itself. The flames around its neck intensify, too, increasing Emboars power and speed.
7715.name: emboar

7716.text: Its said that Oshawott learned to maintain its scalchop with riverbed stones by mimicking humans it saw using whetstones.
7716.name: oshawott

7717.text: Dewott has a studious and stern personality. It masters the use of its scalchops through dedicated, repeated training.
7717.name: dewott

7718.text: Samurott leads its group strictly. Those who do not follow its rules receive a merciless thrashing.
7718.name: samurott

7719.text: This Pokmon prefers places with lots of lightning strikes. It catches lightning with its mane and stores the electricity within its body.
7719.name: blitzle

7720.text: Once the herd hears thunder, it chases after the storm clouds so that the Blitzle in the group can use the lightning to charge up.
7720.name: zebstrika

7721.text: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
7721.name: drilbur

7722.text: Its drill, which has evolved into steel, is strong enough to bore through iron plates. This Pokmon is a great help in tunnel construction.
7722.name: excadrill

7723.text: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle heavy lumber without difficulty.
7723.name: timburr

7724.text: This Pokmon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
7724.name: gurdurr

7725.text: Rather than rely on their strength, they master moves that make good use of centrifugal force to swing around concrete.
7725.name: conkeldurr

7726.text: The bumps on their heads are sensory organs. When Sewaddle meet, they greet each other by rubbing these bumps together.
7726.name: sewaddle

7727.text: Swadloon wraps itself in leaves for protection. It uses the two leaves atop its head to detect air movements and feel out its surroundings.
7727.name: swadloon

7728.text: It fashions clothing from woven leaves. Though gentle in disposition, it will show no mercy to foes who target young Pokmon.
7728.name: leavanny

7729.text: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
7729.name: cottonee

7730.text: It rides on the wind and slips into peoples homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton- filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
7730.name: whimsicott

7731.text: If the leaves on its head are pruned with regularity, this Pokmon can be grown into a fine plump shape.
7731.name: petilil

7732.text: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.
7732.name: lilligant

7733.text: Its so vicious that its called the Thug of the River. Yet Basculin is still targeted by predators, such as Dondozo and Bombirdier.
7733.name: basculin

7734.text: They live hidden under hot desert sands in order to keep their body temperature from dropping.
7734.name: sandile

7735.text: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
7735.name: krokorok

7736.text: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
7736.name: krookodile

7737.text: It will abruptly headbutt anyone that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is extremely hard.
7737.name: scraggy

7738.text: This Pokmon may be rude, but it takes very good care of its family, its friends, and its turf.
7738.name: scrafty

7739.text: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokmon.
7739.name: zorua

7740.text: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
7740.name: zoroark

7741.text: These Pokmon like things neat and tidy. They are always sweeping and dusting their habitat, using their tails as brooms.
7741.name: minccino

7742.text: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.
7742.name: cinccino

7743.text: Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin bawling if you do.
7743.name: gothita

7744.text: Using its psychic power, it arranges pebbles to form the shapes of constellations. Some people believe this Pokmon came from outer space.
7744.name: gothorita

7745.text: It gazes at the stars to predict the future. It acts somewhat detached because it has seen the end of all existence.
7745.name: gothitelle

7746.text: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.
7746.name: solosis

7747.text: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokmon exhibit their maximum power.
7747.name: duosion

7748.text: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.
7748.name: reuniclus

7749.text: It strengthens its body by diving into the depths of ponds, swimming around while looking for bog moss to eat.
7749.name: ducklett

7750.text: Its said that many artists have taken inspiration from the sight of a Swanna performing a beautiful dance in the light of dawn.
7750.name: swanna

7751.text: Despite Deerlings adorable appearance, farmers consider it a nuisance since it loves plant shoots and will eat them all up.
7751.name: deerling

7752.text: There are many Sawsbuck enthusiasts. The paler the pink flowers that bloom on its antlers, the more beautiful the Sawsbuck is considered to be.
7752.name: sawsbuck

7753.text: This Pokmon prefers damp places. It spurts out poison spores to repel approaching enemies.
7753.name: foongus

7754.text: Amoonguss mimics Pok Balls. It is not yet clear whether this mimicry is effective against other Pokmon.
7754.name: amoonguss

7755.text: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokmon gather in the area around Alomomola.
7755.name: alomomola

7756.text: Since it cant generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokmon and absorbs static electricity.
7756.name: joltik

7757.text: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
7757.name: galvantula

7758.text: These Pokmon move in schools. They have an electricity-generating organ, so they discharge electricity if in danger.
7758.name: tynamo

7759.text: These Pokmon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
7759.name: eelektrik

7760.text: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.
7760.name: eelektross

7761.text: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life-force of any who follow it.
7761.name: litwick

7762.text: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.
7762.name: lampent

7763.text: It absorbs spirits, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
7763.name: chandelure

7764.text: If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.
7764.name: axew

7765.text: Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portionsone to eat now and one to save for later.
7765.name: fraxure

7766.text: It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.
7766.name: haxorus

7767.text: When Cubchoo starts sneezing, watch out! If it spatters you with its frosty snot, youll get frostbite.
7767.name: cubchoo

7768.text: Feared as the Snow-White Demon in northern lands, Beartic uses its frosty claws and fangs to attack prey.
7768.name: beartic

7769.text: Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.
7769.name: cryogonal

7770.text: They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.
7770.name: mienfoo

7771.text: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.
7771.name: mienshao

7772.text: Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.
7772.name: golett

7773.text: Golurk were created by ancient people to protect both people and Pokmon. They run on a mysterious energy.
7773.name: golurk

7774.text: Any chips in its blades would prove fatal for it. After each battle, it diligently maintains its blades using its favorite sharpening stone.
7774.name: pawniard

7775.text: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.
7775.name: bisharp

7776.text: With its sharp claws, this Pokmon pierces its prey, and then it pecks at them. Although it also consumes berries, its a carnivore at heart.
7776.name: rufflet

7777.text: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
7777.name: braviary

7778.text: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.
7778.name: vullaby

7779.text: Watching from the sky, they attack weakened prey on the ground. They have a habit of decorating themselves with bones.
7779.name: mandibuzz

7780.text: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.
7780.name: deino

7781.text: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.
7781.name: zweilous

7782.text: Its said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.
7782.name: hydreigon

7783.text: In ancient times, Larvesta was worshiped as the emissary of the sun. However, it was also viewed as a burden since it often caused forest fires.
7783.name: larvesta

7784.text: This Pokmon scatters burning scales. Most of the danger of these scales is not in their heatits in the way they rob the surrounding air of oxygen.
7784.name: volcarona

7785.text: Eating lots of berries makes the bark shell that covers Chespins head and body grow sturdier.
7785.name: chespin

7786.text: It can send a trailer flying with a tackle. Its numb to pain, so even violent collisions dont faze it.
7786.name: quilladin

7787.text: Its gentle disposition would have it avoid conflict, but it gives opponents a thrashing with its thorned fists when the situation calls for it.
7787.name: chesnaught

7788.text: Twigs make for Fennekins snacks. When it nibbles on twigs, it finds the courage to face strong foes.
7788.name: fennekin

7789.text: Braixens branch ignites as its pulled from the Pokmons tail. Braixen then uses the flame to spark powerful attacks.
7789.name: braixen

7790.text: It controls flames telekinetically, trapping its foes in a fiery vortex surpassing 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit and burning them to a crisp.
7790.name: delphox

7791.text: It utilizes its extraordinary jumping abilities to flummox its foes, throwing springy bubbles at them from above their heads.
7791.name: froakie

7792.text: The tips of its fingers and toes stick firmly to vertical surfaces. Frogadier can scale skyscrapers with ease.
7792.name: frogadier

7793.text: It makes shuriken out of mucus excreted from its thighs. These shuriken can cut cleanly through steel cables.
7793.name: greninja

7794.text: Fletchling can be found in both rural and urban areas. They once had a huge territorial dispute with Squawkabilly. Fights broke out all over town.
7794.name: fletchling

7795.text: Its territory has a radius of just over a mile. If any bird Pokmon should enter, it will show them no mercy.
7795.name: fletchinder

7796.text: When it gets excited, it vents sparks from the gaps between its feathers. These unburnable feathers are used as a fireproof material.
7796.name: talonflame

7797.text: This Pokmon scatters poisonous powder to repel enemies. It will eat different plants depending on where it lives.
7797.name: scatterbug

7798.text: Spewpa doesnt live in a fixed location. It roams where it pleases across the fields and mountains, building up the energy it needs to evolve.
7798.name: spewpa

7799.text: This Pokmon was born in frigid lands. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
7799.name: vivillon

7800.text: The more a Litleo trains its body and spirit by battling mighty enemies, the hotter its mane will grow.
7800.name: litleo

7801.text: The mane of a male Pyroar heats up to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit during battle. Merely approaching it will cause severe burns.
7801.name: pyroar

7802.text: This Flabb rides a red flower. Immediately after birth, this Pokmon begins flying around in search of a flower it likes.
7802.name: flabebe

7803.text: As long as it has sunlight and water, Skiddo can make energy with the leaves on its body, allowing it to live on rocky mountains barren of food.
7803.name: skiddo

7804.text: These Pokmon live in herds in mountainous places. The victor in their contests of clashing horns will become the leader of the herd.
7804.name: gogoat

7805.text: Behind an Espurrs expressionless face is a frantic struggle to contain psychic power.
7805.name: espurr

7806.text: If Meowstic continuously emits its powerful psychic energy, it will damage its own body.
7806.name: meowstic

7807.text: Being upside-down improves its blood flow and clears its mind, causing the power of its psychic moves to increase dramatically.
7807.name: inkay

7808.text: It flashes the luminescent spots on its body to hypnotize its opponents, gaining total control over them.
7808.name: malamar

7809.text: This Pokmon is a poor swimmer. If its caught in a fierce storm, it will sometimes get washed far away and become unable to return to its home.
7809.name: skrelp

7810.text: Since Finizen is the better swimmer, Dragalge will approach it under the cover of seaweed, then immobilize it with a poisonous attack.
7810.name: dragalge

7811.text: Claunchers claws will regrow if they fall off. The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a distinct flavor that doesnt appeal to all tastes.
7811.name: clauncher

7812.text: The cannonballs of seawater that Clawitzer launches from its claw are powerful enough to punch through tanker hulls.
7812.name: clawitzer

7813.text: Sylveon cuts an elegant figure as it dances lightly around, feelers fluttering, but its piercing moves aim straight for its opponents weak spots.
7813.name: sylveon

7814.text: Hawlucha live quietly without flocking together. They fight constantly with their natural enemies: noisy groups of Primeape.
7814.name: hawlucha

7815.text: Dedenne emit electrical waves from the whiskers on their cheeks to communicate with each other. When low on electricity, they curl up and sleep.
7815.name: dedenne

7816.text: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
7816.name: carbink

7817.text: Goomys horns are excellent sensory organs that cover all five of Goomys senses. Goomy picks up on danger from the movement of the air.
7817.name: goomy

7818.text: When Sliggoo senses danger, the mucus coating its entire body becomes more concentrated itll dissolve anything.
7818.name: sliggoo

7819.text: This Pokmon is uncontrollable when enraged. It rampages on and on, lashing its tail with enough power to send a dump truck flying.
7819.name: goodra

7820.text: In the past, noble families entrusted their vault keys to a Klefki. They passed the Klefki down through the generations, taking good care of it.
7820.name: klefki

7821.text: This Pokmon came to be when the spirit of a deceased child possessed a tree stump. It now wanders the forest searching for friends.
7821.name: phantump

7822.text: Trevenant is very kind to Pokmon living in the forest. It doesnt even care if these Pokmon take up residence in the greenery on its head.
7822.name: trevenant

7823.text: Bergmite protects itself by coating its body in ice formed by frigid air of ?148 degrees Fahrenheit. It fights with Frigibax whenever they meet.
7823.name: bergmite

7824.text: This Pokmon uses its massive icy body to flatten anything that gets in its way. When its floating out on the ocean, it looks exactly like drift ice.
7824.name: avalugg

7825.text: Noibat can change the frequency of its sound waves at will, and it generates ultrasonic waves of up to 200,000 hertz.
7825.name: noibat

7826.text: In the dark, even Hydreigon are terrified of this Pokmon. But in the light, Noivern is the one that avoids battle.
7826.name: noivern

7827.text: It feels relaxed in tight, dark places and has been known to nestle into its Trainers bag or the front of their jacket.
7827.name: rowlet

7828.text: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.
7828.name: dartrix

7829.text: It nocks its arrow quills and looses them at opponents. When it needs to hit, it pulls the vines on its hood to narrow its view and focus.
7829.name: decidueye

7830.text: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.
7830.name: litten

7831.text: Torracat will let its Trainer coddle it once theyve grown close, but its a powerful, sharp-clawed Pokmon, so its Trainer gets covered in scratches.
7831.name: torracat

7832.text: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.
7832.name: incineroar

7833.text: The balloons it inflates with its nose grow larger and larger as it practices day by day.
7833.name: popplio

7834.text: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try to help.
7834.name: brionne

7835.text: Also known as a songstress, it is a sight to behold on moonlit nights when it sings in front of the colony it leads.
7835.name: primarina

7836.text: Pikipek has strong muscles in its neck, so it wont hurt itself even if it violently shakes its head.
7836.name: pikipek

7837.text: When it encounters foes, it launches the many seeds stored in its beak in a radial burst.
7837.name: trumbeak

7838.text: Pairs of Toucannon are considered symbols of companionship, as these Pokmon will raise the temperature of their beaks to warm each other.
7838.name: toucannon

7839.text: It spends its waking hours searching endlessly for food. When Yungoos is hungry, its ferocity gains a certain edge.
7839.name: yungoos

7840.text: Gumshoos specializes in relentlessly tracking down prey. The simple-minded Skwovet doesnt seem to provide Gumshoos enough challenge.
7840.name: gumshoos

7841.text: It spits sticky threads and winds them around branches, then swings nimbly from tree to tree in a pendulum-like motion.
7841.name: grubbin

7842.text: As it digests fallen leaves, it generates and stores electricity, which it can discharge from the tips of its jaws.
7842.name: charjabug

7843.text: When carrying a Charjabug, Vikavolt can receive electricity from it and then rapidly fire powerful electromagnetic beams from its large jaws.
7843.name: vikavolt

7844.text: If it loses its pincers, theyll quickly regrow. The pincers are popular ingredients in paella since their shells produce a tasty soup stock.
7844.name: crabrawler

7845.text: Though its punches are powerful, this Pokmons movements are sluggish. It blows icy bubbles from its mouth to immobilize its opponents.
7845.name: crabominable

7846.text: This form of Oricorio has sipped red nectar. It whips up blazing flames as it moves to the steps of its passionate dance.
7846.name: oricorio

7847.text: Cutiefly sucks up pollen and nectar with its long proboscis. It stores any pollen it doesnt finish eating in its fur.
7847.name: cutiefly

7848.text: Pollen puffs created by skilled Ribombee can relieve fatigue, making the puffs a popular commodity.
7848.name: ribombee

7849.text: This Pokmon travels in a pack with others until it grows up. When its mood turns sour, it starts striking the ground with the rocks on its neck.
7849.name: rockruff

7850.text: It has a calm and collected demeanor. It swiftly closes in on its prey, then slices them with the rocks in its mane.
7850.name: lycanroc

7851.text: It has excellent regenerative capabilities. Legs that a Mareanie has lost have a very bitter, astringent flavortheyre not suitable as food.
7851.name: mareanie

7852.text: Toxapex gets into fierce battles with Bruxish over areas where warm ocean currents flow, but the odds are always against it.
7852.name: toxapex

7853.text: Though a slow walker, Mudbray is plenty strong. Its pace doesnt change even when its loaded with 50 times its own body weight.
7853.name: mudbray

7854.text: Its legs are fortified with mud and harder than stone, and they can reduce a large truck to scrap with one kick.
7854.name: mudsdale

7855.text: It supports the water bubble that envelops its head with three of its legs. Sometimes it secretly swaps which legs are holding up the bubble.
7855.name: dewpider

7856.text: It launches sticky water bubbles. Foes who lose consciousness while trapped inside these bubbles will get torn apart by Araquanids gnashing jaws.
7856.name: araquanid

7857.text: Many Trainers give their Fomantis their own flowerpots so they can sunbathe in peace and quiet.
7857.name: fomantis

7858.text: A lot of time and effort is required to maintain the vivid colors of its petals. This Pokmon puts its Trainers attentiveness to the test.
7858.name: lurantis

7859.text: Only female Salandit can produce gas laden with pheromones. Males entranced by this gas will do whatever the females tell them.
7859.name: salandit

7860.text: When two Salazzle meet, they will use their pheromone gas to fight over the males in each others group.
7860.name: salazzle

7861.text: A Greedent drawn in by the sweet scent of these Pokmon will tuck the Bounsweet in among the berries in its tail and carry them all away.
7861.name: bounsweet

7862.text: Steenee bounces energetically through forests. If the rind that peels off its body is pulverized, it can be used to treat stomach pains.
7862.name: steenee

7863.text: This Pokmon launches fierce yet elegant kicks with its long, slender legs. It views Quaquaval as its rival.
7863.name: tsareena

7864.text: It prefers areas with lots of flowers. A Comfey adorned with flowers is a happy Comfey, and the flowers gain healing effects.
7864.name: comfey

7865.text: This Pokmon lives quietly in the depths of the forest. The purple, cape-like fur gets longer and longer as Oranguru ages.
7865.name: oranguru

7866.text: The boss chooses 10 members of the group to go out hunting. The hunting party will evenly split the food they find with the rest of the group.
7866.name: passimian

7867.text: It flings sand into the eyes of its prey and tries to close in on them while theyre blinded, but since Sandygast is so slow, the prey tends to escape.
7867.name: sandygast

7868.text: From the hollows in its arms, it fires the bones of its victims, which are all dried up after being drained of their vitality.
7868.name: palossand

7869.text: It will react when touched or called to, but its unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
7869.name: minior

7870.text: A potent anesthetic can be made by diluting Komalas drool. This anesthetic was used for surgeries in the past.
7870.name: komala

7871.text: Mimikyu was only recently identified as a Pokmon. Previously, people thought it was just a ghost wearing a cloth.
7871.name: mimikyu

7872.text: When sunlight reflects on the ripples created by a Bruxish grinding its teeth, the water all around sparkles brilliantly.
7872.name: bruxish

7873.text: They communicate with their allies using the sounds their scales make when struck. A group of these Pokmon causes quite a racket.
7873.name: jangmoo

7874.text: It fires itself up by striking its scales with force as it dances. Its roar is a battle cry.
7874.name: hakamoo

7875.text: It bashes its scales to test its opponents mettle. The sound of struck Kommo-o scales frightens weaker foes and sends them running.
7875.name: kommoo

7876.text: As Grookey strikes everything in sight with its stick, it has more and more fun, and its rhythm becomes livelier.
7876.name: grookey

7877.text: It becomes intensely focused while it drums out vigorous beatsso much so that sometimes it wont listen to its Trainers commands.
7877.name: thwackey

7878.text: When one Rillaboom challenges another who leads a troop, a drumming battle commences. The victor becomes the troops new boss.
7878.name: rillaboom

7879.text: Fire energy gathers in the pads of its feet, raising their temperature. Once hot, Scorbunnys footpads can deal heavy damage to opponents.
7879.name: scorbunny

7880.text: While it prides itself on its varied kicking moves, it can also deliver powerful headbutts once its flames have heated up its forehead.
7880.name: raboot

7881.text: Using a ball that it made out of flames, Cinderace blinds its opponents and keeps them at bay.
7881.name: cinderace

7882.text: Its a very cautious Pokmon. When it has no choice but to battle, it hides itself before attacking.
7882.name: sobble

7883.text: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it defends its home by laying traps.
7883.name: drizzile

7884.text: It may present itself as being well-mannered, but deep down, it still has a lazy side. It will slack off when its Trainer isnt looking.
7884.name: inteleon

7885.text: No matter how much it stuffs its belly with food, it is always anxious about getting hungry again. So, it stashes berries in its cheeks and tail.
7885.name: skwovet

7886.text: This Pokmon makes off with heaps of fallen berries by wrapping them in its tail, which is roughly twice the length of its body.
7886.name: greedent

7887.text: The females are fussier than the males. If another creature dirties a female Rookidees wings, itll peck the offender relentlessly in a burning rage.
7887.name: rookidee

7888.text: This intelligent Pokmon will quickly learn how to use any tool it can hold in its beak or its talons.
7888.name: corvisquire

7889.text: Although its wings have partly turned to steel and become heavy as a result, this Pokmon flies through the skies with ease.
7889.name: corviknight

7890.text: A popular game among children is to lift up sticks that Chewtle have bitten onto to see whose Chewtle can hang on the longest.
7890.name: chewtle

7891.text: Drednaw lurks along the shoreline. When prey come to drink water, Drednaw stretches its neck out and chomps down on them.
7891.name: drednaw

7892.text: Chunks of the surface of this Pokmons body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.
7892.name: rolycoly

7893.text: Due to the coal tar created inside it, the heap of coal on Carkols back never falls apart, even when the Pokmon rolls around at high speeds.
7893.name: carkol

7894.text: Its gentle usually but fearsome when angered. With a body that burns at over 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit, it crushes foes and turns them to ash.
7894.name: coalossal

7895.text: Applin lives inside an apple. When an Applin is separated from its apple, its body loses moisture and the Pokmon grows weak.
7895.name: applin

7896.text: It uses its own body fluid to repair its apple. Strong Flapple that have won many battles have apples that are clay colored all over.
7896.name: flapple

7897.text: When some Lechonk come along to lick the sweet nectar on Appletuns back, Appletun will spew sticky nectar at them to drive them away.
7897.name: appletun

7898.text: Silicobras large nostrils are specialized for spraying sand, so this Pokmon is not very good at telling apart different smells.
7898.name: silicobra

7899.text: The sand it spews contains sharp, pointy gravel, which is actually just sand that Sandacondas saliva has hardened into irregular shapes.
7899.name: sandaconda

7900.text: Its an incredibly poor learner because it uses the bare minimum amount of energy for its brain. It focuses on battling instead.
7900.name: cramorant

7901.text: It takes down prey by charging into them with its hard, pointed jaw. But Arrokudas eyesight is poor, so this tactic has a low success rate.
7901.name: arrokuda

7902.text: It swims at speeds of over 100 knots and battles fiercely with pods of Finizen over prey.
7902.name: barraskewda

7903.text: This selfish, attention-seeking Pokmon stores poison and electricity in two different sacs inside its body.
7903.name: toxel

7904.text: The jolts of electricity it launches by violently strumming the protrusions on its chest easily exceed 15,000 volts.
7904.name: toxtricity

7905.text: Sinistea gets into your body when you drink it, and then it steals your vitality from within. It also tastes awful.
7905.name: sinistea

7906.text: These Pokmon multiply by creeping into teapots and pouring themselves into leftover tea.
7906.name: polteageist

7907.text: It senses the feelings of other living creatures. Be careful not to expose it to strong emotions for too long, or it will end up exhausted.
7907.name: hatenna

7908.text: The moment this Pokmon finds someone whos emitting strong emotions, it will pummel them senseless with its braids to silence them.
7908.name: hattrem

7909.text: Beware of forests that show no signs of living creatures within. You may have wandered into Hatterenes territory.
7909.name: hatterene

7910.text: They live in groups, pestering and playing pranks on each other to polish their troublemaking skills.
7910.name: impidimp

7911.text: This Pokmon absorbs negative emotions and turns them into energy. Its popular with people who tend to think gloomy thoughts.
7911.name: morgrem

7912.text: It lives deep within the forest. Even after evolving into this splendid form, it hasnt given up on its petty misdeeds and pranks.
7912.name: grimmsnarl

7913.text: When attacked, it tackles its foe and covers them in cream. With its foe either blinded or astonished by deliciousness, Milcery flees.
7913.name: milcery

7914.text: Alcremie that have been cherished produce exquisite cream, so Trainers always raise them lovingly.
7914.name: alcremie

7915.text: The leader, known as the brass, uses its extendible horn to issue orders to the others when its time to change formation.
7915.name: falinks

7916.text: This Pokmon is so timid that even brushing against seaweed will make it discharge electricity in surprise. Its lips do not conduct electricity.
7916.name: pincurchin

7917.text: Within its internal organs, Snom amplifies the frigid air it gets from eating snow and then uses this amplified air to create icicle-like spikes.
7917.name: snom

7918.text: It causes blizzards as it flies around with its huge, chill-emanating wings. Clean meltwater is its favorite thing to drink.
7918.name: frosmoth

7919.text: This Pokmon spends its life gazing at the setting sun. It strides leisurely across grassy plains on legs of rock that weigh over 400 pounds each.
7919.name: stonjourner

7920.text: If you lick the ice covering its face, youll find it has a faintly salty taste. This species rode here on ocean currents from a cold, faraway land.
7920.name: eiscue

7921.text: This Pokmon never leaves its Trainers side. It predicts their actions with its psychic power and takes care of their day-to-day needs.
7921.name: indeedee

7922.text: It has a small stomach. If it isnt constantly eating the seeds it keeps in its pockets, it will get hungry immediately.
7922.name: morpeko

7923.text: Cufant can lift loads weighing five tons. In the mornings, it heads into caves with its herd, in search of the ore on which these Pokmon feed.
7923.name: cufant

7924.text: Copperajah are prideful, cantankerous Pokmon. Specimens with vibrant green skin command the respect of others of their kind.
7924.name: copperajah

7925.text: Its metal body is durable but prone to retaining heat. It vents this heat from the slits in its tail.
7925.name: duraludon

7926.text: It has a habit of biting at Clauncher even though it doesnt feed on them. This is said to be vestigial behavior from when Dreepy was alive.
7926.name: dreepy

7927.text: This Pokmon stores up energy in its lungs, then shoots it out. It takes care of Dreepy and battles alongside them until theyre all grown up.
7927.name: drakloak

7928.text: The fastest Dragapult of the group is always surrounded by Dreepy that want to fly at sonic speed.
7928.name: dragapult

7929.text: The sweet scent its body gives off mesmerizes those around it. The scent grows stronger when this Pokmon is in the sun.
7929.name: sprigatito

7930.text: The hardness of Floragatos fur depends on the Pokmons mood. When Floragato is prepared to battle, its fur becomes pointed and needle sharp.
7930.name: floragato

7931.text: With skillful misdirection, it rigs foes with pollen-packed flower bombs. Meowscarada sets off the bombs before its foes realize whats going on.
7931.name: meowscarada

7932.text: Its flame sac is small, so energy is always leaking out. This energy is released from the dent atop Fuecocos head and flickers to and fro.
7932.name: fuecoco

7933.text: The valve in Crocalors flame sac is closely connected to its vocal cords. This Pokmon utters a guttural cry as it spews flames every which way.
7933.name: crocalor

7934.text: Skeledirges gentle singing soothes the souls of all that hear it. It burns its enemies to a crisp with flames of over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit.
7934.name: skeledirge

7935.text: Its strong legs let it easily swim around in even fast-flowing rivers. It likes to keep things tidy and is prone to overthinking things.
7935.name: quaxly

7936.text: The hardworking Quaxwell observes people and Pokmon from various regions and incorporates their movements into its own dance routines.
7936.name: quaxwell

7937.text: Dancing in ways that evoke far-away places, this Pokmon mesmerizes all that see it. Flourishes of its decorative water feathers slice into its foes.
7937.name: quaquaval

7938.text: This Pokmon spurns all but the finest of foods. Its body gives off an herblike scent that bug Pokmon detest.
7938.name: lechonk

7939.text: It entrances female Pokmon with the sweet, alluring scent that wafts from all over its body.
7939.name: oinkologne

7940.text: The thread it secretes from its rear is as strong as wire. The secret behind the threads strength is the topic of ongoing research.
7940.name: tarountula
