7941.text: Spidops covers its territory in tough, sticky threads to set up traps for intruders.
7941.name: spidops

7942.text: Its highly skilled at a fighting style in which it uses its jumping capabilities to dodge incoming attacks while also dealing damage to opponents.
7942.name: nymble

7943.text: It uses its normally folded third set of legs when in Showdown Mode. This places a huge burden on its body, so it cant stay in this mode for long.
7943.name: lokix

7944.text: The pads of its paws are electricity-discharging organs. Pawmi fires electricity from its forepaws while standing unsteadily on its hind legs.
7944.name: pawmi

7945.text: Pawmo uses a unique fighting technique in which it uses its forepaws to strike foes and zap them with electricity from its paw pads simultaneously.
7945.name: pawmo

7946.text: Pawmots fluffy fur acts as a battery. It can store the same amount of electricity as an electric car.
7946.name: pawmot

7947.text: The pair sticks together no matter what. They split any food they find exactly in half and then eat it together.
7947.name: tandemaus

7948.text: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.
7948.name: maushold

7949.text: The yeast in Fidoughs breath is useful for cooking, so this Pokmon has been protected by people since long ago.
7949.name: fidough

7950.text: The surface of this Pokmons skin hardens when exposed to intense heat, and its body has an appetizing aroma.
7950.name: dachsbun

7951.text: This Pokmon converts nutrients into oil, which it stores in the fruit on its head. It can easily go a whole week without eating or drinking.
7951.name: smoliv

7952.text: It basks in the sun to its hearts content until the fruits on its head ripen. After that, Dolliv departs from human settlements and goes on a journey.
7952.name: dolliv

7953.text: This Pokmon drives back enemies by launching its rich, aromatic oil at them with enough force to smash a boulder.
7953.name: arboliva

7954.text: Green-feathered flocks hold the most sway. When theyre out searching for food in the mornings and evenings, it gets very noisy.
7954.name: squawkabilly

7955.text: The ground scrapes its body as it travels, causing it to leave salt behind. Salt is constantly being created and replenished inside Naclis body.
7955.name: nacli

7956.text: It compresses rock salt inside its body and shoots out hardened salt pellets with enough force to perforate an iron sheet.
7956.name: naclstack

7957.text: Many Pokmon gather around Garganacl, hoping to lick at its mineral-rich salt.
7957.name: garganacl

7958.text: Its firepower increases when it fights, reaching over 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit. It likes berries that are rich in fat.
7958.name: charcadet

7959.text: This Pokmon clads itself in armor that has been fortified by psychic and fire energy, and it shoots blazing fireballs.
7959.name: armarouge

7960.text: An old set of armor steeped in grudges caused this Pokmons evolution. Ceruledge cuts its enemies to pieces without mercy.
7960.name: ceruledge

7961.text: It floats using the electricity stored in its body. When thunderclouds are around, Tadbulb will float higher off the ground.
7961.name: tadbulb

7962.text: What appear to be eyeballs are actually organs for discharging the electricity generated by Bellibolts belly-button dynamo.
7962.name: bellibolt

7963.text: These Pokmon make their nests on coastal cliffs. The nests have a strange, crackling texture, and theyre a popular delicacy.
7963.name: wattrel

7964.text: It uses its throat sac to store electricity generated by its wings. Theres hardly any oil in its feathers, so it is a poor swimmer.
7964.name: kilowattrel

7965.text: Its well-developed jaw and fangs are strong enough to crunch through boulders, and its thick fat makes for an excellent defense.
7965.name: maschiff

7966.text: Mabosstiff loves playing with children. Though usually gentle, it takes on an intimidating look when protecting its family.
7966.name: mabosstiff

7967.text: To keep enemies away from its territory, it paints markings around its nest using a poisonous liquid that has an acrid odor.
7967.name: shroodle

7968.text: Each Grafaiai paints its own individual pattern, and it will paint that same pattern over and over again throughout its life.
7968.name: grafaiai

7969.text: Not even Bramblin knows where it is headed as it tumbles across the wilderness, blown by the wind. It loathes getting wet.
7969.name: bramblin

7970.text: Brambleghast wanders around arid regions. On rare occasions, mass outbreaks of these Pokmon will bury an entire town.
7970.name: brambleghast

7971.text: Though it looks like Tentacool, Toedscool is a completely different species. Its legs may be thin, but it can run at a speed of 30 mph.
7971.name: toedscool

7972.text: It coils its 10 tentacles around prey and sucks out their nutrients, causing the prey pain. The folds along the rim of its head are a popular delicacy.
7972.name: toedscruel

7973.text: This Pokmon lives on sheer cliffs. It sidesteps opponents attacks, then lunges for their weak spots with its claws.
7973.name: klawf

7974.text: Traditional Paldean dishes can be extremely spicy because they include the shed front teeth of Capsakid among their ingredients.
7974.name: capsakid

7975.text: The green head has turned vicious due to the spicy chemicals stimulating its brain. Once it goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
7975.name: scovillain

7976.text: It rolls its mud ball around while the energy it needs for evolution matures. Eventually the time comes for it to evolve.
7976.name: rellor

7977.text: An infant sleeps inside the ball. Rabsca rolls the ball soothingly with its legs to ensure the infant sleeps comfortably.
7977.name: rabsca

7978.text: It spends its time running around wastelands. If anyone steals its beloved berries, it will chase them down and exact its revenge.
7978.name: flittle

7979.text: It emits psychic power from the gaps between its multicolored frills and sprints at speeds greater than 120 mph.
7979.name: espathra

7980.text: This Pokmon pounds iron scraps together to make a hammer. It will remake the hammer again and again until its satisfied with the result.
7980.name: tinkatink

7981.text: These Pokmon make their homes in piles of scrap metal. They test the strength of each others hammers by smashing them together.
7981.name: tinkatuff

7982.text: The hammer tops 220 pounds, yet it gets swung around easily by Tinkaton as it steals whatever it pleases and carries its plunder back home.
7982.name: tinkaton

7983.text: Though it looks like Diglett, Wiglett is an entirely different species. The resemblance seems to be a coincidental result of environmental adaptation.
7983.name: wiglett

7984.text: A variety of fish Pokmon, Wugtrio was once considered to be a regional form of Dugtrio.
7984.name: wugtrio

7985.text: Bombirdier uses the apron on its chest to bundle up food, which it carries back to its nest. It enjoys dropping things that make loud noises.
7985.name: bombirdier

7986.text: Its water ring is made from seawater mixed with a sticky fluid that Finizen secretes from its blowhole.
7986.name: finizen

7987.text: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizens, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.
7987.name: palafin

7988.text: The steel section is Varooms actual body. This Pokmon clings to rocks and converts the minerals within into energy to fuel its activities.
7988.name: varoom

7989.text: Revavroom viciously threatens others with the sound of its exhaust. It sticks its tongue out from its cylindrical mouth and sprays toxic fluids.
7989.name: revavroom

7990.text: It can sprint at over 70 mph while carrying a human. The riders body heat warms Cyclizars back and lifts the Pokmons spirit.
7990.name: cyclizar

7991.text: This Pokmon lives in arid deserts. It maintains its metal body by consuming iron from the soil.
7991.name: orthworm

7992.text: Glimmets toxic mineral crystals look just like flower petals. This Pokmon scatters poisonous powder like pollen to protect itself.
7992.name: glimmet

7993.text: Glimmoras petals are made of crystallized poison energy. It has recently become evident that these petals resemble Tera Jewels.
7993.name: glimmora

7994.text: This friendly Pokmon doesnt like being alone. Pay it even the slightest bit of attention, and it will follow you forever.
7994.name: greavard

7995.text: A lovingly mourned Pokmon was reborn as Houndstone. It doesnt like anyone touching the protuberance atop its head.
7995.name: houndstone

7996.text: Thanks to a behavior of theirs known as synchronizing, an entire flock of these Pokmon can attack simultaneously in perfect harmony.
7996.name: flamigo

7997.text: It lives in frigid regions in pods of five or so individuals. It loves the minerals found in snow and ice.
7997.name: cetoddle

7998.text: Ice energy builds up in the horn on its upper jaw, causing the horn to reach cryogenic temperatures that freeze its surroundings.
7998.name: cetitan

7999.text: Veluza has excellent regenerative capabilities. It sheds spare flesh from its body to boost its agility, then charges at its prey.
7999.name: veluza

8000.text: It treats Tatsugiri like its boss and follows it loyally. Though powerful, Dondozo is apparently not very smart.
8000.name: dondozo

8001.text: Tatsugiri is an extremely cunning Pokmon. It feigns weakness to lure in prey, then orders its partner to attack.
8001.name: tatsugiri

8002.text: It imbues its fists with the power of the rage that it kept hidden in its heart. Opponents struck by these imbued fists will be shattered to their core.
8002.name: annihilape

8003.text: It lives at the bottom of ponds and swamps. It will carry Wooper on its back and ferry them across water from one shore to the other.
8003.name: clodsire

8004.text: The hardened head from the tail protects the head of the main body as Farigiraf whips its long neck around to headbutt enemies.
8004.name: farigiraf

8005.text: It drives enemies out of its nest by sucking in enough air to fill its long, narrow lungs, then releasing the air in an intense blast.
8005.name: dudunsparce

8006.text: Though it commands a massive army in battle, its not skilled at devising complex strategies. It just uses brute strength to keep pushing.
8006.name: kingambit

8007.text: This creature resembles a mysterious Pokmon that, according to a paranormal magazine, has lived since ancient times.
8007.name: greattusk

8008.text: It resembles a mysterious Pokmon described in a paranormal magazine as a Jigglypuff from one billion years ago.
8008.name: screamtail

8009.text: It bears a slight resemblance to a Pokmon described in a dubious magazine as a cross between a dinosaur and a mushroom.
8009.name: brutebonnet

8010.text: It has similar features to a ghostly pterosaur that was covered in a paranormal magazine, but the two have little else in common.
8010.name: fluttermane

8011.text: This Pokmon somewhat resembles an ancient form of Volcarona that was introduced in a dubious magazine.
8011.name: slitherwing

8012.text: It slightly resembles a Magneton that lived for 10,000 years and was featured in an article in a paranormal magazine.
8012.name: sandyshocks

8013.text: Sightings of this Pokmon have occurred in recent years. It resembles a mysterious object described in an old expedition journal.
8013.name: irontreads

8014.text: It resembles a mysterious object mentioned in an old book. There are only two reported sightings of this Pokmon.
8014.name: ironbundle

8015.text: This Pokmon shares many similarities with Iron Hands, an object mentioned in a certain expedition journal.
8015.name: ironhands

8016.text: Its possible that Iron Jugulis, an object described in an old book, may actually be this Pokmon.
8016.name: ironjugulis

8017.text: No records exist of this species being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokmons traits match up with an object described in an old book.
8017.name: ironmoth

8018.text: Some of its notable features match those of an object named within a certain expedition journal as Iron Thorns.
8018.name: ironthorns

8019.text: This Pokmon lives in forests and craggy areas. Using the power of its dorsal fin, it cools the inside of its nest like a refrigerator.
8019.name: frigibax

8020.text: It attacks with the blade of its frozen dorsal fin by doing a front flip in the air. Arctibaxs strong back and legs allow it to pull off this technique.
8020.name: arctibax

8021.text: It launches itself into battle by flipping upside down and spewing frigid air from its mouth. It finishes opponents off with its dorsal blade.
8021.name: baxcalibur

8022.text: It lives inside an old treasure chest. Sometimes it gets left in shop corners since no one realizes its actually a Pokmon.
8022.name: gimmighoul

8023.text: It has a sturdy body made up of stacked coins. Gholdengo overwhelms its enemies by firing coin after coin at them in quick succession.
8023.name: gholdengo

8024.text: It drains the life-force from vegetation, causing nearby forests to instantly wither and fields to turn barren.
8024.name: wochien

8025.text: The hatred of those who perished by the sword long ago has clad itself in snow and become a Pokmon.
8025.name: chienpao

8026.text: It slowly brings its exceedingly heavy head down upon the ground, splitting the earth open with huge fissures that run over 160 feet deep.
8026.name: tinglu

8027.text: The envy accumulated within curved beads that sparked multiple conflicts has clad itself in fire and become a Pokmon.
8027.name: chiyu

8028.text: According to an article in a dubious magazine, this Pokmon has some connection to a phenomenon that occurs in a certain region.
8028.name: roaringmoon

8029.text: Its possible that this is the object listed as Iron Valiant in a certain expedition journal.
8029.name: ironvaliant

8030.text: This Pokmon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.
8030.name: koraidon

8031.text: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.
8031.name: miraidon

8032.text: It resembles an illustration published in a paranormal magazine, said to be a depiction of a super-ancient Suicune.
8032.name: walkingwake

8033.text: According to the few eyewitness accounts that exist, it used its shining blades to julienne large trees and boulders.
8033.name: ironleaves

8034.text: The head sticking out belongs to the fore-wyrm, while the tail belongs to the core-wyrm. The two share one apple and help each other out.
8034.name: dipplin

8035.text: Poltchageist looks like a regional form of Sinistea, but it was recently discovered that the two Pokmon are entirely unrelated.
8035.name: poltchageist

8036.text: It prefers cool, dark places, such as the back of a shelf or the space beneath a home's floorboards. It wanders in search of prey after sunset.
8036.name: sinistcha

8037.text: Okidogi is a ruffian with a short temper. It can pulverize anything by swinging around the chain on its neck.
8037.name: okidogi

8038.text: Munkidori keeps itself somewhere safe while it toys with its foes, using psychokinesis to induce intense dizziness.
8038.name: munkidori

8039.text: Fezandipiti beats its glossy wings to scatter pheromones that captivate people and Pokmon.
8039.name: fezandipiti

8040.text: This mischief-loving Pokmon is full of curiosity. It battles by drawing out the type-based energy contained within its masks.
8040.name: ogerpon

8041.text: It digs holes on mountains, searching for food. Its so durable that being caught in a cave-in wont faze it.
8041.name: archaludon

8042.text: These capricious syrpents have banded together. On the rare occasion that their moods align, their true power is unleashed.
8042.name: hydrapple

8043.text: It resembles an eerie Pokmon once shown in a paranormal magazine. That Pokmon was said to be an Entei regenerated from a fossil.
8043.name: gougingfire

8044.text: It bears resemblance to a Pokmon that became a hot topic for a short while after a paranormal magazine touted it as Raikou's ancestor.
8044.name: ragingbolt

8045.text: It was named after a mysterious object recorded in an old book. Its body seems to be metallic.
8045.name: ironboulder

8046.text: There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.
8046.name: ironcrown

8047.text: Its thought that this Pokmon lived in ancient Paldea until it got caught in seismic shifts and went extinct.
8047.name: terapagos

8048.text: Its peach-shaped shell serves as storage for a potent poison. It makes poisonous mochi and serves them to people and Pokmon.
8048.name: pecharunt

8049.text: This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across many different regions.
8049.name: pikachuoriginal

8050.text: This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Hoenn region.
8050.name: pikachuhoenn

8051.text: This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Sinnoh region.
8051.name: pikachusinnoh

8052.text: This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Unova region.
8052.name: pikachuunova

8053.text: This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Kalos region.
8053.name: pikachukalos

8054.text: This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the Alola region.
8054.name: pikachualola

8055.text: This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed as the two overcame many hardships together.
8055.name: pikachupartner

8056.text: This Pikachu wears its partners capproof of the strong bond Pikachu and its partner formed during adventures across the world.
8056.name: pikachuworld

8057.text: An ancient tradition of Alolan festivals, still carried on to this day, is a competition to slide Sandshrew across ice as far as one can.
8057.name: sandshrewalola

8058.text: A long, long time ago, it lived in the desert. With its sharp claws fully extended, it can run right up an iceberg without slipping.
8058.name: sandslashalola

8059.text: In hot weather, this Pokmon makes ice shards with its six tails and sprays them around to cool itself off.
8059.name: vulpixalola

8060.text: It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.
8060.name: ninetalesalola

8061.text: Its golden whiskers function as sensors. It pokes them out of its burrow to monitor its surroundings.
8061.name: diglettalola

8062.text: Its metallic whiskers are heavy, so its not very fast, but it has the power to dig through even the hardest bedrock.
8062.name: dugtrioalola

8063.text: If you step on a Geodude sleeping on the ground, youll hear a zapping sound and feel a tingling shock throughout your entire body.
8063.name: geodudealola

8064.text: Gravelers entire body is electrically charged due to the stones it likes to eat. It is a very quick-tempered Pokmon.
8064.name: graveleralola

8065.text: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isnt fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.
8065.name: golemalola

8066.text: It uses its tail to fish, but the scent of the spice emanating from its tail ensures its catches are always lacking.
8066.name: slowpokegalar

8067.text: Shellder bites down hard on Slowbros arm to suck out more poison. This seems to cause itching, so Slowbro occasionally lashes out.
8067.name: slowbrogalar

8068.text: Alolan Grimer will gladly gobble up any kind of trash, making it a widely used and popular Pokmon at garbage disposal facilities.
8068.name: grimeralola

8069.text: What look like fangs and claws are actually crystallized poison that will afflict you at a mere touch, so dont get too close.
8069.name: mukalola

8070.text: As it grew taller and taller, it outgrew its reliance on psychic powers, while within it awakened the power of the sleeping dragon.
8070.name: exeggutoralola

8071.text: This kind of Tauros, known as the Combat Breed, is distinguished by its thick, powerful muscles and its fierce disposition.
8071.name: taurospaldeacombat

8072.text: People call this kind of Tauros the Blaze Breed due to the hot air it snorts from its nostrils. Its three tails are intertwined.
8072.name: taurospaldeablaze

8073.text: It swims by jetting water from its horns. The most notable characteristic of the Aqua Breed is its high body fat, which allows it to float easily.
8073.name: taurospaldeaaqua

8074.text: Its dangerous for Wooper to travel alone. They line up in groups of three or four and help each other as they walk around the wetlands.
8074.name: wooperpaldea

8075.text: It creates potions by mixing toxins with the food its eaten. Not even Slowking itself knows what effects the potions will have.
8075.name: slowkinggalar

8076.text: It absorbs toxins from the food it eats. The distinct purple spikes on its body are evidence of its potent poison.
8076.name: qwilfishhisui

8077.text: This Pokmon can often be seen along seashores. Its capable of spending a limited amount of time on land.
8077.name: shelloseast

8078.text: Fishers say that they didnt see many of these Pokmon in the past, but this form of Gastrodon is now increasing in number.
8078.name: gastrodoneast

8079.text: This Rotom has possessed a convection microwave oven. It will sear the surrounding area with its burning heat, then smile in delight.
8079.name: rotomheat

8080.text: The model of washing machine that Rotom can inspirit has been discontinued, so these appliances are now traded at high prices.
8080.name: rotomwash

8081.text: The special motor within the refrigerator is the key to bringing about Rotoms change in form.
8081.name: rotomfrost

8082.text: There are several appliances that Rotom can inspirit, but the first one to be developed was the electric fan.
8082.name: rotomfan

8083.text: This Rotom has possessed a lawn mower. It will mow down grass and flowers, then swagger around with pride at its accomplishments.
8083.name: rotommow

8084.text: The power of its jaws is immenseenough to leave teeth marks in iron sheets. Its personality is also extremely vicious.
8084.name: basculinbluestriped

8085.text: Its ecology is starkly different from that of other Basculin, so theories that its a totally different species have gained traction in recent years.
8085.name: basculinwhitestriped

8086.text: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. When a distinct grassy smell starts to waft from one, you know that summer has begun.
8086.name: deerlingsummer

8087.text: Deerling have different scents depending on the season. In this form, Deerling have a softly sweet scent that lingers in the nose.
8087.name: deerlingautumn

8088.text: This Pokmon will playfully headbutt those it gets along well with. It has antlers hidden under its flower, so the headbutts are a little painful.
8088.name: deerlingwinter

8089.text: This Pokmons leaves can be made into a black tea, the taste of which varies depending on the region of origin. Paldeas is especially aromatic.
8089.name: sawsbucksummer

8090.text: Sawsbuck in their Autumn Form are known for having very short tempers. The males fight each other incessantly.
8090.name: sawsbuckautumn

8091.text: Though there are many enthusiasts for Sawsbuck as a species, this seasonal form in particular is not very popular.
8091.name: sawsbuckwinter

8092.text: This Pokmon was born in a snowy land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8092.name: vivillonpolar

8093.text: This Pokmon was born in a land of severe cold. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8093.name: vivillontundra

8094.text: This Pokmon was born in a land of vast space. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8094.name: vivilloncontinental

8095.text: This Pokmon was born in a verdant land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8095.name: vivillongarden

8096.text: This Pokmon was born in a land with distinct seasons. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8096.name: vivillonelegant

8097.text: This Pokmon was born in a land where flowers bloom. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8097.name: vivillonmeadow

8098.text: This Pokmon was born in a sun-drenched land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8098.name: vivillonmodern

8099.text: This Pokmon was born in a land with ocean breezes. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8099.name: vivillonmarine

8100.text: This Pokmon was born in a place with many islands. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8100.name: vivillonarchipelago

8101.text: This Pokmon was born in a land with little rain. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8101.name: vivillonhigh plains

8102.text: This Pokmon was born in a parched land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8102.name: vivillonsandstorm

8103.text: This Pokmon was born in a land where large rivers flow. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8103.name: vivillonriver

8104.text: This Pokmon was born in a land with intense rainfall. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8104.name: vivillonmonsoon

8105.text: This Pokmon was born in a land with a tropical climate. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8105.name: vivillonsavanna

8106.text: This Pokmon was born in a land bathed in light. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8106.name: vivillonsun

8107.text: This Pokmon was born in a land of perpetual summer. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8107.name: vivillonocean

8108.text: This Pokmon was born in a land of tropical rain forests. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8108.name: vivillonjungle

8109.text: This Pokmon was born in a mysterious land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8109.name: vivillonfancy

8110.text: This Pokmon was born in a special land. It scatters colorful, toxic scales from its wings during battle.
8110.name: vivillonpokeball

8111.text: It unleashes a variety of moves by drawing forth the power hidden within flowers. This Pokmon is particularly fond of yellow flowers.
8111.name: flabebeyellow

8112.text: Floette can draw forth the latent capabilities of Grass-type Pokmon. It syncs with yellow flowers.
8112.name: floetteyellow

8113.text: This Pokmon cannot use moves on its own. When it syncs with flowers, it becomes able to use Grass-type moves.
8113.name: floetteorange

8114.text: It exchanges power with flowers via wavelengths of visible light. This form of Floette can sync with the wavelength that produces the color blue.
8114.name: floetteblue

8115.text: This Pokmon battles by drawing forth the power of yellow flowers. It ruthlessly punishes anyone who tramples on flowering plants.
8115.name: florgesyellow

8116.text: In times long past, castle governors would lovingly raise Florges to care for their castles exquisite gardens.
8116.name: florgesorange

8117.text: A Florges adorned with white flowers can sync with the wavelengths of various colors to draw forth their power.
8117.name: florgeswhite

8118.text: When they sense danger, they exert their psychic power at its maximum output. They have no regard for their opponents.
8118.name: meowsticf

8119.text: The energetic, cheerful dance of these Oricorio is popular with children, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.
8119.name: oricoriopompom

8120.text: This form of Oricorio has sipped pink nectar. It elevates its mind with the gentle steps of its dance, then unleashes its psychic energy.
8120.name: oricoriopau

8121.text: The elegant, attractive dance of these Oricorio is popular with adults, but the Oricorio themselves are hard to find in Paldea.
8121.name: oricoriosensu

8122.text: This Lycanroc has an extremely vicious temperament. It will happily sustain injuries for the sake of taking down its opponent.
8122.name: lycanrocmidnight

8123.text: These Pokmon have both calm and ferocious qualities. Its said that this form of Lycanroc is the most troublesome to raise.
8123.name: lycanrocdusk

8124.text: It will react when touched or called to, but its unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
8124.name: miniormeteororange

8125.text: It will react when touched or called to, but its unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
8125.name: miniormeteoryellow

8126.text: It will react when touched or called to, but its unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
8126.name: miniormeteorgreen

8127.text: It will react when touched or called to, but its unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
8127.name: miniormeteorblue

8128.text: It will react when touched or called to, but its unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
8128.name: miniormeteorindigo

8129.text: It will react when touched or called to, but its unknown whether such responses indicate consciousness.
8129.name: miniormeteorviolet

8130.text: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
8130.name: miniorred

8131.text: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
8131.name: miniororange

8132.text: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
8132.name: minioryellow

8133.text: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
8133.name: miniorgreen

8134.text: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
8134.name: miniorblue

8135.text: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
8135.name: miniorindigo

8136.text: It feeds on dust in the atmosphere. The color of its core is said to be determined by the composition of the dust it eats.
8136.name: miniorviolet

8137.text: It has taken damage and can no longer hold the head of its cloth disguise upright. For as long as it lives, Mimikyu will never forget its attacker.
8137.name: mimikyubusted

8138.text: Cramorant takes advantage of Arrokudas frantic thrashing to help spit Arrokuda out at high speed.
8138.name: cramorantgulping

8139.text: With a Pikachu stuck in its throat, Cramorant can use Pikachus prickling electricity to give its opponents a shock.
8139.name: cramorantgorging

8140.text: As it gulps down stagnant water and generates electricity in its body, a sound like a rhythm played by a bass guitar reverberates all around.
8140.name: toxtricitylowkey

8141.text: This Sinistea lives in an antique teacup. As valuable as this Pokmon is, its awful taste remains unchanged.
8141.name: sinisteaantique

8142.text: Though risky to drink, this Pokmons tea tastes delicious. Gourmets who have no fear of danger drink Polteageist tea day after day.
8142.name: polteageistantique

8143.text: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with sweet and tart flavors.
8143.name: alcremierubycream

8144.text: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with an aromatic flavor.
8144.name: alcremiematchacream

8145.text: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a refreshing flavor.
8145.name: alcremiemintcream

8146.text: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a sour flavor.
8146.name: alcremielemoncream

8147.text: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a salty flavor.
8147.name: alcremiesaltedcream

8148.text: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a mix of flavors.
8148.name: alcremierubyswirl

8149.text: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with a bitter flavor.
8149.name: alcremiecaramelswirl

8150.text: When attacked, it strikes back by throwing cream accented with complex flavors.
8150.name: alcremierainbowswirl

8151.text: Contrary to its looks, Eiscue is a poor swimmer. It creates ice balls at the tip of its single hair to lure prey in and fish them up.
8151.name: eiscuenoice

8152.text: In search of happy feelingssuch as joy and gratitudeIndeedee bustles around, taking diligent care of people and other Pokmon.
8152.name: indeedeef

8153.text: Hunger has disrupted this Pokmons hormonal balance. The Electric-type energy stored in its cheek sacs has turned into Dark-type energy.
8153.name: morpekohangry

8154.text: This special Ursaluna can see in the dark with its left eye and protects itself with mud that is as hard as iron.
8154.name: ursalunabloodmoon

8155.text: It can afflict a target with terrifying illusions that are under its control. The deeper the sadness in its friends souls, the paler Basculegion becomes.
8155.name: basculegionf

8156.text: This is a meticulous Pokmon that likes to keep things tidy. It shrouds itself in a floral aroma that soothes the Pokmon around it.
8156.name: oinkolognef

8157.text: The larger pair protects the little ones during battles. When facing strong opponents, the whole group will join the fight.
8157.name: mausholdfour

8158.text: Blue-feathered Squawkabilly view their green- feathered counterparts as rivals, since the latter make up the largest, most powerful groups.
8158.name: squawkabillyblue

8159.text: The yellow Squawkabilly are especially fierce. Theyve even been known to drive other bird Pokmon out of town.
8159.name: squawkabillyyellow

8160.text: Though these Squawkabilly are the fewest in number, they have no trouble living in towns since they blend in with the white buildings.
8160.name: squawkabillywhite

8161.text: This hero of the ocean swims at a speed of 50 knots and saves drowning people and Pokmon.
8161.name: palafinhero

8162.text: This Pokmon tricks its opponents by playing dead. It is small and weak, but it uses its smarts to survive.
8162.name: tatsugiridroopy

8163.text: Its one of the most intelligent dragon Pokmon. It camouflages itself by inflating its throat sac.
8163.name: tatsugiristretchy

8164.text: A recent study uncovered that the number of segments a Dudunsparces body has is determined by the Pokmons genes.
8164.name: dudunsparcethreesegment

8165.text: It wanders around, carrying an old coin on its back. It survives by draining the life-force from humans who try to pick up its coin.
8165.name: gimmighoulroaming

8166.text: It has similar characteristics to a creature described in an old book as the Winged King.
8166.name: koraidonlimited

8167.text: It was given the name Miraidon by the professor who discovered it. Its ecology and other details are unknown.
8167.name: miraidonlowpower

8168.text: It has taken up residence in a very expensive tea caddy. It takes an expert to distinguish the expensive tea caddies from the cheap ones.
8168.name: poltchageistartisan

8169.text: The more stirring it does with the tea whisk on its head, the more energy it builds up. It does this to prepare for battle.
8169.name: sinistchamasterpiece

8170.text: In this form, it draws on the power of water. It attacks unrelentingly with kicks and ivy strikes.
8170.name: ogerponwellspring

8171.text: In this form, it draws on the power of fire. It spears its enemies with thorn-covered ivy.
8171.name: ogerponhearthflame

8172.text: In this form, it draws on the power of stone. Its body is rock-solid, protecting it from all manner of attacks.
8172.name: ogerponcornerstone

8173.text: The shell is made of crystallized Terastal energy. When struck by a move, this shell absorbs the moves energy and transfers it to Terapagos.
8173.name: terapagosterastal

8174.text: An old expedition journal describes the sight of this Pokmon buried in the depths of the earth as resembling a planet floating in space.
8174.name: terapagosstellar

8175.text: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokmon.
8175.name: bulbasaur

8176.text: There is a plant bulb on its back. When it absorbs nutrients, the bulb is said to blossom into a large flower.
8176.name: ivysaur

8177.text: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokmon.
8177.name: venusaur

8178.text: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.
8178.name: charmander

8179.text: It lashes about with its tail to knock down its foe. It then tears up the fallen opponent with sharp claws.
8179.name: charmeleon

8180.text: Its wings can carry this Pokmon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.
8180.name: charizard

8181.text: It hides in its shell to protect itself, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
8181.name: squirtle

8182.text: When tapped on its head, this Pokmon will pull it in, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
8182.name: wartortle

8183.text: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
8183.name: blastoise

8184.text: Often found in forests and grasslands. It has a sharp, toxic barb of around two inches on top of its head.
8184.name: weedle

8185.text: Almost incapable of moving, this Pokmon can only harden its shell to protect itself when it is in danger.
8185.name: kakuna

8186.text: They may appear in a swarm. Beedrill flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.
8186.name: beedrill

8187.text: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.
8187.name: pidgey

8188.text: This Pokmon has a sprawling territory and will fiercely peck at any intruder.
8188.name: pidgeotto

8189.text: It flies over water as it hunts, skimming along the surface to catch Magikarp and other such prey.
8189.name: pidgeot

8190.text: As it matures, it grows longer. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
8190.name: ekans

8191.text: To intimidate foes, it spreads its chest wide and makes eerie sounds by expelling air from its mouth.
8191.name: arbok

8192.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8192.name: pikachu

8193.text: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.
8193.name: raichu

8194.text: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.
8194.name: clefairy

8195.text: A timid fairy Pokmon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
8195.name: clefable

8196.text: It sleeps for 18 hours a day. It uses a variety of extrasensory powers even while asleep.
8196.name: abra

8197.text: If it uses its abilities, it emits special alpha waves that cause machines to malfunction.
8197.name: kadabra

8198.text: Its brain cells multiply continually until it dies. As a result, it remembers everything.
8198.name: alakazam

8199.text: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it's the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
8199.name: machop

8200.text: It can lift a dump truck with one hand. Using that kind of strength, it helps people do heavy jobs.
8200.name: machoke

8201.text: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
8201.name: machamp

8202.text: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.
8202.name: bellsprout

8203.text: It spits out Poison Powder to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of acid.
8203.name: weepinbell

8204.text: Once taken into Victreebel's body, even the hardest object will be melted into nothing by the Pokmon's acid.
8204.name: victreebel

8205.text: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.
8205.name: slowpoke

8206.text: An attached Shellder won't let go because of the tasty flavor that oozes out of Slowbro's tail.
8206.name: slowbro

8207.text: It's born from gases. Anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
8207.name: gastly

8208.text: It licks with its gaseous tongue to steal its victim's life force. It lurks in darkness, waiting for prey.
8208.name: haunter

8209.text: It hides in shadows. It is said that in rooms where Gengar is hiding, the temperature drops by nearly 10 degrees Fahrenheit.
8209.name: gengar

8210.text: It usually lives underground. It searches for food while boring its way through the ground at 50 mph.
8210.name: onix

8211.text: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets its baby out to play only when it feels safe to do so.
8211.name: kangaskhan

8212.text: Even if its body is torn, it can regenerate as long as the glowing central core remains intact.
8212.name: staryu

8213.text: At the center of its body is a red core that sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.
8213.name: starmie

8214.text: It tears and shreds prey with its wickedly sharp scythes. It very rarely spreads its wings to fly.
8214.name: scyther

8215.text: It swings its long pincers wildly to attack. During cold periods, it hides deep in forests.
8215.name: pinsir

8216.text: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the weakest and most pathetic Pokmon in the world.
8216.name: magikarp

8217.text: In ancient literature, there is a record of a Gyarados that razed a village when violence flared.
8217.name: gyarados

8218.text: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokmon conceals many different possible evolutions.
8218.name: eevee

8219.text: It has evolved to be suited for an aquatic life. It can become invisible when it melts away into water.
8219.name: vaporeon

8220.text: It absorbs negative ions from the atmosphere to spit out 10,000 volts of electricity.
8220.name: jolteon

8221.text: It has a flame sac inside its body. After inhaling deeply, it blows out flames of nearly 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
8221.name: flareon

8222.text: It was regenerated from a pterosaur's genetic matter that was found in amber. It flies with high- pitched cries.
8222.name: aerodactyl

8223.text: This Pokmon is full of life energy. It continually sheds its skin and grows steadily larger.
8223.name: dratini

8224.text: Its crystalline orbs appear to give this Pokmon the power to freely control the weather.
8224.name: dragonair

8225.text: It is said to make its home somewhere in the sea. It guides wrecked ships to shore.
8225.name: dragonite

8226.text: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA-engineering experiments.
8226.name: mewtwo

8227.text: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up sun rays.
8227.name: chikorita

8228.text: The spicy aroma emanating from around its neck has an energizing effect.
8228.name: bayleef

8229.text: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.
8229.name: meganium

8230.text: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.
8230.name: totodile

8231.text: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.
8231.name: croconaw

8232.text: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.
8232.name: feraligatr

8233.text: It spins a web using fine yet durable thread. It then waits patiently for prey to be trapped.
8233.name: spinarak

8234.text: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It's hard to tell which end is which.
8234.name: ariados

8235.text: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.
8235.name: pichu

8236.text: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.
8236.name: cleffa

8237.text: Its fluffy coat doubles in size when static electricity builds up. Touching it can be shocking.
8237.name: mareep

8238.text: If its coat becomes fully charged with electricity, its tail lights up. Flaaffy can fire wool that zaps on impact.
8238.name: flaaffy

8239.text: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.
8239.name: ampharos

8240.text: It uses the fine fur on its body to sense movement in the air and predict the weather...as well as its foes' thoughts.
8240.name: espeon

8241.text: The light of the moon changed Eevee's genetic structure. It lurks in the darkness, waiting for prey.
8241.name: umbreon

8242.text: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.
8242.name: slowking

8243.text: It chews its way through boulders with its sturdy jaws. Its eyes can see in the darkness underground.
8243.name: steelix

8244.text: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.
8244.name: scizor

8245.text: This powerful Pokmon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.
8245.name: heracross

8246.text: It carries food rolled up in its tail. It has a habit of sharing food with people lost in the mountains.
8246.name: delibird

8247.text: Because it nests in bramble bushes, the feathers of its chicks grow hard from being scratched by thorns.
8247.name: skarmory

8248.text: Around dawn, their ominous howls echo through the area to announce their territory.
8248.name: houndour

8249.text: The flames it breathes when angry contain toxins. If they cause a burn, it will hurt forever.
8249.name: houndoom

8250.text: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
8250.name: larvitar

8251.text: Its body is as hard as bedrock. By venting pressurized gas, it can launch itself like a rocket.
8251.name: pupitar

8252.text: If it rampages, it knocks down mountains and buries rivers. Maps must be redrawn afterward.
8252.name: tyranitar

8253.text: If its red horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokmon, its body warms up slightly.
8253.name: ralts

8254.text: The cheerful spirit of its Trainer gives it energy for its psychokinetic power. It spins and dances when happy.
8254.name: kirlia

8255.text: It has the power to predict the future. Its power peaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
8255.name: gardevoir

8256.text: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.
8256.name: sableye

8257.text: Attached to its head is a huge set of jaws formed by horns. It can chew through iron beams.
8257.name: mawile

8258.text: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.
8258.name: aron

8259.text: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.
8259.name: lairon

8260.text: It claims an entire mountain as its own. The more wounds it has, the more it has battled, so don't take it lightly.
8260.name: aggron

8261.text: It meditates in order to build up its mental energy. It eats just one berry a day.
8261.name: meditite

8262.text: Through yoga training, it gained the psychic power to predict its foe's movements.
8262.name: medicham

8263.text: It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging. This Pokmon's whole body gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
8263.name: electrike

8264.text: It discharges electricity from its mane. The Pokmon creates a thundercloud overhead from which to drop lightning bolts.
8264.name: manectric

8265.text: It uses the different poisons in each hand separately when it attacks. The stronger its aroma, the healthier it is.
8265.name: roselia

8266.text: They live in massive rivers that course through jungles. Swarms of these Pokmon attack any prey that wanders into their territory.
8266.name: carvanha

8267.text: It can swim at speeds of 75 mph by jetting seawater through its body. It is the bandit of the sea.
8267.name: sharpedo

8268.text: The magma in its body reaches 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit. Its hump gets smaller when it uses Fire-type moves.
8268.name: numel

8269.text: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 yearsor whenever it becomes really angry.
8269.name: camerupt

8270.text: For some reason, it likes to land on people's heads softly and act like it's a hat.
8270.name: swablu

8271.text: It flies gracefully through the sky. Its melodic humming makes you feel like you're in a dream.
8271.name: altaria

8272.text: It uses its horn to feed on envy and maliceor so it's said. It's very active at night.
8272.name: shuppet

8273.text: A doll bore a grudge over being junked, and it became a Pokmon. It seeks the child that disowned it.
8273.name: banette

8274.text: It senses coming disasters and appears before people only to warn them of impending danger.
8274.name: absol

8275.text: In some snowy lands, certain folklore says a house will prosper if a Snorunt lives there.
8275.name: snorunt

8276.text: To protect itself, it clad its body in an armor of ice, made by freezing moisture in the air.
8276.name: glalie

8277.text: Its well-developed neck muscles and ironlike head can smash boulders into pieces.
8277.name: bagon

8278.text: Within its rugged shell, its cells have begun changing. The shell peels off the instant the Pokmon evolves.
8278.name: shelgon

8279.text: It's uncontrollable if enraged. It flies around spouting flames, scorching fields and mountains.
8279.name: salamence

8280.text: They communicate with one another by using magnetic pulses. In a swarm, they move in perfect unison.
8280.name: beldum

8281.text: It is formed by two Beldum joining together. Its steel body won't be scratched if it collides with a jet.
8281.name: metang

8282.text: Metang combined to form it. With four brains, it has the intelligence of a supercomputer.
8282.name: metagross

8283.text: When it feels the sun's warm touch, it opens its bud to release pollen. It lives alongside clear pools.
8283.name: budew

8284.text: It lures prey in with a sweet scent, then finishes them off with the poisonous whips on its arms either by constricting the prey or skewering them.
8284.name: roserade

8285.text: One of Buneary's ears is always rolled up. It can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
8285.name: buneary

8286.text: This Pokmon's ears are apparently very delicate. They must be handled gently and with care, or else Lopunny will kick you with its graceful legs.
8286.name: lopunny

8287.text: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.
8287.name: gible

8288.text: As it digs to expand its nest, it unearths raw gemstones. It has a habit of hoarding these in its nest.
8288.name: gabite

8289.text: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.
8289.name: garchomp

8290.text: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.
8290.name: riolu

8291.text: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.
8291.name: lucario

8292.text: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.
8292.name: hippopotas

8293.text: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.
8293.name: hippowdon

8294.text: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.
8294.name: snover

8295.text: It blankets wide areas in snow by whipping up blizzards. It is also known as the Ice Monster.
8295.name: abomasnow

8296.text: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.
8296.name: leafeon

8297.text: By controlling its body heat, it can freeze the atmosphere around it to make a diamond-dust flurry.
8297.name: glaceon

8298.text: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using the extending swords on its elbows.
8298.name: gallade

8299.text: It freezes foes with an icy breath that is nearly ?60 degrees Fahrenheit. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.
8299.name: froslass

8300.text: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
8300.name: tepig

8301.text: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
8301.name: pignite

8302.text: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
8302.name: emboar

8303.text: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
8303.name: patrat

8304.text: Using luminescent matter within its body, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
8304.name: watchog

8305.text: It shares the leaves on its head with weary Pokmon. These leaves reduce fatigue.
8305.name: pansage

8306.text: Ill-tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaves growing on its head are very bitter.
8306.name: simisage

8307.text: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.
8307.name: pansear

8308.text: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
8308.name: simisear

8309.text: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. It provides this water to plants by using its tail.
8309.name: panpour

8310.text: It prefers places with clean water. When the stores of water on its head run low, it replenishes its supply by siphoning up more with its tail.
8310.name: simipour

8311.text: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
8311.name: drilbur

8312.text: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
8312.name: excadrill

8313.text: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to check their emotions and physical health.
8313.name: audino

8314.text: Its bite injects a venom potent enough to paralyze even the large bird Pokmon that try to prey on it.
8314.name: venipede

8315.text: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
8315.name: whirlipede

8316.text: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until they stop moving. Then it finishes them off with deadly venom.
8316.name: scolipede

8317.text: It moves below the sand's surface, exposing only its nose and eyes. A black membrane shields its eyes from the sun.
8317.name: sandile

8318.text: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
8318.name: krokorok

8319.text: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can tear apart the body of an automobile.
8319.name: krookodile

8320.text: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.
8320.name: scraggy

8321.text: It pulls up its shed skin to protect itself while it kicks. The bigger the crest, the more arrogantly it behaves.
8321.name: scrafty

8322.text: The combination of garbage bags and industrial waste caused the chemical reaction that created this Pokmon.
8322.name: trubbish

8323.text: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
8323.name: garbodor

8324.text: The temperature of their breath is ?58 degrees Fahrenheit. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.
8324.name: vanillite

8325.text: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.
8325.name: vanillish

8326.text: If both heads get angry simultaneously, this Pokmon expels a blizzard from its horn, burying everything in snow.
8326.name: vanilluxe

8327.text: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its patagial membranes and released while it is gliding.
8327.name: emolga

8328.text: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
8328.name: tynamo

8329.text: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes them with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
8329.name: eelektrik

8330.text: With their sucker mouths, they latch on to prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
8330.name: eelektross

8331.text: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokmon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.
8331.name: litwick

8332.text: Lampent appears at the moment of death and promptly absorbs the spirit as it leaves the body.
8332.name: lampent

8333.text: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
8333.name: chandelure

8334.text: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.
8334.name: stunfisk

8335.text: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.
8335.name: chespin

8336.text: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights.
8336.name: quilladin

8337.text: Its tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.
8337.name: chesnaught

8338.text: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
8338.name: fennekin

8339.text: It keeps a twig in its tail. Using friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
8339.name: braixen

8340.text: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
8340.name: delphox

8341.text: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
8341.name: froakie

8342.text: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.
8342.name: frogadier

8343.text: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
8343.name: greninja

8344.text: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through without rest.
8344.name: bunnelby

8345.text: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.
8345.name: diggersby

8346.text: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it's merciless to intruders that enter its territory.
8346.name: fletchling

8347.text: The hotter the flame sac in its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.
8347.name: fletchinder

8348.text: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers as it flies.
8348.name: talonflame

8349.text: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
8349.name: scatterbug

8350.text: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.
8350.name: spewpa

8351.text: The patterns on this Pokmon depend on the climate and topography of the land it was born in. This form is from frigid lands.
8351.name: vivillon

8352.text: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokmon are quick to fight.
8352.name: litleo

8353.text: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.
8353.name: pyroar

8354.text: This Pokmon can draw forth the power hidden within blooming wild flowers. It is particularly fond of red flowers.
8354.name: flabebe

8355.text: This Pokmon uses red wavelengths of light to pour its own energy into flowers and draw forth their latent potential.
8355.name: floette

8356.text: They say that flower gardens created by Florges constantly emit a power that can heal both body and spirit.
8356.name: florges

8357.text: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
8357.name: skiddo

8358.text: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in their grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets human and Pokmon run as if one being.
8358.name: gogoat

8359.text: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can't help grinning if anyone pats its head.
8359.name: pancham

8360.text: Although it has a violent temperament, it won't put up with those who bully the weak. It senses foes' movements with its leaf.
8360.name: pangoro

8361.text: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokmon were the designated guardians of the king.
8361.name: furfrou

8362.text: It keeps its intense psychic power from leaking out by using its ears to cover the organs emitting that power.
8362.name: espurr

8363.text: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
8363.name: meowstic

8364.text: Apparently Honedge was born when a departed spirit began inhabiting an ancient sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.
8364.name: honedge

8365.text: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords that cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.
8365.name: doublade

8366.text: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to rule.
8366.name: aegislash

8367.text: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.
8367.name: spritzee

8368.text: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless they happen to really enjoy the smell, Trainers will have a hard time walking alongside it.
8368.name: aromatisse

8369.text: To entangle and immobilize its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
8369.name: swirlix

8370.text: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.
8370.name: slurpuff

8371.text: It drains foes' will to fight by flashing light at them. It then takes the opportunity to hide itself away.
8371.name: inkay

8372.text: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokmon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.
8372.name: malamar

8373.text: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.
8373.name: binacle

8374.text: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.
8374.name: barbaracle

8375.text: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, this Pokmon sprays liquid poison to take down prey that approach unawares.
8375.name: skrelp

8376.text: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.
8376.name: dragalge

8377.text: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.
8377.name: clauncher

8378.text: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.
8378.name: clawitzer

8379.text: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.
8379.name: helioptile

8380.text: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
8380.name: heliolisk

8381.text: This Pokmon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.
8381.name: tyrunt

8382.text: This Pokmon behaved like a king 100 million years ago. Nothing could stop it.
8382.name: tyrantrum

8383.text: This ancient Pokmon was restored from a part of its body that had been frozen in ice for 100 million years.
8383.name: amaura

8384.text: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as ?240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.
8384.name: aurorus

8385.text: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with them.
8385.name: sylveon

8386.text: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.
8386.name: hawlucha

8387.text: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.
8387.name: dedenne

8388.text: Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it releases energy from the stone in its head.
8388.name: carbink

8389.text: Thanks to the slimy membrane covering its body, punches or kicks from its enemies slide right off it.
8389.name: goomy

8390.text: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.
8390.name: sliggoo

8391.text: This very friendly dragon Pokmon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.
8391.name: goodra

8392.text: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.
8392.name: klefki

8393.text: According to old tales, these Pokmon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.
8393.name: phantump

8394.text: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It's kind to the Pokmon that reside in its body.
8394.name: trevenant

8395.text: It was recently discovered that the different varieties of Pumpkaboo vary not only in size but also in the size of the souls they collect.
8395.name: pumpkaboo

8396.text: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.
8396.name: gourgeist

8397.text: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. If the ice breaks, this Pokmon uses cold air to quickly create new ice.
8397.name: bergmite

8398.text: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its enormous frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
8398.name: avalugg

8399.text: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.
8399.name: noibat

8400.text: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.
8400.name: noivern

8401.text: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
8401.name: xerneas

8402.text: It's said that when its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
8402.name: yveltal

8403.text: It's hypothesized that it's monitoring those who destroy the ecosystem from deep in the cave where it lives.
8403.name: zygarde

8404.text: Diancie is a spontaneous mutation of Carbink. Its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
8404.name: diancie

8405.text: It uses loops to gather things it likes and take them to its secret home. It also teleports through a loop.
8405.name: hoopa

8406.text: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
8406.name: volcanion

8407.text: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it completely destroys its surroundings with its intense breath.
8407.name: drampa

8408.text: Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass. The brass's orders are absolute.
8408.name: falinks

8409.text: In order to support its flower, which has grown larger due to Mega Evolution, its back and legs have become stronger.
8409.name: venusaurmega

8410.text: The overwhelming power that fills its entire body causes it to turn black and creates intense blue flames.
8410.name: charizardmegax

8411.text: Its bond with its Trainer is the source of its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability greater than that of a jet.
8411.name: charizardmegay

8412.text: The cannon on its back is as powerful as a tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.
8412.name: blastoisemega

8413.text: Its legs have become poison stingers. It stabs its prey repeatedly with the stingers on its limbs, dealing the final blow with the stinger on its rear.
8413.name: beedrillmega

8414.text: With its muscular strength now greatly increased, it can fly continuously for two weeks without resting.
8414.name: pidgeotmega

8415.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8415.name: pikachuoriginal

8416.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8416.name: pikachuhoenn

8417.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8417.name: pikachusinnoh

8418.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8418.name: pikachuunova

8419.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8419.name: pikachukalos

8420.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8420.name: pikachualola

8421.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8421.name: pikachupartner

8422.text: It has small electric sacs on both its cheeks. When in a tough spot, this Pokmon discharges electricity.
8422.name: pikachuworld

8423.text: It uses psychokinesis to control electricity. It hops aboard its own tail, using psychic power to lift the tail and move about while riding it.
8423.name: raichualola

8424.text: It flies by using the power of moonlight to control gravity within a radius of over 32 feet around it.
8424.name: clefablemega

8425.text: Alakazam has traded away its muscles, unleashing its true power. With its psychic powers, it can foresee all things.
8425.name: alakazammega

8426.text: The volume of this Pokmon's acid has increased due to Mega Evolution, filling its mouth. If it's not careful, the acid will overflow and spill out.
8426.name: victreebelmega

8427.text: Although this Pokmon is normally zoned out, its expression abruptly sharpens on occasion. The cause for this seems to lie in Slowpoke's diet.
8427.name: slowpokegalar

8428.text: When bathed in the energy of Mega Evolution, Shellder converts into impregnable armor. There is virtually no change in Slowpoke.
8428.name: slowbromega

8429.text: A Shellder bite set off a chemical reaction with the spices inside Slowbro's body, causing Slowbro to become a Poison-type Pokmon.
8429.name: slowbrogalar

8430.text: It can pass through other dimensions and appear anywhere. It caused a stir one time when it stuck just one leg out of a wall.
8430.name: gengarmega

8431.text: Its child has grown rapidly, thanks to the energy of Mega Evolution. Mother and child show off their harmonious teamwork in battle.
8431.name: kangaskhanmega

8432.text: Its movements have become more humanlike. Whether it's simply trying to communicate or wants to supplant humanity is unclear.
8432.name: starmiemega

8433.text: After Mega Evolution, it becomes able to fly. Perhaps because it's so happy, it rarely touches the ground.
8433.name: pinsirmega

8434.text: It jets water from the orifices on its sides, streaking above the water surface at supersonic speed.
8434.name: gyaradosmega

8435.text: Parts of its body have become stone. Some scholars claim that this is Aerodactyl's true appearance.
8435.name: aerodactylmega

8436.text: Mega Evolution has excessively powered up this Pokmon's feelings of kindness. It finishes off its opponents with mercy in its heart.
8436.name: dragonitemega

8437.text: Psychic power has augmented its muscles. It has a grip strength of one ton and can sprint 100 meters in two seconds flat!
8437.name: mewtwomegax

8438.text: Despite its diminished size, its mental power has grown phenomenally. With a mere thought, it can smash a skyscraper to smithereens.
8438.name: mewtwomegay

8439.text: This Pokmon can fire a tremendously powerful Solar Beam from its four flowers. Another name for this is Mega Sol Cannon.
8439.name: meganiummega

8440.text: With its arms and hoodlike fin, this Pokmon forms a gigantic set of jaws with a bite 10 times as powerful as Mega Feraligatr's actual jaws.
8440.name: feraligatrmega

8441.text: Massive amounts of energy intensely stimulated Ampharos's cells, apparently awakening its long- sleeping dragon's blood.
8441.name: ampharosmega

8442.text: A combination of toxins and the shock of evolving has increased Shellder's intelligence to the point that Shellder now controls Slowking.
8442.name: slowkinggalar

8443.text: To protect itself from opponents' attacks, it uses magnetism to control pieces of its hard outer shell that have flaked off.
8443.name: steelixmega

8444.text: Due to the effects of Mega Evolution, its pincers have taken on a more diabolical form, ripping anything they pinch to shreds.
8444.name: scizormega

8445.text: It can grip things with its two horns and lift 500 times its own body weight.
8445.name: heracrossmega

8446.text: It flies faster than the speed of sound. After whipping up shock waves to send enemies flying, it finishes them off with its talons.
8446.name: skarmorymega

8447.text: Houndoom's entire body generates heat when it Mega Evolves. Its intense, fiery breath turns its opponents to charcoal.
8447.name: houndoommega

8448.text: The effects of Mega Evolution make it more ferocious than ever. It's unclear whether it can even hear its Trainer's orders.
8448.name: tyranitarmega

8449.text: When it opens the red plate on its chest and unleashes its heart, its strongest psychic power is released.
8449.name: gardevoirmega

8450.text: The jewel from its chest, which has grown gigantic due to the effects of Mega Evolution, can turn back any attack.
8450.name: sableyemega

8451.text: Its two sets of jaws thrash about violently as if they each had a will of their own. One gnash from them can turn a boulder to dust.
8451.name: mawilemega

8452.text: Energy from Mega Evolution has turned the iron inside this Pokmon into steel armor that covers Mega Aggron's whole body.
8452.name: aggronmega

8453.text: Thanks to Mega Evolution, its mental power is limitless. It conjures up arms imbued with malice to defeat its enemies.
8453.name: medichammega

8454.text: Mega Evolution fills its body with a tremendous amount of electricity, but it's too much for Manectric to fully control.
8454.name: manectricmega

8455.text: The spines sprouting from its head are transformed fangs. If they're injured or broken off, the spines will regenerate countless times.
8455.name: sharpedomega

8456.text: When this Pokmon's rage reaches a boiling point, the huge volcano in the hump on its back erupts violently, spewing molten lava.
8456.name: cameruptmega

8457.text: Its down is so soft, it seems as if a touch could melt it. But it's strong enough that just a few strands could be used to hoist a dump truck.
8457.name: altariamega

8458.text: Mega Evolution increases its vindictiveness, and the cursing power that was held back by its zipper comes spilling out.
8458.name: banettemega

8459.text: When this Pokmon whips the winglike fur on its back as though beating its wings, it sends an intimidating aura flying at its opponents.
8459.name: absolmega

8460.text: When it spews stupendously cold air from its broken mouth, the entire area around it gets whited out.
8460.name: glaliemega

8461.text: To streamline itself for flight, it pulls its forelegs into its shell. Salamence flies at high speeds even when faced with complex topographical features.
8461.name: salamencemega

8462.text: This form results from one Metagross, one Metang, and two Beldum linking up.
8462.name: metagrossmega

8463.text: It swings its ears like whips and strikes its enemies with them. It has an intensely combative disposition.
8463.name: lopunnymega

8464.text: Its disposition is more vicious than before its Mega Evolution. Garchomp carves its opponents up with the scythes on both arms.
8464.name: garchompmega

8465.text: Black streaks all over its body show where its auras and the energy of Mega Evolution intermingled and raced through it.
8465.name: lucariomega

8466.text: The buds on its back have sprouted into impressive icicles that can whip up massive blizzards of ?22 degrees Fahrenheit.
8466.name: abomasnowmega

8467.text: It gets power from the bond it has with its Trainer. Mega Evolution has given it plates to slice its enemies and a cape to protect its body.
8467.name: gallademega

8468.text: This Pokmon can use eerie cold air imbued with ghost energy to freeze even insubstantial things, such as flames or the wind.
8468.name: froslassmega

8469.text: Brandishing a blazing flame shaped like a serpentine spear, it rushes in to rescue its imperiled allies.
8469.name: emboarmega

8470.text: If this Pokmon brings its arms and head together to form a streamlined shape and spins at high speeds, it can destroy anything.
8470.name: excadrillmega

8471.text: Anyone who touches the secondary feelers that have sprouted from the base of its throat will fall into a deep sleep.
8471.name: audinomega

8472.text: Its deadly venom gives off a faint glow. The venom affects Scolipede's mind, honing its viciousness.
8472.name: scolipedemega

8473.text: Mega Evolution has caused Scrafty's shed skin to turn white, growing tough and supple. Of course, this Pokmon is still as feisty as ever.
8473.name: scraftymega

8474.text: It now generates 10 times the electricity it did before Mega Evolving. It discharges this electricity from its false Eelektrik, which are made of mucus.
8474.name: eelektrossmega

8475.text: One of its eyes is a window linking our world with the afterlife. This Pokmon draws in hatred and converts it into power.
8475.name: chandeluremega

8476.text: Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.
8476.name: stunfiskgalar

8477.text: It has fortified armor and a will to defend at all costs. Both are absurdly strong.
8477.name: chesnaughtmega

8478.text: It wields flaming branches to dazzle its opponents before incinerating them with a huge fireball.
8478.name: delphoxmega

8479.text: This Pokmon spins a giant shuriken at high speed to make it float, then clings to it upside down to catch opponents unawares.
8479.name: greninjamega
